gloss_it: Struttura composta dall'insieme di più archi Un'arcata o galleria è un elemento architettonico che consiste in una successione continua di archi, normalmente uguali tra loro, che creano un passaggio coperto sul soffitto, con uno o entrambi i lati delle pareti aperti, oppure completamente chiusi. Struttura architettonica semiaperta di grandi dimensioni di cui almeno un lato è costituito da una serie di colonne.
gloss_en: A structure composed of a series of arches supported by columns A structure composed of a series of arches supported by columns An arcade is a succession of contiguous arches, with each arch supported by a colonnade of columns or piers. A series of adjoining arches Covered walk enclosed by a line of arches on one or both sides Architectural structure ajar large of which at least one side is constituted by a series of columns.
A passageway under a curved masonry construction A passageway under a curved masonry construction A passageway covered by an arch, particularly one made of masonry. Passageway covered by an arch.

gloss_it: Elemento architettonico con curvatura variabile che poggia su colonne, pilastri o pareti, sia con funzione di sostegno  sia con funzione decorativa L'arco, in architettura, è un elemento strutturale a forma curva che si appoggia su due piedritti e tipicamente è sospeso su uno spazio vuoto. Elemento strutturale e decorativo curvilineo poggiante su due piedritti La disposizione a forma d'arco di pietre trapezoidali, progettata per ridistribuire all'esterno la forza verso il basso.
gloss_en: (architecture) a masonry construction (usually curved) for spanning an opening and supporting the weight above it (architecture) a masonry construction (usually curved) for spanning an opening and supporting the weight above it An arch is a vertical curved structure that spans an elevated space and may or may not support the weight above it, or in case of a horizontal arch like an arch dam, the hydrostatic pressure against it. Structure that spans a space and supports a load An arch-shaped arrangement of trapezoidal stones, designed to redistribute downward force outward. An architectural element having the shape of an arch. Architectural element.

gloss_it: Studioso di archeologia Persona che studia o lavora in archeologia.
gloss_en: An anthropologist who studies prehistoric people and their culture An anthropologist who studies prehistoric people and their culture Someone who studies or works in archeology.

gloss_it: Scienza che studia le civiltà antiche L'archeologia è la scienza che studia le civiltà e le culture umane del passato e le loro relazioni con l'ambiente circostante, mediante la raccolta, la documentazione e l'analisi delle tracce materiali che hanno lasciato. Nella schedatura dei dati rilevati in fase di scavo, è la sigla che sta per Unità Stratigrafica Scienza che studia le civiltà e le culture umane del passato Studio scientifico dei resti materiali delle culture dei popoli storici o preistorici.
gloss_en: The branch of anthropology that studies prehistoric people and their cultures The branch of anthropology that studies prehistoric people and their cultures Archaeology, sometimes spelled archeology, is the study of human activity through the recovery and analysis of material culture. Study of human past through material culture The scientific study of the material remains of the cultures of historical or prehistorical peoples.  The study of the past by excavation and analysis of its material remains.
A person who archaizes A person who archaizes A person who uses archaisms in language. A person who uses archaisms in language.
A relic that has been excavated from the soil A relic that has been excavated from the soil

gloss_en: The site of an archeological exploration The site of an archeological exploration An archeological or paleontological investigation, or the site where such an investigation is taking place. Archeological investigation. A site where an archaeological exploration is being carried out.

gloss_it: Chi progetta opere di vario tipo L'Architetto è la figura professionale esperta della progettazione urbanistica, edilizia e architettonica, del restauro dei monumenti, della progettazione del paesaggio, dell'allestimento, dell'estimo immobiliare e del disegno. Professione di chi progetta edifici e supervisiona la loro costruzione Persona il cui compito è quello di progettare edifici o altre strutture, o che prepara i progetti e supervisiona la costruzione. Chi crea piani per la realizzazione o costruzione di qualcosa.
gloss_en: Someone who creates plans to be used in making something (such as buildings) Someone who creates plans to be used in making something (such as buildings) A designer is a person who plans the look or workings of something prior to it being made, by preparing drawings or plans. An architect is a person who plans, designs and oversees the construction of buildings. A professional trained in the planning, design, and supervision of the construction of buildings Person trained to plan and design buildings, and oversee their construction Person who designs A professional who designs buildings or other structures, or who prepares plans and superintends construction. Someone who creates plans to be used in making something. A professional who designs buildings or other structures, or who prepares plans and superintends construction. A person who designs something, or who designs things as a profession. Person who designs.

Branca dell'ingegneria Applicazione di principi e teconologie di ingegneria per la progettazione e la costruzione di edifici.
gloss_en: The branch of engineering that deals with the construction of buildings (as distinguished from architecture as a design art) The branch of engineering that deals with the construction of buildings (as distinguished from architecture as a design art) Architectural engineering, also known as building engineering or architecture engineering, is an engineering discipline that deals with the technological aspects and multi-disciplinary approach to planning, design, construction and operation of buildings, such as analysis and integrated design of environmental systems, structural systems, behavior and properties of building components and materials, and construction management. Application of engineering principles and technology to building design and construction The application of engineering principles and technology to building design and construction.
(architecture) something added to a building to improve its appearance (architecture) something added to a building to improve its appearance

gloss_en: Scale drawing of a structure Scale drawing of a structure Plans are a set of drawings or two-dimensional diagrams used to describe a place or object, or to communicate building or fabrication instructions. In the field of architecture an architectural plan is a design and planning for a building, and can contain architectural drawings, specifications of the design, calculations, time planning of the building process, and other documentation. Design and planning for a building Drawings or diagrams used to describe an object Scale drawing of a structure or its parts. A two-dimensional drawing of a building as seen from above with obscuring or irrelevant details such as roof removed, or of a floor of a building, revealing the internal layout; as distinct from the elevation. 2-dimensional drawing from above.

gloss_en: Architecture as a kind of art form Architecture as a kind of art form An architectural style is a set of characteristics and features that make a building or other structure notable or historically identifiable. A list of architectural styles, often named after the architectural periods they first occurred in A specific method of construction
An architectural product or work An architectural product or work

lab_en: the art and history of architecture
gloss_it: L'architettura è la disciplina che ha come scopo l'organizzazione dello spazio a qualsiasi scala, ma principalmente quella in cui vive l'essere umano. L'arte e la scienza di progettare o costruire strutture o grandi gruppi di strutture, in linea con criteri estetici e funzionali.
gloss_en: The discipline dealing with the principles of design and construction and ornamentation of fine buildings The discipline dealing with the principles of design and construction and ornamentation of fine buildings Architecture is both the process and the product of planning, designing, and constructing buildings or other structures. The art and science of designing and building structures, or large groups of structures, in keeping with aesthetic and functional criteria. The art and science of designing and managing the construction of buildings and other structures, particularly if they are well proportioned and decorated. Art and science of designing buildings and other structures.
The profession of designing buildings and environments with consideration for their esthetic effect The profession of designing buildings and environments with consideration for their esthetic effect

The moldings (or other elements) framing a door, window or other rectangular opening.

An excavated space around the walls of a building
A passageway between buildings or giving access to a basement A passageway between buildings or giving access to a basement An outdoor passage offering access to a basement.

The central area of an ancient Roman amphitheater where contests and spectacles were held; especially an area that was strewn with sand The central area of an ancient Roman amphitheater where contests and spectacles were held; especially an area that was strewn with sand The sand-covered centre of an amphitheatre where contests were held in Ancient Rome. The sand-covered centre of an amphitheatre.

gloss_en: The products of human creativity; works of art collectively The products of human creativity; works of art collectively The products of human creativity; works of art collectively.

gloss_it: L'arte, nel suo significato più ampio, comprende ogni attività umana – svolta singolarmente o collettivamente – che porta a forme di creatività e di espressione estetica, poggiando su accorgimenti tecnici, abilità innate o acquisite e norme comportamentali derivanti dallo studio e dall'esperienza. In cui il termine Varietà si riferisce a spettacoli teatrali compositi, nati per l'intrattenimento all `interno di locali come i bar e i night club; oppure può riferirsi a trasmissioni televisive e spettacoli di carattere leggero con numeri di diverso genere. Attività umana che porta a forme creative di espressione estetica Creazione, con mezzi diversi, di opere con valore estetico con determinati significati.
gloss_en: The creation of beautiful or significant things The creation of beautiful or significant things Art is a diverse range of human activities involving the creation of visual, auditory or performing artifacts, which express the creator's imagination, conceptual ideas, or technical skill, intended to be appreciated primarily for their beauty or emotional power. What has emotional or aesthetic appeal The creation of works of beauty or other special significance. The creative and emotional expression of mental imagery, such as visual, auditory, social, etc.

gloss_it: Raccolta di opere arte.

A collection of works of art housed together.

Someone who buys and sells works of art.

Istituzione, edificio o stanza per la mostra e la conservazione di opere d'arte.

Works of art that are not paintings A work of art with some artistic merit. Work of art.

An object formed by humans, particularly one of interest to archaeologists Something made by humans and of archaeological interest A man-made object taken as a whole. An object, such as a tool, ornament, or weapon of archaeological or historical interest, especially such an object found at an archaeological excavation. Archaeological object.

Il mobile è un contenitore per suppellettili, abiti, biancheria, documenti o altri oggetti. Parte fondamentale dell'arredamento dell'abitazione o di locali adibiti ad altra attività umana
gloss_en: Furnishings that make a room or other area ready for occupancy Furnishings that make a room or other area ready for occupancy Furniture refers to movable objects intended to support various human activities such as seating, eating, and sleeping. A tradesman or craftsman who has completed an apprenticeship, but is not yet a Master tradesman Skilled worker who has successfully completed an official apprenticeship Skilled craft worker who makes or creates things by hand A person who practices or is highly skilled in a craft. Someone who is skilled in their trade; an artisan. A skilled manual worker who uses tools and machinery in a particular craft. Skilled manual worker. Person who creates art as an occupation.

Artists' workshop A workshop or studio, especially for an artist, designer or fashion house. Studio.

Il battistero è l'edificio annesso a una chiesa, qui si svolge il rito del battesimo. gloss_en: Bowl for baptismal water Bowl for baptismal water A baptismal font is an article of church furniture used for baptism. In Christian architecture the baptistery or baptistry is the separate centrally planned structure surrounding the baptismal font. A container for holy water used in the Christian ceremonial of baptism Large basins or other vessels set in or on the ground or fixed on a pedestal and intended for use in the baptismal rite Separate buildings or parts of buildings containing a font for the baptismal rite Building adjacent to a church or in the church itself, for the baptism of catechumens. An article of church furniture or a fixture used for the baptism of children and adults. A large basin used for baptism in or near a church. A basin used for baptism. Space where a baptismal font is located.

gloss_en: A tower that is part of a defensive structure (such as a castle) A tower that is part of a defensive structure (such as a castle) A barbican is a fortified outpost or gateway, such as at an outer defense perimeter of a city or castle, or any tower situated over a gate or bridge which was used for defensive purposes. A mound of earth, especially one placed over a prehistoric tomb; a barrow.

La parte più bassa di un edificio, parzialmente o totalmente sotto il livello del suolo, spesso utilizzata per lo stoccaggio.

gloss_en: A Roman building used for public administration A Roman building used for public administration In the Roman architecture a rectangular building, divided into aisles by rows of columns, intended for public functions (trade, administration of justice etc.); also used for meetings of the early Christian communities

In fortification: an indented parapet, formed by a series of rising members called cops or merlons, separated by openings called crenelles or embrasures, the soldier sheltering himself behind the merlon while he fires through the embrasure or through a loophole in the battlement. Indented parapet formed by a series of rising members. A pattern along the top of a parapet (fortified wall), most often in the form of multiple, regular, rectangular spaces in the top of the wall, through which arrows or other weaponry may be shot, especially as used in medieval European architecture. Pattern along the top of a parapet through which arrows or other weaponry may be shot.

Gruppo sociale di persone che svolgono un'attività intellettuale
gloss_en: An educated and intellectual elite An educated and intellectual elite The intelligentsia is a status class of educated people engaged in the complex mental labours that critique, guide, and lead in shaping the culture and politics of their society. Status class of educated people An elite group of intellectuals; learned people, the literati.

A pattern of regularly spaced horizontal and vertical lines A pattern of regularly spaced horizontal and vertical lines In graphic design, a grid is a structure made up of a series of intersecting straight or curved lines used to structure content. Organized lines for guiding graphic design Used in graphic design to guide objects A pattern of regularly spaced horizontal and vertical lines.

gloss_en: Chiaroscuro painting or stained glass etc., in shades of grey imitating the effect of relief Chiaroscuro painting or stained glass etc., in shades of grey imitating the effect of relief Grisaille is a painting executed entirely in shades of grey or of another neutral greyish colour. Painting technique In painting, a method of working which employs only varying values of gray to create form. Often a preliminary step in a fully colored painting.
A curved edge formed by two intersecting vaults A curved edge formed by two intersecting vaults The surface formed by two such vaults.

Two barrel vaults intersecting at right angles Two barrel vaults intersecting at right angles A groin vault or groined vault is produced by the intersection at right angles of two barrel vaults. A type of vaulted chamber in medieval architecture Produced by the intersection at right angles of two barrel vaults A vault resulting from the intersection of two barrel-vaults crossing in a right angle. Its thrusts are concentrated along the groins or arrises and eventually at the four corners. Structure created by intersection of vaults.

gloss_en: Art characterized by an incongruous mixture of parts of humans and animals interwoven with plants Art characterized by an incongruous mixture of parts of humans and animals interwoven with plants Since at least the 18th century Italy, grotesque has come to be used as a general adjective for the strange, mysterious, magnificent, fantastic, hideous, ugly, incongruous, unpleasant, or disgusting, and thus is often used to describe weird shapes and distorted forms such as Halloween masks. A ceremony to mark the beginning of construction.

A gutter under the eaves of a building.

gloss_it: L'edilizia residenziale pubblica è un'espressione con la quale ci si riferisce comunemente a tre tipi di operazioni edilizie che vedono l'attivazione della pubblica amministrazione statale, a livello nazionale e/o locale, per offrire ai consociati dei beni immobili abitativi in proprietà, in locazione o in superficie. L'housing sociale, traducibile in edilizia residenziale sociale o edilizia abitativa sociale è una tipologia di intervento immobiliare e urbanistico che consiste nel garantire in locazione una soluzione abitativa a individui e nuclei familiari del ceto medio il cui reddito non sia sufficiente per l'acquisto di un immobile, ma sia troppo elevato per accedere a soluzioni di edilizia popolare, benché entrambe le tipologie di abitazione possano coesistere nello stesso ambito urbanistico: infatti in un unico complesso possono trovare posto sia privati gestiti da società di gestione del risparmio, fondazioni o cooperative che alloggi popolari.

Residential properties usually owned by a government Residences built at minimal expense and designed to keep the rental rate or price of purchase affordable for persons with limited means, usually determined by an annual income level set below the local median. Rental accommodation subsidised by public funds and provided for disadvantaged groups such as low-income earners, social-security recipients, the elderly and people with disabilities. Accommodation subsidised by the government for disadvantaged groups.

Branch of art history which studies images Branch of art history The branch of art history dealing with the identification, description, classification and interpretation of the subject-matter of the figurative arts.  A set of specified or traditional symbolic forms associated with the subject or theme of a stylized genre of art. Set of symbolic forms.

gloss_en: The branch of art history that studies visual images and their symbolic meaning (especially in social or political terms) The branch of art history that studies visual images and their symbolic meaning (especially in social or political terms) Iconology is a method of interpretation in cultural history and the history of the visual arts used by Aby Warburg, Erwin Panofsky and their followers that uncovers the cultural, social, and historical background of themes and subjects in the visual arts. The study of icons in art or art history. The study of icons.

gloss_it: L'archeologia subacquea è una branca dell'archeologia. L'archeologia marittima o archeologia marina, è una disciplina all'interno delle scienze archeologiche che si occupa dello studio del rapporto tra l'uomo e il mare, i laghi e i fiumi, attraverso l'analisi dei resti di navi, attrezzature costiere, strutture portuali, carichi sommersi, resti umani o paesaggi sommersi.
gloss_en: The archeology of underwater sites The archeology of underwater sites Underwater archaeology is archaeology practiced underwater. Maritime archaeology is a discipline within archaeology as a whole that specifically studies human interaction with the sea, lakes and rivers through the study of associated physical remains, be they vessels, shore-side facilities, port-related structures, cargoes, human remains and submerged landscapes. Archaeology of underwater sites and artifacts Archaeological study of human interaction with the sea A branch of archaeology that specializes in seas, lakes, and rivers. Discipline.

gloss_en: A prefabricated hut of corrugated iron having a semicircular cross section A prefabricated hut of corrugated iron having a semicircular cross section A Nissen hut is a prefabricated steel structure for military use, especially as barracks, made from a half-cylindrical skin of corrugated iron. Architectural term The transversal part of a church, which crosses at right angles to the greatest length, and between the nave and choir. In the basilicas, this had often no projection at its two ends. In Gothic churches these project greatly, and should be called the arms of the transept. It is common, however, to speak of the arms themselves as the transepts.

gloss_it: La Josiah Wedgwood & Sons Ltd., poi semplicemente Josiah Wedgwood Ltd. e comunemente nota come Wedgwood, è una manifattura inglese di ceramica fine, con sede nello Staffordshire, nota per le sue produzioni di creamware, basaltware e jasperware.
gloss_en: A type of pottery made by Josiah Wedgwood and his successors; typically has a classical decoration in white on a blue background A type of pottery made by Josiah Wedgwood and his successors; typically has a classical decoration in white on a blue background Wedgwood is a fine china, porcelain, and luxury accessories manufacturer that was founded on 1 May 1759 by the English potter and entrepreneur Josiah Wedgwood and was first incorporated in 1895 as Josiah Wedgwood and Sons Ltd. It was rapidly successful and was soon one of the largest manufacturers of Staffordshire pottery, "a firm that has done more to spread the knowledge and enhance the reputation of British ceramic art than any other manufacturer", exporting across Europe as far as Russia, and to the Americas. The term percent for art refers to a program, often a city ordinance, where a fee, usually some percentage of the project cost, is placed on large scale development projects in order to fund and install public art. The details of such programs vary from area-to-area. program, often a city ordinance, where a fee, usually some percentage of the project cost, is placed on large scale development projects in order to fund and install public art; details of such programs vary from area to area

gloss_it: Gloriette è il nome che veniva dato nel XII secolo ad una piccola camera e, a partire dal rinascimento a un piccolo padiglione o ad un tempietto all'antica sito nel parco di un castello, come luogo propizio al riposo e alla poesia.
gloss_en: A gloriette is a building in a garden erected on a site that is elevated with respect to the surroundings. Park feature, often a type of pavillion

gloss_it: Un khachkar è un cippo funerario scolpito che si trova tipicamente in Armenia. Stele funeraria, votiva o commemorativa che reca una croce. Simbolo religioso armeno
gloss_en: A khachkar, also known as an Armenian cross-stone is a carved, memorial stele bearing a cross, and often with additional motifs such as rosettes, interlaces, and botanical motifs. Carved, memorial stele bearing a cross, Armenian symbol An Armenian carved memorial stone. Armenian carved memorial stone.
A bolection is a decorative moulding which projects beyond the face of a panel or frame in raised panel walls, doors, and fireplaces.
The word foral is a noun derived from the Portuguese word foro, ultimately from Latin forum, equivalent to Spanish fuero, Galician foro, Catalan fur and Basque foru.
A monolithic column or single-piece column is a large column of which the shaft is made from a single piece of stone instead of in vertical sections. Column made from one single piece of stone
Process of formulating, adding color, shading, and texturing of an image

A fire control tower is a structure located near the coastline, used to detect and locate enemy vessels offshore, direct fire upon them from coastal batteries, or adjust the aim of guns by spotting shell splashes.

A window valance is a form of window treatment that covers the uppermost part of the window and can be hung alone or paired with window blinds, or curtains. Used above a window to conceal hardware or other window treatments treatment that covers the uppermost part of a window

In printmaking, a counterproof is a print taken off from another just printed, which, by being passed through the press, gives a copy in reverse, and of course in the same position as that of the plate from which the first was printed, the object being to enable the printmaker to inspect the state of the plate.
A "Doom painting" or "Doom" is a traditional English term for a wall-painting of the Last Judgment in a medieval church.
A herbaceous border is a collection of perennial herbaceous plants arranged closely together, usually to create a dramatic effect through colour, shape or large scale.
An atmospheric theatre is a type of movie palace design which was popular in the late 1920s. A type of cinema architecture Type of movie theater
In archaeology, a stone ball or petrosphere is the name for any spherical man-made object of any size that is composed of stone. Spherical man-made object of any size that is composed of stone
A monumental inscription is an inscription, typically carved in stone, on a grave marker, cenotaph, memorial plaque, church monument or other memorial.

gloss_it: La coppa diatreta è una tipologia di contenitore in vetro romano di lusso, diffusosi intorno al IV secolo circa, e considerato «il pinnacolo delle potenzialità dei romani nella lavorazione del vetro».
gloss_en: A cage cup, also vas diatretum, plural diatreta, or "reticulated cup" is a type of luxury Late Roman glass vessel, found from roughly the 4th century, and "the pinnacle of Roman achievements in glass-making". Luxury Late Roman glass vessel
The architecture of Iceland draws from Scandinavian influences and traditionally was influenced by the lack of native trees on the island. Overview about the architecture of Iceland

gloss_it: La calligrafia occidentale in alfabeto latino ha una storia molto complessa: nel corso dei secoli si è evoluta e tutt'ora continua ad evolversi.
gloss_en: Western calligraphy is the art of writing and penmanship as practiced in the Western world, especially using the Latin alphabet.
A strainer bar is used to construct a wooden stretcher frame used by artists to mount their canvases. Wooden frame to hold canvas taut, as for a painting surface
In geometry, a pentagonal pyramid is a pyramid with a pentagonal base upon which are erected five triangular faces that meet at a point.

gloss_it: Una fiera o esposizione è una manifestazione in cui si presentano al pubblico dei prodotti, al fine di poterli vendere e/o pubblicizzare. Manifestazione in cui si espongono al pubblico dei prodotti
gloss_en: A trade fair is an exhibition organized so that companies in a specific industry can showcase and demonstrate their latest products and services, meet with industry partners and customers, study activities of rivals, and examine recent market trends and opportunities. Or expo, a trade show Exhibition organized so that companies can showcase or/and demonstrate their newest products An exhibition at which members of a specific industry exhibit or demonstrate their products to prospective customers and to each other. Exhibition for a particular field.
A sliver building is a tall slender building constructed on a lot with a narrow frontage, typically 45 feet or less. A tall slender building

A diaphragm arch is a transverse wall-bearing arch forming a partial wall dividing a vault or a ceiling into compartments. A type of arch Transverse wall-bearing arch forming a partial wall dividing a vault or a ceiling

gloss_it: Il Westwerk è quella costruzione architettonica tipicamente medioevale di epoca carolingia che venne costruita a ridosso delle grandi chiese del Sacro Romano Impero.
gloss_en: A westwork, forepart, avant-corps or avancorpo is the monumental, often west-facing entrance section of a Carolingian, Ottonian, or Romanesque church. Monumental, west-facing entrance section of a Carolingian, Ottonian, or Romanesque church The vaulted monumental structure at the western end of a church constructed in some medieval styles, flanked by two towers and containing the entrance. Architectural feature.

gloss_it: Con il termine di origine tedesco Blockhaus si intende un tipo di abitazione con pianta rettangolare e circondata da pareti in legno.
gloss_en: A log house, or log building, is a structure built with horizontal logs interlocked at the corners by notching. Type of house, built from wooden logs; much the same as a log cabin

Thiruvallur Veeraraghava Swamy Temple is a temple dedicated to Hindu god Vishnu, located in Thiruvallur, Chennai Metropolitan City, an area and headquarters in Tiruvallur district in the South Indian state of Tamil Nadu.

A cabriole leg is one of four vertical supports of a piece of furniture shaped in two curves; the upper arc is convex, while lower is concave; the upper curve always bows outward, while the lower curve bows inward; with the axes of the two curves in the same plane. In furniture design, a curved leg with outcurved knee and incurved ankle. A signature design element of the Queen Anne style of furniture, the cabriole predates both 18th century England and Italy. The style originated in Italy and is a conventionalized representation of the rear leg of a leaping goat.
A guard tower is any military tower used for guarding an area. Type of military fortification

gloss_it: La libertà di panorama è una limitazione del diritto d'autore che consente di scattare e riprodurre fotografie di edifici, opere e luoghi pubblici, senza infrangere il diritto d'autore di alcuno. Limitazione del diritto d'autore per le riproduzioni di opere presenti in luoghi pubblici
gloss_en: Freedom of panorama is a provision in the copyright laws of various jurisdictions that permits taking photographs and video footage and creating other images of buildings and sometimes sculptures and other art works which are permanently located in a public place, without infringing on any copyright that may otherwise subsist in such works, and the publishing of such images. The concept in copyright law that permits taking pictures or video of publicly displayed art Limitation to copyright A provision in copyright law that permits taking photographs or video footage, or creating other images (such as paintings), of buildings and sometimes artworks that are permanently located in a public place, and publishing such images without infringing copyright. Provision in copyright law.

gloss_it: Nel sistema delle caste presente nell'America spagnola in epoca coloniale, un peninsular era uno spagnolo nato in madrepatria, e si contrapponeva alle persone di discendenza pura spagnola ma nati nel Nuovo Mondo.
gloss_en: In the context of the Spanish colonial empire, a peninsular was a Spaniard born in Spain residing in the New World, Spanish East Indies, or Spanish Guinea. Inhabitants of Spain and their descendants who immigrated to the Americas
The architecture of Manchester demonstrates a rich variety of architectural styles.

gloss_it: Il termine visir, indicava un alto funzionario presso la corte musulmana/ottomana di un sultano, di un emiro o di un califfo.
gloss_en: The vizier was the highest official in ancient Egypt to serve the pharaoh during the Old, Middle, and New Kingdoms. Highest rank of official in Ancient Egypt
A round barrow is a type of tumulus and is one of the most common types of archaeological monuments. Hemispherical mound of earth and/or stone raised over a burial placed in the middle
As with other cities in Ireland, Limerick has a history of great architecture.

In art and archaeology, in sculpture as well as in painting, a register is a horizontal level in a work that consists of several levels arranged one above the other, especially where the levels are clearly separated by lines. The separation of multiple pictographic scenes from each other Part of a visual design A distinct horizontal (or, more rarely, vertical) section of a work of art or inscription that is divided into several such sections.

gloss_it: L'intercolunnio, dal latino intercolumnium è in architettura lo spazio compreso fra due colonne di un colonnato, misurato nella parte inferiore della colonna.
gloss_en: In architecture, intercolumniation is the spacing between columns in a colonnade, as measured at the bottom of their shafts. Spacing between columns in a colonnade The spaces between adjacent columns (of a colonnade).
A double-deck elevator or double-deck lift is an elevator where one cab is stacked on top of another.
A Shabbat elevator is an elevator which works in a special mode, operating automatically, to satisfy the Jewish law requiring Jews to abstain from operating electrical switches on Shabbat.

gloss_it: L'architettura francese fu inizialmente influenzata da quella romana, quando, con la conquista della Gallia da parte di Giulio Cesare, fu dato avvio alla costruzione di colonie di veterani, ben presto divenute vere e proprie città come nel caso di Lione, già Lugdunum.
gloss_en: French architecture consists of numerous architectural styles that either originated in France or elsewhere and were developed within the territories of France.
An inflatable building is a structure constructed using two layers of membrane connected together, typically using spars made from the same material.

gloss_it: Il microbulino è una tecnica usata nel mesolitico per la produzione di manufatti come le punte di freccia e microliti in genere.
gloss_en: A microburin is a characteristic waste product from manufacture of lithic tools — sometimes confused with an authentic burin — which is characteristic of the Mesolithic, but which has been recorded from the end of the Upper Paleolithic until the Calcolithic. A characteristic waste product from the ancient manufacture of lithic tools: a fragment of a lithic flake or blade that shows on its upper face the beginnings of a notch terminating in an oblique flection that ends in a very acute trihedral apex.

gloss_it: Un ostrakon o ostracon è un pezzo di ceramica, solitamente rotto da un vaso o altri recipienti di terracotta. In senso più lato, i frammenti di materiali fragili (ad esempio il vetro). Un esempio sono gli ostraka usati nell `antica Atene come schede elettorali.
gloss_en: An ostracon is a piece of pottery, usually broken off from a vase or other earthenware vessel. Broken piece of pottery with inscription A piece of pottery or stone, usually broken off from a vase or other earthenware vessel, especially one used to cast a vote during the Ancient Greek process of ostracism.
Roof comb is the structure that tops a pyramid in monumental Mesoamerican architecture.

gloss_it: L'opera listata o opus vittatum è una tecnica edilizia romana nella quale il paramento del nucleo di cementizio della muratura è costituito da filari di laterizi alternati a filari di altri materiali. tecnica edilizia dell'antica civiltà romana
gloss_en: Opus vittatum, also called Opus listatum was an ancient Roman construction technique introduced at the beginning of the fourth century, made by parallel horizontal courses of tuff blocks alternated with bricks. Roman construction technique using horizontal courses of tuff blocks alternated with bricks
Opus craticum or craticii is an ancient Roman construction technique described by Vitruvius in his books De architectura as wattlework which is plastered over.

gloss_it: L'opera incerta è una tecnica edilizia romana che riguarda il modo in cui viene realizzato il paramento di un muro in opera cementizia. tecnica edilizia dell'antica civiltà romana
gloss_en: Opus incertum was an ancient Roman construction technique, using irregularly shaped and randomly placed uncut stones or fist-sized tuff blocks inserted in a core of opus caementicium. Ancient Roman construction technique An Ancient Roman construction technique, using irregular-shaped and randomly placed uncut stones or fist-sized tuff blocks inserted in a core of opus caementicium (Roman concrete).

A sky lobby is an intermediate interchange floor in a skyscraper where people can change from an express elevator that stops only at the sky lobby to a local elevator which stops at every floor within a segment of the building. Intermediate interchange floor where people can change from an express elevator to a local elevator

lab_en: architecture of the republic of ireland
gloss_en: The architecture of the Republic of Ireland is one of the most visible features in the Irish countryside – with remains from all eras since the Stone Age abounding.

A misericord is a small wooden structure formed on the underside of a folding seat in a church which, when the seat is folded up, is intended to act as a shelf to support a person in a partially standing position during long periods of prayer. A ledge, sometimes ornately carved, attached to a folding church seat to provide support for a person standing for long periods; a subsellium. Ledge.

gloss_it: Ci fu a più riprese un Théâtre italien de Paris a Parigi.
gloss_en: Comédie-Italienne or Théâtre-Italien are French names which have been used to refer to Italian-language theatre and opera when performed in France. Italian-language theatre and opera performed in France

A starter home or starter house is a house that is usually the first which a person or family can afford to purchase, often using a combination of savings and mortgage financing. A relatively small and inexpensive home, typically the first that a person or family can afford to purchase.

gloss_it: Il cristallo di Boemia, è un vetro decorativo prodotto, sin dal XIII secolo, nelle regioni di Boemia e Slesia, ora facenti parte della Repubblica Ceca.
gloss_en: Bohemian glass, chiefly referred to as Bohemia crystal, is glass produced in the regions of Bohemia and Silesia, now parts of the Czech Republic. Potash lime glass

gloss_it: La chimera in architettura è utilizzata per descrivere un elemento decorativo rappresentante una figura fantastica, mitica o grottesca, tendenzialmente zoomorfica. Rappresentante una creatura zoomorfa scolpita in maniera grottesca e/o immaginifica Elemento architettonico
gloss_en: In architecture, a grotesque or chimera is a fantastic or mythical figure used for decorative purposes. A fantastic, mythical or grotesque decorative feature Fantastic or mythical figure used as architectural element

gloss_it: Gord è il termine usato per indicare un tipo di insediamento fortificato slavo costruito in legno; si usa a volte il termine tedesco burgwall per indicare tali siti.
gloss_en: A gord is a medieval Slavic fortified wooden settlement, sometimes known as a burgwall after the German term for such sites. A typical, Slavic settlement type of the High Middle Ages, sometimes called a Slavic burgwall Medieval Slavonic fortified settlement
A Projection panel is a device that, although no longer in production, was used as a data projector is today.
Namako wall or Namako-kabe is a Japanese wall design widely used for vernacular houses, particularly on fireproof storehouses by the latter half of the Edo period.

Integrated design is a comprehensive holistic approach to design which brings together specialisms usually considered separately. Comprehensive holistic approach to design which brings together specialisms usually considered separately

gloss_it: Il timpano è, nell'architettura templare, la superficie verticale triangolare racchiusa nella cornice del frontone, i cui tre lati si chiamano geison. Elemento architettonico
gloss_en: A tympanum is the semi-circular or triangular decorative wall surface over an entrance, door or window, which is bounded by a lintel and an arch. It often contains sculpture or other imagery or ornaments. An architectural element located within the arch or pediment Architectural element

gloss_it: Il gotico in Italia ha caratteristiche che lo distinguono notevolmente da quello del luogo d'origine dell'architettura gotica, cioè la Francia, e dagli altri paesi europei in cui questo linguaggio si è diffuso. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Gothic architecture appeared in the prosperous independent city-states of Italy in the 12th century, later than in Northern Europe. Style of architecture

gloss_it: Il gotico francese è la più antica ed una delle più famose varianti dell'arte gotica.
gloss_en: French Gothic architecture is an architectural style which emerged in France in 1140, and was dominant until the mid-16th century.

gloss_it: Il Gotico spagnolo riprende lo stile francese, ma con certa differenze, come il triforio cieco, le nervature assiali e l'assenza del matroneo.
gloss_en: Spanish Gothic architecture is the style of architecture prevalent in Spain in the Late Medieval period.
Portuguese Gothic architecture is the architectural style prevalent in Portugal in the Late Middle Ages.

gloss_it: La farsa fliacica fu un genere drammatico comico sviluppatosi nelle colonie doriche della Magna Grecia in età ellenistica, tra il IV e il III secolo a.C. Si trattava di una tipologia teatrale del tutto particolare, che ebbe forse origine nella stessa Italia meridionale, seppure grazie alle influenze provenienti dall'Ellade, e influenzò la nascita del teatro latino.
gloss_en: A Phlyax play, also known as a hilarotragedy, was a burlesque dramatic form that developed in the Greek colonies of Magna Graecia in the 4th century BC.
The architecture of England is the architecture of modern England and in the historic Kingdom of England. Architectural styles of modern England and the historic Kingdom of England

gloss_it: La Madonna del parto è un affresco realizzato da Piero della Francesca, databile al 1455-1465 circa, e conservato in un museo appositamente predisposto di Monterchi, proveniente dalla cappella di Santa Maria di Momentana.
gloss_en: A Madonna del Parto is an iconic depiction of the Virgin Mary shown as pregnant, which was developed in Italy, mainly in Tuscany in the 14th century. Fresco by Piero della Francesca
Interior architecture is the design of a building or shelter from inside out, or the design of a new interior for a type of home that can be fixed.

gloss_it: Un alzacristallo è un dispositivo usato per alzare o abbassare i finestrini, ed è presente praticamente su tutte le auto.
gloss_en: Power windows or electric windows are automobile windows which can be raised and lowered by pressing a button or switch, as opposed to using a crank handle. Automobile windows that are raised and lowered by a switch Automobile windows which can be raised and lowered by pressing a button or switch, as opposed to using a crank handle
In the construction of masonry buildings, a fire cut or fireman's cut is a diagonal cut along the end of a joist or beam where it enters a masonry wall.

gloss_it: Lo Stile Adam è il nome dato all'architettura elaborata dai fratelli Robert Adam e James Adam nella seconda metà del Settecento, diffusasi in Inghilterra e nel Nord America.
gloss_en: The Adam style is an 18th-century neoclassical style of interior design and architecture, as practised by the three Scottish brothers Robert Adam, James Adam and William Adam, of whom Robert and James were the most widely known. A style of interior decoration with elaborate plasterwork Neoclassical style of interior design and architecture

gloss_it: In Europa, dalla metà del XVII secolo, per un periodo di quasi tre secoli, le locande di posta e osterie di posta furono una delle strutture più importanti per i viaggiatori di terra.
gloss_en: The coaching inn was a vital part of Europe's inland transport infrastructure until the development of the railway, providing a resting point for people and horses.
A picture stone, image stone or figure stone is an ornate slab of stone, usually limestone, which was raised in Germanic Iron Age or Viking Age Scandinavia, and in the greatest number on Gotland.

gloss_it: Achiet-le-Petit è un comune francese di 338 abitanti situato nel dipartimento del Passo di Calais nella regione dell'Alta Francia.
gloss_en: Achiet-le-Petit is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in northern France.

Holbein carpets are a type of carpet taking their name from Hans Holbein the Younger, due to their depiction in European Renaissance paintings, although they are shown in paintings from many decades earlier than Holbein. A type of Ottoman carpet

The architecture of Toronto is an eclectic combination of architectural styles, ranging from 19th century Georgian architecture, to 21st century postmodern architecture and beyond. Overview of the architecture of Toronto

gloss_it: La conservazione storica o heritage preservation negli USA e heritage conservation nel Regno Unito, è uno sforzo che cerca di preservare, conservare e proteggere gli edifici, oggetti, paesaggi o altri manufatti di importanza storica. Sforzo che cerca di preservare, conservare e proteggere gli edifici, oggetti, paesaggi o altri manufatti di importanza storica
gloss_en: Historic preservation, heritage preservation or heritage conservation, is an endeavor that seeks to preserve, conserve and protect buildings, objects, landscapes or other artifacts of historical significance. Of buildings, monuments, etc..
The architecture of Croatia has roots in a long history: the Croats have inhabited the area for fourteen centuries, but there are important remnants of earlier periods still preserved in the country.

gloss_it: Lo Spielberg fortezza della città di Brno, in Repubblica Ceca. In cui fu incarcerato Silvio Pellico Fortezza della città di Brno
gloss_en: Špilberk Castle is a castle on the hilltop in Brno, Southern Moravia. building in Czech republic, used as prison by Nazis hill in Brno-město, Czech Republic
In architecture, a brief is a statement of a client's requirements, which form the basis for appointing an architect. A type of educational or business document including desires and requirements
A weep, a weep hole, or a weep-brick is a small opening that allows water to drain from within an assembly. small opening that allows water to drain from within an assembly

A broach spire is a type of tall pyramidal structure, which usually sits atop a tower or turret of a church. A spire that starts on a square base and is carried up to a tapering octagonal spire by means of triangular faces type of spire

In the United States, an architectural firm or architecture firm is a company which employs one or more licensed architects and practices the profession of architecture; while in South Africa, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Denmark and other countries, an architectural firm is a company which offers architectural services. Company employing licensed architects, offering architecture-related services
The architecture of Azerbaijan refers to the architecture development in Azerbaijan. The architecture development in Azerbaijan
A cartouche is an oval or oblong design with a slightly convex surface, typically edged with ornamental scrollwork. A scrolling frame device Frame for a painted or engraved design
A blind arch is an arch found in the wall of a building that has been infilled with solid construction and so cannot serve as a passageway, door or window.

Open plan is the generic term used in architectural and interior design for any floor plan which makes use of large, open spaces and minimizes the use of small, enclosed rooms such as private offices. Floor plan which makes use of large, open spaces and minimizes the use of small, enclosed rooms such as private offices; open workplace

gloss_it: Nell'antica architettura greca e romana, il peribolos era una corte racchiusa da un muro che circonda un'area sacra come un tempio, un santuario o un altare. Recinzione di uno spazio sacro
gloss_en: In ancient Greek and Roman architecture, a peribolos was a court enclosed by a wall, especially one surrounding a sacred area such as a temple, shrine, or altar. An enclosed court, especially one surrounding a temple.

gloss_it: Trofeo, nel linguaggio artistico indica un ornamento che è rappresentato per lo più da gruppi decorativi ordinati di armi o trofei di caccia o bottini di guerra.
gloss_en: A trophy is an architectural ornament representing a group of weapons, banners and armour. An architectural ornament
Buckland-by-Faversham was one of the parishes to the south-west of Faversham in Kent, England.

gloss_it: Basilica minore è una denominazione onorifica che il papa concede, tramite un breve apostolico, a edifici religiosi cattolici particolarmente importanti attribuendovi il rango di basilica. Titolo onorifico accordato ad alcune chiese cattoliche
gloss_en: Title given to some Roman Catholic churches

Building services engineering is a professional engineering discipline that strives to achieve a safe and comfortable indoor environment whilst minimizing the environmental impact of a building. Discipline that strives to achieve a safe and comfortable indoor environment whilst minimizing the environmental impact of a building
The term bodega in Spanish can mean "pantry", "tavern", or "wine cellar". Spanish still-life genre in baroque art

gloss_it: Il termine croce inscritta denota la forma architettonica dominante nelle chiese bizantine del medio e ultimo periodo.
gloss_en: A cross-in-square or crossed-dome plan was the dominant architectural form of middle- and late-period Byzantine churches. Architectural form of middle- and late-period Byzantine churches

The solar was a room in many English and French medieval manor houses, great houses and castles, mostly on an upper storey, designed as the family's private living and sleeping quarters. A place in many medieval homes Private chamber in English medieval domestic architecture A loft or upper chamber forming the private accommodation of the head of the household in a medieval hall; a garret room.

Tiled printing is a method that computer programs use to enable users to print images larger than a standard page, popularized by a program called The Rasterbator. method that computer programs use to enable users to print images larger than a standard page, popularized by a program called The Rasterbator
Skyscrapers are frequently featured in films for their impressive appearance and potent symbolism.
A lattice tower or truss tower is a freestanding vertical framework tower. Freestanding framework tower
Talavera pottery is a Mexican and Spanish pottery tradition from Talavera de la Reina, in Spain.
A church porch is a room-like structure at a church's main entrance.

In construction or renovation, underpinning is the process of strengthening the foundation of an existing building or other structure. process of strengthening the foundation of an existing building or other structure A support or foundation, especially as a structure of masonry that supports a wall. A support or foundation of a structure.

gloss_it: L'architettura organica è una branca dell'architettura moderna che promuove un'armonia tra l'uomo e la natura, la creazione di un nuovo sistema in equilibrio tra ambiente costruito e ambiente naturale attraverso l'integrazione dei vari elementi artificiali propri dell'uomo, e naturali dell'intorno ambientale del sito. Branca dell'architettura moderna
gloss_en: Organic architecture is a philosophy of architecture which promotes harmony between human habitation and the natural world. A philosophy of architectural design, emerging in the early 20th century, asserting that in structure and appearance a building should be based on organic forms and should harmonize with its natural environment
Spar boxes are a type of folk art, crafted by miners to display minerals and crystals they have found. Folk art crafted by miners with the minerals and crystals found within the mountains

gloss_it: La rocca è una costruzione fortificata eretta a presidio di un territorio, preferibilmente in un luogo elevato e scosceso. Fortezza costruita in un luogo elevato e scosceso Costruzione fortificata costruita in un luogo elevato e scosceso
gloss_en: A rocca is a type of Italian fortified stronghold or fortress, typically located on a hilltop, beneath or on which the inhabitants of a historically clustered village or town might take refuge at times of trouble. A fortifiable stronghold High, fortifiable stronghold

gloss_it: Architettura georgiana è il nome dato nei paesi anglofoni agli stili architettonici che si sono susseguiti fra il 1720 e il 1840, che prendono il nome dai quattro monarchi inglesi chiamati George, ovvero la cosiddetta era georgiana.
gloss_en: Georgian architecture is the name given in most English-speaking countries to the set of architectural styles current between 1714 and 1830. Set of architectural styles current between 1720 and 1840
A revolving restaurant or rotating restaurant is usually a tower restaurant eating space designed to rest atop a broad circular revolving platform that operates as a large turntable.
A bump gate is a drive-through gate used in rural areas to provide a barrier to livestock that does not require the driver to exit the vehicle. Drive-through gate used in rural areas

A windstorm inspection, also referred to as a windstorm mitigation inspection, windstorm insurance inspection or wind mitigation inspection, is a kind of home inspection common in the coastal areas of the Southeastern United States.
A dado rail, also known as a chair rail or surbase, is a type of moulding fixed horizontally to the wall around the perimeter of a room.

A coffin portrait was a realistic portrait of the deceased person put on coffins for the funeral and one of the elements of the castrum doloris, but removed before the burial. portrait of the deceased used to decorate a coffin during a funeral service

gloss_it: La leva Barker è un sistema pneumatico che moltiplica la forza di un dito sul tasto di un organo a canne meccanico.
gloss_en: The Barker lever is a pneumatic system which multiplies the force of a finger on the key of a tracker pipe organ.

In broadcast facilities and television studios, a central apparatus room, central machine room, or central equipment room, or central technical area, or rack room is where shared equipment common to all technical areas is located. An equipment room found at broadcasting facilities
A Japanese wall is composed of a mixture of sand, clay, diatomaceous earth and straw, and is a traditional element in the construction of Japanese teahouses, castles and temples.
Pole framing or post-frame construction is a simplified building technique adapted from the labor-intensive traditional timber framing technique. construction method

gloss_it: La croce astile, o croce processionale, è un oggetto liturgico usato dalla Chiesa cattolica e da altre confessioni cristiane. Oggetto liturgico
gloss_en: A processional cross is a crucifix or cross which is carried in Christian processions. A Crucifix held during a Christian procession Cross or crucifix held during a Christian procession

French furniture comprises both the most sophisticated furniture made in Paris for king and court, aristocrats and rich upper bourgeoisie, on the one hand, and French provincial furniture made in the provincial cities and towns many of which, like Lyon and Liège, retained cultural identities distinct from the metropolis.

gloss_it: L'opera cementizia è una tecnica edilizia inventata e ampiamente utilizzata dai Romani. Tecnica edilizia dell'antica civiltà romana
gloss_en: Roman concrete, also called opus caementicium, was a material used in construction in Ancient Rome. Building material used in construction during the late Roman Republic
Colombia's architectural heritage includes Spanish colonial architecture including Catholic churches.

Portuguese pavement is a traditional-style pavement used for many pedestrian areas in Portugal. The traditional paving used in most pedestrian areas in Portugal ("Calçada Portuguesa" in Portuguese) Pavement used for pedestrian areas A pavement consisting of small flat pieces of various different stones arranged in a mosaic pattern.

gloss_it: La Falsa porta è un elemento architettonico in pietra o legno raffigurante una simbolica porta che con la sua magica funzione consentiva al Ka del defunto di transitare, attraverso la via dell'Aldilà, dal regno dei morti a quello dei vivi e viceversa. Elemento architettonico dell'Antico Egitto
gloss_en: A false door, or recessed niche, is an artistic representation of a door which does not function like a real door. architectural pattern in Ancient Egypt
A wall dormer is a dormer whose facial plane is integral with the facial plane of the wall that it is built into, breaking the line of the eaves of a building.
Quilt art, sometimes known as art quilting, mixed media art quilts or fiber art quilts, is an art form that uses both modern and traditional quilting techniques to create art objects.

Architectural photography is the sub genre of the photography discipline where the primary emphasis is made to capturing photographs of buildings and similar architectural structures that are both aesthetically pleasing and accurate in terms of representations of their subjects.

lab_en: the five point palm exploding heart technique
five point palm exploding heart technique
gloss_it: Dianxue è un termine delle arti marziali cinesi che indica l'arte di riconoscere e colpire i punti che possono provocare danni al proprio avversario.
gloss_en: The touch of death refers to any martial arts technique reputed to kill using seemingly less than lethal force targeted at specific areas of the body. Martial arts techniques reputed to kill using seemingly less than lethal force targeted at specific points on the body
A natural building involves a range of building systems and materials that place major emphasis on sustainability.

gloss_it: Si chiama ipostilo uno spazio chiuso in cui il tetto è sostenuto da colonne.
gloss_en: In architecture, a hypostyle hall has a roof which is supported by columns. Hall with a roof supported by columns A building or chamber whose roof is supported on a row of columns. Architecture: a building or chamber whose roof is supported on a row of columns.
Work system has been used loosely in many areas.

gloss_it: Le arti applicate rappresentano l'insieme delle applicazioni di forme d'arte alla progettazione e alla decorazione di oggetti per renderli esteticamente gradevoli. Insieme delle applicazioni di forme d'arte alla progettazione e alla decorazione di oggetti per renderli esteticamente gradevoli
gloss_en: The applied arts are all the arts that apply design and decoration to everyday and essentially practical objects in order to make them aesthetically pleasing. Branch in the production of consumer goods

A church hall or parish hall is a room or building associated with a church, general for community and charitable use. Room or building associated with a church building, general for community and charitable use

gloss_it: La prospettiva aerea, come ogni forma di prospettiva, è un tentativo di rappresentare sulla superficie piana di un'opera pittorica la terza dimensione, data da una illusoria profondità di campo.
gloss_en: Aerial perspective or atmospheric perspective refers to the effect the atmosphere has on the appearance of an object as viewed from a distance. The effect the atmosphere has on the appearance of an object as it is viewed from a distance Effect the atmosphere has on the appearance of an object as it is viewed from a distance

In structural engineering, a diaphragm is a structural element that transmits lateral loads to the vertical resisting elements of a structure. A structural engineering system used to resist lateral loads

gloss_it: La sala del trono è una stanza, spesso un salone, situata nella residenza ufficiale del sovrano, che sia questa un palazzo o un castello fortificato, in cui si trova il trono. Stanza situata nella residenza ufficiale del sovrano.
gloss_en: A throne room or throne hall is the room, often rather a hall, in the official residence of the crown, either a palace or a fortified castle, where the throne of a senior figure is set up with elaborate pomp—usually raised, often with steps, and under a canopy, both of which are part of the original notion of the Greek word thronos. Room in the official residence of the crown A room with a throne, particularly.

gloss_it: Il dinos era un vaso utilizzato in Grecia prevalentemente per mescolare l'acqua al vino. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: In the typology of ancient Greek pottery, the dinos is a mixing bowl or cauldron. An Ancient Greek mixing bowl Ancient mixing bowl or cauldron An Ancient Greek mixing-bowl or cauldron, without handles or feet.
Bratislava fortifications usually refers to the medieval city fortifications of Bratislava, the capital of Slovakia, of which one gate and two sections of walls remain today.

gloss_it: Il termine green building indica, a livello internazionale, un edificio progettato, costruito e gestito in maniera sostenibile ed efficiente, nonché certificato come tale da un ente terzo indipendente.
gloss_en: Green building refers to both a structure and the application of processes that are environmentally responsible and resource-efficient throughout a building's life-cycle: from planning to design, construction, operation, maintenance, renovation, and demolition. Architecture designed to minimize environmental and resource impact A building designed to be ecologically correct by using resources efficiently, using internal recycling, renewable energy sources, recyclable or biodegradable construction materials, and blending in with the local environment, particularly in out-of-town locations. The aims are to reduce to a minimum the environmental impact, and to take human health factors into consideration.
A teardown is the demolition and replacement of a home or other building that was recently purchased for that purpose. The process of replacing an old house with a new one

Giyōfū architecture was a style of Japanese architecture which outwardly resembled Western-style construction but relied on traditional Japanese techniques. a style of Japanese architecture which outwardly resembled Western-style construction in Meiji period

A gunpowder magazine is a magazine designed to store the explosive gunpowder in wooden barrels for safety. A magazine (building) designed to store the explosive gunpowder in wooden barrels for safety Building for the storage of gunpowder

gloss_it: Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Eclecticism is a nineteenth and twentieth-century architectural style in which a single piece of work incorporates a mixture of elements from previous historical styles to create something that is new and original. Architectural style

gloss_it: Il termine laterizio indicava i mattoni impiegati nella tecnica edilizia romana per l'opera laterizia.
gloss_en: Roman brick can refer either to a type of brick used in Ancient Roman architecture and spread by the Romans to the lands they conquered; or to a modern type inspired by the ancient prototypes. Style of brick used in Ancient Roman architecture A modern type of brick inspired by the ancient prototypes, characteristically longer and flatter than standard bricks.

A moot hill or mons placiti is a hill or mound historically used as an assembly or meeting place, as a moot hall is a meeting or assembly building, also traditionally to decide local issues. A hill or mound historically used as an assembly or meeting place Hill or mound historically used as an assembly or meeting place
A stins is a former stronghold or villa in the province of Friesland, the Netherlands.

gloss_it: La lanterna in architettura è la struttura posta alla sommità di una cupola. Struttura posta alla sommità di una cupola o di una torre Struttura architettonica
gloss_en: A roof lantern is a daylighting architectural element. An architectural term to describe a structure above a dome, or other roof, with openings to admit light or air. Often crowned with a cupola, or in the form of a "Lantern Tower". Architectural element

A measurement tower or met mast is a free standing tower or a removed mast, which carries measuring instruments with meteorological instruments such as thermometers and instruments to measure windspeed.

A bomb tower is a lightly constructed tower, often 100 to 700 feet high, built to hold a nuclear weapon for an above ground nuclear test. The tower holds the bomb for the purpose of the investigation of its destructive effects and for the adjustment of measuring instruments, such as high-speed cameras.

gloss_it: In architettura, il termine padiglione ha assunto diversi significati. Struttura a se stante situata in parchi e giardini spesso facente parte di un edificio principale. (vedere anche gazebo); ai giorni nostri, costruzione, provvisoria o definitiva, spesso costruita per formare un complesso di padiglioni utilizzati per esempio in avvenimenti fieristici o mostre
gloss_en: In architecture, pavilion has several meanings: It may be a subsidiary building that is either positioned separately or as an attachment to a main building. An Italian dining pavilion Type of building

In structural engineering, a shear wall is a vertical element of a seismic force resisting system that is designed to resist in-plane lateral forces, typically wind and seismic loads. A wall composed of braced panels to counter the effects of lateral load acting on a structure
A "Head-Neck-Body farmhouse" or Head-Neck-Rump farmhouse is a typical Frisian farmhouse.
Close studding is a form of timber work used in timber-framed buildings in which vertical timbers are set close together, dividing the wall into narrow panels.

The alfiz is an architectonic adornment, consisting of a moulding, usually a rectangular panel, which encloses the outward side of an arch. It is an Islamic Arab architectonic ornament, but has appeared in non-Arab Spanish architecture since the 8th century. In Mozarabic architecture, moulding which encloses the outward side of an arch. Moulding around an arch.

gloss_it: Il cinema futurista fu il più antico movimento del cinema d'avanguardia europeo.
gloss_en: Italian futurism, an artistic and social movement, affected the Italian film industry from 1916 to 1919.

gloss_it: Arnay-le-Duc è un comune francese di 1.774 abitanti situato nel dipartimento della Côte-d'Or nella regione della Borgogna-Franca Contea. Comune della Côte-d'Or (Francia) Comune francese
gloss_en: Arnay-le-Duc is a commune in the Côte-d'Or department in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region of eastern France. Commune in Côte-d'Or, France

gloss_it: Il tradizionalismo in architettura, è una definizione utilizzata per indicare un qualsiasi atteggiamento di progressione e difesa dei metodi di costruzione tradizionale.
gloss_en: Traditionalist architecture is an architectural movement in Europe since the beginning of the 20th century in the Netherlands, Scandinavia, Germany et al. A movement in 20th-century Dutch architecture Architectural style and movement
The architecture of Atlanta is marked by a confluence of classical, modernist, post-modernist, and contemporary architectural styles.

A concrete shell, also commonly called thin shell concrete structure, is a structure composed of a relatively thin shell of concrete, usually with no interior columns or exterior buttresses. Usually with no interior columns or exterior buttresses structure composed of a relatively thin shell of concrete

A great house is a large house or mansion with luxurious appointments and great retinues of indoor and outdoor staff. Specifically houses of the Anglo-Irish ascendancy Large and stately residence with large number of domestic workers in employment

A snow fort or snow castle is a usually open-topped temporary structure made of snow walls that is usually used for recreational purposes. A walled structure constructed of snow and used for children's wintertime play. Snow structure.
Kind of house designated for use in worshipping

gloss_it: Un punto panoramico, anche detto piattaforma panoramica, piattaforma di osservazione o ponte di osservazione, è una piattaforma turistica elevata che consente di avere una vista del panorama circostante.
gloss_en: An observation deck, observation platform, or viewing platform is an elevated sightseeing platform usually situated upon a tall architectural structure, such as a skyscraper or observation tower. A platform situated upon a tall architectural structure or natural feature Elevated sightseeing platform Elevated sightseeing platform An area of a tall building, often open to the sky, from which the public may look at the surrounding panorama. Area of a tall building.

lab_en: history of technology in the middle ages
gloss_it: L'espressione tecnologia medievale si riferisce alla tecnologia impiegata nel Medioevo, ovvero l'epoca storica compresa tra i secoli V e XV.
gloss_en: Medieval technology is the technology used in medieval Europe under Christian rule. The technology used in medieval Europe

gloss_it: Le mura indicano generalmente le fortificazioni estese intorno ad un centro abitato: in opposizione a castello o fortezza, le mura sono quindi la fortificazione urbana. Fortificazione difensiva
gloss_en: A defensive wall is a fortification usually used to protect a city, town or other settlement from potential aggressors. Built to protect against potential aggression Fortification used to protect an area from potential aggressors

An arts council is a government or private non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the arts; mainly by funding local artists, awarding prizes, and organizing arts events. Non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the arts

Confronted animals, or confronted-animal as an adjective, where two animals face each other in a symmetrical pose, is an ancient bilateral motif in art and artifacts studied in archaeology and art history.

Building life cycle refers to the view of a building over the course of its entire life – in other words, viewing it not just as an operational building, but also taking into account the design, construction, operation, demolition and waste treatment.

gloss_it: Il capriccio in pittura, secondo la definizione datane da Filippo Baldinucci, è una opera d'arte che nasce da un'improvvisa fantasia dell'autore.
gloss_en: In painting, a capriccio means an architectural fantasy, placing together buildings, archaeological ruins and other architectural elements in fictional and often fantastical combinations. In painting, an architectural fantasy Architectural fantasy in painting
Post-black art is a category of contemporary African American art. It is a paradoxical genre of art where race and racism are intertwined in a way that rejects their interaction.

gloss_it: Ambiente principale della casa romana, aveva la funzione di sala da letto e più raramente di sala da pranzo; in seguito fu destinato alla conservazione delle memorie familiari e a sala da ricevimento.
gloss_en: In Roman architecture, a tablinum was a room generally situated on one side of the atrium and opposite to the entrance; it opened in the rear onto the peristyle, with either a large window or only an anteroom or curtain. The main room of a Roman house, initially used as a bedroom, or sometimes as a dining room and later used as a room to keep family archives and to receive clients. An anteroom in a house of ancient Rome, opening out of the atrium opposite the main entry and often containing the family statues and archives.
A shell keep is a style of medieval fortification, best described as a stone structure circling the top of a motte. Style of medieval fortification

gloss_it: Il periptero o perittero è la conformazione particolare di un tipo di templi antichi circondati da un portico con colonne.
gloss_en: A peripteros is a type of ancient Greek or Roman temple surrounded by a portico with columns. A type of Ancient Greek or Ancient Roman temple surrounded by a portico with columns.

gloss_it: La perìstasi è un colonnato porticato, la maggior parte delle volte quadrangolare, che circonda, particolarmente nei templi greci, ma anche in quelli romani, il naos.
gloss_en: The peristasis was a four-sided porch or hallway of columns surrounding the cella in an ancient Greek peripteral temple.

gloss_it: archINFORM è un database online popolato con i dati e le informazioni relative alle opere architettoniche di interesse internazionale.
gloss_en: ArchINFORM is an online database for international architecture, originally emerging from records of interesting building projects from architecture students from the University of Karlsruhe, Germany. International Architecture Database

gloss_it: Pseudoperiptero è una delle forme del tempio greco usata anche nell'architettura del tempio romano.
gloss_en: A pseudoperipteros is a building with engaged columns embedded in the outer walls, except the front of the building.

gloss_it: La critica artistica è la discussione dell'arte visiva.
gloss_en: Art criticism is the discussion or evaluation of visual art.
A cumdach or book shrine is an elaborate ornamented box or case used as a reliquary to enshrine books regarded as relics of the saints who had used them in Early Medieval Ireland.

gloss_it: Luogo dotato di bagni per uso pubblico.
gloss_en: Public baths originated from a communal need for cleanliness at a time when most people did not have access to private bathing facilities. Buildings equipped with swimming pools and other facilities for bathing and swimming, traditionally the primary hygienic facility in a city or town A place having baths for public use.
In architecture, a forecourt is an open area in front of a structure's entrance.
The Buon fresco, Italian for true fresh, is a fresco painting technique in which alkaline-resistant pigments, ground in water, are applied to wet plaster.

gloss_it: Il grimaldello è uno strumento utilizzato per scassinare o aprire semplici serrature di cui non si possegga la chiave.
gloss_en: Lock picking is the practice of unlocking a lock by manipulating the components of the lock device without the original key. The art of unlocking a lock without the original key art of unlocking a lock without the original key The action of using tools to unlock a lock without a key to that lock. Action of unlocking.

gloss_it: La video installazione è un tipo di arte visiva nata intorno agli anni settanta.
gloss_en: Video installation is a contemporary art form that combines video technology with installation art, making use of all aspects of the surrounding environment to affect the audience. Installation artwork that includes video as a main element

gloss_it: Con architettura persiana o architettura iraniana si intende l'architettura dell'area del cosiddetto Grande Iran, caratterizzata da vicissitudini storiche e culturali comuni sin da un'epoca risalente almeno al 5000 a.C. fino ai giorni presenti. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Iranian architecture or Persian architecture is the architecture of Iran and parts of the rest of West Asia, the Caucasus and Central Asia. Wikimedia list article Style of architecture
Neomodern or neomodernist architecture is a reaction to the complexity of postmodern architecture and eclecticism in architecture, seeking greater simplicity.
A historic house generally meets several criteria before being listed by an official body as "historic." House with a notable history
The hypotrachelium is the upper part or groove in the shaft of a Doric column, beneath the trachelium.

gloss_it: Anna è considerata dalla tradizione cristiana la moglie di Gioacchino e la madre di Maria Vergine ed è venerata come santa. La madre di Maria. Madre di Maria Vergine
gloss_en: According to apocryphal Christian and Islamic tradition, Saint Anne was the mother of Mary and the maternal grandmother of Jesus. Mother of the Virgin Mary Mother of Virgin Mary in Christian and Islamic traditions; unnamed in the New Testament or Quran

gloss_it: Il serdab è una struttura presente nelle tombe dell'Antico Egitto costituita da una camera destinata alla statua raffigurante il Ka, o "spirito vitale", del defunto.
gloss_en: A serdab, literally meaning "cold water", which became a loanword in Arabic for 'cellar'
Figura serpentinata is a style in painting and sculpture, intended to make the figure seem more dynamic, that is typical of Mannerism. Italian artistic style

gloss_it: Gli ushabti, che in egizio significava "quelli che rispondono" erano delle piccole statue che costituivano elemento integrante ed indispensabile del corredo funebre. Statue funerarie egizie
gloss_en: The ushabti was a funerary figurine used in ancient Egyptian funerary practices. Funerary figurine used in ancient Egyptian religion In ancient Egypt, a figurine of a dead person, placed in their tomb to do their work for them in the afterlife. Figurines of servants of the deceased.
In meteorology, haar or sea fret is a cold sea fog. Cold sea fog, especially on the east coast of Britain

A clandestine church, defined by historian Benjamin J. Kaplan as a "semi-clandestine church", is a house of worship used by religious minorities whose communal worship is tolerated by those of the majority faith on condition that it is discreet and not conducted in public spaces. Secret places of worship by religious minorities
A wiring closet is a small room commonly found in institutional buildings, such as schools and offices, where electrical connections are made.
A sleeper wall is a short wall used to support floor joists, beam and block or hollowcore slabs at ground floor.

Traditional trades is a loosely defined categorization of building trades who actively practice their craft in respect of historic preservation, heritage conservation, or the conserving and maintenance of the existing built environment.
Transmission control room or 'transmission suite', or 'Tx room', or "presentation" is a room at broadcast facilities and television stations around the world.
The karahafu is a type of gable with a style peculiar to Japan.

gloss_it: Le tombe a thòlos, che in greco antico significa cupola, sono monumenti funerari risalenti come tipologia alla tarda età del bronzo. Tipo di monumento funerario
gloss_en: A beehive tomb, also known as a tholos tomb, is a burial structure characterized by its false dome created by corbelling, the superposition of successively smaller rings of mudbricks or, more often, stones. A style of Mycenaean tomb from the Bronze Age Burial structure A dome-shaped tomb, or tholos.
