gloss_it: Alla prima, è una tecnica di pittura con la quale vengono applicati strati di vernice umida su strati precedentemente inseriti prima della essiccazione. Tecnica pittorica
gloss_en: Wet-on-wet, or alla prima, direct painting or au premier coup, is a painting technique in which layers of wet paint are applied to previously administered layers of wet paint. Painting technique
Verre Églomisé is a French term referring to the process of applying both a design and gilding onto the rear face of glass to produce a mirror finish.
A maidam is a tumulus of the royalty and aristocracy of the medieval Ahom Kingdom in Assam, India. Tumuli of the Ahom Kingdom
Stourbridge fair was an annual fair held on Stourbridge Common in Cambridge, England.
A hammerbeam roof is a decorative, open timber roof truss typical of English Gothic architecture and has been called "... Decorative, open timber roof truss typical of English Gothic architecture

gloss_it: La ceramica a figure rosse fu una tecnica per la decorazione di vasi in terracotta introdotta ad Atene nel 530 a.C. dove sostituì gradualmente la più antica tecnica della ceramica a figure nere.
gloss_en: Red-figure vase painting is one of the most important styles of figural Greek vase painting. Ancient Greek pottery style
The Mold cape is a solid sheet-gold object dating from about 1900–1600 BC in the European Bronze Age.

gloss_it: Nel campo dell'ingegneria civile e dell'architettura con il termine isolatori sismici si intendono tutti quei dispositivi che servono a isolare la struttura portante degli edifici dagli effetti di un terremoto.
gloss_en: Seismic base isolation, also known as base isolation, or base isolation system, is one of the most popular means of protecting a structure against earthquake forces. Means of protecting a structure against earthquake

gloss_it: Il patrimonio dell'umanità UNESCO Giardino persiano comprende nove giardini in varie province iraniane, che esemplificano la varietà di tipologie del giardino persiano, che si sono evolute per adattarsi alle diverse condizioni climatiche, pur mantenendo le loro caratteristiche che hanno radici fin dai tempi di Ciro il Grande, nel VI secolo a.C.. Giardini in varie province iraniane
gloss_en: The tradition and style of garden design represented by Persian gardens or Iranian gardens, an example of the paradise garden, has influenced the design of gardens from Andalusia to India and beyond. Tradition and style of garden, and World Heritage Site

Federal modernism is an architectural style which emerged in 1949 after the US General Services Administration was created in response to the organizational needs of the US federal government during its time of post-war expansion.

gloss_it: I dipinti "in Maestà" raffigurano un personaggio in trono. Dipinto che raffigura un personaggio in trono
gloss_en: Maestà, the Italian word for "majesty", designates an iconic formula of the enthroned Madonna with the child Jesus, whether or not accompanied with angels and saints. Artistic depiction of the enthroned Madonna with the Child Jesus

A knot garden is a garden of very formal design in a square frame, consisting of a variety of aromatic plants and culinary herbs including germander, marjoram, thyme, southernwood, lemon balm, hyssop, costmary, acanthus, mallow, chamomile, rosemary, Calendula, Viola and Santolina. Elaborate interlace of tightly-clipped low hedging
A light shelf is a horizontal surface that reflects daylight deep into a building.

gloss_it: I giardini moghul sono i giardini realizzati dagli imperatori moghul secondo i canoni dell'architettura islamica: il risultato tradisce importanti influenze dai giardini persiani e da quelli timuridi.
gloss_en: Mughal gardens are a type of gardens built by the Mughals. Also called Shalimar Bagh, several royal gardens of the Mughal Empire Gardens built by Mughals

gloss_it: Il termine Barocco edoardiano si riferisce a uno stile di revival neobarocco diffuso nei territori dell'impero britannico durante l'età edoardiana.
gloss_en: Edwardian architecture is a Neo-Baroque architectural style that was popular in the British Empire during the Edwardian era. Architectural style popular during the reign of King Edward VII

gloss_it: Una barca funeraria o nave tomba era un'imbarcazione che veniva utilizzata per contenere le spoglie di un morto e i suoi beni.
gloss_en: A ship burial or boat grave is a burial in which a ship or boat is used either as a container for the dead and the grave goods, or as a part of the grave goods itself.
Ugsarmal bair, or just Ugsarmal, is the Mongolian term for high rise panel buildings.
Ancient Greek technology developed during the 5th century BC, continuing up to and including the Roman period, and beyond. Inventions and technology in Ancient Greece
Neolocal residence is a type of post-marital residence in which a newly married couple resides separately from both the husband's natal household and the wife's natal household.

gloss_it: Lo stilobate è nel tempio greco il piano su cui poggia il colonnato.
gloss_en: In classical Greek architecture, a stylobate is the top step of the crepidoma, the stepped platform upon which colonnades of temple columns are placed. Top step of the crepidoma The top step of the crepidoma, i.e. the platform upon which the superstructure of the building is erected. Top step of the crepidoma.
A tsunami-proof building is a purposefully designed building which will, through its design integrity, withstand and survive the forces of a tsunami wave or extreme storm surge.
The bellstone is a pillar located in Kauai County, Hawaii near 'Opaeka'a Falls.
A came is a divider bar used between small pieces of glass to make a larger glazing panel. Divider bar used between small pieces of glass to make a larger glazing panel.
A rolling ball sculpture is a form of kinetic art – an art form that contains moving pieces – that specifically involves one or more rolling balls. kind of sculpture and toy

gloss_it: Un catholicon o katholicon o sobor, nella chiesa ortodossa, può essere: la cattedrale di una diocesi, la chiesa principale di un monastero corrispondente alla chiesa conventuale della cristianità occidentale, una grande chiesa di una città nella quale si riuniscono tutti i fedeli del luogo, per celebrare alcune feste principali, piuttosto che recarsi nella loro chiesa parrocchiale. Chiesa principale di un monastero ortodosso,
gloss_en: A katholikon or catholicon or sobor refers to one of three things in the Eastern Orthodox Church: The cathedral of a diocese. The primary church in an Orthodox or Eastern Catholic monastery primary church in an Orthodox or Eastern Catholic monastery

In church architecture, sedilia are seats, usually made of stone, found on the liturgical south side of an altar, often in the chancel, for use during Mass for the officiating priest and his assistants, the deacon and sub-deacon. Seats where Catholic clergy sit during intervals in the Mass A series of seats, often recessed into the wall, on the south side of the chancel or choir for the use of officiating clergy.

In Hindu temple architecture, Latina or Rekha Prasad is the most common type of northern Indian shikhara, whose form is a single slightly curved tower with four sides of equal length, thus square in plan.

gloss_it: Edificio a più piani utilizzato per il parcheggio di un gran numero di autoveicoli
gloss_en: A multistorey car park or parking garage also called a multistory, parkade, parking structure, parking ramp, parking deck or indoor parking is a building designed for car parking and where there are a number of floors or levels on which parking takes place. A chiefly British abbreviation for an automobile parking structure Building designed for car parking and where there are a number of floors or levels on which parking takes place

A pile cap is a thick concrete mat that rests on concrete or timber piles that have been driven into soft or unstable ground to provide a suitable stable foundation. top part of a deep foundation, typically a thick concrete block into which the pile tops are embedded, used to transfer the load of the structure above to the piles driven into the ground below

gloss_it: La chiesa parrocchiale è un edificio specificamente dedicato al culto religioso cristiano.
gloss_en: A parish church in Christianity is the church which acts as the religious centre of a parish. A local church united with other parishes under a bishop or presbytery Church which acts as the religious centre of a parish A church that serves as the religious centre of a parish; the basic administrative unit of episcopal churches. Church that serves as the religious centre of a parish.

gloss_it: Il lèbes gamikòs, o "lebes nuziale", è una forma della ceramica greca antica usata nelle cerimonie nuziali. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: The lebes gamikos, or "nuptial lebes," is a form of ancient Greek pottery used in marriage ceremonies. Form of ancient Greek pottery used in marriage ceremonies A form of Ancient Greek pottery consisting of a large bowl-like body on a stand, believed to have been used in the ritual sprinkling of the bride with water before a wedding.

gloss_it: Il lebes, nella Grecia antica, era originariamente un vaso profondo con il fondo arrotondato, e necessitava perciò di un piedistallo per farlo restare eretto. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: The lebes is a type of ancient Greek cauldron, normally in bronze. An Ancient Greek cauldron, normally of bronze, and often supported by a tripod.

gloss_it: Il cratere era un grande vaso utilizzato per mescolare vino e acqua nel simposio greco.
gloss_en: A krater or crater was a large vase in Ancient Greece, used for the dilution of wine with water. Type of ancient Greek mixing-bowl for wine An ancient Greek vessel for mixing water and wine. Greek vessel.
A fieldstone church is a type of church, built using fieldstone of glacial erratics and glacial rubble.

gloss_it: L'impluvium, era una vasca quadrangolare a fondo piatto progettata per raccogliere l'acqua piovana e si trovava nell'atrio, un locale all'interno di una tipologia di abitazione diffusa tra i greci, gli etruschi ed i romani. Bacino utilizzato per raccogliere l'acqua piovana nell'atrio di una casa romana.
gloss_en: The impluvium is the sunken part of the atrium in a Greek or Roman house. sunken part of the atrium in a Greek or Roman house Basin used to collect rainwater in the atrium of a Roman house. Rectangular opening in the roof of the atrium of a Roman house which serves as source of light and is used to collect rainwater in the impluvium underneath. A low basin in the center of a household atrium, into which rainwater flowed down from the roof through the compluvium. Basin.
Castles in Portugal were crucial components of the military throughout its history.

A distribution center for a set of products is a warehouse or other specialized building, often with refrigeration or air conditioning, which is stocked with products to be redistributed to retailers, to wholesalers, or directly to consumers.

gloss_it: La colonna rostrata o rostrale è una colonna commemorativa di tradizione greca e romana che veniva eretta per commemorare una vittoria navale.
gloss_en: A rostral column is a type of victory column originating in ancient Greece and Rome, where they were erected to commemorate a naval military victory. A monumental scaled column, frequently decorated with ship bows Naval victory column  type
Design impact measures are used to qualify projects for various rating systems and to guide both design and regulatory decisions from beginning to end.

gloss_it: Un ventaglio è uno strumento portatile, che, quando lo si agita, si impiega per spingere l'aria verso la persona in maniera di rinfrescarsi. È uno strumento portatile.
gloss_en: A handheld fan, or simply hand fan, may be any broad, flat surface that is waved back-and-forth to create an airflow. An implement held and waved by hand to move air Device used to cool oneself, usually made of folded paper A hand-held device to agitate or move air or other gas. A hand-held device designed to be waved back and forth in order to induce airflow for the purpose of cooling the user. Hand-held device.
Enclosed cremation cemetery is a term used by archaeologists to describe a type of cemetery found in north western Europe during the late Neolithic and early Bronze Age.

gloss_it: Si parla di architettura indo-saracena in riferimento al neostile prevalentemente impiegato da architetti britannici in India nel tardo XIX secolo, specialmente per edifici pubblici e di rappresentanza dell'impero anglo-indiano e per i palazzi dei vari stati principeschi indiani.
gloss_en: Indo-Saracenic architecture was a revivalist architectural style mostly used by British architects in India in the later 19th century, especially in public and government buildings in the British Raj, and the palaces of rulers of the princely states. Revivalist architectural style being composed of Ancient and Mediaeval Indian and Modern British elements used in 19th Century

gloss_it: L'architettura coloniale americana è una corrente che si sviluppò a partire dal XVII secolo e continuò sino all'inizio del XIX.
gloss_en: American colonial architecture includes several building design styles associated with the colonial period of the United States, including First Period English, French Colonial, Spanish Colonial, Dutch Colonial, and Georgian.

gloss_it: Garbhagriha o Garbha gruha è il sancta sanctorum, l'ambiente più sacro di un tempio indù dove si trova il murti della divintà principale del tempio.
gloss_en: A garbhagriha or sannidhanam is the sanctum sanctorum, the innermost sanctuary of a Hindu and Jain temples where resides the murti of the primary deity of the temple. The small unit shrine of a Hindu temple. Garbhagriha or garbha gṛha (Devanagari: गर्भगॄह) is a Sanskrit word meaning the interior of the sanctum sanctorum, the innermost sanctum of a Hindu temple where resides the murti (idol or icon) of the primary deity of the temple Innermost sanctum of a Hindu temple The innermost sanctum of a temple, where the murti of the primary deity is found.

gloss_it: La casatorre è una costruzione fortificata, una rocca con funzioni sia militari che abitative in auge nel medioevo a partire dal X secolo.
gloss_en: A tower house is a particular type of stone structure, built for defensive purposes as well as habitation. Type of stone structure, built for defensive and habitation purposes
Synagogue architecture often follows styles in vogue at the place and time of construction.

gloss_it: Un bawn è un muro difensivo che circonda una casatorre irlandese.
gloss_en: A bawn is the defensive wall surrounding an Irish tower house. A defensive wall built around a tower house. It was once used to protect livestock during an attack.

A mechanical floor, mechanical penthouse, mechanical layer or mechanical level is a story of a high-rise building that is dedicated to mechanical and electronics equipment. Mechanical rooms-only skyscraper section

Nakshi kantha, a type of embroidered quilt, is a centuries-old Bengali art tradition of the Bengal region, notable in Bangladesh and Indian states of West Bengal, Tripura and part of Assam. A type of embroidered quilt

gloss_it: Lo stile italianeggiante, è uno stile architettonico di stampo classicista sviluppatosi nella prima metà dell'Ottocento in Gran Bretagna e negli Stati Uniti d'America, ispirato all'architettura italiana, in particolare a quella rinascimentale. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: The Italianate style of architecture was a distinct 19th-century phase in the history of Classical architecture. 19th-century phase in the history of Classical architecture

gloss_it: Ansac-sur-Vienne è un comune francese di 855 abitanti situato nel dipartimento della Charente nella regione della Nuova Aquitania.
gloss_en: Ansac-sur-Vienne is a commune in the Charente department in southwestern France.

An overspill estate is a housing estate planned and built for the housing of excess population in urban areas, both from the natural increase of population and often in order to rehouse people from decaying inner city areas, usually as part of the process of slum clearance. A housing estate planned and built for the rehousing of people from decaying inner city areas, usually as part of the process of slum clearance.

A Commissioners' church, also known as a Waterloo church and Million Act church, is an Anglican church in the United Kingdom built with money voted by Parliament as a result of the Church Building Acts of 1818 and 1824. Type of Anglican church

gloss_it: Arc-et-Senans è un comune francese di 1.510 abitanti situato nel dipartimento del Doubs nella regione della Borgogna-Franca Contea. Comune francese
gloss_en: Arc-et-Senans is a commune in the Doubs department in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region of eastern France. Commune in Doubs, France
Sustainable art is art in harmony with the key principles of sustainability, which include ecology, social justice, non-violence and grassroots democracy.

A shieling, also spelt sheiling, shealing and sheeling, is a hut, or collection of huts, once common in wild or lonely places in the hills and mountains of Scotland and northern England. Mountain pasture A shepherd's hut or shack.

gloss_it: Nel 1917 nei Paesi Bassi nasce la rivista De Stijl ed insieme ad essa il movimento artistico del neoplasticismo per opera di vari artisti, tra cui Piet Mondrian.
gloss_en: Geometric abstraction is a form of abstract art based on the use of geometric forms sometimes, though not always, placed in non-illusionistic space and combined into non-objective compositions. Form of abstract art involving geometry

gloss_it: Eaucourt-sur-Somme è un comune francese di 411 abitanti situato nel dipartimento della Somme nella regione dell'Alta Francia. Comune francese
gloss_en: Eaucourt-sur-Somme is a commune in the Somme department in Hauts-de-France in northern France. In the Somme département Commune in Somme, France

gloss_it: L'architettura del Pakistan si riferisce alle varie strutture costruite durante diversi periodi storici nell'attuale regione del Pakistan.
gloss_en: Pakistani architecture is intertwined with the architecture of the broader Indian subcontinent. Overview of Pakistani architecture

An almonry is the place or chamber where alms were distributed to the poor in churches or other ecclesiastical buildings. A building in which alms were distributed. Building in which alms were distributed.
A colonial meeting house was a meeting house used in colonial New England built using tax money.
Lokapāla, Sanskrit and Pāli for "guardian of the world", has different uses depending on whether it is found in a Hindu or Buddhist context.

A photogram is a photographic image made without a camera by placing objects directly onto the surface of a light-sensitive material such as photographic paper and then exposing it to light. Photographic image made without a camera by placing objects directly onto the surface of a light-sensitive material A photograph made without using a camera; normally by placing an object in contact with photosensitive paper and exposing it to light. A photograph made without using a camera.

gloss_it: Una residenza ufficiale è la residenza del capo di stato, capo del governo, governatore o altra figura equivalente. Un capo di governo, o un altro importante rappresentante di uno Stato sovrano ha la sua residenza Residenza di capi di stato, capo di governo, governatore, leader religioso, leader di organizzazioni internazionali o altra figura equivalente
gloss_en: An official residence is the residence at which a nation's head of state, head of government, governor, religious leader, leaders of international organizations, or other senior figure officially resides. Residence of heads of state, head of government, governor, religious leader, leaders of international organizations, or other equivalent figure

gloss_it: Pietra dura, o pietre dure, o anche parchin kari nell'Asia meridionale, è un termine usato per indicare una tecnica di taglio e composizione di pietre allo scopo di creare delle immagini.
gloss_en: Pietra dura or pietre dure [ˈpjɛːtre ˈduːre], called parchin kari or parchinkari in the Indian Subcontinent, is a term for the inlay technique of using cut and fitted, highly polished colored stones to create images. A technique of using cut and fitted, highly-polished colored stones to create images Hard and fine stones in general, as used for inlay etc. and distinguished from the softer stones used in building.

A hagioscope or squint is an architectural term denoting a small splayed opening or tunnel at seated eye-level, through an internal masonry dividing wall of a church in an oblique direction, giving worshippers a view of the altar and therefore of the elevation of the host. Architectural term A small opening in an interior wall of a church, enabling those in the transept to view the high altar.

gloss_it: I castelli a Z sono comuni in Inghilterra e Scozia.
gloss_en: Z-plan is a form of castle design common in England and Scotland. A form of castle design common in England and Scotland. Form of castle design common in England and Scotland
A sculpting technique employed by the Spanish artist Juan Martínez Montañés in the 17th-century. A sculpting technique

Crown molding is a form of cornice created out of decorative molding installed atop an interior wall. Decorative element to gracefully flare out to a finished top edge such as capping walls, pilasters, and cabinets A molding at the edge of a room between ceiling and wall. Molding between ceiling and wall.

gloss_it: La caponiera, o capponiera, è un'opera fortificata dell'ingegneria militare, in legno o in muratura, destinata alla difesa del fossato di una cinta muraria, per impedirne il passaggio al nemico.
gloss_en: A caponier is a type of defensive structure in a fortification. Type of fortification structure A type of fortification structure which allows firing along the bottom of a dry moat that surrounds the main fortress. Fortification structure.
Roman glass objects have been recovered across the Roman Empire in domestic, industrial and funerary contexts.

gloss_it: La domus era un tipo di abitazione utilizzata nell'antica Roma. Tipo di abitazione utilizzata nell'antica Roma
gloss_en: In ancient Rome, the domus was the type of town house occupied by the upper classes and some wealthy freedmen during the Republican and Imperial eras. Roman urban house of upper classes

gloss_it: Il tetrapilo è un antico tipo di monumento romano di forma cubica, con una porta su ognuna delle quattro facce laterali: generalmente era eretto in corrispondenza delle intersezioni stradali.
gloss_en: A tetrapylon, plural tetrapyla, known in Latin as a quadrifrons is a type of ancient Roman monument of cubic shape, with a gate on each of the four sides, generally built on a crossroads. Ancient Roman monument of cubic shape, generally built on a crossroads A Roman-style cubic structure with a gate on each of its four sides.

gloss_it: Un tokonoma è una piccola alcova rialzata presente nelle washitsu, la stanza in stile tradizionale Giapponese con tatami per pavimento, dove solitamente sono appese le pergamene giapponesi, dette kakemono. Una piccola alcova rialzata presente nelle washitsu con tatami per pavimento, dove solitamente sono appese le pergamene giapponesi
gloss_en: A tokonoma, or simply toko, is a recessed space in a Japanese-style reception room, in which items for artistic appreciation are displayed. A Japanese architectural feature A recess in a domestic interior in which a hanging scroll and a flower arrangement is displayed.

gloss_it: Insulated concrete form è un sistema costruttivo per realizzare pareti in cemento armato mediante casseri isolanti, solitamente in polistirolo, che rimangono in opera dopo il getto di calcestruzzo, garantendo l'isolamento termico delle pareti.
gloss_en: Insulating concrete form or insulated concrete form is a system of formwork for reinforced concrete usually made with a rigid thermal insulation that stays in place as a permanent interior and exterior substrate for walls, floors, and roofs. A construction technique construction method for reinforced concrete walls

gloss_it: Il giardino cinese è un giardino di carattere paesaggistico che si è evoluto nel corso di 3000 anni.
gloss_en: The Chinese garden is a landscape garden style which has evolved over three thousand years. Style of garden

A ringwork is a form of fortified defensive structure, usually circular or oval in shape. Type of medieval castle A fortified defensive structure, usually circular or oval in shape, essentially a motte-and-bailey castle minus the motte.

A palas is a German term for the imposing or prestigious building of a medieval Pfalz or castle that contained the great hall. That part of a medieval imperial palace or castle containing the great hall and other prestigious state rooms. Architecture

gloss_it: L'espressione thousand-yard stare o two-thousand-yard, in inglese letteralmente "sguardo a mille iarde", è una locuzione spesso utilizzata per descrivere l'espressione neutra e imbambolata assunta da alcuni soldati diventati momentaneamente emozionalmente distaccati dagli avvenimenti, spesso tragici, che li circondano.
gloss_en: The thousand-yard stare or two-thousand-yard stare is a phrase often used to describe the blank, unfocused gaze of combatants who have become emotionally detached from the horrors around them. Trauma symptom A blank, unfocused glance given by a traumatized soldier.
:Not to be confused with the word jinja, which denotes a Shinto shrine. A type of headquarters in Japan Administrative headquarters of a small domain or parcel of land held by the Tokugawa shogunate

A Lotto carpet is a hand-knotted, patterned carpet that was produced primarily during the 16th and 17th centuries along the Aegean coast of Anatolia, Turkey, although it was also copied in various parts of Europe. A carpet having a lacy arabesque pattern
Hindu temples typically have Kalasam at the top of temple towers.
The method of building wooden buildings with a traditional timber frame with horizontal plank or log infill has many names, the most common of which are piece sur piece
Exuperius and Zoe are 2nd century Christian martyrs. Martyrs and saints (died 127) Married couple of saints
Bath bus station serves as part of an integrated transport interchange for the city of Bath, Somerset, England.

gloss_it: I Mogollon furono un'antica popolazione americana diffusa dal 300 a.C. al 1300 d.C. Devono il loro nome ai Monti Mogollón, così chiamati in onore di Juan Ignacio Flores Mogollón, governatore del Vicereame della Nuova Spagna dal 1712 al 1715.
gloss_en: Mogollon culture is an archaeological culture of Native American peoples from Southern New Mexico and Arizona, Northern Sonora and Chihuahua, and Western Texas. A culture in what is now Northern Mexico and the Southwestern United States. Ethnic group
The scaenae frons is the elaborately decorated permanent architectural background of a Roman theatre stage.

In painting, staffage are the human and animal figures depicted in a scene, especially a landscape, that are not the primary subject matter of the work. The people and animals represented in a landscape painting.
Brick nog, is a construction technique in which bricks are used to fill the vacancies in a wooden frame. Bricks filled in-between wooden framing
Korean gardens are natural, informal, simple and unforced, seeking to merge with the natural world. Type of Asian garden
The Soft Portuguese style is an architectural model used in public and private buildings in Portugal, essentially during the 1940s and the early 1950s.

Woodblock printing or block printing is a technique for printing text, images or patterns used widely throughout East Asia and originating in China in antiquity as a method of printing on textiles and later paper. Early printing technique and print A technique for printing text, images or patterns used widely throughout East Asia and originating in China in antiquity as a method of printing on textiles and later paper. Technique for printing text, images or patterns.
Buildings associated with any aspect of the various activities and business relationships of industry and trade

The architecture of Israel has been influenced by the different styles of architecture brought in by those who have occupied the country over time, sometimes modified to suit the local climate and landscape.

In art, a commission is the act of requesting the creation of a piece, often on behalf of another. The purchase or the creation of a piece of art most often on behalf of another Hiring and payment for the creation of a piece of art
Murano at Portofino is a highly affluent residential enclave tower /skyscraper in Miami Beach, Florida's South Beach.

gloss_it: L'adlocutio era l'usanza di fare un discorso formale alle truppe, tenuto dai consoli repubblicani, dagli imperatori o dai loro generali, sia durante il periodo repubblicano sia quello imperiale.
gloss_en: In ancient Rome the Latin word adlocutio means an address given by a general, usually the emperor, to his massed army and legions, and a general form of Roman salute from the army to their leader. Address given by a Roman general or emperor to his massed army and legions

gloss_it: Per riza o oklad s'intende una protezione in metallo posta su un tavola dipinta con una immagine sacra, detta icona, ma che lascia scoperti volti e mani delle figure sacre ritratte.
gloss_en: A riza or oklad, sometimes called a "revetment" in English, is a metal cover protecting an icon. A metal cover protecting a religious icon
Butterfly doors are a type of car door sometimes seen on high-performance cars.

lab_en: painted character study of a head in exotic dress
gloss_it: Una tronie è un tipo, o gruppo di tipi di opere comuni nella pittura del Secolo d'oro olandese e nella pittura barocca fiamminga che mostra un'espressione facciale esagerata o un personaggio tipo in costume.
gloss_en: A tronie is the name given to a type of work common in Dutch Golden Age painting and Flemish Baroque painting that depict an exaggerated facial expression or people in costume. Type of artwork showing an exaggerated face or character in costume

gloss_it: I dentelli sono piccoli blocchi usati come ornamento ripetuto nella modanatura sotto una cornice.
gloss_en: A dentil is a small block used as a repeating ornament in the bedmould of a cornice. Small block used as a repeating ornament in the bedmould of a cornice Any one of a series of small rectangular blocks projecting like teeth from a molding or beneath a cornice.

gloss_it: La pelìke è un vaso, utilizzato come contenitore di liquidi, con imboccatura larga e profilo continuo e con il massimo diametro del corpo in prossimità del piede, al quale si unisce senza stelo. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: A pelike is a one-piece ceramic container similar to an amphora. Special form of ancient greek amphora A ceramic container of Ancient Greece, similar to an amphora.
A micro gallery was a computer-based guide to archives and museum collections, first developed for the collections at the National Gallery in London, UK.
Külliyye is an Ottoman term that refers to the building complexes that provides social services to the region it was located.

gloss_it: Il Tempio funerario detto anche cultuale oppure tempio alto o tempio a monte, parte integrante del complesso piramidale durante l'Antico e Medio Regno era un edificio dedicato al culto del sovrano defunto e del suo Ka nella sua valenza terrena e divina ed è anche denominato tempio piramidale canonico.
gloss_en: Mortuary temples were temples that were erected adjacent to, or in the vicinity of, royal tombs in Ancient Egypt. The temples were designed to commemorate the reign of the Pharaoh under whom they were constructed, as well as for use by the king's cult after death. Temples beside royal tombs in Ancient Egypt
Education in Madagascar has a long and distinguished history.

gloss_it: L'architettura moghul, un amalgama di architettura islamica, persiana e indiana, rappresenta in architettura le caratteristiche stilistiche distintive sviluppate dai Moghul durante il XVI e XVII secolo nei territori attualmente appartenenti a India, Pakistan, e Bangladesh.
gloss_en: Mughal architecture is the type of Indo-Islamic architecture developed by the Mughals in the 16th, 17th and 18th centuries throughout the ever-changing extent of their empire in the Indian subcontinent. A style of architecture Indo-Islamic architecture from 16th to 18th century India
A ka statue is a type of ancient Egyptian statue intended to provide a resting place for the ka of the person after death.

gloss_it: sito archeologico di un cimitero dell'epoca preistorica
gloss_en: A grave field is a prehistoric cemetery, typically of Bronze Age and Iron Age Europe. Prehistoric cemetery lacking above-ground structures, buildings, or grave markers
Nose tombs are tombs that contain human noses or other body parts that were brought back to Japan as trophies during the Japanese invasions of Korea in the late 16th century.
Building management is a discipline that comes under the umbrella of facility management.

An interstitial space is an intermediate space located between regular-use floors, commonly located in hospitals and laboratory-type buildings to allow space for the mechanical systems of the building.

gloss_it: Il termine derivante dal francese vernissage viene usato per indicare l'inaugurazione di una mostra d'arte.
gloss_en: A vernissage is a term used for a preview of an art exhibition, which may be private, before the formal opening. A preview of an art exhibition prior to the formal opening The start of an art exhibition. A private viewing of an art exhibition before it opens to the public. Private viewing of an exhibition before it opens to the public.
The temple shops or Hebrew plural hanuyot were buildings near the Temple in Jerusalem mentioned in the Babylonian Talmud.

gloss_it: Con il termine falansterio il filosofo e politologo francese Charles Fourier, agli inizi del XIX secolo, indicava la struttura abitativa in cui si svolgeva la vita dei membri dell'unità sociale di base prevista nelle sue teorie e da lui denominata "Falange". edificio abitativo utopico
gloss_en: A phalanstère was a type of building designed for a self-contained utopian community, ideally consisting of 500–2000 people working together for mutual benefit, and developed in the early 19th century by Charles Fourier. A building layout developed by utopian socialist Charles Fourier Building designed for a self-contained utopian community

gloss_it: Un horreum era un magazzino pubblico annonario utilizzato in epoca romana.
gloss_en: A horreum was a type of public warehouse used during the ancient Roman period.
A kistvaen or cistvaen is a tomb or burial chamber formed from flat stone slabs in a box-like shape.

gloss_it: Gorintō
gloss_en: Gorintō is a Japanese type of Buddhist pagoda believed to have been first adopted by the Shingon and Tendai sects during the mid Heian period.

gloss_it: Il broletto o arengario a partire dall'XI secolo, identifica nelle città lombarde l'area recintata dove si solevano svolgere le assemblee cittadine e l'amministrazione della giustizia. Area recintata dove si svolgevano le assemblee cittadine e l''amministrazione della giustizia
gloss_en: In Middle Age Communes in Italy, a broletto was the place where the whole population met for democratic assemblies, and where the elected men lived and administered justice.
Tension fabric buildings are constructed using a rigid frame—which can consist of timber, steel, rigid plastic, or aluminum—and a sturdy fabric outer membrane.
A diaulos, in ancient Greek architecture, was a peristyle round the great court of the palaestra, described by Vitruvius, which measured two stadia

gloss_it: L'arte confuciana è il complesso delle manifestazioni artistiche ispirate alle opere di Confucio e ai successivi insegnamenti confuciani.
gloss_en: Confucian art is art inspired by the writings of Confucius, and Confucian teachings.

gloss_it: Lo Stile Federale è il nome dato all'architettura classicheggiante apparsa negli Stati Uniti tra il 1780 ed il 1830 circa, ed in particolare tra il 1785 ed il 1815.
gloss_en: Federal-style architecture is the name for the classicizing architecture built in the newly founded United States between c. An architectural style related to Georgian architecture

Villa rustica was the term used by the ancient Romans to denote a villa set in the open countryside, often as the hub of a large agricultural estate. Roman villa set in the open countryside, often as the hub of a large agricultural estate

gloss_it: La tomba con carro è un tipo di sepoltura in cui il defunto è sepolto assieme al carro che possedeva in vita; in molti casi venivano inumati anche i suoi cavalli.
gloss_en: Chariot burials are tombs in which the deceased was buried together with their chariot, usually including their horses and other possessions. Tombs where deceased are buried with their chariot

gloss_it: La pietra della follia o pietra della pazzia era, nell'immaginario collettivo medioevale, una pietra che, all'interno della fronte, veniva considerata responsabile della pazzia dei pazienti che ne erano affetti.
gloss_en: The stone of madness, also called stone of folly, was a hypothetical stone in a patient's head, thought to be the cause of madness, idiocy or dementia.
Castrum doloris is a name for the structure and decorations sheltering or accompanying the catafalque or bier that signify the prestige or high estate of the deceased.

Offsite construction refers to the manufacturing, planning, design, fabrication, and assembly of building elements at a location other than their final installed location to support the rapid speed of, and efficient construction of a permanent structure. A mode of construction
In architecture, shoebox style is a functionalist style of modern architecture characterised by predominantly rectilinear, orthogonal shapes, with regular horizontal rows of windows or glass walls.
DIB-200 is a possible mixed use supertall skyscraper project proposed by Kajima Construction and designed by Sadaaki Masuda and Scott Howe.

gloss_it: Wabi-sabi costituisce una visione del mondo giapponese, o estetica, fondata sull'accettazione della transitorietà e dell'imperfezione delle cose.
gloss_en: In traditional Japanese aesthetics, wabi-sabi is a world view centered on the acceptance of transience and imperfection. A Japanese aesthetic term A world view centered on the acceptance of transience and imperfection in traditional japanese aesthetics A Japanese aesthetic that derives from imperfection and transience.
Korean architecture refers to an architectural style that developed over centuries in Korea. Korean architectural style

gloss_it: Nell'arte e nella decorazione, la palmetta, è un motivo decorativo a ventaglio in forma di foglia di palma.
gloss_en: The palmette is a motif in decorative art which, in its most characteristic expression, resembles the fan-shaped leaves of a palm tree. A motif in decorative art resembling the fan-shaped leaves of a palm tree.
Architectural design values make up an important part of what influences architects and designers when they make their design decisions.
Underground art is any form of art that operates outside of conventional norms in the art world, part of underground culture. Art with a following independent of commercial success

gloss_it: In architettura, un'enfilade è una serie di stanze formalmente allineate l'una dopo l'altra.
gloss_en: In architecture, an enfilade is a suite of rooms formally aligned with each other.

gloss_it: La pisside è un oggetto liturgico usato nella Chiesa cattolica ed in altre confessioni cristiane per conservare le ostie consacrate dopo la Celebrazione eucaristica. Oggetto liturgico
gloss_en: A ciborium is a vessel, normally in metal.

An engineering drawing is a type of technical drawing that is used to convey information about an object. A type of technical drawing Type of technical drawing used to define requirements for engineered items

Prefabricated homes, often referred to as prefab homes or simply prefabs, are specialist dwelling types of prefabricated building, which are manufactured off-site in advance, usually in standard sections that can be easily shipped and assembled. Specialist dwelling types of prefabricated building
The pulpitum is a common feature in medieval cathedral and monastic church architecture in Europe.

gloss_it: La cuspide è un elemento architettonico piatto di forma triangolare con funzione decorativa.
gloss_en: A tented roof is a type of polygonal hipped roof with steeply pitched slopes rising to a peak.
A corner office is an office that is located in the corner of a building. An office at a place in a building or floor where two walls join together, generally occupied by managers.
Architecture parlante is architecture that explains its own function or identity. architecture of the French Revolutionary period

gloss_it: Il tepidario era la parte delle antiche terme romane destinata ai bagni in acqua tiepida.
gloss_en: The tepidarium was the warm bathroom of the Roman baths heated by a hypocaust or underfloor heating system. A warm room in a Roman baths that was usually heated by a hypocaust.

gloss_it: Un'opera a corno è un elemento avanzato delle fortificazioni alla moderna generalmente posto a protezione di una cortina muraria di una fortificazione maggiore dalla quale si protende verso la campagna.
gloss_en: An element of the trace italienne system of fortification that consists of a pair of demi-bastions. A hornwork is an element of the Italian bastion system of fortification. A type of fortification consisting of a pair of demi-bastions with a curtain wall connecting them and with two long sides directed upon the faces of the bastions, or ravelins of the inner fortifications, so as to be defended by them.
The following temples are in Hyderabad. building in India

gloss_it: La pochade è un genere di commedia, nata a Parigi sul finire del XIX secolo, strutturata su canovacci di vicende amorose, intrighi e colpi ad effetto. genere di commedia, basata su vicende amorose, nata a Parigi alla fine dell'Ottocento
gloss_en: A pochade is a type of sketch used in painting. Type of sketch used in painting

gloss_it: Si intende con classicismo socialista l'architettura caratterizzante l'Unione Sovietica tra il 1933 - anno di approvazione del progetto per il palazzo dei Soviet, curato da Boris Iofan - e il 1955, quando Nikita Chruščёv decise di sciogliere l'Accademia sovietica di architettura, condannando gli "eccessi" dei decenni precedenti.
gloss_en: Stalinist architecture, mostly known in the former Eastern Bloc as Stalinist style or Socialist Classicism, is the architecture of the Soviet Union under the leadership of Joseph Stalin, between 1933 and 1955. Architectural style
The Catalan vault, also called tile vault, Catalan turn, Catalan arch, boveda ceiling, or timbrel vault, is a type of low brickwork arch forming a vaulted ceiling that often supports a floor above.

lab_it: cerchi di pietre dell'età del ferro
cerchio di pietre dell'età del ferro
gloss_it: I cerchi di pietre dell'età del ferro furono una tipica architettura funeraria in uso nella Scandinavia meridionale, specialmente nel Gotland e nel Götaland, durante l'età del ferro pre-romana e l'età del ferro romana.
gloss_en: The stone circles of the Iron Age were a characteristic burial custom of southern Scandinavia, especially on Gotland and in Götaland during the Pre-Roman Iron Age and the Roman Iron Age. Iron Age burial site in Scandinavia

gloss_it: Rovine di una chiesa
gloss_en: A redundant church is a church building that is no longer used for Christian worship. Church building that is no longer required for regular public worship, usually Anglican buildings

gloss_it: Uno tzompantli è un tipo di intelaiatura in legno documentata in diverse culture mesoamericane, che veniva usata per l'esposizione pubblica di teschi umani, normalmente quelli di prigionieri di guerra o di vittime sacrificali.
gloss_en: A tzompantli or skull rack is a type of wooden rack or palisade documented in several Mesoamerican civilizations, which was used for the public display of human skulls, typically those of war captives or other sacrificial victims. Mesoamerican wooden rack or palisade used for the public display of human skulls, e.g. those of war captives or sacrificial victims An Aztec ceremonial rack of skulls.
In countries whose armies are organised on a regimental basis, such as the army of the United Kingdom, a regimental museum is a military museum dedicated to the history of a specific army regiment.
The steve.
In the Catholic Church, the altar is the structure upon which the Eucharist is celebrated.
The architecture of Ethiopia varies greatly from region to region.

A quincunx is a geometric pattern consisting of five points arranged in a cross, with four of them forming a square or rectangle and a fifth at its center. An arrangement of five units in a pattern corresponding to the five-spot on dice, playing cards, or dominoes. Arrangement of five units.

gloss_it: El Caracol o Caracol è un grande sito archeologico costruito dalla civiltà maya situato nel distretto di Cayo, in Belize. Sito archeologico Maya
gloss_en: For the Québécoise singer see Carole Facal. An ancient Maya archaeological site in Belize Maya city in Belize

A roundhouse is a type of house with a circular plan, usually with a conical roof. A kind of house with circular walls, constructed during both the Iron Age and later, found in many areas of the world. Type of house with a circular plan, usually with a conical roof
Earthquake simulation applies a real or simulated vibrational input to a structure that possesses the essential features of a real seismic event.

lab_en: list of chinese names of bronze vessels
gloss_en: Sets and individual examples of ritual bronzes survive from when they were made mainly during the Chinese Bronze Age.

gloss_it: Tintinnabŭlum: strumento sonoro costituito da campanello, utilizzato nel cerimoniale della chiesa romana durante i riti processionali della solennità del Corpus Domini e di altre festività contemplate nel calendario liturgico.
gloss_en: A tintinnabulum is a bell mounted on a pole, placed in a Roman Catholic basilica to signify the church's link with the Pope. A bell in a Roman Catholic Basilica Bell, placed in a basilica

A Futuro house, or Futuro Pod, is a round, prefabricated house designed by Finnish architect Matti Suuronen, of which fewer than 100 were built during the late 1960s and early 1970s. Prefabricated house designed by Matti Suuronen
A curling house was used to store curling stones, brushes and other equipment used to maintain a curling pond and play the game of curling in Scotland and elsewhere.
For the locomotive named after the hall, see GWR 4900 Class 5900 Hinderton HallHinderton Hall is a country house to the northeast of Neston, Cheshire, England.
muf is a collaborative of artists, architects and urban designers based in London, England, specialising in the design of the urban public realm to facilitate appropriation by users.
Roman Marian churches are religious buildings dedicated to the veneration of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

gloss_it: Una peel tower è una piccola casatorre o un dongione fortificato, costruiti tra il confine di Inghilterra e Scozia, nella regione nord dell'Inghilterra.
gloss_en: Peel towers are small fortified keeps or tower houses, built along the English and Scottish borders in the Scottish Marches and North of England, mainly between the mid-14th century and about 1600. A small fortified keep or tower house Type of small fortified keep or tower house found in parts of the UK
Neolithic architecture refers to structures encompassing housing and shelter from approximately 10,000 to 2,000 BC, the Neolithic period. Perhaps founded in Syria and it's neighbouring countries.
A building undergoes progressive collapse when a primary structural element fails, resulting in the failure of adjoining structural elements, which in turn causes further structural failure.

gloss_it: Il Macellum era un particolare mercato delle città romane, in cui venivano convogliate le merci destinate alla vendita: si trattava di un mercato specializzato nella vendita al dettaglio di carne e di pesce. In cui venivano convogliate le merci destinate alla vendita. Un esempio ne è il Macellum di Herdonia.
gloss_en: A macellum is an ancient Roman indoor market building that sold mostly provisions.
A tholos, from Ancient Greek θόλοςpl. tholi A structure found in the centre of the macellum

gloss_it: Compound è un termine di lingua inglese che, nella scienza militare, indica un edificio o gruppo di edifici delimitati da una recinzione più o meno alta o ancora maggiormente difesi a fortificazione. zona militare
gloss_en: In military science, a compound is a type of fortification made up of walls or fences surrounding several buildings in the center of a large piece of land. A version of the above fortified with defensive structures Type of fortification
A Gibbs surround or Gibbs Surround is a type of architectural frame surrounding a door, window or niche in the tradition of classical architecture otherwise known as a rusticated doorway or window.

gloss_it: Una torre pendente è una torre che, o per cause naturali, o per difetto di progettazione o per motivi voluti si erge sulla sua base in direzione non perpendicolare.
gloss_en: An inclined tower is a tower that was intentionally built at an incline. A tower that was intentionally built at an incline A tower which does not stand perpendicular to the ground, either intentionally or unintentionally
In the liturgical traditions of Western Christianity, the Epistle side is the term used to designate the side of a church on which the Epistle is read during the Mass or Eucharist.

gloss_it: Il cong è un manufatto di giada dell'antica Cina.
gloss_en: A cong is a form of ancient Chinese jade artifact. A form of jade artifact from ancient China

gloss_it: Il bi è un manufatto di giada dell'antica Cina a forma di disco, utilizzato per scopi cerimoniali. Manufatto di giada
gloss_en: The bi is a type of circular ancient Chinese jade artifact. A type of jade disc produced in ancient China Type of circular ancient Chinese jade artifact A type of jade disk produced in ancient China.

gloss_it: L'abat-son designa l'insieme di lame inclinate dall'alto in basso e dall'interno all'esterno disposte generalmente nelle aperture delle torri civiche e di quelle campanarie. Grande feritoia in un campanile della chiesa che dirige il suono della campana verso il suolo.
gloss_en: An abat-son is an architectural device constructed to reflect or direct sound in a particular direction. Large louver in a church bell tower which directs the sound of the bell toward the ground.

lab_it: battistero di san giovanni in fronte al laterano
battistero di san giovanni in laterano
battistero di san giovanni in fonte al laterano
gloss_it: Il Battistero lateranense, il cui titolo è San Giovanni in Fonte al Laterano, è un luogo di culto cattolico di Roma, a pianta centrale, opera di architettura paleocristiana, modello e archetipo dei battisteri edificati nella cristianità per tutto il medioevo.
gloss_en: The domed octagonal Lateran Baptistery stands somewhat apart from the Archbasilica of Saint John Lateran, Rome, to which it has become joined by later construction. Church building in Rome, Italy

In construction, cross bracing is a system utilized to reinforce building structures in which diagonal supports intersect. system to reinforce building structures in which diagonal supports intersect.

Neo-eclectic architecture is a name for an architectural style that has influenced residential building construction in North America in the later part of the 20th century and early part of the 21st. Style of architecture

gloss_it: Il lapidario è genericamente una raccolta di pietre, sassi, rocce. Luogo che raccoglie ed espone reperti archeologici in pietra
gloss_en: A lapidarium is a place where stone monuments and fragments of archaeological interest are exhibited. Place exhibiting stone monuments and objects of archaeological interest
Arkís is an Icelandic architectural practice based in Reykjavík that has been in operation since 1997. Icelandic architectural practice
The architecture of Denmark has its origins in the Viking period, richly revealed by archaeological finds.

A sally port is a secure, controlled entry way to an enclosure, e.g., a fortification or prison. Secure, controlled entryway to a fortification or prison An entryway controlled by two doors or gates, each of which must be closed before the other can open.
In church architecture, a retroquire, or back-choir, is the space behind the high altar in a church or cathedral, which sometimes separates it from the end chapel.

gloss_it: Il sistema costruttivo a piramide gradonata è trasversale a molte culture ed ha prodotto anche in contesti storico-geografici indipendenti risultati molto simili.
gloss_en: A step pyramid or stepped pyramid is an architectural structure that uses flat platforms, or steps, receding from the ground up, to achieve a completed shape similar to a geometric pyramid. Architectural structure that uses flat platforms or steps to form geometric pyramid A pyramid composed of several stacked platforms or mastabas so that each face has steps.

gloss_it: La concattedrale è una chiesa che ha la stessa dignità e gli stessi privilegi di una cattedrale, ma ha precedenza minore. Chiesa con la stessa dignità e gli stessi privilegi di una cattedrale ma precedenza minore
gloss_en: A co-cathedral is a cathedral church which shares the function of being a bishop's seat, or cathedra, with another cathedral, often in another city. Type of church

lab_en: architecture of cathedrals and great churches
architecture of cathedrals, basilicas & abbey churches
architecture of cathedrals, basilicas and abbey churches
cathedral architecture of the western world
gloss_en: The architecture of cathedrals and great churches is characterised by the buildings' large scale and follows one of several branching traditions of form, function and style that derive ultimately from the Early Christian architectural traditions established in Late Antiquity during the Christianization of the Roman Empire.

gloss_it: I castelli miliari erano fortini rettangolari costruiti durante il periodo dell'Impero romano e collocati ad intervalli di circa un miglio romano lungo le diverse frontiere dell'Impero, come ad esempio lungo il Vallo di Adriano in Britannia.
gloss_en: A milecastle was a small fort, a rectangular fortification built during the period of the Roman Empire. A small Roman fort or a rectangular fortification
A moving skyscraper is a tall building in which individual floors can rotate on its axis.

Urban art combines street art and graffiti and is often used to summarize all visual art forms arising in urban areas, being inspired by urban architecture or present urban lifestyle. Art genre related to cities

gloss_it: Il termine grangia indicava originariamente una struttura edilizia utilizzata per la conservazione del grano e delle sementi, poi il complesso di edifici costituenti un'azienda agricola e, solo in seguito, passò ad indicare una vasta azienda produttiva, per lo più di proprietà monastica.
gloss_en: Monastic granges were outlying landholdings held by monasteries independent of the manorial system. A farming estate belonging to a monastery Manor or other centre of an outlying farming estate belonging to a monastery

lab_en: winter, summer, autumn, or spring complexion
gloss_it: Analisi del colore, chiamata anche Armocromia, analisi del colore personale, analisi del colore stagionale o corrispondenza della tonalità della pelle, è un termine spesso utilizzato nell'industria cosmetica e della moda per descrivere un metodo per determinare i colori dell'abbigliamento e del trucco che si armonizzano con la carnagione della pelle, il colore degli occhi e il colore dei capelli di una persona, con il vantaggio di poter utilizzare questo strumento per la pianificazione del guardaroba e la consulenza di stile. È una teoria che si basa sull'analisi di pelle, occhi e capelli per trovare la palette di colori che più valorizza le cromie personali
gloss_en: Color analysis, also known as personal color analysis, seasonal color analysis, or skin-tone matching, is a term often used within the cosmetics and fashion industry to describe a method of determining the colors of clothing and makeup that harmonize with a person's skin complexion, eye color, and hair color with the benefit of being able to use this tool for wardrobe planning and style consulting. A process of determining the colors that best suit an individual's natural coloring

gloss_it: Pitture rupestri
gloss_en: Cave paintings are a type of parietal art, found on the wall or ceilings of caves. Paintings found on cave walls and ceilings

gloss_it: La casa per vacanza è una struttura ricettiva extra alberghiera che prevede l'affitto temporaneo a turisti di un appartamento o una casa arredati in alternativa all'hotel.
gloss_en: A vacation rental is the renting out of a furnished apartment, house, or professionally managed resort-condominium complex on a temporary basis to tourists as an alternative to a hotel. Furnished apartment for short-term stays

gloss_it: Türbe significa, in lingua turca, tomba.
gloss_en: Türbe is the word for "tomb" used in the Ottoman Empire. Grave of a prominent Moslem

gloss_it: La denominazione inglese site-specific è generalmente usata nell'ambito dell'arte e della creatività contemporanee per indicare un intervento che è pensato e si inserisce in un preciso luogo.
gloss_en: Site-specific art is artwork created to exist in a certain place. Artwork created for a certain place
A chaitya, chaitya hall, chaitya-griha, or caitya refers to a shrine, sanctuary, temple or prayer hall in Indian religions. A Buddhist or Jain shrine including a stupa.
Skyscape art depicts representations of the sky, especially in a painting or photograph. Art which depicts representations of the sky
In architecture, a sexpartite vault is a rib vault divided into six bays by two diagonal ribs and three transverse ribs.

A jacquemart is an automaton, an animated, mechanised figure of a person, usually made from wood or metal, which strikes the hours on a bell with a hammer. Animated, mechanised figure of a person, usually made from wood or metal, which strikes the hours on a bell with a hammer

Light clay is a natural building material used to infill between a wooden frame in a timber framed building using a combination of clay and straw, woodchips or some other lighter material. Straw-clay, a mixture of straw with a dressing of dilute liquid clay or clay slip. This natural material, making use of an agricultural by-product with an abundant component of soil, has good insulating qualities but is not suitable for load-bearing structural elements.

gloss_it: Il gavit è una sorta di nartece che si trova esclusivamente nell'architettura armena.
gloss_en: A gavit or zhamatun is often contiguous to the west of a church in a Medieval Armenian monastery. vestibular feature of Mediaeval Armenian monastic architecture

Heritage at risk is term for cultural heritage assets that are at risk as a result of neglect, decay, or inappropriate development; or are vulnerable to becoming so. English Heritage's register of endangered historic heritage

gloss_it: Il cosiddetto "sorriso arcaico" è una caratteristica della scultura greca antica di epoca arcaica, che consiste nella caratterizzazione dei volti con le labbra incurvate in su, in forma di sorriso.
gloss_en: The archaic smile was used by sculptors in Archaic Greece, especially in the second quarter of the 6th century BCE, possibly to suggest that their subject was alive and infused with a sense of well-being. A smiling facial expression commonly found on Greek statues of the Archaic period.

Extreme ironing is an extreme sport in which people take ironing boards to remote locations and iron items of clothing. An extreme sport and a performance art The humorous extreme sport of ironing in various outdoor places, especially those that are remote or difficult to access. Abbreviation: EI.
The great chamber was the second most important room in a medieval or Tudor English castle, palace, mansion, or manor house after the great hall. Ceremonial centre of a manor or castle

Floor area ratio is the ratio of a building's total floor area to the size of the piece of land upon which it is built. The ratio of the total floor area of buildings on a certain location to the size of the land of that location, or the zoning limit imposed on such a ratio The ratio of the total floor area of buildings on a certain location to the size of the land of that location.

Seismic loading is one of the basic concepts of earthquake engineering which means application of an earthquake-generated agitation to a structure. One of the basic concepts of earthquake engineering These are caused due to earthquakes. Structure is loaded when base is shaken. External force applied to a building structure as a result of earthquake-generated agitation. External force applied to a building structure.

gloss_it: Una balestriera è una stretta apertura a forma di croce in una fortezza, attraverso la quale un arciere o un balestriere potevano lanciare i loro dardi.
gloss_en: An arrowslit is a narrow vertical aperture in a fortification through which an archer can launch arrows or a crossbowman can launch bolts. A slit in a castle wall Opening in a wall from which missiles, such as arrows, were fired during sieges A slit, as in a castle wall, through which arrows can be fired.

California bungalow is an alternative name for the American Craftsman style of residential architecture, when it was applied to small-to-medium sized homes rather than the large "ultimate bungalow" houses of designers like Greene and Greene.
A water table is a projection of lower masonry on the outside of a wall slightly above the ground.
Earthquake-resistant or aseismic structures are designed to protect buildings to some or greater extent from earthquakes. structures designed to protect buildings from earthquakes

gloss_it: La Maiolica ispano-moresca è un tipo di produzione ceramica sviluppatasi in Spagna a partire dal XIV secolo.
gloss_en: Hispano-Moresque ware is a style of initially Islamic pottery created in Al Andalus or Muslim Spain, which continued to be produced under Christian rule in styles blending Islamic and European elements.
The talus is an architectural feature of some late medieval castles, especially prevalent in crusader constructions. A sloped portion of a fortified wall

The dogtrot, also known as a breezeway house, dog-run, or possum-trot, is a style of house that was common throughout the Southeastern United States during the 19th and early 20th centuries. Also known as a possum-trot

A low-energy house is characterized by an energy-efficient design and technical features which enable it to provide high living standards and comfort with low energy consumption and carbon emissions. Any type of house that uses less energy than a traditional or average contemporary house A house that uses less energy than a traditional house.

gloss_it: Energy-plus-house è un termine che indica una casa che auto-produce energia da fonti rinnovabili.
gloss_en: An energy-plus house produces more energy from renewable energy sources, over the course of a year, than it imports from external sources.

gloss_it: In bioedilizia una casa passiva o edificio passivo è un edificio che copre la maggior parte del suo fabbisogno di energia per riscaldamento e raffrescamento ambientale interno ricorrendo a dispositivi passivi. Tipo di casa
gloss_en: Passive house is a voluntary standard for energy efficiency in a building, which reduces the building's ecological footprint. A standard for energy efficiency in buildings Type of house House that consumes very little energy and needs to traditional heating because of its superior heat insulation.

gloss_it: Il balsamario è un piccolo contenitore in vetro utilizzato per conservare balsami e olii profumati.
gloss_en: An unguentarium, also referred to as Balsamarium, Lacrimarium or tears vessel, is a small ceramic or glass bottle found frequently by archaeologists at Hellenistic and Roman sites, especially in cemeteries. A small bottle used to store balms or scented oils.
An X-chair is a chair with an X-shaped frame. Medieval and Renaissance chair with an X-shaped frame

In archaeology, a wheelhouse is a prehistoric structure from the Iron Age found in Scotland. A prehistoric structure from the Iron Age found in Scotland, characteristically including an outer wall within which a circle of stone piers (resembling the spokes of a wheel) form the basis for lintel arches supporting corbelled roofing with a hearth at the hub.
In architecture, flushwork is the decorative combination on the same flat plane of flint and ashlar stone.
A yett is a gate or grille of latticed wrought iron bars used for defensive purposes in castles and tower houses.

A room divider is a screen or piece of furniture placed in a way that divides a room into separate areas. Screen or piece of furniture placed in a way that divides a room A screen or piece of furniture placed in a way that it divides a room into separate areas. Screen or piece of furniture.
Human scale is the set of physical qualities, and quantities of information, characterizing the human body, its motor, sensory, or mental capabilities, and human social institutions.

gloss_it: Il Sacbé, è una tipica strada della civiltà maya.
gloss_en: A sacbe, plural sacbeob, or "white way", is a raised paved road built by the Maya civilization of pre-Columbian Mesoamerica. A raised paved road built by the Maya civilization of pre-Columbian Mesoamerica.
In Late Antiquity, a consular diptych was a type of diptych intended as a de-luxe commemorative object.

gloss_it: L’iconòstasi, anche chiamato tramezzo in occidente, è una parete divisoria decorata con icone che separa la navata delle chiese di rito orientale dal Bema dove viene celebrata l'Eucaristia.
gloss_en: In Eastern Christianity, an iconostasis is a wall of icons and religious paintings, separating the nave from the sanctuary in a church. Wall of icons and religious paintings, separating the nave from the sanctuary in a church A wall of icons between the sanctuary and the nave in a church of eastern Christendom. A wall of icons.
Sosweawon or Sosaewon is a typical Korean garden of the middle Joseon Dynasty. Garden
In Late Antiquity, an imperial diptych is a theoretical type of ivory diptych, made up of two leaves of five panels each and each with a central panel representing the emperor or empress.

gloss_it: Shinden-zukuri si riferisce allo stile dell'architettura domestica sviluppato per palazzi sontuosi o aristocratici costruiti a Heian-kyō, l'odierna Kyoto, nel periodo Heian, in particolare nel Giappone del X secolo. Stile architettonico giapponese
gloss_en: Shinden-zukuri refers to the style of domestic architecture developed for palatial or aristocratic mansions built in Heian-kyō in the Heian period, especially in 10th century Japan.

gloss_it: L'ergastulum era una prigione sotteranea in uso ai tempi dei Romani per punire gli schiavi riottosi e che ospitava gli schiavi dediti a lavori particolarmente usuranti.
gloss_en: An ergastulum was a Roman building used to hold in chains dangerous slaves or to punish other slaves. Roman building used to hold in chains dangerous slaves, or to punish other slaves

gloss_it: Le piramidi mesoamericane, note anche come Teocalli, sono un elemento importante dell'antica architettura mesoamericana.
gloss_en: Mesoamerican pyramids form a prominent part of ancient Mesoamerican architecture. Ancient pyramid-shaped masonry structures located in Mexico and Central America Pyramid-shaped structures of ancient Mesoamerica

lab_en: école nationale des beaux-arts de nancy
ecole nationale des beaux-arts de nancy
gloss_it: L'École des beaux-arts si riferisce ad alcune influenti scuole d'arte in Francia. Scuole d'arte in Francia
gloss_en: An École des Beaux-Arts is one of a number of influential art schools in France. Several art schools in France Influential art schools in France

gloss_it: Una stazione difensiva era una residenza difendibile costruita sulla frontiera americana durante la fine del XVIII e l'inizio del XIX secolo.
gloss_en: A station was a defensible residence constructed on the American frontier during the late 18th and early 19th century. Defensible residence constructed on the American frontier during the late 18th and early 19th century

This sideboard was designed by Edward William Godwin, who was one of the most important exponents of Victorian Japonisme or Anglo-Japanese style, the appropriation of Japanese artistic styles. A Victorian Japonisme style sideboard designed by Edward William Godwin
Tennessee marble is a type of crystalline limestone found only in East Tennessee, in the southeastern United States. base material
A kerkenkruis is in the Netherlands a couple of churches that form a cross on a map.
This article covers the architecture of Estonia.
Adaptive reuse refers to the process of reusing an existing building for a purpose other than which it was originally built or designed for. reuse of an existing building for a new purpose

gloss_it: Un distretto storico o distretto del patrimonio è una sezione di una città che contiene gli edifici più antichi considerati preziosi per ragioni storiche o architettoniche. Sezione di una città che contiene edifici antichi ritenuti preziosi per ragioni storiche, culturali, o architettoniche
gloss_en: A historic district or heritage district is a section of a city which contains older buildings considered valuable for historical or architectural reasons. Section of a city which contains older buildings considered valuable for historical or architectural reasons
An alternative exhibition space is a space other than a traditional commercial venue used for the public exhibition of artwork.
A pointing machine is a measuring tool used by stone sculptors and woodcarvers to accurately copy plaster, clay or wax sculpture models into wood or stone. Sculpting tool

gloss_it: Tetto verde è un tetto di un edificio parzialmente o completamente ricoperto di vegetazione.
gloss_en: A green roof or living roof is a roof of a building that is partially or completely covered with vegetation and a growing medium, planted over a waterproofing membrane. Technique where the top portion of a building is covered with vegetation and a growing medium A roof of a house or other building which is covered with soil and grass, plants, trees, or other landscaping materials. Roof of a house or other building which is covered with soil and grass, plants, trees, etc.
Postmodern art is a body of art movements that sought to contradict some aspects of modernism or some aspects that emerged or developed in its aftermath. Art movement

gloss_it: Il castello giapponese è un tipo di fortezza presente in Giappone.
gloss_en: Japanese castles were fortresses constructed primarily of wood and stone. Fortresses constructed primarily of wood and stone

gloss_it: Un torii è il tradizionale portale d'accesso giapponese che porta ad un jinja o, più semplicemente, ad un'area sacra.
gloss_en: A torii is a traditional Japanese gate most commonly found at the entrance of or within a Shinto shrine, where it symbolically marks the transition from the mundane to the sacred. A traditional Shinto shrine gate A traditional Japanese gate at Shinto shrines, symbolically marking the transition from the profane to the sacred. Traditional shrine gate.
The Ubaid house is a dwelling used by the Ubaid culture of the Neolithic era.

gloss_it: Un ritratto del donatore o ritratto votivo è un ritratto, inserito in un dipinto più grande o altro lavoro, che mostra la persona che ha commissionato e pagato l'immagine o un membro della sua famiglia.
gloss_en: A donor portrait or votive portrait is a portrait in a larger painting or other work showing the person who commissioned and paid for the image, or a member of his, or her, family. Portrait of the person who paid for a painting, typically in a church Portrait in a larger work showing the person who commissioned and paid for the image

gloss_it: I papiers collés sono delle opere d'arte che, come suggerisce il nome francese, sono realizzate mediante l'accostamento di pezzi di carta
gloss_en: Papier collé is a type of collage and collaging technique in which paper is adhered to a flat mount. A painting technique and type of collage An art technique in which pieces of flat material (paper, oilcloth, etc.) are pasted into a painting in much in the same way as a collage, except that the pasted pieces represent objects in the painting.
A private view is a special viewing of an exhibition by invitation only, often an art exhibition and normally a preview at the start of a public exhibition.
The architecture of Leeds, a city and metropolitan borough in West Yorkshire, England, encompasses a wide range of architectural styles and notable buildings.

gloss_it: Un catalogo ragionato è un elenco completo, con annotazioni, di tutte le opere note realizzate da un artista sia in un particolare mezzo o in tutti i media. Elenco di tutte le opere realizzate da un artista
gloss_en: A catalogue raisonné is a comprehensive, annotated listing of all the known artworks by an artist either in a particular medium or all media. A list of artworks Comprehensive, annotated listing of all the known artworks by an artist A complete index, usually with descriptions and reproductions, of a body of work, such as all the creations of a single artist.

Herodian architecture is a style of classical architecture characteristic of the numerous building projects undertaken during the reign of Herod the Great, the Roman client king of Judea. style of classical architecture during the reign of Herod the Great

A mail chute is a largely defunct letter collection device used in early multi-storey office buildings, hotels, apartment buildings and other high rise structures. A chute for collecting and transporting mail within a building

gloss_it: Un hōkyōintō è una pagoda giapponese, così chiamata perché inizialmente conteneva il Hōkyōin dharani sūtra.
gloss_en: A hōkyōintō is a Japanese pagoda, so called because it originally contained the Hōkyōin dharani sūtra.

A modello, from Italian, is a preparatory study or model, usually at a smaller scale, for a work of art or architecture, especially one produced for the approval of the commissioning patron. A preparatory sketch or study for a painting or other artwork.

gloss_it: Con il nome collodio umido si indicano quei procedimenti fotografici storici che utilizzavano il collodio come legante per emulsioni fotosensibili.
gloss_en: The collodion process is an early photographic process. Early photographic technique
Until the discovery that Maya stelae depicted kings instead of high priests, the Maya priesthood and their preoccupations had been a main scholarly concern. Religious practice
A cathedral close is the area immediately around a cathedral, sometimes extending for a hundred metres or more from the main cathedral building.

A conversation piece is an informal group portrait, especially those painted in Britain in the 18th century, beginning in the 1720s. Painting genre A painting of a group of people engaged in conversation or some other activity, popular in 18th century.
Ram guards protect the hydraulic ram on an excavator which is used to move the boom and other parts of the arm of an excavator to carry out work.

gloss_it: Lo shamir, secondo la mitologia ebraica, fu forse, quindi senza certezza per la traduzione, una sorta di "verme" leggendario che tagliava le pietre per il Santuario.
gloss_en: In the Gemara, the shamir is a worm or a substance that had the power to cut through or disintegrate stone, iron and diamond.

gloss_it: La cassaforma semi-rampante è un tipo di cassaforma industrializzata che permette la costruzione di grandi opere in altezza: la cassaforma può essere traslata man mano che viene effettuata la gettata di cemento.
gloss_en: Slip forming, continuous poured, continuously formed, or slipform construction is a construction method in which concrete is poured into a continuously moving form. Vertically moving formwork in which concrete is continuously poured
Negative space, in art, is the space around and between the subject of an image. In art, the space around or between elements of the subject The space around and between the subject(s) of an image.
In the Hindu epic Mahabharata, Navagunjara is a creature composed of nine different animals. Mythical creature described in Sarala Dasa's Odia Mahabharata

Tongue and groove is a method of fitting similar objects together, edge to edge, used mainly with wood, in flooring, parquetry, panelling, and similar constructions. A method for connecting two pieces of wood or similar material. A joint, in flooring or panelling, made by fitting a ridge (tongue) along the edge of one board into a corresponding slot (groove) on another. Joint, in flooring or panelling.

gloss_it: Una parete scorrevole è una parete non portante composta da elementi scorrevoli entro guide che ne delimitano un percorso prefissato.
gloss_en: Portable partitions are a form of temporary walls which serve to divide rooms in place of permanent walls.

gloss_it: La finestra termale è una grande finestra semicircolare suddivisa in tre parti, dove la parte centrale risulta normalmente più grande rispetto alle due laterali.
gloss_en: Diocletian windows, also called thermal windows, are large semicircular windows characteristic of the enormous public baths of Ancient Rome.
Architect of record is the architect or architecture firm whose name appears on a building permit issued for a specific project on which that architect or firm performed services.
A truth window is an opening in a wall surface, created to reveal the layers or components within the wall. Opening in a wall surface to reveal the wall components, often found in strawbale houses

gloss_it: La serranda è un dispositivo meccanico di chiusura avvolgibile utilizzata nei negozi, per la chiusura delle vetrine, nei garage.
gloss_en: A roller shutter, coiling door, roller door or sectional overhead door is a type of door or window shutter consisting of many horizontal slats hinged together. A shutter (for a window or door) consisting of a series of horizontal sections that are hinged together and attached to a roller at the top. Shutter consisting of a series of horizontal sections that are hinged together.

Škvorec Chateau is a chateau, formerly a minor castle, located in small market town of Škvorec, Central Bohemia, about 23 kilometres east of Prague in the Czech Republic. A castle near Prague, Czech Republic. chateau in Prague-East District

The term architectural designer may refer to an architect, architectural technologist or any other person that is involved in the design process of buildings or urban landscapes. Person that is involved in the design of buildings or urban landscapes
