gloss_it: Il Benben, nella mitologia egizia, e più specificamente nella cosmogonia di Eliopoli, era la collina primigenia che emerse dall'oceano primordiale del Nun, e sulla quale il dio creatore Atum generò se stesso e la prima coppia divina.
gloss_en: In the creation myth of the Heliopolitan form of ancient Egyptian religion, Benben was the mound that arose from the primordial waters Nu upon which the creator deity Atum settled. Egyptology
Panelház is a Hungarian term for a type of concrete block of flats, built in the People's Republic of Hungary and other Eastern Bloc countries.

The term Chinese pyramids refers to pyramidal shaped structures in China, most of which are ancient mausoleums and burial mounds built to house the remains of several early emperors of China and their imperial relatives. Pyramidal shaped structures in China, most of which are ancient mausoleums and burial mounds built to house the remains of several early emperors of China and their imperial relatives

gloss_it: Lo Stile revival mediterraneo è uno stile introdotto negli Stati Uniti alla fine del XIX secolo e incorpora diverse tendenze riferibili all'architettura spagnola rinascimentale, a quella coloniale spagnola, allo Stile Beaux-Arts, al Rinascimento italiano, all'Architettura gotica veneziana.
gloss_en: Mediterranean Revival is an architectural style introduced in the United States in the waning nineteenth century variously incorporating references from Spanish Renaissance, Spanish Colonial, Italian Renaissance, French Colonial, Beaux-Arts, Arabic Andalusian architecture, and Venetian Gothic architecture. A design style popular in the early twentieth century Design style during the 20th century

lab_en: temples of the church of jesus christ of latter-day saints
temple of the church of jesus christ of latter-day saints
entrance requirements for lds church temples
gloss_en: In The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, a temple is a building dedicated to be a House of the Lord. Place of worship of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints A house of worship dedicated to a polytheistic faith.

MEED, abbreviated from the former name Middle East Economic Digest, is a business intelligence tool for the Middle East and North Africa, providing analysis and commentary on Middle Eastern markets, companies, people and data on the regional projects market. Middle East Economic Digest
Kačina is a significant Empire style palace in Svatý Mikuláš in the central region of the Czech Republic.

gloss_it: In architettura l'arcata cieca è un arco, generalmente appartenente ad una serie continua, sovrapposto ad una parete chiusa, come elemento decorativo.
gloss_en: A blind arcade or blind window is an arcade that is composed of a series of arches that has no actual openings and that is applied to the surface of a wall as a decorative element: i.e., the arches are not windows or openings but are part of the masonry face. Architectural element

gloss_it: La "chambre de bonne" è un tipico piccolo appartamento monolocale, prevalentemente parigino ma presente anche in altre città della Francia e del Belgio e più raramente in altre costruzioni del nord-Europa, ricavato all'ultimo piano o nel sottotetto dei palazzi medio- o alto-borghesi costruiti nel XIX secolo a seguito dello sviluppo urbanistico della capitale dato dal piano regolatore di Haussmann.
gloss_en: A chambre de bonne is a type of French apartment consisting of a single room in a middle-class house or apartment building.
The Tolštejn Castle is located in the microregion of Tolštejn, approximately 4 km south of Varnsdorf. Hill in Rozhled (Jiřetín pod Jedlovou), Czech Republic
In Buddhist art and culture, the Urna is a spiral or circular dot placed on the forehead of Buddhist images as an auspicious mark.
X-bracing is a structural engineering practice where the lateral load on a building is reduced by transferring the load into the exterior columns.

gloss_it: La parola tabernacolo, nella tradizione ebraica e cristiana significa il luogo della casa di Dio presso gli uomini.
gloss_en: A tabernacle is a fixed, locked box in which, in some Christian churches, the Eucharist is "reserved". Which is a small cupboard, chest or cabinet in which the consecrated hosts are kept

gloss_it: Una klismos è un tipo di sedia dell'antica Grecia, familiare in quanto presente in raffigurazioni di mobili antichi dipinti su manufatti in ceramica greca e in bassorilievi dalla metà del V secolo a.C. in poi.
gloss_en: A klismos or klismos chair is a type of ancient Greek chair, familiar from depictions of ancient furniture on painted pottery and in bas-reliefs from the mid-fifth century BCE onwards. A light Ancient Greek chair with curved legs.

The terms the Lobby and Lobby journalists collectively characterise the political journalists in the United Kingdom Houses of Parliament. (UK) parliamentary journalists receiving privileged political access in exchange for sourcing anonymity

gloss_it: In falegnameria e nell'edilizia in legno strutturale, quello a tenone e mortasa è un tipo di giunzione ad incastro composto da un maschio e dall'alloggio corrispondente ; è stato utilizzato per migliaia di anni dai falegnami di tutto il mondo per unire pezzi di legno, soprattutto quando questi formano un angolo di 90 gradi.
gloss_en: A mortise and tenon joint connects two pieces of wood or of material. A woodworking joint Woodworking joint Machine element

lab_en: listed building in the united kingdom
statutory list of buildings of special architectural or historic interest
gloss_it: Un Listed building, ovvero un Monumento classificato, nel Regno Unito, è un'opera artistica riconosciuta e protetta per il suo aspetto storico, architetturale o culturale eccezionale. Tipologia di monumento protetto nel Regno Unito
gloss_en: A listed building, or listed structure, is one that has been placed on one of the four statutory lists maintained by Historic England in England, Historic Environment Scotland in Scotland, Cadw in Wales, and the Northern Ireland Environment Agency in Northern Ireland. In architecture: designation of a historically significant structure Collection of protected architectural creations in the United Kingdom

gloss_it: Le fortificazioni di Cattaro sono un sistema integrato di fortificazioni storiche che avevano la funzione di proteggere la città medievale di Cattaro, in Montenegro. sistema di fortificazioni storiche della città di Cattaro, in Montenegro
gloss_en: The fortifications of Kotor are an integrated historical fortification system that protected the medieval town of Kotor containing ramparts, towers, citadels, gates, bastions, forts, cisterns, a castle, and ancillary buildings and structures.

A musical fountain, also known as a dancing fountain, is a type of animated fountain for entertainment purposes that creates an aesthetic design. Animated fountain created by the effects of sound waves and laser against water Type of animated fountain for entertainment purposes

gloss_it: L'architettura neoromanica è stata una tendenza artistica, in voga tra il 1840 ed i primi anni del Novecento, ispirata allo stile romanico dei secoli XI e XII. Stile architettonico in voga a metà del XIX secolo
gloss_en: Romanesque Revival is a style of building employed beginning in the mid-19th century inspired by the 11th- and 12th-century Romanesque architecture. An architectural style which started in the late 19th century, inspired by the original Romanesque architecture Style of building employed beginning in the mid-19th century

In German linguistics, the Sankt Goar line, das–dat line, or was–wat line is an isogloss separating the dialects to the north, which have a t in the words dat and wat, from the dialects to the south, which have an s: das, was.
Platform, formerly known as City House and British Railways House, is a building over Leeds railway station that was built by Taylor Woodrow in 1962. Building in Leeds, West Yorkshire, UK

A cruck or crook frame is a curved timber, one of a pair, which support the roof of a building, historically used in England. Curved timber used as roof support A sturdy timber with a curve or angle used for primary framing of a timber house, usually used in pairs.

gloss_it: L'arte delle lacche russe si sviluppò come derivazione dalla pittura delle icone russe che si concluse con il crollo della Russia imperiale.
gloss_en: Russian lacquer art developed from the art of icon painting, which came to an end with the collapse of Imperial Russia.

gloss_it: Kommunalka
gloss_en: Kommunalki or communal apartments appeared in the Soviet Union following the Russian revolution of 1917.

gloss_it: Una torre di trasmissione è una struttura verticale finalizzata a supportare una antenna per telecomunicazioni.
gloss_en: Radio masts and towers are typically tall structures designed to support antennas for telecommunications and broadcasting, including television. Tall structures designed to support antennas (also known as aerials in the UK) Tall structure designed to support antennas

gloss_it: Un traliccio di trasmissione è un'opera artificiale per telecomunicazioni con la caratteristica principale di impiegare l'intera struttura come antenna.
gloss_en: A mast radiator is a radio mast or tower in which the metal structure itself is energized and functions as an antenna. Type of radio antenna
A riverscape comprises the features of the landscape which can be found on and along a river. River and its surrounding landscape A landscape that features a river.

A chultun is a bottle-shaped underground storage chamber built by the pre-Columbian Maya in southern Mesoamerica. A bottle-shaped underground storage chamber built by the pre-Columbian Maya in southern Mesoamerica, in some cases designed to collect rainwater.

gloss_it: SAMO© è lo pseudonimo con cui taggavano i due writer Jean-Michel Basquiat e Al Diaz a New York dal 1978 al 1980. Gruppo musicale statunitense
gloss_en: SAMO is a graffiti tag originally used on the streets of New York City from 1978 to early 1980. A graffiti tag used by the artist Jean-Michel Basquiat graffiti tag

gloss_it: Il paesaggio è una porzione di territorio come appare abbracciata dallo sguardo di un soggetto.
gloss_en: A landscape is the visible features of an area of land, its landforms, and how they integrate with natural or man-made features. Areas of land without human-built structures The traits, patterns, and structure of a specific geographic area.

gloss_it: L'architettura giacobiana è la seconda fase dell'architettura rinascimentale in Inghilterra, venuta dopo l'architettura elisabettiana.
gloss_en: The Jacobean style is the second phase of Renaissance architecture in England, following the Elizabethan style. second phase of Renaissance architecture in England

gloss_it: Lo sviluppo di fortificazioni medievali è l'aspetto della tecnologia medievale che si occupa dello sviluppo della costruzione delle fortificazioni e del loro uso in Europa, dalla caduta dell'Impero romano d'Occidente al Rinascimento.
gloss_en: Medieval fortification refers to medieval military methods that cover the development of fortification construction and use in Europe, roughly from the fall of the Western Roman Empire to the Renaissance. Fortifications and Castles built during the middle ages

gloss_it: Un ninfeo è in origine un edificio sacro dedicato ad una ninfa, in genere posto presso una fontana o una sorgente d'acqua.
gloss_en: A nymphaeum or nymphaion, in ancient Greece and Rome, was a monument consecrated to the nymphs, especially those of springs. A type of monument in Antiquity Type of monument in ancient Greece and Rome An ancient Greek or Roman shrine consecrated to water nymphs, often with a fountain.

gloss_it: lista di un progetto Wikimedia
gloss_en: Used by Sumerians and other Mesopotamian cultures beginning in the third millennium BC, clay nails, also referred to as dedication or foundation pegs, cones, or nails, were cone-shaped nails made of clay, inscribed with cuneiform, baked, and stuck into the mudbrick walls to serve as evidence that the temple or building was the divine property of the god to whom it was dedicated. symbolic item buried under foundations to consecrate the building in Sumerian culture

gloss_it: Nel mondo romano l'uso di seppellire i defunti con il rito dell'inumazione comportò l'utilizzo di sarcofagi, spesso riccamente scolpiti.
gloss_en: In the burial practices of ancient Rome and Roman funerary art, marble and limestone sarcophagi elaborately carved in relief were characteristic of elite inhumation burials from the 2nd to the 4th centuries AD. At least 10,000 Roman sarcophagi have survived, with fragments possibly representing as many as 20,000.

gloss_it: I sarcofagi paleocristiani sono quelli prodotti dai primi cristiani, in particolare si conoscono esemplari del III secolo, fino al V secolo circa.
gloss_en: Early Christians sarcophagi are those Ancient Roman sarcophagi carrying inscriptions or carving relating them to early Christianity.

gloss_it: Il ritratto ellenistico è uno dei maggiori traguardi dell'arte greca, nel quale si riuscì, in maniera definitivamente incontrovertibile, a realizzare ritratti fisionomici, dotati anche di valenze psicologiche.
gloss_en: Hellenistic portraiture was one of the most innovative features of Hellenistic art.

gloss_it: Il ritratto romano fu uno dei più importanti vertici dell'arte romana e del ritratto in generale, raggiungendo traguardi di grande intensità. Tipologia artistica
gloss_en: Roman portraiture was one of the most significant periods in the development of portrait art. Art genre

gloss_it: Una casa ad alveare è un edificio costituito da un cerchio di pietre sormontato da un tetto a cupola.
gloss_en: A beehive house is a building made from a circle of stones topped with a domed roof. A type of stone building in Scotland and Ireland Building made from a circle of stones topped with a domed roof

gloss_it: La pieve fu una circoscrizione territoriale religiosa e civile facente capo ad una chiesa rurale con battistero, detta chiesa matrice, pievana. Territorio facente capo ad una chiesa medievale
gloss_en: In the Middle Ages, a pieve was a rural church with a baptistery, upon which other churches without baptisteries depended.

gloss_it: Il restauro architettonico può essere definito come la disciplina dell'architettura volta a garantire la conservazione di un'opera di Architettura, per valorizzarla e consentirne il riuso, tenendo in debito conto le sue valenze storiche.
gloss_en: Architectural conservation describes the process through which the material, historical, and design integrity of any built heritage are prolonged through carefully planned interventions. Process of preservation of historically significant buildings
A monolithic dome is a structure cast in a one-piece form. Structure cast in one piece over a form, made of concrete or similar structural material

A concrete slab is a common structural element of modern buildings, consisting of a flat, horizontal surface made of cast concrete. A flat concrete plate used in construction Common structural element of modern buildings

A man cave or manspace, and less commonly a manland or mantuary is a male retreat or sanctuary in a home, such as a specially equipped garage, spare bedroom,media room,den,basement, or tree house. A part of a home specifically reserved for adult male activities, such as drinking beer, playing games and watching TV; often a garage or den. Part of a home.

gloss_it: La stoà
gloss_en: A stoa, in ancient Greek architecture, is a covered walkway or portico, commonly for public use. Ancient Greek covered walkway or portico In Ancient Greece, a walkway with a roof supported by colonnades, often with a wall on one side; specifically, the Great Hall in Athens.
In architecture, circulation refers to the way people move through and interact with a building. The flow of people through a building Way people move through and interact with a building

gloss_it: Il giardino alla francese o giardino formale francese rappresenta l'espressione del classicismo barocco nell'arte del giardinaggio
Il megaron designa l'unità architettonica che funge da fulcro della realtà palaziale minoica e soprattutto micenea.
gloss_en: The megaron, plural megara, was the great hall in ancient Greek palace complexes. The rectangular great hall in a Mycenaean building, usually supported with pillars. Mycenean rectangular hall.
The central old citadel of Hanoi was the former residence of Vietnamese monarchs dating back to Đại Việt, when the city was known as Thăng Long.

A siheyuan is a historical type of residence that was commonly found throughout China, most famously in Beijing and rural Shanxi. A traditional type of Chinese residence Historical type of residence in China, or Chinese quadrangles A traditional type of Chinese residence consisting of four houses with a courtyard in the middle; a Chinese quadrangle. Traditional Chinese residence.
A barrel roof is a curved roof that, especially from below, is curved like a cut-away barrel.

gloss_it: Il ciborio è un elemento architettonico a forma di baldacchino che sovrasta l'altare maggiore nelle chiese. Elemento architettonico
gloss_en: In ecclesiastical architecture, a ciborium is a canopy or covering supported by columns, freestanding in the sanctuary, that stands over and covers the altar in a basilica or other church. Canopy or covering that covers the altar in a church
Buddhist religious architecture developed in the Indian subcontinent. Style of building

Many of Mexico's older architectural structures, including entire sections of Pre-Hispanic and colonial cities, have been designated World Heritage sites for their historical and artistic significance. Overview of the architecture in Mexico

gloss_it: Anti-arte è qualsiasi opera che può essere esposta in un contesto "tradizionale" ma che di fatto denigra l'arte stessa o ne stravolge la natura.
gloss_en: Anti-art is a loosely used term applied to an array of concepts and attitudes that reject prior definitions of art and question art in general. Art practice paradox of dialectical antitheses challenging conventional ideas about art Art that is usually exhibited and delivered in a conventional context but that makes fun of serious art or the artistic establishment or challenges the nature of art. Art that make makes fun of serious art.

A combine painting is an artwork that incorporates various objects into a painted canvas surface, creating a sort of hybrid between painting and sculpture. Type of painting in which 3-dimensional objects are part of the painted surface, closely associated with Robert Rauschenberg Artwork that incorporates various objects into a painting

The architecture of Copenhagen in Denmark is characterised by a wide variety of styles, progressing through Christian IV's early 17th century landmarks and the elegant 17th century mansions and palaces of Frederiksstaden, to the late 19th century residential boroughs and cultural institutions to the modernistic contribution of the 20th century such as Arne Jacobsen's National Bank and SAS Royal Hotel.

Pit alignments are a type of prehistoric monument found throughout the British Isles, the function of which is at present poorly understood. series of pits at intervals along a single or parallel pair of lines; prehistoric earthworks in the British Isles with poorly understood function

An artist's portfolio is an edited collection of an artist's best artwork intended to showcase their style or method of work. A sample of an artist's work or a case used to display artwork, photographs etc.. Collection of best artwork
Nubian architecture is diverse and ancient. overview about the Nubian architecture

gloss_it: Abstraction-Création fu collettivo di artisti fondato a Parigi nel 1931 da Auguste Herbin, Jean Hélion e Georges Vantongerloo per promuovere l'arte astratta, dopo il ritorno al figurativo degli anni 20, e contrastare l'influenza dell'agguerrito gruppo dei surrealisti capeggiati da André Breton. Collettivo di artisti
gloss_en: Abstraction-Création was a loose association of artists formed in Paris in 1931 to counteract the influence of the Surrealist group led by André Breton. Artist association

gloss_it: Con candeliere, o anche portacandela, ci si riferisce ad un oggetto a sostegno di una candela, consistente in un sostegno verticale fissato su un piedistallo.
gloss_en: A sconce is a type of light fixture that is fixed to a wall. Type of light fixture affixed to a wall
A bent in American English is a transverse rigid frame. A transverse frame of a framed structure; a subunit of framing.

Polite architecture, or "the Polite" in architectural theory comprises buildings designed to include non-local styles for aesthetically-pleasing decorative effect by professional architects. Or the polite: a form of building design which is aestheticly led and characterised by intentionally incorporated stylistic or romantic features or the polite: a form of building design which is aesthetically led and characterised by intentionally incorporated stylistic or romantic features
In mathematics, a Buekenhout geometry or diagram geometry is a generalization of projective spaces, Tits buildings, and several other geometric structures, introduced by Buekenhout.
A Bit-hilani is an ancient architectural type of palace.
The Afrasiab murals, also called the Paintings of the Ambassadors, is a rare example of Sogdian art. Anonymous painting

In architecture, open building is an approach to the design of buildings that takes account of the possible need to change or adapt the building during its lifetime, in line with social or technological change.
In architecture, a free plan is an open plan with non-load-bearing walls dividing interior space.
A mason's mark is a symbol often found on dressed stone in buildings and other public structures.
A jamb statue is a figure carved on the jambs of a doorway or window.

gloss_it: L'anfiteatro romano di Milano era un antico anfiteatro della città romana di Mediolanum, l'odierna Milano. Antico anfiteatro romano di Milano
gloss_en: The Milan amphitheatre was a Roman amphitheatre in the ancient city of Mediolanum, the modern Milan in northern Italy. Roman amphitheatre in Milan, Italy
The roots of Brazilian sculpture have been traced back to the late 16th century, emerging soon after the first settlements in the newly discovered land. history of Brazilian sculptural art

gloss_it: L'antone o scuro è un particolare tipo di schermo per infissi.
gloss_en: A window shutter is a solid and stable window covering usually consisting of a frame of vertical stiles and horizontal rails. A solid window covering used to block light and winds
An architectural drawing or architect's drawing is a technical drawing of a building that falls within the definition of architecture. Technical drawing of a building
The Saflieni phase is one of the eleven phases of Maltese prehistory, the fourth of five in the middle or Temple period. Archaelogical phase of Maltese prehistory

gloss_it: Un'armatura nel linguaggio della scultura è una struttura attorno alla quale l'opera scultorea è stata realizzata.
gloss_en: In sculpture, an armature is a framework around which the sculpture is built. A framework around which a sculpture is built framework around which a sculpture is built A supporting framework in a sculpture.
Stoneham station is a former train station in Stoneham, Massachusetts. Listed on the NRHP in Massachusetts Former railway station in Stoneham, Massachusetts

A Tapsel gate is a type of wooden gate, unique to the English county of Sussex, which has a central pivot upon which it can rotate through 90° in either direction before coming to a stop at two fixed points.

Construction surveying or building surveying is to stake out reference points and markers that will guide the construction of new structures such as roads or buildings. The process of layout out construction projects, and verifying their position during construction, also known as engineering surveying Practice of making preparatory measurements before constructing buildings

gloss_it: Il calidario era la parte delle antiche terme romane destinata ai bagni in acqua calda e ai bagni di vapore. calikari. destinata ai bagni in acqua calda e ai bagni di vapore
gloss_en: A caldarium was a room with a hot plunge bath, used in a Roman bath complex. In Roman baths, the hottest room, with a plunge-pool. It preceded the tepidarium and frigidarium.

gloss_it: Un diaframma è una struttura prefabbricata o gettata in opera che viene utilizzata per sostenere scavi artificiali di natura provvisoria o definitiva impedendo lo scivolamento del terreno all'interno dello scavo.
gloss_en: A slurry wall is a civil engineering technique used to build reinforced concrete walls in areas of soft earth close to open water, or with a high groundwater table. Technique used to build reinforced concrete walls in areas of soft earth close to open water or with a high ground water table

Rajput painting, also called Rajasthani painting, evolved and flourished in the royal courts of Rajputana in northern India, mainly during the 17th and 18th centuries. Art style that evolved in the courts of Rajputana in India

gloss_it: I Fori Imperiali costituiscono una serie di cinque piazze monumentali edificate nel corso di un secolo e mezzo nel cuore della città di Roma da parte di Giulio Cesare e degli imperatori Augusto, Vespasiano, Nerva e Traiano. Sito archeologico di Roma
gloss_en: The Imperial fora are a series of monumental fora, constructed in Rome over a period of one and a half centuries, between 46 BC and 113 AD. The fora were the center of the Roman Republic and of the Roman Empire. Archaeological sites in Rome

gloss_it: La facciata ventilata è un particolare tipo di rivestimento perimetrale delle pareti che prevede l'applicazione a secco, sulla superficie esterna dell'edificio, di pannelli di opportuno spessore, non strettamente aderenti alla struttura.
gloss_en: A rainscreen is an exterior wall detail where the siding stands off from the moisture-resistant surface of an air/water barrier applied to the sheathing to create a capillary break and to allow drainage and evaporation. In building construction Form of exterior wall cladding The exterior weather-facing surface of an exterior wall.
A pilier cantonné is a type of compound pier commonly associated with High Gothic architecture.

A fortochka is a small ventilation window. Small ventilation window, mostly found in Russia A small ventilation window, spanning the frame of one window pane, that opens on hinges independently of the whole window, common in Russia, post-Soviet states and Finland. Small ventilation window spanning the frame of a window.
Shaped canvases are paintings that depart from the normal flat, rectangular configuration. Painting implement

gloss_it: Una goccia, in architettura, è un motivo ornamentale a forma di tronco di cono, piazzato sotto una cornice, sotto un triglifo, sotto una console, etc.
gloss_en: A gutta is a small water-repelling, cone-shaped projection used in the architrave of the Doric order in classical architecture. Small cone-shaped projection used in the architrave of the Doric order A small water-repelling, cone-shaped projection used in the architrave of the Doric order in classical architecture.

Hellenistic glass was glass produced during the Hellenistic period, from the conquests of Alexander the Great to the expansion of the Roman Empire in the Mediterranean, Europe, western Asia and northern Africa.

gloss_it: Lo Stick style è uno stile architettonico americano della fine del XIX secolo, transizione tra il Carpenter Gothic della metà del XIX secolo ed il Queen Anne Style che si evolvette negli anni '90 dell'Ottocento.
gloss_en: The Stick style was a late-19th-century American architectural style, transitional between the Carpenter Gothic style of the mid-19th century, and the Queen Anne style that it had evolved into by the 1890s. A late-19th-century American architectural style Late-19th-century American architectural style
A fireplace fireback is a piece of heavy cast iron, sized in proportion to the fireplace and the fire, which is placed against the back wall of the fireplace.

Phenomenology in architecture can be understood as a discursive and realist attempt to understand and embody the philosophical insights of phenomenology. Based on the experience of building materials and their sensory properties Aspect of philosophy researching into the experience of built space

The altar rail is a low barrier, sometimes ornate and usually made of stone, wood or metal in some combination, delimiting the chancel or the sanctuary and altar in a church, from the nave and other parts that contain the congregation. Barrier or low rails in front of the altar of a church
The architecture of Stockholm has a history that dates back to the 13th century, possibly even earlier.
Ketton stone is a Jurassic oolitic limestone, cream to pale yellow or pink in colour, used as a building stone since the 16th century.

gloss_it: Nell'architettura rinascimentale e moderna tedesca, col termine Lustschloss si indicava una piccola costruzione in forma di palazzo che era utilizzata per gli attimi di svago del proprietario, solitamente il signore del luogo ove veniva costruita; la struttura era abitata stagionalmente o occasionalmente, e non vi si tenevano ricevimenti ufficiali ma solo privati.
gloss_en: In Renaissance and Early Modern German architecture, a Lustschloss is a small palace which served the private pleasure of its owner, usually the ruler of the area it is located in, and was seasonally inhabited as a respite from court ceremonies and state duties.

gloss_it: Shenshi è un termine che indica genericamente la classe sociale dei notabili nella Cina imperiale, di solito i titolari di un diploma, gli ex funzionari non più in servizio, i grandi proprietari terrieri.
gloss_en: The term "landed gentry", or "gentry", originally used for Britain, does not correspond to any single term in Chinese.

In structural engineering, a pre-engineered building is designed by a PEB supplier or PEB manufacturer with a single design to be fabricated using various materials and methods to satisfy a wide range of structural and aesthetic design requirements.

gloss_it: Un wat [ วัด], nell'accezione comune del termine, è un tempio buddhista in Cambogia, in Thailandia ed in Laos.
gloss_en: A wat Devanāgarī: वाटquarters for bhikkhusThai: สุเหร่า; RTGS: surao; or Thai: มัสยิด; RTGS: matsayitThai: สุเหร่ายิว; RTGS: surao yioวัดจีนศาลเจ้าeither Buddhist or Taoistวัดแขกเทวสถานโบสถ์คริสต์วัดฝรั่งRTGS: botวัด; watวิสุงคามสีมา Buddhist temple in Thailand, Cambodia or Laos

Shoin-zukuri is a style of Japanese residential architecture used in the mansions of the military, temple guest halls, and Zen abbot's quarters of the Azuchi–Momoyama and Edo periods. Style of Japanese architecture

gloss_it: frieze è una rivista d'arte internazionale in lingua inglese.
gloss_en: frieze is a contemporary art magazine, published eight times a year from London. A London-based art magazine British magazine
Welsh art refers to the traditions in the visual arts associated with Wales and its people.
In architecture, a hyphen is a connecting link between two larger building elements. An architectural element Architectural element
A tahōtō is a form of Japanese pagoda found primarily at Esoteric Shingon and Tendai school Buddhist temples.
Church architecture refers to the architecture of buildings of Christian churches. Branch of architecture focused on church buildings

gloss_it: La predella è una fascia dipinta divisa in più riquadri che di solito faceva da corredo alle pale d'altare dipinte su legno.
gloss_en: A predella is the platform or step on which an altar stands. A raised step near the base of a Christian altar.

The French landscape garden is a style of garden inspired by idealized romantic landscapes and the paintings of Hubert Robert, Claude Lorrain and Nicolas Poussin, European ideas about Chinese gardens, and the philosophy of Jean-Jacques Rousseau.
A reja is a decorative screen of iron.

A National school was a school founded in 19th century England and Wales by the National Society for Promoting Religious Education. A Church of England school founded by the National Society in England and Wales in the 19th century schools established by a charity in England and Wales

Dimension stone is natural stone or rock that has been selected and finished to specific sizes or shapes. Stone fabricated to specific sizes or shapes Natural stone that has been finished to specific sizes and shapes Natural stone or rock that has been fabricated to a specific shape or size.

gloss_it: Il termine colore a tempera indica colori coprenti all'acqua formati da pigmenti con sostanze leganti quali uovo, caseina, colle animali o gomme vegetali.
gloss_en: Fresco-secco is a wall painting technique where pigments mixed with an organic binder and/or lime are applied onto a dry plaster. Fresco painting technique
Tamil architecture is the style and techniques developed in the Tamil regions over thousands years.

A rocket mass heater, also known as rocket stove mass heater, is a form of slow-release radiant heating system, designed to primarily heat people and secondary to warm areas in line of sight around it. (Aka Rocket Stove) is a more efficiant and cleaner burning wood burning stove / heater.

Spanish Colonial architecture represents Spanish colonial influence on New World and East Indies' cities and towns, and it is still being seen in the architecture as well as in the city planning aspects of conserved present-day cities. Architectural style

An English basement is an apartment on the lowest floor of a building, generally a townhouse or brownstone, which is partially below and partially above ground level and which has its own entrance separate from those of the rest of the building.

gloss_it: Una semi-cupola, chiamata anche "mezza cupola", è in architettura un termine che indica mezza cupola, utilizzata come copertura di un'area semi-circolare.
gloss_en: In architecture, a semi-dome is a half dome that covers a semi-circular area in a building.

An ángel arcabucero is an angel depicted with an arquebus instead of the sword traditional for martial angels, dressed in clothing inspired by that of the Andean nobles and aristocrats. angel depicted with an firearm

gloss_it: Un tetraconch, dal greco "quattro conchiglie", è un edificio, normalmente una chiesa o altro edificio religioso, con quattro absidi, una in ogni direzione, normalmente di eguali dimensioni.
gloss_en: A tetraconch, from the Greek for "four shells", is a building, usually a church or other religious building, with four apses, one in each direction, usually of equal size. A building, especially a church, that has four apses.
A drill hall is a place such as a building or a hangar where soldiers practise and perform military drill. A building where soldiers practice and perform military drills
Like other aspects of the culture of Africa, the architecture of Africa is exceptionally diverse.
Architecture in Cardiff, the capital city of Wales, dates from Norman times to the present day.

Alternative natural materials are natural materials like rock or adobe that are not as commonly in use as materials such as wood or iron. Alternative natural materials have many practical uses in areas such as sustainable architecture and engineering.

gloss_it: La Corona per l'antico popolo della valle del Nilo, era riservata alle divinità ed al sovrano come simbolo del potere con attributi magici-identificativi e fin dal periodo predinastico l'iconografia egizia e la statuaria ne mostrano un numero notevole, assimilando ad essa anche il copricapo ed il simbolo.
gloss_en: The pschent was the double crown worn by rulers in ancient Egypt. The ancient Egyptians generally referred to it as sekhemty, the Two Powerful Ones.

gloss_it: Un teocalli è una piramide mesoamericana in cima alla quale si trova un tempio.
gloss_en: A teocalli is a Mesoamerican pyramid surmounted by a temple. A Mesoamerican pyramid surmounted by a temple.
The Jesus Church is a church situated just off Valby Langgade in the Valby district of Copenhagen, Denmark. Church in Copenhagen, founded by Carl Jacobsen of Carlsberg

gloss_it: La volta a padiglione indica in architettura un elemento di copertura con superficie curva.
gloss_en: In architecture, a cloister vault is a vault with four concave surfaces meeting at a point above the center of the vault. A vault resulting from the intersection of two barrel vaults crossing in a right angle. The angles of intersection are groins with projecting angles at the base, which die away at the summit. Structure created by intersection of vaults.
The double-skin facade is a system of building consisting of two skins, or facades, placed in such a way that air flows in the intermediate cavity. A type of building facade type of building facade

gloss_it: La patena è un oggetto liturgico usato durante la celebrazione eucaristica dalla Chiesa cattolica, dalla Chiesa ortodossa e da varie altre confessioni cristiane.
gloss_en: A paten, or diskos, is a small plate, usually made of silver or gold, used to hold Eucharistic bread which is to be consecrated during the Mass. Small plate used to hold Eucharistic bread which is to be consecrated during the Mass

Computer-aided mural is the use of computer technology for designing mural art and wall decoration resulting in the frescography procedure, which was invented in 1998 by German muralist Rainer Maria Latzke. use of computer technology for designing mural art and wall decoration resulting in the frescography procedure

lab_en: donggung palace and wolji pond in gyeongju
gloss_en: Donggung Palace and Wolji Pond, formerly known as Anapji, is an artificial pond in Gyeongju National Park, South Korea. Lake

gloss_it: Lo Stile Napoleone III o Secondo Impero è il nome comunemente assegnato allo stile architettonico della Francia e specialmente di Parigi fiorito durante il Secondo Impero Francese sotto il patronato culturale di Napoleone III. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: The Napoleon III style, also known as the Second Empire style, was a highly eclectic style of architecture and decorative arts, which used elements of many different historical styles, and also made innovative use of modern materials, such as iron frameworks and glass skylights. Second Empire architecture in Europe is an architectural style rooted in the 16th century Renaissance, which grew to its greatest popularity in Europe in the second half of the nineteenth century and early years of the twentieth century. An architectural style associated with the Second French Empire Architectural and art style, most popular between 1865 and 1880

gloss_it: Architettura elisabettiana è il termine dato alla prima architettura rinascimentale in Inghilterra, durante il regno di Elisabetta I. Storicamente, il periodo corrisponde al Cinquecento in Italia, alla primo Rinascimento in Francia, ed al Plateresco in Spagna.
gloss_en: Elizabethan architecture refers to buildings of a certain style constructed during the reign of Queen Elizabeth I of England and Ireland from 1558–1603. Term given to early Renaissance architecture in England, during the reign of Queen Elizabeth I

Steel frame is a building technique with a "skeleton frame" of vertical steel columns and horizontal I-beams, constructed in a rectangular grid to support the floors, roof and walls of a building which are all attached to the frame. Building technique in which a skeleton frame of vertical steel columns is constructed in a rectangular grid; made the skyscraper possible

gloss_it: Sala principale è il termine usato in inglese per l'edificio all'interno di un complesso di un tempio buddista giapponese che sancisce l'oggetto principale della venerazione.
gloss_en: Main hall is the building within a Japanese Buddhist temple compound which enshrines the main object of veneration. Of a Buddhist temple Main building in Japanese buddhist temples

gloss_it: Il ken è un'unità di lunghezza giapponese tradizionale, uguale a sei piedi giapponesi.
gloss_en: The ken is a traditional Japanese unit of length, equal to six Japanese feet. Measurement in Japanese architecture; today standardized as 20/11 metres A Japanese unit of length equal to six shakus.

A stirrup spout vessel is a type of ceramic vessel common among several Pre-Columbian cultures of South America beginning in the early 2nd millennium BCE. A specific type of ceramic vessel from Pre-Columbian cultures of South America
A potato house is a structure built for the storage of harvested sweet potatoes.

In architecture, Chinese Chippendale refers to a specific kind of railing or balustrade that was inspired by the "Chinese Chippendale" designs of cabinetmaker Thomas Chippendale. An architectural detail derived from Thomas Chippendale's Chinese-influenced work

Uşak carpets, Ushak carpets or Oushak Carpets are Turkish carpets that use a particular family of designs, called by convention after the city of Uşak, Turkey – one of the larger towns in Western Anatolia, which was a major center of rug production from the early days of the Ottoman Empire, into the early 20th century.

Gable stones are carved and often colourfully painted stone tablets, which are set into the walls of buildings, usually at about 4 metres from the ground. An ornament in Dutch architecture Architectural element, usually on a building
A crooked spire, is a tower showing a twist and/or a deviation from the vertical.

gloss_it: La garitta di vedetta è una piccola costruzione in muratura, legno o metallo, generalmente addossata alle mura esterne delle fortezze medievali, tipica del periodo compreso tra il XIV e il XVI secolo.
gloss_en: A bartizan, also called a guerite or échauguette, or spelled bartisan, is an overhanging, wall-mounted turret projecting from the walls of late medieval and early-modern fortifications from the early 14th century up to the 18th century. Small turret projecting from the top of towers or parapets
Glazed architectural terra-cotta is a ceramic masonry building material used as a decorative skin.
For the radio station see KMA  A collaboration between media artists Kit Monkman and Tom Wexler
In historic preservation, sustainable preservation is the idea that preservation has tangible ecological benefits, on the basis that the most sustainable building is one that is already built.

gloss_it: Le kistvaen di Dartmoor sono delle sepolture a cista del periodo tardo neolitico e dell'Età del Bronzo comprese tra il 2500 a.C. ed il 1500 a.C. Le kistvaens si possono trovare in molti luoghi tra cui Dartmoor, in un'area di brughiera di 954 m² a sud del Devon, in Inghilterra.
gloss_en: Dartmoor kistvaens are burial tombs or cists from the late Neolithic and early Bronze Age, i.e. from c 2500 BC to c 1500 BC.
An Airey house is a type of prefabricated house built in Great Britain following the Second World War. type of prefabricated house in the UK
Many national governments and states have a public official titled the state architect or government architect. position; public official in several countries

A low-rise is a building that is only a few stories tall or any building that is shorter than a high-rise, though others include the classification of mid-rise. Building that is only a few stories tall

gloss_it: Un giardino fisico era un terreno dove venivano coltivante piante e erbe medicinali.
gloss_en: A physic garden is a type of herb garden with medicinal plants.
Video painting is a form of video art presented via projectors, LCD or other flat panel display and wall-mounted in the same manner as traditional paintings.
The karamon or karakado is a type of gate seen in Japanese architecture.

gloss_it: In edilizia la cerimonia di topping out è un rito dei costruttori tradizionalmente tenuto quando l'ultimo elemento strutturale dell'edificio è posto sulla cima della stesso.
gloss_en: In building construction, topping out is a builders' rite traditionally held when the last beam is placed atop a structure during its construction. A ceremony at the completion of a building construction Builders'' rite

gloss_it: Un bastione circolare è una sorta di argine di forma circolare usato come strumento di difesa nelle fortificazioni militari, nelle fortezze di collina o nei rifugi.
gloss_en: A circular rampart is an embankment built in the shape of a circle that was used as part of the defences for a military fortification, hill fort or refuge, or was built for religious purposes or as a place of gathering. Embankment built in the shape of a circle
Underground living refers to living below the ground's surface, whether in natural or manmade caves or structures.

gloss_it: Architettura medievale è un termine usato per rappresentare varie forme di architettura popolare nel medioevo.
gloss_en: Medieval architecture is architecture common in the Middle Ages, and includes religious, civil, and military buildings.
Cobblestone architecture refers to the use of cobblestones embedded in mortar as method for erecting walls on houses and commercial buildings.
A sidelight in a building is a window, usually with a vertical emphasis, that flanks a door or a larger window. A window found at one or both sides of a door.

gloss_it: La deesis o deisis è un tema iconografico cristiano di matrice culturale bizantina, molto diffuso nel mondo ortodosso.
gloss_en: In Byzantine art, and later Eastern Orthodox art generally, the Deësis or Deisis, is a traditional iconic representation of Christ in Majesty or Christ Pantocrator: enthroned, carrying a book, and flanked by the Virgin Mary and St. John the Baptist, and sometimes other saints and angels. Artistic theme of Jesus flanked by the Virgin Mary and John the Baptist, sometimes with other saints

Architectural rendering, architectural illustration, or architectural visualization is the art of creating three-dimensional images or animations showing the attributes of a proposed architectural design. Creating two-dimensional images or animations showing the attributes of a proposed architectural design

The Italian Renaissance garden was a new style of garden which emerged in the late 15th century at villas in Rome and Florence, inspired by classical ideals of order and beauty, and intended for the pleasure of the view of the garden and the landscape beyond, for contemplation, and for the enjoyment of the sights, sounds and smells of the garden itself.
A burial tree or burial scaffold is a tree or simple structure used for supporting corpses or coffins. tree or simple structure used for supporting corpses
Bird stones are prehistoric, abstract stone carvings made by Native Americans. Prehistoric, abstract stone carvings made by Native Americans
A collapse zone is an area around a structure, usually a burning structure, that may suffer structural collapse.
In architecture, brattishing or brandishing is a decorative cresting which is found at the top of a cornice or screen, panel or parapet. open-carved work on the top of a medieval screen or shrine
Works of bamboo painting, usually in ink, are a recognized motif or subgenre of East Asian painting.
A heiau is a Hawaiian temple. traditional Hawaiian temple A temple in traditional Hawaiian society.
Faulx-les-Tombes Castle is a 19th-century château in Faulx-les-Tombes in the municipality of Gesves, province of Namur, Belgium. Castle in Faulx-les-Tombes, Belgium Section of Gesves, Belgium

A box gutter, internal gutter, parallel gutter, or trough gutter is a rain gutter on a roof usually rectangular in shape; it may be lined with EPDM rubber, metal, asphalt, or roofing felt, and may be concealed behind a parapet or the eaves, or in a roof valley.
The architecture of Liverpool is rooted in the city's development into a major port of the British Empire. History and survey of architecture in Liverpool, England
An art agent is an agent who represents artists.

gloss_it: Un cammino di ronda è un camminamento rialzato nascosto dietro alla merlatura di un castello. Camminamento rialzato delle mura di difesa
gloss_en: A chemin de ronde, also called an allure, alure or, more prosaically, a wall-walk, is a raised protected walkway behind a castle battlement. A raised protected walkway behind a castle battlement.
Membrane structures are spatial structures made out of tensioned membranes. A sort of spatial structure made of tensioned membranes spatial structure made out of tensioned membranes
Rice-hull bagwall construction is a system of building, with results aesthetically similar to the use of earthbag or cob construction.
A double-sided painting is a canvas which has a painting on either side. A canvas which has a painting on either side
The estipite column is a type of column or pilaster typical of the Churrigueresque baroque style of Spain and Spanish America used in the 18th century.

gloss_it: La casaforte è un'antica residenza signorile fortificata del periodo medievale che ebbe il suo maggiore sviluppo nel periodo dei liberi comuni.
gloss_en: A fortified house is a type of building which developed in Europe during the Middle Ages, generally with significant fortifications added. Type of building which developed in Europe during the Middle Ages

gloss_it: Il termine francese vermeil indica una varietà di argento dorato.
gloss_en: Silver-gilt or gilded/gilt silver, sometimes known in American English by the French term vermeil, is silver which has been gilded with gold.
A Green building council is any national non-profit, non-government organization that is part of a global network recognized by the World Green Building Council.

gloss_it: Con il termine pyramidion si intende la cuspide piramidale monolitica delle piramidi e degli obelischi che rappresentava la sacra pietra benben.
gloss_en: A pyramidion is the uppermost piece or capstone of an Egyptian pyramid or obelisk, in archaeological parlance. Capstone of an Egyptian pyramid or obelisk The small pyramid which crowns or completes an obelisk or pyramid. Miniature pyramid.

gloss_it: Secondo l'iscrizione della stele di Sdok Kok Thom, Indrapura fu la prima capitale di Jayavarman II, attorno al 781 d.C., negli anni che precedettero la fondazione vera e propria dell'Impero Khmer, avvenuta nell'802. Capitale del Re Khmer Jayavarman II
gloss_en: According to inscription on the stele of Sdok Kok Thom, Indrapura was the first capital of Jayavarman II reign about 781, before the foundation of Khmer Empire in 802. The first capital city of Khmer king Jayavarman II, possibly Banteay Prei Nokor
A crown steeple, or crown spire, is a traditional form of church steeple in which curved stone flying buttresses form the open shape of a rounded crown.
A stupika is a small votive stupa.
Construction delays in residential and light construction are often the result of miscommunication between contractors, subcontractors, and property owners.
Digital architecture has been used to refer to other aspects of architecture that feature digital technologies.

gloss_it: Il dripping è una tecnica pittorica caratteristica dell'Action Painting americana.
gloss_en: A form of abstract art in which paint is dripped or poured onto the canvas. Drip painting is a form of abstract art in which paint is dripped or poured onto the canvas. An art style of dripping paint across a canvas A form of abstract art in which paint is dripped or poured onto the canvas.

gloss_it: Retablo è il termine spagnolo che indica una grande pala d'altare inquadrata architettonicamente. Termine spagnolo che indica una grande pala d'altare
gloss_en: A retable is a structure or element placed either on or immediately behind and above the altar or communion table of a church. Appendages placed on the mensa of an altar in a Christian church A table or shelf behind an altar, on which are placed images or holy objects. Table or shelf behind an altar.

A monumental brass is a type of engraved sepulchral memorial which in the 13th century began to partially take the place of three-dimensional monuments and effigies carved in stone or wood. Commemorative plates laid down in British and European churches Type of church memorial
The architecture of Mumbai blends Gothic, Victorian, Art Deco, Indo-Saracenic and contemporary architectural styles. Artistic historical buildings in Mumbai
Sofa painting is a pejorative term for paintings that match a color scheme or match a sofa. A painting that is acquired to match a color scheme or furniture.

gloss_it: Gli intrecci sono una forma ornamentale basata sulla ripetizione di motivi di curve intrecciate, più o meno complesse, incrociate ed aggrovigliate, che evocano i nodi che si possono fare con delle corde o gli intrecci dei cesti.
gloss_en: In the visual arts, interlace is a decorative element found in medieval art. A decorative element found especially in early Medieval art in Northern Europe Decorative element of bands or portions of other motifs looped, braided, and knotted in complex geometric patterns A decorative element found especially in early medieval art. Decorative element found in medieval art.

gloss_it: Il controsoffitto è un'opera edile costituita da una superficie piana dalla struttura leggera, posta al di sotto del soffitto, che determina una diminuzione dell'altezza utile del locale interessato.
gloss_en: A dropped ceiling is a secondary ceiling, hung below the main ceiling. secondary ceiling hung below a main ceiling A secondary ceiling, suspended from above, used to conceal wiring, plumbing and ducts. Secondary ceiling.
American Figurative Expressionism is a 20th-century visual art style or movement that first took hold in Boston, and later spread throughout the United States. American art movement

An anta, or sometimes parastade is an architectural term describing the posts or pillars on either side of a doorway or entrance of a Greek temple - the slightly projecting piers which terminate the walls of the naos. An architectural term for columns or pillars on the side of a door or window that are not detached from the main structure.
A shrubbery is a wide border to a garden where shrubs are thickly planted, or a similar larger area with a path winding through it. Wide border to a garden where shrubs are thickly planted

A beach hut is a small, usually wooden and often brightly coloured, box above the high tide mark on popular bathing beaches. A small wooden hut on a beach Small building used for shelter on beaches A small, single-room building above high-water mark on a beach that is used for changing into swimming clothes, for recreation, or for temporary storage.

Donnybrook stone is a fine to medium-grained feldspathic and kaolinitic sandstone found near the town of Donnybrook, Western Australia. Indurated fine- to medium-grained feldspathic and kaolinitic sandstone with shale partings and colour variations from white to beige and pink. Found near Donnybrook, Western Australia, Australia.
Šlokenbeka Castle is a fortified manor in the historical region of Semigallia, in Latvia.

gloss_it: Un oeil-de-boeuf, occhio di bue in lingua francese, è un'apertura che può essere praticata su una facciata, una porta, un muro etc. Essa è generalmente posta nella parte superiore della struttura.
gloss_en: Oeil-de-boeuf, also œil de bœuf and sometimes anglicized as ox-eye window, is a relatively small elliptical or circular window, typically for an upper storey or above a door to let in natural light. Small oval "bull's eye" window small oval or round window
Headington stone is a limestone from the Headington Quarry area of Oxford, England. A limestone from the Headington Quarry area of Oxford, England, historically much used in building.
The visual art of Botswana has varied among different ethnic group and throughout history.
The architecture of Scotland includes all human building within the modern borders of Scotland, from the Neolithic era to the present day.
A flower seller, normally a woman, traditionally sells flowers on the street.

A hand boiler or love meter is a glass sculpture used as an experimental tool to demonstrate vapour-liquid equilibrium, or as a collector's item to whimsically "measure love." A glass sculpture sometimes used as a collector's item to measure love
A tower mill is a type of vertical windmill consisting of a brick or stone tower, on which sits a wooden 'cap' or roof, which can rotate to bring the sails into the wind. Type of vertical windmill

gloss_it: In architettura l'eclettismo definisce lo stile nato dalla mescolanza dei migliori stilemi ripresi da diversi movimenti architettonici, storici e anche esotici. Stile artistico
gloss_en: Eclecticism is a kind of mixed style in the fine arts: "the borrowing of a variety of styles from different sources and combining them". The practice of selecting or borrowing from earlier styles and combining the borrowed elements.

gloss_it: L'architettura russa segue una tradizione le cui radici derivano direttamente dall'architettura bizantina.
gloss_en: Russian architecture follows a tradition whose roots lie in early Russian wooden architecture and in the architecture of Kievan Rus' with its centers in Veliky Novgorod and Kyiv. Architectural styles within Russian sphere of influence

The architectural technologist, also known as a building technologist, provides technical building design services and is trained in architectural technology, building technical design and construction. A specialist in the technology of building design and construction

gloss_it: La tavoletta cerata era uno strumento scrittorio tipico dell'antichità, ma vi sono testimonianze che ne dimostrano l'uso anche nel medioevo.
gloss_en: A wax tablet is a tablet made of wood and covered with a layer of wax, often linked loosely to a cover tablet, as a "double-leaved" diptych. Used as far back as ancient Greece, what scribes wrote on Writing implement A tablet made of wood and covered with a layer of wax, used as used as a reusable and portable writing surface in Antiquity and throughout the Middle Ages. Tablet covered with wax.

A crux gemmata is a form of cross typical of Early Christian and Early Medieval art, where the cross, or at least its front side, is principally decorated with jewels. Form of cross typical of Early Christian and Early Medieval art

gloss_it: La Pittura illusionistica, che include tecniche come il sotto in su e la quadratura, è un genere pittorico del Rinascimento, del Barocco e del Rococò, nel quale il trompe-l'œil, la prospettiva e altri effetti spaziali vengono impiegati per creare l'illusione di uno spazio tridimensionale dal punto di vista dello spettatore, su una superficie piatta, semicurva o curva.
gloss_en: Illusionistic ceiling painting, which includes the techniques of perspective di sotto in sù and quadratura, is the tradition in Renaissance, Baroque and Rococo art in which trompe-l'œil, perspective tools such as foreshortening, and other spatial effects are used to create the illusion of three-dimensional space on an otherwise two-dimensional or mostly flat ceiling surface above the viewer. Art

gloss_it: La fortificazione alla moderna è un tipo di fortificazione elaborato a partire dal XV secolo in Italia, per ovviare al problema posto dallo sviluppo dell'artiglieria, evidenziato dalle guerre d'Italia e da quelle contro gli Ottomani. Tipo di fortificazione
gloss_en: A fortification composed of many projecting triangular bastions (usually from five to eight), specifically designed to cover each other; first seen in the mid-15th century in Italy. A bastion fort or trace italienne, is a fortification in a style that evolved during the early modern period of gunpowder when the cannon came to dominate the battlefield. 15th and 16th century Europe Fortification
Sukiya-zukuri is one type of Japanese residential architectural style. Traditional Japanese interior

gloss_it: Un Gopura, o Gopuram, è una torre monumentale, solitamente ornata, posta all'entrata di ciascun tempio, specialmente in India meridionale.
gloss_en: A gopuram or gopura is a monumental entrance tower, usually ornate, at the entrance of a Hindu temple, in the Dravidian architecture of the Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Karnataka, and Telangana states of Southern India. Monumental gateway tower to Hindu temple complexes A monumental tower, usually ornate, at the entrance of a temple, especially in Southern India.

gloss_it: Shikhara é un termine sanscrito che significa "picco montuoso" e si riferisce alle torri dei templi indù dell'India del Nord.
gloss_en: Shikhara, a Sanskrit word translating literally to "mountain peak", refers to the rising tower in the Hindu temple architecture of North India, and also often used in Jain temples. Rising tower in Indian temple architecture A spire or pyramid-shaped tower forming part of a Hindu temple.
Photo-referencing in visual art is the practice of creating art based on a photograph.

Glass mullion system or glass fin system is a glazing system in which sheets of tempered glass are suspended from special clamps, stabilized by perpendicular stiffeners of tempered glass, and joined by a structural silicone sealant or by metal patch plates.

A coved ceiling is a ceiling that has had the visual appearance of the point where the ceiling meets the walls improved by the addition of coving. ceiling with a large concave curve at the wall-to-ceiling transition

gloss_it: La tomba a galleria è una tipo di sepolcro megalitico diffuso in Europa occidentale in un periodo compreso fra il neolitico e l'età del bronzo, tra il 3500 e il 1200 a.C. Destinati alle sepolture collettive, questo tipo di sepolcri sono stati rinvenuti in Catalogna, Francia, Paesi Bassi, Germania, nelle isole Britanniche, in Scandinavia, Sardegna e nel sud Italia.
gloss_en: A passage grave or passage tomb consists of one or more burial chambers covered in earth or with stone, and having a narrow access passage made of large stones. Type of megalithic tomb
Lime plaster is a type of plaster composed of sand, water, and lime, usually non-hydraulic hydrated lime. type of plaster composed of sand, water, and lime

gloss_it: Il Libro della pittura è un codice del XVI secolo basato su annotazioni di Leonardo da Vinci sulla pittura, probabilmente realizzato da Francesco Melzi attorno al 1540.
gloss_en: A Treatise on Painting is a collection of Leonardo da Vinci's writings entered in his notebooks under the general heading "On Painting".

gloss_it: L'oinochoe è un vaso simile alla brocca, utilizzato per versare il vino o l'acqua.
gloss_en: An oenochoe, also spelled oinochoe, is a wine jug and a key form of ancient Greek pottery. Variant of ancient jugs A type of Ancient Greek pottery wine jug. Greek jug.
Devil's doors are structural features found in the north wall of some medieval and older churches in the United Kingdom.

Opus africanum is a form of ashlar masonry used in Carthaginian and ancient Roman architecture, characterized by pillars of vertical blocks of stone alternating with horizontal blocks, filled in with smaller blocks in between. Form of ashlar masonry used in Carthaginian and ancient Roman architecture

gloss_it: Per arte tribale, detta anche arte etnografica e arte indigena, si intende ogni arte visiva e cultura materiale proveniente dai popoli indigeni.
gloss_en: Tribal art is the visual arts and material culture of indigenous peoples. Visual arts and culture of indigenous peoples Art made by the indigenous tribes

gloss_it: Una Blackhouse è una comune tipologia abitativa nelle Highlands scozzesi, nelle Isole Ebridi ed in Irlanda.
gloss_en: A blackhouse is a traditional type of house which used to be common in Ireland, the Hebrides, and the Scottish Highlands. House

Visionary art is art that purports to transcend the physical world and portray a wider vision of awareness including spiritual or mystical themes, or is based in such experiences. art that purports to transcend the physical world
Toe the line is an idiomatic expression meaning either to conform to a rule or standard, or to stand poised at the starting line in a footrace.
A treadwheel crane is a wooden, human powered, hoisting and lowering device. A wooden, human powered, hoisting and lowering device.

A post in ground construction, also called earthfast or hole-set posts, is a type of construction in which vertical, roof-bearing timbers, called posts, are in direct contact with the ground. Type of construction in which vertical, roof-bearing timbers, called posts, are in direct contact with the ground. They may be placed into excavated post holes, driven into the ground, or on sills which are set on the ground without a foundation

gloss_it: La torque, detta anche torquis, torc o torq era un collare o un girocollo, o più raramente un bracciale, solitamente d'oro o di bronzo, più raramente d'argento, realizzato con una disposizione a tortiglione da cui deriva il nome.
gloss_en: A torc, also spelled torq or torque, is a large rigid or stiff neck ring in metal, made either as a single piece or from strands twisted together. Personal adornment made from twisted metal Rigid, usually twisted ring worn around the neck or arm, often of precious metal

gloss_it: Una casa a fossa è un'abitazione primitiva scavata nel terreno e coperta.
gloss_en: A shelter for humans or domesticated animals and livestock based on a hole or depression dug into the ground; can be fully recessed into the earth, with a flat roof covered by ground, semi-recessed, with a constructed wood or sod roof standing out, or dug into a hillside. A pit house is a large house in the ground used for shelter. Building

gloss_it: Un claw beaker è il nome dato dagli archeologi a un tipo di vaso per bere spesso trovato come oggetto funerario nel VI e VII secolo d.C. nelle sepolture dei Franchi e degli Anglosassoni.
gloss_en: A claw beaker is a name given by archaeologists to a type of drinking vessel often found as a grave good in 6th and 7th century AD Frankish and Anglo-Saxon burials. A type of drinking vessel used in the Dark Ages in Europe

According to the theory of the art historian Marcia B. Hall, which has gained considerable acceptance, cangiante is one of four modes of painting colours available to Italian High Renaissance painters, along with sfumato, chiaroscuro and unione.

gloss_it: Un baserri è un tipo tradizionale di casa rurale a graticcio o in pietra che si trova nel Paese Basco, nel nord della Spagna e nel sud-ovest della Francia.
gloss_en: A baserri is a traditional half-timbered or stone-built type of housebarn farmhouse found in the Basque Country in Northern Spain and Southwestern France.

gloss_it: Il termine Arte generativa si riferisce al concetto di “Arte che genera arte” dove, l'opera artistica, è il prodotto di un sistema autonomo in grado di determinare le caratteristiche di un'opera che altrimenti richiederebbero decisioni prese direttamente dall'artista.
gloss_en: Generative art refers to art that in whole or in part has been created with the use of an autonomous system. Art genre

gloss_it: Nelle arti decorative, il motivo ornamentale cuir découpé, detto anche ornamento auricolare, ricorda per la sua forma un pezzo di cuoio o metallo tagliato e avvolto in volute stilizzate. ornamento decorativo
gloss_en: In the history of art and design, strapwork is the use of stylised representations in ornament of ribbon-like forms. A stylized representation of strips or bands of curling leather parchment or metal cut into elaborate shapes, with piercings and often interwoven.

In archaeology, phenomenology applies to the use of sensory experiences to view and interpret an archaeological site or cultural landscape. Based upon understanding cultural landscapes from a sensory perspective

The Stirling torcs make up a hoard of four gold Iron Age torcs, a type of necklace, all of which date to between 300 and 100 BC and which were buried deliberately at some point in antiquity. Archaeological find in Stirling, Scotland, UK
Roman amphitheatres are Roman theatres – large, circular or oval open-air venues with raised seating – built by the ancient Romans. Large, circular or oval open-air venues with raised seating

gloss_it: Il moya nell'architettura giapponese rappresenta il centro di un edificio.
gloss_en: In Japanese architecture omoya is the core of a building. The core of a building in Japanese architecture

In Japanese architecture the term hisashi has two meanings: As more commonly used, the term indicates the eaves of a roof, that is, the part along the edge of a roof projecting beyond the side of the building to provide protection against the weather.
In Japanese architecture mokoshi, literally "skirt storey" or "cuff storey", is a decorative pent roof surrounding a building below the true roof.
A county hall or shire hall is a common name given to a building that houses the seat of local government for a county.

The imbrex and tegula were overlapping roof tiles used in ancient Greek and Roman architecture as a waterproof and durable roof covering. Interlocking roofing tiles used in ancient Greek and Roman architecture The imbrex and tegula  were overlapping roof tiles used in ancient Greek and Roman architecture as a waterproof and durable roof covering.

Single room occupancy is a form of housing that is typically aimed at residents with low or minimal incomes who rent small, furnished single rooms with a bed, chair, and sometimes a small desk. A style of living arrangement Low-cost housing alternative
ArchiAfrika is a non-profit organisation concerned with the architecture of Africa.
Pendant vaulting is considered to be a type of English fan vaulting. A late Gothic architecture vault in which large decorative pendants hang from the vault at a distance from the walls

The fina in Mediterranean architecture is a physical space used in urban design, corresponding to the approximately 1-meter-wide public space alongside buildings. Narrow public space immediately alongside buildings
A spire or steeple, especially of Gothic style; an object emerging from the ridge of a roof.

lab_en: list of rock-cut temples in india
gloss_it: L'architettura rupestre è una forma di architettura, collegata alla cosiddetta arte rupestre, le cui realizzazioni sono costituite da costruzioni ricavate in particolari tipi di roccia, talvolta sfruttando grotte o caverne già esistenti, e ottenute sia scavando la roccia stessa sia costruendo edifici all'esterno della stessa.
gloss_en: Rock-cut architecture is the creation of structures, buildings, and sculptures by excavating solid rock where it naturally occurs. Creation of structures, buildings, and sculptures by excavating solid rock

Consecration crosses are crosses on the interior walls and exterior architecture of a Christian church or cathedral showing where the bishop has anointed the church with chrism or holy water in order to consecrate it.
Battered corners are an architectural detail in some buildings.

lab_en: chalk figures in the united kingdom
gloss_en: A hill figure is a large visual representation created by cutting into a steep hillside and revealing the underlying geology.

gloss_it: Per arte sacra, secondo l'interpretazione di Titus Burckhardt, non si intende qualunque opera artistica che rappresenti un soggetto religioso, ma più specificamente l’arte le cui stesse forme riflettono la visione spirituale propria di una data religione.
gloss_en: Religious art or sacred art is artistic imagery using religious inspiration and motifs and is often intended to uplift the mind to the spiritual. Art that is religious in theme

gloss_it: Un distretto a collocazione storica è un livello di regolazione urbanistica locale previsto dagli Stati Uniti che ingloba le restrizioni della suddivisione in zone per una determinata area geografica, con l'obiettivo principale di preservare il carattere storico del quartiere. livello di regolazione urbanistica locale degli Stati Uniti
gloss_en: A Historic overlay district is a layer of local planning regulation in the United States which incorporates the restrictions of the underlying zoning for a given geographic area, with the main goal of preserving the historic character of the neighborhood. A zoning district that applies special rules to a portion of other districts, usually for historic or conservation reasons

gloss_it: Il giardino formale, o giardino all'italiana, è uno stile di giardino di origine tardo-rinascimentale ed è caratterizzato da una suddivisione geometrica degli spazi ottenuta con l'utilizzo di filari alberati e siepi, di sculture vegetali di varia forma ottenute con la potatura di cespugli sempreverdi, specchi d'acqua geometrici, spesso accostati ad elementi architettonici quali fontane e statue. Stile di giardino
gloss_en: The giardino all'italiana or Italian garden is stylistically based on symmetry, axial geometry and on the principle of imposing order over nature. Style of garden
A canal house is a house overlooking a canal. House overseeing a canal
In French Gothic architecture, Rayonnant is the period from about the mid-13th century to mid-14th century.

A knee wall is a short wall, typically under three feet in height, used to support the rafters in timber roof construction. A knee wall is a short wall, typically under three feet in height, used to support the rafters in timber roof construction.
Italian Rococo art refers to painting and the plastic arts in Italy during the Rococo period, which went from about the early/mid-18th to the late 18th century.

gloss_it: Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Italian Baroque architecture refers to baroque architecture in Italy. Style of architecture
A vaṭadāge is a type of Buddhist structure found in Sri Lanka.
The architecture of Singapore displays a range of influences and styles from different places and periods.
The hunping, translated as soul jar or soul vase, is a type of ceramic funerary urn often found in the tombs of the Han dynasty and especially the Six Dynasties periods of early imperial China.
A quoad sacra parish is a parish of the Church of Scotland which does not represent a civil parish.
Yue ware or Yüeh ware is a type of Chinese ceramics, a felspathic siliceous stoneware, which is characteristically decorated with celadon glazing. Type of Chinese ceramics

gloss_it: Una pesa pubblica, meno comunemente peso pubblico, è un'infrastruttura che ospita una bilancia destinata a misurare la massa di veicoli ed altri oggetti di grandi dimensioni. Opera architettonica che ospita una bilancia detta pesa
gloss_en: A weighhouse or weighing house is a public building at or within which goods are weighed. A public building at or within which goods, and the like, are weighed Public building in which goods are weighed
Stamped concrete is concrete that is patterned and/or textured or embossed to resemble brick, slate, flagstone, stone, tile, wood, and various other patterns and textures.
Roof shingles are a roof covering consisting of individual overlapping elements. overlapping plates for covering a roof

gloss_it: L'insula era un tipo edilizio che costituiva il condominio dell'antica Roma tardo-repubblicana e, poi, imperiale. Tipologia edilizia romana
gloss_en: In Roman architecture, an insula was one of two things: either a kind of apartment building, or a city block. A kind of apartment building in ancient Rome that provided housing for all but the elite Roman apartment building in urban areas A multi-level apartment building in ancient Rome which housed the urban population and often included shops and businesses on the ground level. A block of buildings in a Roman town. A block of buildings in a Roman town.

gloss_it: Il marmo pavonazzetto è un tipo di marmo bianco con venature "paonazze", ovvero di colore violaceo scuro, come nella coda del pavone.
gloss_en: Pavonazzetto marble also known as Docimaean marble or Synnadic marble, is a white marble originally from Docimium, or modern Iscehisar, Turkey.
An Old Frisian farmhouse is a small unit farmhouse that combined the farmer's living area and animals' stalls, and had limited space for storing harvest products.

A Gulf house, also called a Gulf farmhouse or East Frisian house, is a type of byre-dwelling that emerged in the 16th and 17th centuries in North Germany. A type of farmhouse that emerged in the 16th and 17th centuries in North Germany Farm
Mathematical tiles are a building material used extensively in the southeastern counties of England—especially East Sussex and Kent—in the 18th and early 19th centuries.
Panoramic paintings during the Romantic Era captured all 360 degrees of a scene.
Marine art was especially popular in Britain during the Romantic Era, and taken up readily by British artists in part because of England's geographical form.

gloss_it: Il velarium, detto anche velum, era una copertura mobile in tessuto composta da più teli in canapa, utilizzata nei teatri e negli anfiteatri romani per garantire agli spettatori un'adeguata protezione in caso di maltempo o nelle giornate di canicola. Copertura mobile di teatri ed anfiteatri romani
gloss_en: A velarium was a type of awning used in Roman times. Suspended roof or shade awning of ancient Rome An awning that stretched over the seating area of the Colosseum in Ancient Rome.

Pilgrim badges are decorations worn by some of those who undertake a Christian pilgrimage to a place considered holy by the Church. Effects worn by Christian pilgrims A badge, typically of lead alloy, sold as souvenirs to Roman Catholic pilgrims in the late Middle Ages.

gloss_it: L'edicola è una struttura architettonica relativamente di piccole dimensioni, con la funzione pratica di ospitare e proteggere l'elemento che vi è collocato. Motivo architettonico classico, di destinazione sacrale o funeraria, consistente in una struttura a forma di tabernacolo
gloss_en: In ancient Roman religion, an aedicula is a small shrine, and in classical architecture refers to a niche covered by a pediment or entablature supported by a pair of columns and typically framing a statue. Classical architectural motive with a sacred or funeral function which exists of a structure shaped like a tabernacle A small shrine.
Self-framing metal buildings are a form of pre-engineered building which utilizes roll formed roof and wall panel diaphragms as significant parts of the structural supporting system.
Total floor area measured to the outer skin of the building

gloss_it: Una chiesa fortificata è una chiesa specificamente dedicata al culto religioso cristiano e alla difesa militare di una comunità. Chiesa costruita per essere difesa dai nemici.
gloss_en: A fortified church is a church that is built to serve a defensive role in times of war. A church that is built to be defended against enemies.
Wayō is a style developed in art and architecture in Japan during the Heian period, mainly by the esoteric sects Tendai and Shingon.

Nilotic landscape is any artistic representation of landscapes that emulates or is inspired by the Nile river in Egypt. The term was coined to refer primarily to such landscapes created outside of Egypt, especially in the Aegean, though it is occasionally used to refer to scenes of hunting and fishing in Egyptian art. A nilotic landscape is a river scene with rich and abundant plant and animal life, much of which is native to Egypt. Common iconographic elements include papyrus, palm trees, fish and water birds, and in some cases felines, monkeys, and/or crocodile.
