gloss_it: Nell'antica Roma, l'apodyterion era il vestibolo principale per l'ingresso e l'uscita nei bagni pubblici, costituito da un ampio spogliatoio con cabine o scaffali di legno o in muratura, e talvolta da semplici nicchie nelle pareti, dove i cittadini riponevano i vestiti e altri oggetti personali durante la permanenza nell'impianto termale.
gloss_en: In ancient Rome, the apodyterium was the primary entry in the public baths, composed of a large changing room with cubicles or shelves where citizens could store clothing and other belongings while bathing. dressing room in ancient Greek and Roman baths and palaestrae The apartment at the entrance of the baths, or in the palestra, for getting undressed. The apartment at the entrance of the baths, or in the palestra, for getting undressed.
Dutch brick is a small type of yellow brick made in the Netherlands, or similar brick, and an architectural style of building with brick developed by the Dutch.

gloss_it: Il trencadís è un tipo di applicazione ornamentale del mosaico che impiega frammenti di ceramica –fondamentalmente azulejo- insieme alla malta.
gloss_en: Trencadís, also known as pique assiette, broken tile mosaics, bits and pieces, memoryware, and shardware, is a type of mosaic made from cemented-together tile shards and broken chinaware. art technique
A housebarn is a building that is a combination of a house and a barn. A building that is a combination of a house and a barn.
A risk panel is a body that determines whether a person's mental illness causes him to be too much of a risk to society to be released from involuntary commitment.
Lute holes are wooden carvings designed to fit into the sound-hole of a guitar, reducing feedback and protecting the edge of the sound hole from pick damage.
A seascraper, also known as a waterscraper, is a proposed large building which will function as a floating city.
The architecture of Luxembourg probably extends back to the Treveri, a Celtic tribe who prospered in the 1st century BC.

A setback, sometimes called step-back, is a step-like recession in a wall. Making upper storeys of a high-rise building further back than the lower ones for aesthetic, structural, or land-use restriction reasons
In Roman Catholic tradition, "Seat of Wisdom" or "Throne of Wisdom" is one of many devotional titles for Mary, the Mother of God.

gloss_it: Capilla abierta è una tipologia di edificio sacro tipico dell'architettura messicana del XVI secolo.
gloss_en: A capilla abierta or “open chapel” is considered to be one of the most distinct Mexican construction forms.

lab_en: architecture and sculptures of ancient egypt
gloss_en: Spanning over two thousand years, ancient Egypt was not one stable civilization but in constant change and upheaval, commonly split into periods by historians. The architectural structure style Aspect of architecture
The sculpture of Japan started from the clay figure. sculptures from Japan

gloss_it: Quadrifoglio è un termine utilizzato in araldica per indicare una foglia quadrilobata ed a punte. Simbolo araldico
gloss_en: A quatrefoil is a decorative element consisting of a symmetrical shape which forms the overall outline of four partially overlapping circles of the same diameter. element or shape composed of four partially overlapping circles A symmetrical shape that forms the overall outline of four partially-overlapping circles of the same diameter. Shape.

gloss_it: Un gül è un elemento di disegno, a forma di medaglione, tipico dei tappeti tradizionali, tessuti a mano, nell'Asia centrale e occidentale.
gloss_en: A gul is a medallion-like design element typical of traditional hand-woven carpets from Central and West Asia. A design element in oriental carpets Medallion-like motif, often octagonal, typical of traditional hand-woven carpets from Central and West Asia
In Japanese architecture, an engawa or en is an edging strip of non-tatami-matted flooring, usually wood or bamboo. Edging strip in Japanese architecture

A lookout, lookout rafter or roof outlooker is a wooden joist that extends in cantilever out from the exterior wall of a building, supporting the roof sheathing and providing a nailing surface for the fascia boards. A structural element used in roof framing

gloss_it: Per architettura neoclassica si intende lo stile architettonico che, in linea con la più generale tendenza artistica del neoclassicismo, riprende ideali e apparato formale dell'architettura classica greca e romana e la razionalità nelle forme stesse, assimilando gli elementi architettonici tradizionali a elementi costruttivi. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Neoclassical architecture is an architectural style produced by the Neoclassical movement that began in the mid-18th century in Italy and France which then became one the most prominent and iconic architectural styles in the Western World. An architectural style of the 18th and 19th centuries Style of European and American architecture between the mid-18th century and the mid-19th century

gloss_it: La mètopa è un elemento architettonico del fregio dell'ordine dorico dell'architettura greca e romana.
gloss_en: In classical architecture, a metope is a rectangular architectural element that fills the space between two triglyphs in a Doric frieze, which is a decorative band of alternating triglyphs and metopes above the architrave of a building of the Doric order. The architectural element between two triglyphs in a Doric frieze.

gloss_it: Una stolpekirke è una tipologia di chiesa che precede le stavkirke, e da queste differisce per il fatto che i pali angolari non poggiano su di una piattaforma, ma sono piantati direttamente nel terreno.
gloss_en: Post church is a term for a church building which predates the stave churches and differ in that the corner posts do not reside on a sill but instead have posts dug into the earth.

gloss_it: Un sigillo cilindrico è un cilindro sulla cui superficie laterale è impresso un particolare disegno in rilievo, usato nei tempi antichi per stampigliare una serie di simboli su una superficie bidimensionale, generalmente di argilla.
gloss_en: A cylinder seal is a small round cylinder, typically about one inch in length, engraved with written characters or figurative scenes or both, used in ancient times to roll an impression onto a two-dimensional surface, generally wet clay. An ancient, often clay, cylinder engraved with a `picture story ' Form of seals

gloss_it: La Manifattura di Aubusson, nel Dipartimento della Creuse, nel 2009 è stata iscritta dall'UNESCO nel Patrimonio culturale immateriale dell'umanità.
gloss_en: Aubusson tapestry is tapestry manufactured at Aubusson, in the upper valley of the Creuse in central France. Intangible cultural heritage of tapestry making in Aubusson and the Creuse region of France

gloss_it: Il calligramma o carme figurato è un tipo di componimento poetico fatto per essere guardato e contemplato oltre che per essere letto. Tipo di componimento poetico
gloss_en: A calligram is text arranged in such a way that it forms a thematically related image. Poem, phrase, or word in which the typeface, calligraphy or handwriting is arranged in a way that creates a visual image A word, phrase or longer text in which the typeface or the layout has some special significance.
The ante-chapel is that portion of a chapel which lies on the western side of the choir screen.
Leitrum is a concrete bunker and antiaircraft tower in Vienna built by the NAZIs during the Second World War.
A heathen hof or Germanic pagan temple was a temple building of Germanic religion; a few have also been built for use in modern heathenry. Germanic pagan temple

gloss_it: La bioarchitettura è l'insieme delle discipline dell'architettura che presuppongono un atteggiamento ecologicamente corretto nei confronti dell'ecosistema. Architettura che si propone il rispetto dell'ambiente naturale
gloss_en: Sustainable architecture is architecture that seeks to minimize the negative environmental impact of buildings by efficiency and moderation in the use of materials, energy, development space and the ecosystem at large. Architecture that seeks to minimize the negative environmental impact of buildings by efficiency and moderation in the use of materials, energy, and development space and the ecosystem at large

The antiquity of architecture of Karnataka can be traced to its southern Neolithic and early Iron Age, Having witnessed the architectural ideological and utilitarian transformation from shelter- ritual- religion.
Back-to-backs are a form of terraced houses in the United Kingdom, built from the late 18th century through to the early 20th century in various guises. Form of terraced house

MasterSpec is a master guide building and construction specification system used within the United States by architects, engineers, landscape architects, and interior designers to express results expected in construction.

In architecture, a wedding-cake style is an informal reference to buildings with many distinct tiers, each set back from the one below, resulting in a shape like a wedding cake, and may also apply to buildings that are richly ornamented, as if made in sugar icing. Buildings with many tiers giving the appearance of a wedding cake Visual style in architecture favoring multiple "tiers" and setbacks
A ploutonion or plutonium is a sanctuary specially dedicated to the ancient Greek and Roman god Pluto.

In the context of physical construction, deconstruction is the selective dismantlement of building components, specifically for reuse, repurposing, recycling, and waste management. The process of manually taking down a building Selective dismantlement of building components

gloss_it: La soprapporta è il termine architettonico usato per designare un dipinto, un bassorilievo o un pannello decorativo posizionato al di sopra di una porta, tipico degli stili barocco e rococò.
gloss_en: An "overdoor" is a painting, bas-relief or decorative panel, generally in a horizontal format, that is set, typically within ornamental mouldings, over a door, or was originally intended for this purpose. Relief, panel or painting above a doorway A decoration, usually a painting, that is placed above a doorway.
Hunting magic is the magic associated with hunting in hunter-gatherer cultures, both contemporary and prehistoric.

Jagua tattoo is a temporary form of skin decoration resulting from the application of an extract of the fruit Genipa americana, also known as jagua. A type of skin decoration temporary form of skin decoration

gloss_it: La patera è una coppa usata per offrire bevande durante i sacrifici rituali. Piatto ampio e poco profondo, usato in antichità per bere, soprattutto in un contesto rituale; Coppa usata per versare liquidi durante i sacrifici rituali
gloss_en: In the material culture of classical antiquity, a phiale Shallow libation bowl A broad, shallow dish used for drinking, primarily in ritual contexts such as libations.
An aisleless church is a single-nave church building that consists of a single hall-like room. Church building with a single nave and no side-aisles
A bent entrance is a defensive feature in mediaeval fortification.
A mailroom or post room is a room in which incoming and outgoing mail is processed and sorted. A room used for receiving and (usually) sending mail.
A spur castle is a type of medieval fortification that is sited on a spur of a hill or mountain for defensive purposes.
A votive crown is a votive offering in the form of a crown, normally in precious metals and often adorned with jewels.

gloss_it: La pietra d'Istria è una roccia compatta calcarea microcristallina con bassa porosità, proveniente appunto dalla penisola istriana.
gloss_en: Istrian stone, pietra d'Istria, the characteristic group of building stones in the architecture of Venice, Istria and Dalmatia, is a dense type of impermeable limestones that was quarried in Istria, nowadays Croatia; between Portorož and Pula.

A slab hut is a kind of dwelling or shed made from slabs of split or sawn timber. A kind of dwelling made from slabs of split or sawn timber Kind of dwelling or shed made from slabs of split or sawn timber

lab_it: apparizione di gesù sulla via di emmaus
gloss_it: Secondo il Nuovo Testamento, l'apparizione sulla strada di Emmaus è una delle prime apparizioni dopo la risurrezione di Gesù.
gloss_en: According to the New Testament, the road to Emmaus appearance is one of the early resurrection appearances of Jesus after his crucifixion and the discovery of the empty tomb. Artistic theme and biblical episode in Emmaus

gloss_it: Il coltello da pittore è un utensile semi-rigido, del genere delle spatole, usato dai pittori per stendere il colore sulla superficie pittorica, in modo simile all'utilizzo pennello.
gloss_en: A painting knife is an artist's tool with a flexible steel blade used to apply paint to the canvas. Artist's tool used to apply paint to the canvas
Praying hands, also known as Study of the Hands of an Apostle, is a pen-and-ink drawing by the German printmaker, painter and theorist Albrecht Dürer. Drawing by Albrecht Dürer

gloss_it: Il polos è un ornamento di forma cilindrica, sferica, o anche quadrangolare, che cingeva il capo di divinità femminili del Vicino Oriente antico e dell'Anatolia, che fu adottato dagli antichi greci per adornare le rappresentazioni scultoree di figure di divinità femminili come Grandi Madri, Rea, Cibele e Era, o di donne addette ai culti.
gloss_en: The polos crown is a high cylindrical crown worn by mythological goddesses of the Ancient Near East and Anatolia and adopted by the ancient Greeks for imaging the mother goddesses Rhea and Cybele and Hera. Headdress of certain ancient Greek female gods

gloss_it: La sticker art, è una forma di street art in cui il messaggio o l'immagine sono veicolati da un adesivo.
gloss_en: Sticker art is a form of street art in which an image or message is publicly displayed using stickers. Type of Street Art

gloss_it: Lo smalto di Limoges è un particolare metodo di colorazione di oggetti sacri molto in voga a Limoges, nel sud-ovest della Francia, per diversi secoli e, con alterne fortune, fino ai nostri giorni.
gloss_en: Limoges enamel has been produced at Limoges, in south-western France, over several centuries up to the present. Artistic material made in Limoges, France

gloss_it: L'architettura islamica, o arabo moresca, raccoglie stili artistici della cultura araba dall'ottavo secolo fino ai giorni nostri.
gloss_en: Islamic architecture comprises the architectural styles of buildings associated with Islam. Architectural style

Hedwig glasses or Hedwig beakers are a type of glass beaker originating in the Middle East or Norman Sicily and dating from the 10th-12th centuries AD. They are named after the Silesian princess Saint Hedwig, to whom three of them are traditionally said to have belonged. Type of glass of uncertain origin dating from some time in the 10th-12th centuries AD Type of glass beaker originating in the Middle East or Norman Sicily and dating from the 10th-12th centuries AD

gloss_it: I netsuke sono piccole sculture tradizionali giapponesi, di solito in avorio o in legno, la cui origine risale probabilmente al XV secolo.
gloss_en: A netsuke is a miniature sculpture, originating in 17th-century Japan. A small, often collectible, artistic carving characterized by an opening or two small holes (紐通し (himotōshi)), most commonly made of wood or ivory, used as a fob at the end of a cord attached to a suspended pouch containing pens, medicines, or tobacco. Netsuke originated in feudal Japan in the late 16th and 17th centuries. Miniature sculptures.

A boat show is a public exhibition or trade fair of current boat models, debuts, concept vessels, or out-of-production classics. Public exhibition or trade fair An exhibition where (usually) new boat models are on show to the public. Exhibition of boats.
A timber trackway is a simple raised wooden walkway, boardwalk, or causeway used as the shortest route between two places in a bog or peatland.

gloss_it: Sebbene sia antica, l'architettura indiana ha incorporato anche valori moderni quando l'India divenne un moderno stato nazionale.
gloss_en: The architecture of India is rooted in its history, culture and religion. Architectural style of a major geographical region
An articled clerk is someone who is studying to be an accountant or a lawyer.

gloss_it: Un hongsalmun
gloss_en: In architecture, a hongsalmun is a gate for entering a sacred place in Korea.

gloss_it: Un mercato dei tessuti è un edificio storico situato solitamente nel centro della principale piazza del mercato di una città europea, edificati dall'epoca medioevale fino al XVII secolo.
gloss_en: A cloth hall or linen hall is a historic building located in the centre of the main marketplace of a European town.

ThermaSAVE is a panel building system which uses a 4 to 12-inch-thick core of expanded polystyrene sandwiched between two sheets of cellulose fiber-reinforced cement board varying in thickness from 3/8 to 7/16 inch, depending on structural requirements. system used in construction
Panel buildings may refer to buildings of one of the following types: Built of structural insulated panels Built of pre-fabricated concrete blocks, named differently in various countries.

A chained library is a library where the books are attached to their bookcase by a chain, which is sufficiently long to allow the books to be taken from their shelves and read, but not removed from the library itself. library where the books are attached to their bookcase by a chain
Katōmado, also written as, is a style of pointed arch or bell-shaped window found in Japanese architecture.

A lay clerk, also known as a lay vicar, song man or a vicar choral, is a professional adult singer in an Anglican cathedral and often Roman Catholic Cathedrals in the UK, or collegiate choir in Britain and Ireland.

lab_it: templo masónico de santa cruz de tenerife
templo masonico de santa cruz de tenerife
gloss_it: In massoneria, il termine tempio massonico ha vari significati.
gloss_en: A Masonic Temple or Masonic Hall is, within Freemasonry, the room or edifice where a Masonic Lodge meets. Room or structure where a Masonic Lodge meets
A naviforme was a prehistoric boat-shaped house built on the Balearic Islands of Spain.

In masonry veneer building construction, a shelf angle or masonry support is a steel angle which supports the weight of brick or stone veneer and transfers that weight onto the main structure of the building so that a gap or space can be created beneath to allow building movements to occur.

Milford pink granite, also known as Milford granite or Milford pink is a Proterozoic igneous rock located in and around the town of Milford, Massachusetts, covering an area of approximately 39 square miles, as mapped by the USGS. Coarse biotite granite, quarried in Milford, Massachusetts, composed mostly of light pink feldspar

gloss_it: L'architettura buddista giapponese è l'architettura dei templi buddisti in Giappone, costituita da varianti sviluppate a livello locale di stili architettonici nati in Cina.
gloss_en: Japanese Buddhist architecture is the architecture of Buddhist temples in Japan, consisting of locally developed variants of architectural styles born in China.

In building construction, roof pitch is the steepness of a roof quantified as a ratio or as the number of angular degrees that one 'exposure' surface deviates from horizontal level. Steepness of a roof Measure of roof steepness

Fast-track construction is construction industry jargon for a project delivery strategy to start construction before the design is complete. A scheduling technique construction industry jargon for a project delivery strategy to start construction before the design is complete
In architecture, corps de logis is the principal block of a large, usually classical, mansion or palace. The principal mass of a building, excluding the wings.

gloss_it: La Cour d'honneur è lo spazio del castello o dell'hôtel barocco dove si smontava di carrozza.
gloss_en: A cour d'honneur is a three-sided ceremonial courtyard, created by flanking the main central block, or corps de logis, with symmetrical advancing secondary wings containing minor rooms. Architectural term for a three-sided courtyard A three-sided ceremonial courtyard, created by flanking the main central block, or corps de logis, with symmetrical advancing secondary wings containing minor rooms.

gloss_it: Matematica e architettura sono correlate, poiché, come con altre arti, gli architetti usano la matematica per diverse ragioni. Correlazione tra matematica e architettura nell'arco dei secoli
gloss_en: Mathematics and architecture are related, since, as with other arts, architects use mathematics for several reasons. Overview about the correlation of mathematics and architecture
Apart from being a large city with an active cultural life, Stockholm, the capital of Sweden, houses many national cultural institutions.

A chasse, châsse or box reliquary is a shape commonly used in medieval metalwork for reliquaries and other containers. A medieval casket with sloping roofs like a house Relic holder in the shape of a chest, casket, or small church-like structure

gloss_it: Un'opera esterna è una fortezza di dimensioni ridotte, costruita all'esterno dei confini della fortificazione principale, parzialmente o totalmente distaccata.
gloss_en: An outwork is a minor fortification built or established outside the principal fortification limits, detached or semidetached. Type of fortification

gloss_it: Architettura ottomana o architettura turca è l'architettura dell'Impero Ottomano che si sviluppò a Bursa e Edirne nel XV e XVI secolo.
gloss_en: Ottoman architecture is the architecture of the Ottoman Empire, which emerged in Bursa and Adrianople in 13th and 15th centuries. Architecture of the Ottoman Empire

lab_en: tombs dug out of the rocks
gloss_en: A rock-cut tomb is a burial chamber that is cut into an existing, naturally occurring rock formation, so a type of rock-cut architecture. Tomb cut out in rock
A dwarf gallery is an architectural ornament in Romanesque architecture.
A pura is a Balinese Hindu temple, and the place of worship for adherents of Balinese Hinduism in Indonesia. Temple of Balinese Hindus religion
Thermal lag describes a body's temperature with respect to time as a result of its thermal mass.

gloss_it: L'iwan è un elemento tipico dell'architettura islamica.
gloss_en: An iwan is a rectangular hall or space, usually vaulted, walled on three sides, with one end entirely open. Structure in Iranian and Islamic architecture

gloss_it: Le piramidi triadiche furono un'innovazione della civiltà maya preclassica consistente in una struttura dominante finacheggiata da due edifici più piccoli rivolti verso l'interno, il tutto montato su un'unica piattaforma basale.
gloss_en: Triadic pyramids were an innovation of the Preclassic Maya civilization consisting of a dominant structure flanked by two smaller inward-facing buildings, all mounted upon a single basal platform.

gloss_it: Aneb-Hetch era uno dei 42 nòmi dell'Antico Egitto.
gloss_en: Inebu-hedj was one of 42 nomes in Ancient Egypt. Nome of Ancient Egypt

gloss_it: Una torre muraria è una torre costruita all'interno di una cinta di mura. Struttura difensiva utilizzata nelle fortificazioni
gloss_en: A fortified tower is one of the defensive structures used in fortifications, such as castles, along with curtain walls. Defensive structure used in fortifications

gloss_it: Lo champlevé è un'antica tecnica di decorazione a smalto di Limoges, secondo la quale alveoli o cavità vengono scavati sulla superficie di un oggetto metallico e riempiti di smalto vitreo.
gloss_en: Champlevé is an enamelling technique in the decorative arts, or an object made by that process, in which troughs or cells are carved, etched, die struck, or cast into the surface of a metal object, and filled with vitreous enamel. The process of making enamel of this kind.

gloss_it: La tomba di Cloghanmore e una tomba megalitica a camera, del tipo a corte, sita a circa otto chilometri a est da Carrick in Malin More, Glencolmcille in County Donegal, Irlanda.
gloss_en: Cloghanmore is a megalithic chamber tomb of the court tomb type located about 8 km east from Carrick in Malin More, Glencolmcille, in County Donegal, Ireland.
Daibutsuyō is a Japanese religious architectural style which emerged in the late 12th or early 13th century.
Zenshūyo is a Japanese Buddhist architectural style derived from Chinese Song Dynasty architecture.

gloss_it: Lo psyktèr è un tipo di vaso greco caratterizzato da un corpo bulboso posizionato sopra un piede alto e stretto che veniva usato per refrigerare il vino. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: A psykter is a type of Greek vase that is characterized by a bulbous body set on a high, narrow foot. A type of Greek vase used as a wine cooler in the ancient Greek symposion An Ancient Greek pot with a bulbous body set on a high, narrow foot, used as a wine cooler.

gloss_it: L'hydria è un vaso greco utilizzato principalmente per trasportare acqua, ma anche come urna cineraria o come contenitore per le votazioni. Ma anche come urna cineraria o come contenitore per le votazioni
gloss_en: The hydria is a form of Greek pottery that existed between the Late Geometric Period and the Hellenistic period. Type of Greek pottery used for carrying water

gloss_it: La lekythos, in italiano lecito, è un vaso dal corpo allungato, stretto collo con un'unica ansa e ampio orlo svasato. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: A lekythos is a type of ancient Greek vessel used for storing oil, especially olive oil. Type of ancient Greek perfume bottle A pottery flask with a narrow neck, used in Ancient Greece for storing oil.

gloss_it: Il cantaro o kántharos
gloss_en: A kantharos or cantharus is a type of ancient Greek cup used for drinking. Type of Greek pottery

gloss_it: La loutrophòros è un vaso greco antico in ceramica, di forma allungata, caratterizzato da un collo alto, generalmente della stessa misura della pancia, e da due anse impostate sulla spalla e appena sotto l'orlo. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: A loutrophoros is a distinctive type of Greek pottery vessel characterized by an elongated neck with two handles. Ancient Greek vase shape An Ancient Greek pottery vessel with elongated neck and two handles, used to hold water during marriage and funeral rituals.

gloss_it: Uno stamnos è un contenitore per liquidi, in argilla, creato in Grecia e prodotto dalla fine del VI secolo a.C. alla fine del V, in Etruria fino al IV. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: A stamnos is a type of Greek pottery used to store liquids. Ancient greek storrage jar, form of the amphora An Ancient Greek pottery container used to store liquids. It is more squat than an amphora, and has handles.

gloss_it: Un castello imperiale o Reichsburg era un castello costruito per ordine del Sacro Romano Imperatore, la cui gestione era affidata a un Reichsministeriales o a un Burgmannen.
gloss_en: An imperial castle or Reichsburg was a castle built by order of the Holy Roman Emperor, whose management was entrusted to Reichsministeriales or Burgmannen.

gloss_it: La villa romana di La Olmeda è una villa romana del IV secolo i cui resti sono stati scoperti nel 1968 nel comune di Pedrosa de la Vega, in provincia di Palencia.
gloss_en: The palatial Late Antique Roman villa at La Olmeda is situated in Pedrosa de la Vega in the province of Palencia, near the banks of the Carrión. Ancient Roman villa in Pedrosa de la Vega, Spain

In land use, a setback is the minimum distance which a building or other structure must be set back from a street or road, a river or other stream, a shore or flood plain, or any other place which is deemed to need protection. The distance a structure must be from the edge of a lot
There are two notable Ipswich Hoards. Hoards in Britain

gloss_it: La Fibula celtica è una particolare tipologia di fibula utilizzata dalle popolazioni celtiche per assicurare al corpo capi di vestiario.
gloss_en: The Celtic brooch, more properly called the penannular brooch, and its closely related type, the pseudo-penannular brooch, are types of brooch clothes fasteners, often rather large; penannular means formed as an incomplete ring. Ring-and-pin clothing fastener

In British law, an ancient monument is an early historical structure or monument worthy of preservation and study due to archaeological or heritage interest. A structure or ruin of historical or archaeological interest An old or ancient building or other structure, or a site of historical interest that is usually looked after by an official organisation. Ancient building, structure or site.
Stand-up tragedy is a style of tragic performance where a performer performs in front of a live audience, speaking directly to them.

gloss_it: La vanitas, in pittura, è una natura morta con elementi simbolici allusivi al tema della caducità della vita.
gloss_en: A vanitas is a symbolic work of art showing the transience of life, the futility of pleasure, and the certainty of death, often contrasting symbols of wealth and symbols of ephemerality and death. A type of still life
The Norcon pillbox is a type of hardened field fortification built in Britain during the invasion crisis of 1940–1941.
A hill castle is a castle built on a natural feature that stands above the surrounding terrain. Castle built on a natural feature that stands above the surrounding terrain
Russian churches often have various recurrent elements in their architecture.

gloss_it: Per architettura ottoniana si intende l'attività costruttiva fiorita in Europa occidentale a partire dalla dinastia ottoniana, all'incirca dall'887 fino all'anno Mille, con particolare riferimento quindi al IX e X secolo.
gloss_en: Ottonian architecture is an architectural style which evolved during the reign of Emperor Otto the Great.

A treasure binding or jewelled bookbinding is a luxurious book cover using metalwork in gold or silver, jewels, or ivory, perhaps in addition to more usual bookbinding material for book-covers such as leather, velvet, or other cloth. Book covering style

gloss_it: Uno stupa è un monumento buddhista, originario del subcontinente indiano, la cui funzione principale è quella di conservare reliquie.
gloss_en: A stūpa is a mound-like or hemispherical structure containing relics that is used as a place of meditation. Stūpa (Pāli thūpa) -- a "heap" or a mound-like structure containing Buddhist relics. Mound-like structure containing Buddhist relics, typically the ashes of Buddhist monks, used by Buddhists as a place of meditation The earliest form of Buddhist architecture, probably derived from Indian funeral mounds.
A Western Wall camera, also known as a wallcam, is a live webcam that displays action at the Western Wall live as it is taking place.

gloss_it: Il frigidario era la parte delle antiche terme romane dove potevano essere presi bagni in acqua fredda. Ambiente delle terme romane, costituito da una sala non riscaldata e provvista di una grande vasca di acqua fredda.
gloss_en: A frigidarium is a large cold pool at the Roman baths. The cold rooms of Roman baths, sometimes including a cold plunge pool Part of the Roman thermae consisting of a non-heated room containing a pool of cold water. In Ancient Roman baths, a room with a bath of cold water.
Green woodworking is a form of wood craft or in broad terms, carpentry, that works unseasoned or "green" timber into finished items.

gloss_it: La torre d'assedio o torre mobile è una macchina da guerra usata per raggiungere le mura difensive di una città o fortezza durante un assedio. Arma da assedio
gloss_en: A siege tower or breaching tower is a specialized siege engine, constructed to protect assailants and ladders while approaching the defensive walls of a fortification. Siege engine A siege weapon, consisting of a wheeled wooden tower with ladders inside, which was parked next to walls so assailants could safely scale them. Tower used as siege weapon.
An ambry is a recessed cabinet in the wall of a Christian church for storing sacred vessels and vestments. storage cupboard or recess in a church wall

gloss_it: Anfiprostilo è un termine architettonico che designa i templi che possiedono un portico di colonne sulla facciata, avanti e dietro, ma privo delle colonne sui lati del tempio.
gloss_en: In classical architecture, amphiprostyle denotes an ancient temple with a portico both at the front and the rear, where the columns on the narrow sides are not between antae. An amphiprostyle temple or edifice. Amphiprostyle temple.
Hawaiian feather helmets, known as mahiole in the Hawaiian language, were worn with feather cloaks.

gloss_it: L'arcosolio è una tipologia architettonica utilizzata per i monumenti funebri e, in particolare, nella catacombe.
gloss_en: An arcosolium, plural arcosolia, is an arched recess used as a place of entombment. A tomb in an arched recess in a wall. A tomb in an arched recess in a wall.

Châteauesque is a Revivalist architectural style based on the French Renaissance architecture of the monumental châteaux of the Loire Valley from the late fifteenth century to the early seventeenth century. Revival architectural style

gloss_it: Lo shōrō, shurō o kanetsuki-dō è il campanile di un tempio buddista in Giappone, che ospita il tempio bonshō.
gloss_en: The shōrō, shurō or kanetsuki-dō is the bell tower of a Buddhist temple in Japan, housing the temple's bonshō.
Attic base is the term given in architecture to the base of Roman Ionic order columns, consisting of an upper and lower torus, separated by a scotia and fillets.

The architecture of Madagascar is unique in Africa, bearing strong resemblance to the construction norms and methods of Southern Borneo from which the earliest inhabitants of Madagascar are believed to have immigrated.
The visual language is a system of communication using visual elements. A system of communication using visual elements

Kairō, bu, sōrō or horō is the Japanese version of a cloister, a covered corridor originally built around the most sacred area of a Buddhist temple, a zone which contained the kondō and the tō. A cloister-like part of a Japanese Buddhist temple.
E-hon or Ehon is the Japanese term for picture books. Japanese picture books of a specific period and format

In temples of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, an Ordinance room is a room where the ceremony known as the Endowment is administered, as well as other ordinances such as Sealings. Place for Latter-day Saint ordinances

Rustic architecture is a style of architecture in the United States, used in rural government and private structures and their landscape interior design. An informal architectural style in the United States and Canada with several variations Style of architecture in the United States, used in rural government and private structures and their landscape interior design
A photographic studio is a workspace to take, develop, print and duplicate photographs. Place or organisation that undertakes professional-quality photography
The Japodian burial urns are a series of fifteen burial urns made by the Illyrian tribe of the Japodes around the area of Bihać in Bosnia.
Sylacauga marble, also commonly known as Alabama marble, is a marble that is found in a belt running through Talladega County, Alabama.
A spirit way is the ornate road leading to a Chinese tomb of a major dignitary.

gloss_it: Parlando di cultura dell'India ci si riferisce alle religioni, agli usi, alle tradizioni, alle lingue parlate, alle cerimonie, alle arti, al modo di vivere in India e al suo popolo.
gloss_en: Indian culture is the heritage of social norms, ethical values, traditional customs, belief systems, political systems, artifacts and technologies that originated in or are associated with the Indian subcontinent. Pattern of human activity and symbolism associated with India

gloss_it: Nell'architettura giapponese, i fusuma sono pannelli verticali rettangolari che scorrendo ridefiniscono la struttura delle stanze, o fungono da porte, all'interno delle abitazioni tradizionali.
gloss_en: In Japanese architecture, fusuma are vertical rectangular panels which can slide from side to side to redefine spaces within a room, or act as doors. A vertical rectangular sliding panel, often painted or decorated, used in Japan as a door or movable wall.
An equatorial room, in astronomical observatories, is the room which contains an equatorial mounted telescope.
An oil dipper is used to hold a supply of turpentine, oil or painting medium. Container for oil for painting
Sureswari temple or Sursuri temple is located at the left bank of Tel River towards the south-west of the confluence of Mahanadi and Tel River.

gloss_it: Forme di espressione umana, generalmente influenzate dalla cultura
gloss_en: The arts refers to the theory, human application and physical expression of creativity found in human cultures and societies through skills and imagination in order to produce objects, environments and experiences. The general types of artistic expression Human expression and creativity, usually influenced by culture

Building for Life, Building for Life 12, Adeliladu am Oes 12 Cymru and Building for a Healthy Life are design tools for improving the quality of new homes and neighbourhoods used across England and Wales.

The term slype is a variant of slip in the sense of a narrow passage; in architecture, the name for the covered passage usually found in monasteries or cathedrals between the transept and the chapter house, as at St Andrews, Winchester, Gloucester, Exeter, Durham, St. Albans and Christ Church Cathedral, Oxford. Covered passage usually found in monasteries or cathedrals between the transept and the chapter house A covered passageway, especially one connecting the transept of a cathedral or monastery to the chapter house.
A green home is a type of house designed to be environmentally sustainable.

The second Christiansborg Palace was a new main residence for the Danish Monarch built from 1803 to 1828 in Copenhagen as a replacement for the first Christiansborg Palace which had been destroyed by fire in 1794. 19th-century residence of the Danish monarch

gloss_it: Lista di un progetto Wikimedia
gloss_en: A piscina is a shallow basin placed near the altar of a church, or else in the vestry or sacristy, used for washing the communion vessels. Wikimedia list article A drained basin near a church's altar for the disposal of water from liturgical ablutions.

gloss_it: L'obelisco incompiuto di Assuan è un obelisco egizio la cui estrazione non è stata completata, probabilmente a causa della comparsa di fenditure nella roccia.
gloss_en: The unfinished obelisk is the largest known ancient obelisk and is located in the northern region of the stone quarries of ancient Egypt in Aswan, Egypt. ancient obelisk
Systems music is music with sound continua which evolve gradually, often over very long periods of time.

gloss_it: Putto è un termine che nel campo dell'arte indica un bambino nudo, quasi sempre di sesso maschile e spesso raffigurato con le ali. Rappresentazione di un bambino nudo, spesso alato, soprattutto un cherubino o un cupido, tipica dell'arte rinascimentale o barocca.
gloss_en: A putto is a figure in a work of art depicted as a chubby male child, usually naked and sometimes winged. Figure in a work of art depicted as a chubby male child, usually nude and sometimes winged A representation of a naked, often winged, child, especially a cherub or a cupid in Renaissance or Baroque art. A representation, especially in Renaissance or Baroque art, of a small, naked, often winged (usually male) child; a cherub. Representation of a small, naked, often winged child.

gloss_it: Il Barocco polacco si sviluppò dall'inizio del XVII alla metà del XVIII secolo.
gloss_en: The Polish Baroque lasted from the early 17th to the mid-18th century.

gloss_it: Il sentō è un tipo di bagno pubblico giapponese, dove i clienti hanno la possibilità di svolgere attività finalizzate all'igiene personale previo pagamento di una quota d'ingresso.
gloss_en: Sentō is a type of Japanese communal bathhouse where customers pay for entrance. Type of Japanese communal bathhouse where customers pay for entrance

gloss_it: L'acciaio COR-TEN fa parte della categoria degli acciai basso legati definiti patinabili. Tipo di Acciaio legato Acciaio strutturale resistente alla corrosione
gloss_en: Weathering steel, often referred to by the genericised trademark COR-TEN steel and sometimes written without the hyphen as corten steel, is a group of steel alloys which were developed to eliminate the need for painting, and form a stable rust-like appearance after several years' exposure to weather. Steel alloy forming a rust-look finish when exposed to weather Any of a group of steel alloys developed to eliminate the need for painting, forming a stable rust-like appearance if exposed to the weather for a long period.
The double disc is a Pictish symbol of unknown meaning that is frequently found on Class I and Class II Pictish stones, as well as on Pictish metalwork. Pictish symbol

gloss_it: Il tamburo è un elemento architettonico di raccordo, posizionato tra una volta a cupola e il perimetro d'imposta della stessa cupola.
gloss_en: In architecture, a tholobate or drum is the upright part of a building on which a dome is raised. Dome base The substructure on which a dome or cupola rests.
The ball-flower is an architectural ornament in the form of a ball inserted in the cup of a flower.

gloss_it: Il Vastu Shastra è probabilmente l'architettura olistica più antica del mondo e proviene dalla cultura dell'antica India, come lo Yoga e l'Ayurveda.
gloss_en: Vastu shastra is a traditional Indian system of architecture originating in India. Architecture and design-related texts of India

gloss_it: Il mercato dell'arte o, meglio, i mercati dell'arte sono composti da artisti, acquirenti e mediatori o distributori. Commercio di opere d'arte
gloss_en: An art auction or fine art auction is the sale of art works, in most cases in an auction house. The art market is the marketplace of buyers and sellers trading in commodities, services, and works of art. Marketplace of buyers and sellers trading in the commodities, services, and works-of-art commonly associated with the various arts

In English architecture, mainly from the Tudor period onwards, a banqueting house is a separate pavilion-like building reached through the gardens from the main residence, whose use is purely for entertaining, especially eating. Type of building and part of Tudor and Early Stuart English architecture

A bonded warehouse, or bond, is a building or other secured area in which dutiable goods may be stored, manipulated, or undergo manufacturing operations without payment of duty. Building or other secured area in which dutiable goods may be stored

gloss_it: Il termine temenos rappresenta un appezzamento di terreno che viene espropriato ed assegnato a capi o regnanti, oppure riservato al culto di un dio o alla costruzione di un santuario. appezzamento di terreno dedicato alla divinità, nell'antichità classica
gloss_en: A temenos is a piece of land cut off and assigned as an official domain, especially to kings and chiefs, or a piece of land marked off from common uses and dedicated to a god, a sanctuary, holy grove or holy precinct: the Pythian race-course is called a temenos, the sacred valley of the Nile is the Νείλοιο πῖον τέμενος Κρονίδα, the Acropolis of Athens is the ἱερὸν τέμενος, and the Kaaba inside the courtyard of Islam's most important mosque, the Great Mosque of Mecca. A piece of land cut off and assigned as an official domain or a piece of land marked off from common uses and dedicated to a god Piece of land assigned as an official domain or dedicated to gods A piece of land marked off from common uses and assigned as an official domain, especially to a king, chief, or god.

Nazi plunder was stealing of art and other items as a result of the organized looting of European countries during the time of the Third Reich by agents acting on behalf of the ruling Nazi Party of Germany.
EwingCole is an American integrated architecture, engineering, interior design and planning firm founded in 1961 as Alexander Ewing & Associates.

In architecture, a frontispiece is the combination of elements that frame and decorate the main, or front, door to a building. The combination of elements that frame and decorate the main, or front, door to a building
The ramparts of Aigues-Mortes are the 13th century fortifications of the town Aigues-Mortes, in Gard, France.
Hillforts in Britain refers to the various hillforts within the island of Great Britain.
A Roman mosaic is a mosaic made during the Roman period, throughout the Roman Republic and later Empire. Style of mosaic from the Roman period
The trompette militaire is a loud majestic sounding organ stop, with brassy, penetrating tone. organ stop

In The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, a tabernacle is a multipurpose religious building, used for church services and conferences, and as community centers. Multipurpose religious building in the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

An autonomous building is a building designed to be operated independently from infrastructural support services such as the electric power grid, gas grid, municipal water systems, sewage treatment systems, storm drains, communication services, and in some cases, public roads. Building desgined to be independent from public infrastructure

A garage door is a large door on a garage that opens either manually or by an electric motor. Large door on a garage that accommodates vehicles entering and exiting The door, or one of a set of doors, on a garage, allowing to close the entrance. Door on a garage.
A pocket door is a sliding door that, when fully open, disappears into a compartment in the adjacent wall. Type of sliding door A door that slides into the wall. Type of sliding door.
The labrum in architecture was a large water-filled vessel or basin with an overhanging lip. A large water-filled vessel or basin with an overhanging lip
A discharging arch or relieving arch is an arch built over a lintel or architrave to take off the superincumbent weight.
The topographical tradition describes a long-established tradition of painting largely or entirely concerned with specific places on the earth and their topography.

gloss_it: La scuola di Chicago è un movimento ed una vera e propria scuola di architettura che si è formata a Chicago tra la fine dell'Ottocento e l'inizio del Novecento. Scuola di architettura
gloss_en: Chicago's architecture is famous throughout the world and one style is referred to as the Chicago School. A style of commercial buildings American architectural style
A groundscraper is a large building that has relatively few stories but which greatly extends horizontally.
Creole marble, also called Georgia creole or Georgia marble, is a marble from quarries in Pickens County, Georgia, United States.
Muzan-e, also known as "Bloody Prints", refers to Japanese woodcut prints of violent nature published in the late Edo and Meiji periods.
A freestone is a stone used in masonry for molding, tracery and other replication work required to be worked with the chisel.

Seljuk architecture comprises the building traditions used by the Seljuk dynasty, when it ruled most of the Middle East and Anatolia during the 11th to 13th centuries. Style of Persianized architecture

gloss_it: Le incisioni rupestri sono segni scavati nella roccia con strumenti appuntiti di vario genere, come una punta di roccia più dura a forma di scalpello, utilizzando una tecnica di picchiettatura, guidata o meno da un percussore o una punta metallica, o per mezzo di una tecnica di raschiatura a graffio, da cui il nome graffito.
gloss_en: A petroglyph is an image created by removing part of a rock surface by incising, picking, carving, or abrading, as a form of rock art. Rock art depicting pictograms and logograms. Pictogram and logogram images carved on a rock surface An image created by removing part of a rock surfaces by incising, pecking, carving, and abrading.
In the theatre of ancient Greece, the skene was the structure at the back of a stage. An element of ancient Greek theater: the structure at the back of the stage. Element of ancient Greek theater.
A sleeping porch is a deck or balcony, sometimes screened or otherwise enclosed with screened windows, and furnished for sleeping in warmer months. Lightly-enclosed porch for sleeping in fresh air

gloss_it: Le perline sono tavole di legno piallato e con incastri sui lati denominati maschio e femmina, che possono venire utilizzate per vari scopi, specie in campo edilizio nel rivestimento di pareti e soffitti dove si parla infatti di "perlinato". Elementi di copertura del tetto in legno Elemento strutturale orizzontale che corre lungo tutto il tetto, poggia sulle travi principali ortogonali e sostiene le travi ordinarie o tavole del tetto.
gloss_en: A purlin is a longitudinal, horizontal, structural member in a roof. A horizontal structural member that runs along the length of a roof, resting upon the principal rafters at right angles and supporting the ordinary rafters or boards of the roof. A longitudinal structural member bridging two or more rafters of a roof. Longitudinal structural member of a roof.

In architecture, an engaged column is a column embedded in a wall and partly projecting from the surface of the wall, sometimes defined as semi- or three-quarter detached. An architectural feature Column embedded in a wall and partly projecting from the surface of the wall A column embedded in a wall and partly projecting from the surface of the wall.

gloss_it: Il corpo di guardia è una struttura presente nei castelli, manieri e mansion europei.
gloss_en: A gatehouse is an entry control point building, enclosing or accompanying a gateway for a town, religious house, castle, manor house, or other fortification building of importance. Defensive or decorative gates in the form of buildings

gloss_it: Il Mass damper, detto anche tuned mass damper o assorbitore armonico, è un dispositivo montato su diverse strutture per impedire disagi, danni, e cedimenti strutturali esterni causati dalle vibrazioni.
gloss_en: A tuned mass damper, also known as a harmonic absorber or seismic damper, is a device mounted in structures to reduce the amplitude of mechanical vibrations, that consists of a mass that is mounted on one or more damped springs. A device mounted in structures to prevent discomfort, damage or structural failure by vibration Device designed to reduce vibrations in structures

Rag-stone is a name given by some architectural writers to work done with stones that are quarried in thin pieces, such as Horsham Stone, sandstone, Yorkshire stone, and the slate stones, but this is more properly flag or slab work. Work done with stones that are quarried in thin pieces

Aboriginal Australian kinship comprises the systems of Aboriginal customary law governing social interaction relating to kinship in traditional Aboriginal cultures. Systems of law covering social interactions in Australian Aboriginal societies
A metate or metlatl is a type or variety of quern, a ground stone tool used for processing grain and seeds. Mesoamerican quern or milling-stone
Tokyō is a system of supporting blocks and brackets supporting the eaves of a Japanese building, usually part of a Buddhist temple or Shinto shrine. A bracketing system used in Japanese architecture
A pantile is a type of fired roof tile, normally made from clay. Type of fired roof tile

A Borobudur ship is the 8th-century wooden double outrigger sailing vessel of Maritime Southeast Asia depicted in some bas reliefs of the Borobudur Buddhist monument in Central Java, Indonesia. 8th-century sailing vessel depicted in bas reliefs of Borobudur, Java, Indonesia

gloss_it: Le città maya furono i luoghi nei quali si concentrò la popolazione della civiltà precolombiana dei Maya in Mesoamerica.
gloss_en: Maya cities were the centres of population of the pre-Columbian Maya civilization of Mesoamerica. Which means the tidal temple from the movie imagination world

Apart from the architecture of Rajasthan, the most notable forms of the visual art of Rajasthan are architectural sculpture on Hindu and Jain temples in the medieval era, in painting illustrations to religious texts, beginning in the late medieval period, and post-Mughal miniature painting in the Early Modern period, where various different court schools developed, together known as Rajput painting.

gloss_it: Una targa blu è un segno permanente installato in un luogo pubblico per commemorare un legame tra quel posto ed una persona, o un evento celebri.
gloss_en: A blue plaque is a permanent sign installed in a public place in the United Kingdom and elsewhere to commemorate a link between that location and a famous person, event, or former building on the site, serving as a historical marker. Marker commemorating a link between a location and a person or event

In architecture, a dog-tooth or dogtooth pattern is an ornament found in the mouldings of medieval work of the commencement of the 12th century, which is thought to have been introduced by the Crusaders.

A conjuratory or exconjuratory is a small religious building from which ceremonies were conducted to bless the fields and ward off calamities caused by the weather, like storms, hail and excessive rain that could ruin the harvests. Small religious building from which ceremonies were conducted to bless the fields and ward off calamities caused by the weather

gloss_it: I wall sticker sono delle speciali decorazioni da applicare sui muri di un ambiente interno, ma anche mobili, specchi, vetri, ceramiche e altre superfici lisce.
gloss_en: A wall decal, also known as a wall sticker, wall tattoo, or wall vinyl, is a vinyl sticker that is affixed to a wall or other smooth surface for decoration and informational purposes.

Palazzo style refers to an architectural style of the 19th and 20th centuries based upon the palazzi built by wealthy families of the Italian Renaissance. Imitative of Italian palazzi Imitative of Italian palazzi

lab_en: gothic revival in the decorative arts
gloss_it: L'architettura neogotica è la tendenza a riportare in vita lo stile architettonico gotico che si è manifestata principalmente nel XVIII e XIX secolo.
gloss_en: Architectural style that drew its inspiration from medieval architecture and competed with the Neoclassical revivals in the United States and Great Britain. Gothic Revival is an architectural movement that began in the late 1740s in England. A type of architecture based on a mediaeval style revived in the Victorian period Architectural movement

gloss_it: La balestra di Leonardo o balestra gigante è un'arma da lancio progettata da Leonardo da Vinci, i cui disegni si trovano nel Codice Atlantico.
gloss_en: Leonardo's crossbow is a type of shooting weapon designed by Leonardo da Vinci, whose drawings are in the Codex Atlanticus.

gloss_it: L'ipocausto era un sistema di riscaldamento usato nell'antica Roma, consistente nella circolazione di aria calda entro cavità poste nel pavimento e nelle pareti del luogo da riscaldare. Complesso sistema di riscaldamento utilizzato nell'Antica Roma
gloss_en: A hypocaust is a system of central heating in a building that produces and circulates hot air below the floor of a room, and may also warm the walls with a series of pipes through which the hot air passes. Ancient Roman system of underfloor heating An underfloor space or flue through which heat from a furnace passes to heat the floor of a room or a bath.

gloss_it: La Pietra di Vang è una pietra runica datata ai primi anni dell'XI secolo d.C. sita in Vang, contea di Innlandet, Norvegia.
gloss_en: Vang stone listed as N 84 in Rundata is a runestone from the early eleventh century located at Vang in Oppland, Norway.

gloss_it: Auvers-sur-Oise è un comune francese di 7.002 abitanti situato nel dipartimento della Val-d'Oise nella regione dell'Île-de-France, sulla sponda destra del fiume Oise e a 27,2 km NE di Parigi. Comune della Val-d'Oise Comune francese
gloss_en: Auvers-sur-Oise is a commune on the northwestern outskirts of Paris, France. In the Val-d'Oise département Commune in Val-d'Oise, France

The architecture of Canada is, with the exception of that of Canadian First Nations, closely linked to the techniques and styles developed in Canada, Europe and the United States. Broad variety of achitectural styles

A quiggly hole, also known as a pit-house or simply as a quiggly or kekuli, is the remains of an earth lodge built by the First Nations people of the Interior of British Columbia and the Columbia Plateau in the U.S. The word quiggly comes from kick willy or keekwulee, the Chinook Jargon word for "beneath" or "under". Remains of an earth lodge built by First Nations people

gloss_it: Le abitazioni in Giappone presentano una grande varietà di stili.
gloss_en: Housing in Japan includes modern and traditional styles. Overview of housing in Japan

gloss_it: L'architettura futurista è la denominazione di una forma di architettura della prima metà del Novecento teorizzata in Italia, caratterizzata da forte innovazione tecnica e formale, anti-storicismo, esasperato cromatismo, utilizzo di linee dinamiche, volta nel suo insieme a suggerire un'idea di velocità, movimento, urgenza e lirismo.
gloss_en: Futurist architecture is an early-20th century form of architecture born in Italy, characterized by strong chromaticism, long dynamic lines, suggesting speed, motion, urgency and lyricism: it was a part of Futurism, an artistic movement founded by the poet Filippo Tommaso Marinetti, who produced its first manifesto, the Manifesto of Futurism, in 1909. Architectural style

A receiving vault or receiving tomb, sometimes also known as a public vault, is a structure designed to temporarily store dead bodies in winter months when the ground is too frozen to dig a permanent grave in a cemetery. Structure designed to temporarily store dead bodies in winter months when the ground is too frozen to dig a permanent grave
The Ammonite order is an architectural order that features fluted columns and capitals with volutes shaped to resemble fossil ammonites. An architectural order featuring ammonite-shaped capitals

Above and Below is an installation by American artist Maya Lin, the designer of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial in Washington, D.C. It is on display at and owned by the Indianapolis Museum of Art located in Indianapolis, Indiana, United States. Artwork by Maya Linn

gloss_it: Una casa stregata è un'abitazione che è ritenuta coinvolta in presunti eventi soprannaturali o fenomeni paranormali.
gloss_en: A haunted house, spook house or ghost house in ghostlore is a house or other building often perceived as being inhabited by disembodied spirits of the deceased who may have been former residents or were otherwise connected with the property. For those looking for more information on haunted houses House or other building often perceived as being inhabited by disembodied spirits of the deceased

gloss_it: Un sebil o sabil è un piccolo chiosco dove l'acqua viene liberamente distribuita al pubblico.
gloss_en: A sebil or sabil is a small kiosk in the Islamic architectural tradition where water is freely dispensed to members of the public by an attendant behind a grilled window. A fountain, a small structure in a Muslim area where water is freely dispensed to members of the public.
A well house is a building erected in Palestine in the 19th century around water wells, especially near orange groves. Building constructed around a water well

gloss_it: Per arte greca si intende l'arte della Grecia antica, cioè di quelle popolazioni di lingua ellenica che abitarono una vasta area, comprendente la penisola ellenica, le isole egee e ioniche e le colonie fondate in Asia Minore, sul mar Nero, nell'Italia meridionale e insulare e, nella fase più tarda, nelle regioni conquistate da Alessandro Magno, in particolare nella Fenicia, nell'Egitto e nell'Anatolia.
gloss_en: Ancient Greek art stands out among that of other ancient cultures for its development of naturalistic but idealized depictions of the human body, in which largely nude male figures were generally the focus of innovation. Art of Ancient Greece

Tribhaṅga or Tribunga is a standing body position or stance used in traditional Indian art and Indian classical dance forms like the Odissi, where the body bends in one direction at the knees, the other direction at the hips and then the other again at the shoulders and neck. Tribhaṅga is a standing body position or stance used in traditional Indian art and Indian classical dance, where the body bends in one direction at the knees, the other direction at the hips and then the other again at the shoulders and neck
Nightingale floors listen are floors that make a chirping sound when walked upon. floors that make a chirping sound when walked upon

gloss_it: Il giardino del paradiso è una forma di giardino di antica origine iraniana, in particolare achemenide che è formale, simmetrico e molto spesso, chiuso.
gloss_en: The paradise garden is a form of garden of Old Iranian origin, specifically Achaemenid which is formal, symmetrical and most often, enclosed. Form of garden of Old Iranian origin
Xerigordos, often incorrectly Xerigordon in modern historiography, was a castle in Anatolia that served as the setting of the Siege of Xerigordos as a part of the People's Crusade in 1096.

The cabaña pasiega is a type of mixed popular architecture, typical of the Cantabrian mountains, above all, from the upper valleys of Asón and Pas, whose contrasted origin dates back to the 16th century.

The central-passage house, also known variously as center-hall house, hall-passage-parlor house, Williamsburg cottage, and Tidewater-type cottage, was a vernacular, or folk form, house type from the colonial period onward into the 19th century in the United States.

gloss_it: Il Movimento Moderno nella storia dell'architettura fu un periodo collocato tra le due guerre mondiali, teso al rinnovamento dei caratteri, della progettazione e dei principi dell'architettura, dell'urbanistica e del design. L'architettura del Novecento può essere schematizzata in quattro grandi periodi storici: il periodo antecendente alla prima guerra mondiale; quello compreso tra le due guerre; un terzo compreso tra il 1945 ed il 1989, anno della caduta del muro di Berlino; un quarto che congiunge le tendenze dell'ultimo decennio del Novecento con quelle del XXI secolo.
gloss_en: Modern architecture, or modernist architecture, was an architectural style based upon new and innovative technologies of construction, particularly the use of glass, steel, and reinforced concrete; the idea that form should follow function ; an embrace of minimalism; and a rejection of ornament. Attempts at the turn of the 20th century to reconcile the principles underlying architectural design with rapid technological advancement and the modernization of society

gloss_it: La Maiolica di Laterza è un particolare tipo di maiolica prodotto nella città di Laterza, in Puglia.
gloss_en: The Maiolica di Laterza is a kind of maiolica made in the town of Laterza, part of the Apulia region in Italy.
Aizen-in is a Kōya-san Shingon temple in Itano, Tokushima Prefecture, Japan. Shingon temple in Itano, Tokushima Prefecture, Japan
The Italian word arengario refers to government buildings of different historic periods. Italian government building

gloss_it: Fête galante è un termine che si riferisce ad un genere di pittura appositamente creato dall'Accademia di Francia nel 1717 per descrivere le variazioni sul tema della fête champêtre introdotte da Antoine Watteau, caratterizzate da figure in abito di ballo o abbigliate in maschera, inserite in un'ambientazione di giardini all'aperto.
gloss_en: Fête galante is a category of painting specially created by the French Academy in 1717 to describe Antoine Watteau's variations on the theme of the fête champêtre, which featured figures in ball dress or masquerade costumes disporting themselves amorously in parkland settings. Category of painting created to describe Antoine Watteau''s variations on the theme of the fête champêtre
Asnières, now named Asnières-sur-Seine, is the subject and location of paintings that Vincent van Gogh made in 1887. Painting series by Vincent van Gogh

gloss_it: Kāla è una parola sanscrita per "tempo".
gloss_en: Kāla is a word used in Sanskrit to mean "time". A Sanskrit word for "time" Hindu deity and concept

gloss_it: Il Diaconicon è, nella chiesa ortodossa orientale e in quella cattolica orientale, il nome dato al locale posto a sud dell'abside centrale della chiesa, dove vengono custoditi i paramenti sacri, messali, ecc, usati per l'officiazione della liturgia sacra.
gloss_en: The diaconicon is, in Eastern Orthodox and Eastern Catholic churches, the name given to a chamber on the south side of the central apse of the church, where the vestments, books, etc., that are used in the Divine Services of the church are kept. A sacristy for sacred vessels in a Greek church, on the south side of the bema or sanctuary.

gloss_it: Lo Shōsō-in
gloss_en: The Shōsō-in is the treasure house that belongs to Tōdai-ji in Nara, Nara, Japan. Buddhist temple in Nara Prefecture, Japan
Furuichi kofungun is a group of one hundred and twenty-three kofun or tumuli in Fujiidera and Habikino, Osaka Prefecture, Japan.
BarberMcMurry, formerly Barber & McMurry, is an architecture firm based in Knoxville, Tennessee, USA.

gloss_it: L'architettura longobarda è costituita dall'insieme delle opere architettoniche realizzate in Italia durante il regno dei Longobardi, con residuale permanenza nell'Italia meridionale fino al X-XI secolo, e commissionate dai re e dai duchi longobardi.
gloss_en: Lombard architecture refers to the architecture of the Kingdom of the Lombards, which lasted from 568 to 774 and which was commissioned by Lombard kings and dukes.
Verb displacement as it relates to prose, is a technique used to impart a lyrical or poetic feel to a phrase, sentence, or paragraph.
Kerala architecture is a kind of architectural style that is mostly found in the Indian state of Kerala.
An earth lodge is a semi-subterranean building covered partially or completely with earth, best known from the Native American cultures of the Great Plains and Eastern Woodlands.

gloss_it: L'infermeria è solitamente un piccolo locale, oppure un complesso di locali, dove vengono effettuate dall'assistenza sanitaria le prime cure medico-sanitarie, ovvero servizi di pronto soccorso. Locale o insieme di locali  dedicato ai controlli e ai trattamenti medici
gloss_en: A first aid room or medical room, also known as an infirmary, is a room in an establishment to which someone who is injured or taken ill on the premises can be taken for first aid and to await the arrival of professional emergency medical services. Special room for medical examinations and treatments
The hidden roof is a type of roof widely used in Japan both at Buddhist temples and Shinto shrines.

A flèche faîtière is a carved rooftop spear or spire or finial that adorns Kanak houses, particularly the Great Houses of the Kanak Chiefs, in New Caledonia. A type of decorated spear used by the Kanak to adorn their rooftops.
Tower running is a sport which involves running up tall man-made structures. Sport which involves running up tall man-made structures
An accent wall is an interior wall whose design differs from that of the other walls in the room. A wall in a room which has a style distinctly different from the other walls.

gloss_it: L‘estetica giapponese è considerata una parte integrante della cultura nipponica e della vita quotidiana dei giapponesi.
gloss_en: Japanese aesthetics comprise a set of ancient ideals that include wabi, sabi, and yūgen.

gloss_it: Il martyrion o martyrium è una chiesa tipica dell'arte bizantina, costruita sulla tomba di un martire o sul luogo in cui era avvenuta la sua morte e dedicata al suo culto.
gloss_en: A martyrium or martyrion, plural martyria, sometimes anglicized martyry, is a church or shrine built over the tomb of a Christian martyr. Early Christian mausoleum for a martyr. A tomb or other edifice erected in homage to a martyr. Tomb or other edifice erected in homage to a martyr.
The Tokyo Building is an office building located in Tokyo, Japan.

gloss_it: Il 440 West 42nd Street, conosciuto anche come Middle of Manhattan, è un grattacielo a uso misto situato nel quartiere di Hell's Kitchen a New York.
gloss_en: MiMA, a stylized abbreviation of "Middle of Manhattan", is a mixed-use building located at 450 West 42nd Street between Dyer and 10th Avenues in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood of Manhattan, New York City. An apartment building whose name means Middle of Manhattan Skyscraper in New York City

A national shrine is a Catholic church or other sacred place which has met certain requirements and is given this honor by the national episcopal conference to recognize the church's special historical, cultural and religious significance. Designation given to a Catholic church or a sacred place to recognize its special historical, cultural, or religious significance
This article is about the farm at Birdoswald, for the Roman fort, see Banna.

The architectural heritage of Kathmandu city is integral to that of the Kathmandu valley since all monuments have evolved over centuries of craftsmanship influenced by Hindu and Buddhist religious practices.
WUWA  Architectural structure

Letter cutting is a form of inscriptional architectural lettering closely related to monumental masonry and stone carving, often practiced by artists, sculptors, and typeface designers. Form of inscriptional architectural lettering

gloss_it: Con il termine latino hortus gli antichi Romani indicavano di solito il piccolo appezzamento di terreno dove venivano coltivati gli ortaggi destinati a soddisfare le necessità alimentari della famiglia. Appezzamenti di terreno nelle case della Roma antica
gloss_en: Roman gardens and ornamental horticulture became highly developed under Roman civilization.

gloss_it: Un ipogeo è una costruzione sotterranea di interesse storico e antropologico, realizzata interamente dall'essere umano o come riadattamento di cavità naturali. Tipica costruzione sotterranea
gloss_en: A hypogeum or hypogaeum is an underground temple or tomb. Underground temple or tomb An underground room or cavern (also used figuratively). Underground vault.

For other uses related to Sidhhanath Temple, see: Sidhhanath Temple Bhoodsidhhnatha is another name for the Hindu deity Siddhanath, who is believed to be incarnation of Shiva. Village deity of village Bhood, Maharashtra.

gloss_it: Il regionalismo critico è un approccio all'architettura con il quale si cerca di opporsi all'idea di mancanza d'identità e/o di appartenenza di alcune architetture moderne avvalendosi del contesto geografico dell'edificio.
gloss_en: Critical regionalism is an approach to architecture that strives to counter the placelessness and lack of identity of the International Style, but also rejects the whimsical individualism and ornamentation of Postmodern architecture. In architecture, an approach that strives to counter placelessness and lack of identity in modern architecture by using the building's geographical context

gloss_it: Il laconicum, costruzione di origine spartana da cui ne proviene il nome, era un ambiente di forma circolare con vasca centrale rivestita in marmo e nicchie lungo le pareti perimetrali, queste erano solitamente colorate e dipinte con ricchi affreschi come nel caso delle Terme del Foro, il laconicum era ricoperto sempre da un soffitto a cupola con un unico ingresso meridionale per l'apporto di luce. ambiente degli antichi edifici termali romani
gloss_en: The laconicum was the dry sweating room of the Roman thermae, contiguous to the caldarium or hot room. The dry sweating room in Roman bath buildings A hot dry sweating room, next to the caldarium in the Roman baths.

In landscape architecture and garden design, a water feature is one or more items from a range of fountains, jeux d'eau, pools, ponds, rills, artificial waterfalls, and streams. architectural element including water An architectural design element involving water, such as a fountain, a pond or a waterfall.
Kentish ragstone is a hard grey limestone in Kent, England, drawn from the geological formation known as the Hythe Beds of the Lower Greensand. Hard grey limestone in Kent, England

A dingbat is a type of formulaic apartment building that flourished in the Sun Belt region of the United States in the 1950s and 1960s, a vernacular variation of shoebox style "stucco boxes". Slang term, used to describe cheap urban apartment buildings from the 1950s and 1960s
Kadamba architecture was a style of temple architecture founded by Mayurasharma in the 4th century AD in Karnataka, India.

gloss_it: Tecniche artistiche di Stampa come l'incisione, l'Acquaforte, Xilografia e la litografia sono incluse di più integralmente nei loro rispettivi articoli.
gloss_en: Printmaking art techniques such as engraving, etching, woodcut and lithography are covered more fully in their respective articles. A style of two-dimensional art featuring only two, unshaded, contrasting colors; or

lab_en: uk video art: the early years
gloss_it: La videoarte – in inglese video art – è un linguaggio artistico basato sulla creazione e riproduzione di immagini in movimento mediante strumentazioni video.
gloss_en: A type of art which relies on moving pictures and comprises video and/or audio data. Video art is an art form which relies on using video technology as a visual and audio medium. Type of art
A parroquia is a population entity or parish found in Galicia and Asturias in north-west Spain. Type of ecclesiastical subdivision of the Catholic Church in Galicia, Spain
For the system of willow-lined fortifications in China also known as the Willow Wall, see Willow Palisade. human settlement in West Virginia, United States of America

A tambour door can be an up-and-over or side closing-opening door, which can consist of narrow or wider horizontal slats and "rolls" up and down, or to the side by sliding along vertical or horizontal tracks.

gloss_it: Il rotolo disteso o rotolo orizzontale è un rotolo lungo e stretto usato per mostrare una serie di scene nella pittura e nella calligrafia cinese, giapponese
gloss_en: The handscroll is a long, narrow, horizontal scroll format in East Asia used for written text or a series of painted scenes, or a combination of both text and images. Long narrow scroll for displaying painting and calligraphy A traditional Asian scroll that unfolds horizontally so that the reader can view one section at a time while holding it in the hands.

Building Enclosure Commissioning is a strict quality-focused process wherein the energy performance of a facility, system or assembly is evaluated and verified against defined objectives and criteria.
A gu is type of ancient Chinese ritual bronze vessel from the Shang and Zhou dynasties. A Chinese wine goblet from the Shang and Zhou dynasties, also ku
A saw-tooth roof is a roof comprising a series of ridges with dual pitches either side.

gloss_it: Il Que è una tipologia d'ingresso turrito cerimoniale e strutturalmente indipendente tipico dell'architettura cinese.
gloss_en: The que is a freestanding, ceremonial gate tower in traditional Chinese architecture. A freestanding gate tower characteristic of the tomb architectural ensembles during China's Han Dynasty

gloss_it: Il polittico è, originariamente e per definizione, una forma d'arte sacra, una pala d'altare costituita da singoli pannelli separati, racchiusi da una cornice al fine di dare all'opera una struttura architettonica.
gloss_en: A polyptych is a painting which is divided into sections, or panels. Painting divided into multiple panels A work consisting of multiple painted or carved panels joined together, often with hinges. A work consisting of multiple painted or carved panels joined together.
Engineering bricks are a type of brick used where strength, low water porosity or acid resistance are needed.

gloss_it: Una bertesca era una piccola prominenza rettangolare attaccata tramite un arco a mensola al muro di un'apertura difensiva.
gloss_en: In Medieval fortification, a bretèche or brattice is a small balcony with machicolations, usually built over a gate and sometimes in the corners of the fortress' wall, with the purpose of enabling defenders to shoot or throw objects at the attackers huddled under the wall. Type of castle architectural element
An intrusive rock, similar to dolerite, but with an excess of quartz.
An online exhibition, also referred to as a virtual exhibition, online gallery, cyber-exhibition, is an exhibition whose venue is cyberspace. Exhibition whose venue is cyberspace

gloss_it: L'isolamento a cappotto è una tecnica per la coibentazione termica e in alcuni casi acustica delle pareti di un edificio, applicando del materiale isolante sulla superficie delle pareti.
gloss_en: Exterior insulation and finish system is a general class of non-load bearing building cladding systems that provides exterior walls with an insulated, water-resistant, finished surface in an integrated composite material system.

The Kaḷinga architectural style is a style of Hindu architecture which flourished in the ancient Kalinga previously known as Utkal and in present eastern Indian state of Odisha. Architecture style in Odisha

The Victorian restoration was the widespread and extensive refurbishment and rebuilding of Church of England churches and cathedrals that took place in England and Wales during the 19th-century reign of Queen Victoria. The widespread refurbishment and rebuilding of Church of England churches that took place during the 19th century reign of Queen Victoria.
The term of faktura emerged in Russian art criticism before the First World War. A principle of Russian Constructivism
The architecture of Warsaw has influenced and reflected the history of Polish architecture. overview of the architecture of Warsaw

A borg is a former stronghold or villa in the province of Groningen, Netherlands. A former stronghold or villa in the province of Groningen, the Netherlands A former stronghold or villa in the province of Groningen, Netherlands

In architecture, a waterleaf is a distinctive sculptural motif used on the capitals of columns and pilasters in European buildings during the late twelfth century. Sculptural decoration used on the capitals of columns in late twelfth century Romanesque architecture sculptural decoration used on the capitals of columns in late twelfth century Romanesque architecture

A refuge castle or refuge fort is a castle-like defensive location, usually surrounded by ramparts, that is not permanently occupied but acts as a temporary retreat for the local population when threatened by war or attack.
A gate tower is a tower built over or next to a major gateway. Tower built over or next to a major gateway
Conceptual design is an early phase of the design process, in which the broad outlines of function and form of something are articulated.
Commercial Modular Buildings are code-compliant, non-residential structures that are 60% to 90% completed offsite in a factory-controlled environment.
The term lowland castle or plains castle describes a type of castle that is situated on a lowland, plain or valley floor, as opposed to one built on higher ground such as a hill spur.
