A marsh or marshland castle is a type of lowland castle that is situated in marshy or boggy countryside. Lowland castle in boggy terrain
Museum architecture has been of increasing importance over the centuries, especially more recently. architecture of museum buildings

gloss_it: Sotto il nome di manieristi si raccolgono alcuni ceramografi a figure rosse attivi ad Atene nel secondo quarto del V secolo a.C. i quali, rifuggendo le innovazioni formali introdotte nella decorazione vascolare a seguito dell'influenza proveniente dallo sviluppo della pittura parietale contemporanea, adottavano uno stile arcaistico la cui radice è rintracciabile nell'opera del ceramografo Misone, attivo nel primo quarto del V secolo a.C. Prediligevano forme ampie come crateri a calice, pelikai e hydriai.
gloss_en: In archaeological scholarship, the term Mannerists describes a large group of Attic red-figure vase painters, stylistically linked by their affected painting style.

gloss_it: I vasi bilingui sono prodotti della ceramica greca antica decorati utilizzando sia la tecnica a figure nere sia la tecnica a figure rosse. Tecnica o stile della ceramica greca
gloss_en: Bilingual vase painting is a special form of ancient Greek vase painting.
A hilltop castle is a type of hill castle that was built on the summit of a hill or mountain. Hill castle that was built on the summit of a hill or mountain
A ridge castle was a medieval fortification built on a ridge or the crest of mountain or hill chain.
A hillside castle is a castle built on the side of a hill above much of the surrounding terrain but below the summit itself.

gloss_it: La ceramica cicladica descrive la produzione vascolare e ceramica delle isole Cicladi nell'età del bronzo e nell'età del ferro.
gloss_en: Cycladic vase painting was a regional style of Greek vase painting, produced in the Cycladic islands. style of Greek vase painting
Three-phase firing or iron reduction technique is a firing technique used in ancient Greek pottery production, specifically for painted vases.

gloss_it: Si denomina architettura cistercense quella sviluppata dai monaci cistercensi nella costruzione delle loro abbazie a partire dal XII secolo, momento dell'espansione iniziale di questo ordine religioso.
gloss_en: Cistercian architecture is a style of architecture associated with the churches, monasteries and abbeys of the Roman Catholic Cistercian Order. Architectural style

Anglo-Saxon architecture was a period in the history of architecture in England, and parts of Wales, from the mid-5th century until the Norman Conquest of 1066. From the 5th to 11th centuries Architectural style
A rock castle is a type of medieval castle that directly incorporates natural rock outcrops into its defences to such an extent that the rock formations define the structure of the castle.

gloss_it: Gli archetti pensili sono un elemento architettonico composto da file di piccoli archi ciechi, di solito poco sporgenti dalla muratura e poggianti su peducci. L' elemento architettonico che consiste in archi ciechi ancorati a una parete di un edificio.
gloss_en: A Lombard band is a decorative blind arcade, usually located on the exterior of building.

Feather tights is the name usually given by art historians to a form of costume seen on Late Medieval depictions of angels, which shows them as if wearing a body suit with large scale-like overlapping downward-pointing elements representing feathers, as well as having large wings.
The island castle is a variation of the water castle.
A bridge castle is a type of castle that was built to provide military observation and security for a river crossing.

A toll castle is a castle that, in the Middle Ages and the Early Modern Era, guarded a customs post and was intended to control it. A castle guarding a customs post, in the Middle Ages and the Early Modern Era A castle, in the Middle Ages and the Early Modern Era, that guarded a customs post and where tolls were collected. Castle.
Performative architecture is an architecture using digital technologies to challenge the way the built environment is designed.
A cave castle or grotto castle is a residential or refuge castle that has been built into a natural cave.
The Albanian art refers to all artistic expressions and artworks in Albania or produced by Albanians.
Leader heads or conductor heads are components of a roof drainage system which are known by different names, but they all mean the same.

gloss_it: Il tüchlein è una tecnica pittorica decorativa diffusa nelle Fiandre e nei paesi germanici nel Quattro Cinquecento. Tecnica pittorica
gloss_en: Glue-size is a painting technique in which pigment is bound to cloth with hide glue, and typically the unvarnished cloth was then fixed to the frame using the same glue. Painting technique

String art or pin and thread art, is characterized by an arrangement of colored thread strung between points to form geometric patterns or representational designs such as a ship's sails, sometimes with other artist material comprising the remainder of the work. İplik Sanatı

In urban planning, infill, or in-fill, is the rededication of land in an urban environment, usually open-space, to new construction. The construction of new buildings in open space in an existing urban or suburban environment Rededication of land in an urban environment, usually open-space, to new construction
Directoire style describes a period in the decorative arts, fashion, and especially furniture design concurrent with the post-Revolution French Directory. Architectural style

gloss_it: L'area delle arti visive è estremamente ampia essendo definibile in tal modo qualunque forma artistica che abbia come risultato un oggetto visibile.
gloss_en: The visual arts are art forms such as painting, drawing, printmaking, sculpture, ceramics, photography, video, filmmaking, design, crafts, and architecture. Art form which creates works that are primarily visual in nature An art form intended to be appreciated or perceived primarily by sight, such as painting, photography, printmaking, and filmmaking. Art forms that are primarily visual in nature, such as painting, photography, printmaking, and filmmaking. Art forms that are primarily visual in nature.
In architectural, construction, and real estate, floor area, floor space, or floorspace is the area taken up by a building or part of it. Amount of area  taken up by a building or part of it
A Chinese pavilion is a garden pavilion in traditional Chinese architecture.
The architecture of Lebanon embodies the historical, cultural and religious influences that have shaped Lebanon's built environment. Architecture of Lebanon
An apron is a raised section of ornamental stonework below a window ledge, stone tablet, or monument. A raised section of ornamental stonework below a window ledge, stone tablet or monument
Relief carving is a type of wood carving in which figures are carved in a flat panel of wood.

A lighting control system is an intelligent network-based lighting control solution that incorporates communication between various system inputs and outputs related to lighting control with the use of one or more central computing devices.
Various types of visual arts developed in the geographical area now known as Mexico.

gloss_it: L'architettura inca è la più significativa architettura precolombiana nell'America meridionale.
gloss_en: Inca architecture is the most significant pre-Columbian architecture in South America.
A consumption wall is a very wide wall, which appears as a double-sided structure in-filled with smaller stones.

Structural clay tile describes a category of burned-clay building materials used to construct roofing, walls, and flooring for structural and non-structural purposes, especially in fireproofing applications.
Storage pits are underground cists that were used historically to protect the seeds for the following year's crops, and to stop surplus food from being eaten by insects and rodents.

Rumah gadang or rumah bagonjong "house for the Minangkabau people" are the traditional homes of the Minangkabau in West Sumatra, Indonesia. The traditional house of Minangkabau, Indonesia. traditional homes of the Minangkabau in Sumatra, Indonesia

A monitor in architecture is a raised structure running along the ridge of a double-pitched roof, with its own roof running parallel with the main roof. A subsidiary roof structure In architecture, raised structure running along the ridge of a double-pitched roof
A fireboard or chimney board is a panel designed to cover a fireplace during the warm months of the year. A chimney board or screen to close a fireplace when not in use.
ADAM Architecture is an architecture and urban design practice in the UK with offices in Winchester and London. British architecture firm

gloss_it: Le case di paglia sono costruzioni edilizie realizzate con paglia compressa in balle. Tecnica/metodo di costruzione che fa uso di balle di paglia come elementi strutturali, per l'isolamento termico/acustico dell'edificio, o entrambi
gloss_en: Straw-bale construction is a building method that uses bales of straw as structural elements, building insulation, or both. Building method that uses bales of straw as structural elements, building insulation, or both

gloss_it: Lo stile Googie, conosciuto anche come populuxe o doo-wop, è un genere dell'architettura futuristica influenzato dalla cultura dell'automobile, dell'era spaziale e dell'era atomica, originaria del sud della California alla fine degli anni 1940 e che perdurò fino alla metà degli anni 1960.
gloss_en: Googie architecture is a type of futurist architecture influenced by car culture, jets, the Space Age, and the Atomic Age. Also known as doo wop, a form of novelty futuristic architecture Form of post-modern architecture style, a subdivision of futurist architecture

gloss_it: La lesena è un elemento di un ordine architettonico addossato a parete, che consiste in un fusto, a pianta rettangolare, appena sporgente dalla parete stessa, con i relativi capitelli e base. Elemento architettonico verticale puramente decorativo
gloss_en: A lesene, also called a pilaster strip, is an architectural term for a narrow, low-relief, vertical pillar in a wall. A low-relief, vertical pillar or pilaster in a wall, usually without a base or capital; used in architecture to divide a facade or other wall surface optically. Architectural element.

An eccentric flint is an elite chipped artifact of an often irregular shape produced by the Classic Maya civilization of ancient Mesoamerica. An elite chipped artifact of an often irregular shape, typically fashioned from chert, chalcedony or obsidian (not flint), produced by the Classic Maya civilization of ancient Mesoamerica.
A crag is a rocky hill or mountain, generally isolated from other high ground. A geological formation caused by the passage of a glacier over an area of hard rock
A neck ditch, sometimes called a throat ditch, is a dry moat that does not fully surround a castle, but only bars the side that is not protected by natural obstacles.

Certain works of structural engineering design are also works of structural art. Such works can be classified as structural art when they attain excellence in the three areas of efficiency, economy, and elegance, as defined by Prof.

A village hall is a public building in a village used for various things such as:. Building within a village which contains at least one large room, usually owned by and run for the benefit of the local community
The Tomburg is a castle ruin near Wormersdorf, a village in the municipality of Rheinbach near the German city of Bonn.

gloss_it: Un honden è l'area più sacra, il Sancta Sanctorum dei santuari shintoisti, del santuario dov'è riposta la statua o la reliquia rappresentante la divinità.
gloss_en: In Shinto shrine architecture, the honden, also called shinden, or sometimes shōden as in Ise Shrine's case, is the most sacred building at a Shinto shrine, intended purely for the use of the enshrined kami, usually symbolized by a mirror or sometimes by a statue. Main building of a Shinto temple
A Carnot wall is a type of loop-holed wall built in the ditch of a fort or redoubt.

gloss_it: L'architettura giapponese ha una storia antica quanto quella del Paese. L'arte architettonica del Giappone
gloss_en: Japanese architecture has been typified by wooden structures, elevated slightly off the ground, with tiled or thatched roofs. Japanese process of planning, designing and constructing buildings and other structures.

gloss_it: Il termine alcázar identifica le molte fortezze e cittadelle fortificate edificate dagli arabi in Spagna, al tempo della dominazione moresca. Palazzo fortificato edificato dagli arabi in Spagna, al tempo della dominazione moresca
gloss_en: An alcázar is a type of Moorish castle or palace in Spain and Portugal built during Muslim rule although the term is also used for many medieval castles built by Christians on earlier Roman, Visigothic or Moorish fortifications. Type of Moorish castle or palace in Spain and Portugal

gloss_it: Una porta cittadina o porta urbica è un elemento architettonico che fa parte della cerchia muraria che circonda, o circondava, un centro abitato. La porta situata nelle mura della città e permette l'accesso attraverso di esse Porta situata nelle mura di una città fortificata, con la funzione di difensiva o daziaria, come punto controllato di passaggio e accesso in tempo di pace e come punto di difesa in guerra
gloss_en: A city gate is a gate which is, or was, set within a city wall. Gate which is, or was, set within a city wall

Ivory carving is the carving of ivory, that is to say animal tooth or tusk, generally by using sharp cutting tools, either mechanically or manually. Carving of animal tooth or tusk by using sharp cutting tools

gloss_it: La quadriga è un cocchio trainato da quattro cavalli, guidato in vari avvenimenti dall'auriga. Carro tirato da quattro cavalli
gloss_en: A quadriga is a car or chariot drawn by four horses abreast and favoured for chariot racing in Classical Antiquity and the Roman Empire until the Late Middle Ages. Racing chariot A Roman racing chariot drawn by four horses abreast.

A heritage asset is an item that has value because of its contribution to a nation’s society, knowledge and/or culture. item that has value because of its contribution to a nation’s society, knowledge and/or culture

In archaeology, an Atlantic roundhouse is an Iron Age stone building found in the northern and western parts of mainland Scotland, the Northern Isles and the Hebrides. An Iron Age stone building found in the northern and western parts of mainland Scotland, the Northern Isles and the Hebrides Iron age architecture
In mathematics, the Coxeter complex, named after H. S. M. Coxeter, is a geometrical structure associated to a Coxeter group.

Phocaean red slip is a category of terra sigillata, or "fine" Ancient Roman pottery produced in or near the ancient city of Phokaia in Asia Minor. A category of Late Roman and Early Byzantine pottery type of ancient Roman pottery
BIM Wash or BIM Washing is a term describing the inflated, and/or deceptive, claim of using or delivering Building Information Modeling services or products.

gloss_it: Nella Chiesa ortodossa orientale, il metochio o metochion è un tempio di una chiesa autonoma o una nunziatura presente in un altro territorio che intrattiene relazioni con le gerarchie religiose locali, in Italia nello specifico con le gerarchie religiose cattoliche.
gloss_en: A metochion or metochi is an ecclesiastical embassy church within Eastern Orthodox tradition. Eccliastical embassy church of the Eastern Orthodox tradition An ecclesiastical embassy church within Eastern Orthodox tradition. Ecclesiastical embassy church within Eastern Orthodox tradition.

gloss_it: Lo stile vigneto è un termine utilizzato per indicare una sala da concerto ove le sedie degli spettatori circondano il palcoscenico, con file di sedili che via via salgono come nei terrazzamenti di un vigneto.
gloss_en: The vineyard style is a design of a concert hall where the seating surrounds the stage, rising up in serried rows in the manner of the sloping terraces of a vineyard. Concert hall design that features sloping terraced seating sections around the stage

gloss_it: L'effetto Venere è un fenomeno della psicologia della percezione, così chiamato a causa dei vari dipinti di Venere in cui la dea si riflette in uno specchio.
gloss_en: The Venus effect is a phenomenon in the psychology of perception, named after various paintings of Venus gazing into a mirror, such as Diego Velázquez's Rokeby Venus, Titian's Venus with a Mirror, and Veronese's Venus with a mirror.
Sustainable refurbishment describes working on existing buildings to improve their environmental performance using sustainable methods and materials.

A trumeau is the central pillar or mullion supporting the tympanum of a large doorway, commonly found in medieval buildings. Central pillar or mullion supporting the tympanum of a large doorway The pillar or center post supporting the lintel in the middle of a doorway or window opening, especially in a church. Pillar.

gloss_it: Il Vedutismo è un genere pittorico nato nel Settecento che si occupa di paesaggi o di città riprese dal vero. Corrente pittorica
gloss_en: A veduta is a highly detailed, usually large-scale painting or, more often, print of a cityscape or some other vista. Genre of large-scale vista or cityscape A highly detailed, usually large-scale painting of a cityscape or some other vista.

A balconet or balconette is an architectural term to describe a false balcony, or railing at the outer plane of a window-opening reaching to the floor, and having, when the window is open, the appearance of a balcony. Architectural element
A hollow log coffin is a type of coffin used by the Yolngu people of Arnhem Land, Australia. A type of coffin

A snout house is a house with a protruding garage that takes up most of the street frontage. A house that is constructed with an attached front entry garage that is closer to the street than any other part of the house house with a protruding garage in front

lab_en: list of royal burghs of scotland
gloss_en: A royal burgh was a type of Scottish burgh which had been founded by, or subsequently granted, a royal charter. Former type of Scottish burgh A type of Scottish burgh founded by, or subsequently granted, a royal charter; legally abolished in 1975.

gloss_it: Il tetramorfo è una raffigurazione iconografica composta da quattro elementi risalente a una simbologia di origine mediorientale.
gloss_en: A tetramorph is a symbolic arrangement of four differing elements, or the combination of four disparate elements in one unit. Union of the symbols of the Four Evangelists A symbolic arrangement of four differing elements, or the combination of four disparate elements in one unit.

The English wheel, in Britain also known as a wheeling machine, is a metalworking tool that enables a craftsperson to form compound curves from flat sheets of metal such as aluminium or steel. A metalworking tool used to form sheet metal A manually-operated metalworking apparatus used to form smooth, compound curves from flat sheets of metal.

gloss_it: Ministeriale era nel medioevo, una persona che era stata investita da singole autorità di compiti di vario genere, sia civili che militari, come l'esecuzione di lavori diversi, l'amministrazione di beni o poderi, ma anche la custodia di terre, con il connesso possesso e guardia di castelli, portando ed esercitando il mestiere delle armi.
gloss_en: The ministeriales were a class of people raised up from serfdom and placed in positions of power and responsibility in the High Middle Ages in the Holy Roman Empire. A member of a noble class in the Holy Roman Empire People raised up from serfdom to be placed in positions of power and responsibility
Liquid latex is a compound often used for special effects makeup and body painting applications.
A new, third City Hall in Copenhagen, Denmark, was built at Gammeltorv in 1479.
Sugar painting is a form of traditional Chinese folk art using hot, liquid sugar to create two dimensional objects on a marble or metal surface.
A termite shield is a sheet metal fabrication used in light frame construction to reduce the movement of termites from the soil into wood framing members such as floor joists and studs.
Computer art is any art in which computers play a role in production or display of the artwork. Art genre
The architecture of Norway has evolved in response to changing economic conditions, technological advances, demographic fluctuations and cultural shifts.

gloss_it: Il medaglione è un ornamento scultoreo o architetturale di una facciata o di un soffitto, dipinto o realizzato in bassorilievo e inscritto in una cornice circolare od ovoidale. Ornamento architetturale in forma circolare o ovale
gloss_en: A medallion is a round or oval frame that contains a sculptural or pictorial decoration on a façade, an interior, a piece of furniture or equipment. Architecture
Women in architecture have been documented for many centuries, as professional practitioners, educators and clients. Professional women
Air rights are the property interest in the "space" above the earth's surface. Type of real estate ownership right

Between 1891 and 1985 the Principal Architect of the Public Works Department was responsible for the delivery of the State Government’s public buildings capital works program throughout Western Australia. Public servant in Western Australia
A semi-detached house is a single family duplex dwelling house that shares one common wall with the next house. A type of housing A house joined to another one on one side, having one wall shared.
A turret was a small watch tower, incorporated into the curtain wall of Hadrian's Wall. Watch tower incorporated into Hadrian's Wall

A tolbooth or town house was the main municipal building of a Scottish burgh, from medieval times until the 19th century. A traditional Scottish `town hall' for the administration of burghs, usually providing a council meeting chamber, a court house and a jail The main municipal building of a Scottish burgh, from medieval times until the 19th century.

gloss_it: A partire dal Rinascimento si perfezionò un antico metodo di suonare le campane, facendolo evolvere in un sistema che, tra i tanti metodi di suono presenti nel mondo, è uno dei pochi in grado di far eseguire melodie a questi strumenti.
gloss_en: Veronese bellringing art is a style of ringing church bells that developed around Verona, Italy from the eighteenth century.

lab_en: egyptian sun temples of the 5th dynasty
gloss_it: Il tempio solare è una particolare struttura dell'architettura sacra egizia che si discosta dai canoni classici usati negli edifici di culto divino.
gloss_en: Egyptian sun temples were ancient Egyptian temples to the sun god Ra. Ancient Egyptian temples to the sun god Ra

A distinctive type of Ottoman tower houses developed and were built in the Balkans, as well as in Romania, after the Ottoman conquest in the Middle Ages by both Christian and Muslim communities. Tower houses built in the Balkans Tower houses of the Albanians, especially in Northern Albania and Kosovo

gloss_it: L'aggere è un argine, un terrapieno difensivo ottenuto ammassando del terreno a sostegno di un muro o di una fortificazione.
gloss_en: An agger is an ancient Roman embankment or any artificial elevation. A type of ancient Roman rampart or embankment In ancient Roman construction, an earthwork; a mound or raised work.

The scroll in art is an element of ornament and graphic design featuring spirals and rolling incomplete circle motifs, some of which resemble the edge-on view of a book or document in scroll form, though many types are plant-scrolls, which loosely represent plant forms such as vines, with leaves or flowers attached.
Marian columns are religious monuments depicting Virgin Mary on the top, often built in thanksgiving for the ending of a plague or for some other reason.

gloss_it: Il modio è un tipo di copricapo, o corona, a forma di cilindro con un'estremità piana, che si riscontra nell'arte egizia e in quella del mondo greco-romano.
gloss_en: The modius is a type of flat-topped cylindrical headdress or crown found in ancient Egyptian art and art of the Greco-Roman world. A type of cylindrical headdress so called for its resemblance to the measure of grain Cylyndrical Egyptian and Greco-Roman hat A bushel-shaped headdress worn by certain deities in classical art.

In art, prestezza is a painting technique that utilizes rapid brushstrokes to make impressions of faces and objects as opposed to painting them out in detail. A painting technique which uses a series of fast brushstrokes to create the impression of faces and objects, rather than working out their details.
Remains of an Iron Age building interpreted as the possible remains of a temple were excavated in Uppåkra, south of Lund in Scania, Sweden, from 2000–2004.
Tuckahoe marble is a type of marble found in southern New York state and western Connecticut. Formation of marble found in southern New York

A figure study is a drawing or painting of the human body made in preparation for a more composed or finished work; or to learn drawing and painting techniques in general and the human figure in particular.
A rectangular dolmen, extended dolmen or enlarged dolmen is a specific type of megalith, rectangular in shape, with upright sidestones and, usually, two capstones. Type of dolmen

Stadsgården commonly refers to the wharf on the shore of the Baltic Sea in Stockholm, Sweden, located between Slussen in the west and Masthamnen in the east. The word gård in the name comes from skeppsgård, which was a word used in archaic Swedish for an area used for port and dock operations.

A diagrid is a framework of diagonally intersecting metal, concrete or wooden beams that is used in the construction of buildings and roofs. framework of diagonally intersecting beams used in construction A structure, used by some buildings, which is made up of triangles formed from beams of steel or sometimes other materials.

gloss_it: Un cellarium, era uno spazio adibito a magazzino, usuale nei monasteri e nei castelli medievali.
gloss_en: A cellarium, also known as an undercroft, was a storehouse or storeroom, usually in a medieval monastery or castle. A cellar used for storage in an abbey.

gloss_it: Ordine gigante è un termine dell'architettura.
gloss_en: In Classical architecture, a giant order, also known as colossal order, is an order whose columns or pilasters span two storeys.

gloss_it: Il tondo è un'opera d'arte, costituita da un bassorilievo o da un dipinto, realizzato su un supporto di formato rotondo o all'interno di un disco, e non in un rettangolo come formato più comune. Oggetto d'arte a forma rotonda
gloss_en: A tondo is a Renaissance term for a circular work of art, either a painting or a sculpture. A Renaissance term for a circular work of art, either a painting or a sculpture A round picture or other work of art. A round work of art.
Indo-Islamic architecture is the architecture of the Indian subcontinent produced by and for Islamic patrons and purposes. Islamic architecture in India

gloss_it: La mashrabiyya è un dispositivo di ventilazione forzata naturale, frequentemente usato nell'architettura tradizionale dei Paesi arabi. Elemento architettonico dell'architettura islamica
gloss_en: A mashrabiya, also either shanshūl or rūshān, is an architectural element which is characteristic of traditional architecture in the Islamic world. Arabic architectural design element
A road church is a roadside church, one of a network of such churches in Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Finland, Norway, Russia and Sweden. Network of churches

A model release, known in similar contexts as a liability waiver, is a legal release typically signed by the subject of a photograph granting permission to publish the photograph in one form or another.

The architecture of Melbourne, the capital of the state of Victoria and second most populous city in Australia, is characterised by a wide variety of styles dating from the early years of European settlement to the present day.

gloss_it: La struttura resistente di un manufatto
gloss_en: The term structural system or structural frame in structural engineering refers to the load-resisting sub-system of a building or object. Load-resisting sub-system of a structure

A tin tabernacle, also known as an iron church, is a type of prefabricated ecclesiastical building made from corrugated galvanised iron. They were developed in the mid-19th century initially in the United Kingdom. Common name for church and related buildings made of corrugated iron A church, usually nonconformist, clad in corrugated iron.

A great room is a room inside a house that combines the roles of several more traditional rooms  A room space within an abode which combines the specific functions of several of the more traditional room spaces In many modern homes, the room that replaces the living room.
A dansker is a toilet facility, belonging to a castle, that is housed in a tower over a river or stream.
A dirnitz or Knights' Hall was the heatable area of a medieval castle.

gloss_it: Il rhytòn è un contenitore dal quale i fluidi erano destinati ad essere bevuti, o anche versati in alcune cerimonie come la libagione. Tipo di contenitore
gloss_en: A rhyton is a roughly conical container from which fluids were intended to be drunk or to be poured in some ceremony such as libation, or merely at table. Drinking horn or cup A container from which fluids are intended to be drunk, having one handle and usually a base in the form of a head.

gloss_it: Gli attributi dei santi sono le caratteristiche identificative dei vari santi, come alcune caratteristiche fisiche, i loro vestiti e determinati oggetti o animali.
gloss_en: Symbolism of Christian saints has been used from the very beginnings of the religion. Attributes, symbols, and iconography of Christian saints

gloss_it: I nuraghi sono costruzioni in pietra a forma di cono senza punta presenti con diversa concentrazione in tutta la Sardegna.
gloss_en: The nuraghe, or also nurhag in English, is the main type of ancient megalithic edifice found in Sardinia, developed during the Nuragic Age between 1900 and 730 B.C. Today it has come to be the symbol of Sardinia and its distinctive culture known as the Nuragic civilization. A type of megalithic edifice found in Sardinia, Italy Ancient type of tower common in Sardinia Dry-stone round megalithic tower found in Sardinia. Type of megalithic building.
Dampusan Kofun is a large keyhole-shaped kofun burial mound located within the grounds of the Atsuta Shrine complex in Atsuta-ku, Nagoya, Japan.
An amalaka, is a segmented or notched stone disk, usually with ridges on the rim, that sits on the top of a Hindu temple's shikhara or main tower. Stone disk on the top of a Hindu temple's main tower

gloss_it: Le pompe antincendio sono il cuore degli impianti idrici antincendio e pertanto debbono essere appositamente progettate e costruite per questo specifico utilizzo.
gloss_en: A fire pump is a part of a fire sprinkler system's water supply and powered by electric, diesel or steam. Pumps as firefighting equipment
A jaga mohan or jagamohan or jagamohana is an assembly hall in the Hindu temple architecture, especially in Orissa.

The clock gable, also known as Dutch clock gable, is a gable or facade with decorative shape characteristic of traditional Dutch architecture. A gable or facade with a decorative bell-shape, characteristic of traditional Dutch architecture. Facade with a decorative bell shape.
A perron is kind of stone column, often decorated with a cross-bearing orb common to many towns and cities belonging to the erstwhile Prince-Bishopric of Liège in modern-day Belgium.

gloss_it: Lo studio della storia dell'architettura si colloca nel tempo e nello spazio.
gloss_en: The history of architecture traces the changes in architecture through various traditions, regions, overarching stylistic trends, and dates. Field of history focused on architecture

gloss_it: Le tre lepri sono un simbolo circolare raffigurante tre lepri che si rincorrono in cerchio formando un triangolo equilatero con le loro orecchie.
gloss_en: The three hares is a circular motif or meme appearing in sacred sites from the Middle and Far East to the churches of Devon, England, and historical synagogues in Europe.
Visionary architecture is the name given to architecture which exists only on paper or which has visionary qualities.
A castle warrior was a landholder obliged to provide military services to the ispán or head of a royal castle district in the medieval Kingdom of Hungary.

gloss_it: L'arabesco è uno stile ornamentale composto da elementi calligrafici e/o motivi geometrici. Stile ornamentale, tipico dell'arte islamica Un disegno elaborato di figure floreali intrecciate o disegni geometrici complessi, principalmente utilizzati nell'arte e nell'architettura islamica.
gloss_en: The arabesque is a form of artistic decoration consisting of "surface decorations based on rhythmic linear patterns of scrolling and interlacing foliage, tendrils" or plain lines, often combined with other elements. Decorative pattern of stylized foliage, characteristic of Muslim art An elaborate design of intertwined floral figures or complex geometrical patterns, manly used in Islamic Art and architecture.
An L-plan castle is a castle or tower house in the shape of an L, typically built from the 13th to the 17th century.

gloss_it: Il tiburio è un elemento architettonico che racchiude al suo interno una cupola proteggendola. La torre nolare, all'origine era una torre che ospitava delle campane, un campanile.
gloss_en: In architecture, the lantern tower is a tall construction above the junction of the four arms of a cruciform church, with openings through which light from outside can shine down to the crossing. Architectural element A tower built over the junction of the nave and transept of a cruciform church.

Phallic architecture consciously or unconsciously creates a symbolic representation of the human penis. Archiitectural or sculptural structures that symbolically or realistically emanate the semblance with human penis

Conceptual architecture is a form of architecture that utilizes conceptualism, characterized by an introduction of ideas or concepts from outside of architecture often as a means of expanding the discipline of architecture.

gloss_it: La teoria architettonica è l'atto di pensare, discutere, o più importante scrivere di architettura.
gloss_en: Architectural theory is the act of thinking, discussing, and writing about architecture.

The word qasaba comes from the Arabic القصبة, meaning "central part of a town or citadel". single stone tower or residential tower commonly found in the provinces of Asir and al-Bahah in Saudi Arabia and Yemen
The early skyscrapers were a range of tall commercial buildings built between 1884 and 1945, predominantly in the American cities of New York City and Chicago. Oldest tall buildings
In architecture, a boss is a knob or protrusion of stone or wood. A protruding stone, often decoratively carved Architecture, a knob or protrusion of stone or wood
Hindu temples are built in the Panchayatana layout: the main shrine is surrounded by four subsidiary shrines.
The ancient Hindu temple of Changu Narayan is located on a high hilltop that is also known as Changu or Dolagiri. Another name for Vishnu Temple

gloss_it: L'opera reticolata è una tecnica edilizia romana tramite cui si realizza il paramento di un muro in opera cementizia. tecnica edilizia dell'antica civiltà romana
gloss_en: Opus reticulatum is a form of brickwork used in ancient Roman architecture. Roman masonry in diamond-shaped bricks of tuff, covering a core of opus caementicium
An equipment room is a room or space within a building for the storage or installation of mechanical or electrical/electronic devices.

Hoysala architecture is the building style in Hindu temple architecture developed under the rule of the Hoysala Empire between the 11th and 14th centuries, in the region known today as Karnataka, a state of India. Building style developed under the rule of the Hoysala Empire between the 11th and 14th centuries, in the region known today as Karnataka, in India
Beveled glass is usually made by taking thick glass and creating an angled surface cut around the entire periphery.

Novelty architecture, also called programmatic or mimetic architecture, is a type of architecture in which buildings and other structures are given unusual shapes for purposes such as advertising or to copy other famous buildings without any intention of being authentic. A building or other structure that is interesting because it has an amusing design Type of architecture copying unusual shapes for purposes of advertising or mimicry

gloss_it: Divisionismo, movimento pittorico Divisionismo, concetto giuridico. Movimento pittorico
gloss_en: The characteristic style in Neo-Impressionist painting defined by the separation of colors into individual dots or patches which interacted optically. Divisionism was the characteristic style in Neo-Impressionist painting defined by the separation of colors into individual dots or patches which interacted optically. Style in Neo-Impressionist painting, using the separation of colors into individual dots or patches which interact optically

Burdock piling is an advanced Japanese technique for building stone walls, named after the resemblance of the rough stones used to the ovate shapes of the blossoms of Japanese burdock plants. A Japanese construction technique Japanese stone-walling technique

gloss_it: La colonna tortile, detta anche Salomonica è una colonna ritorta, cioè attorcigliata in spire lungo l'asse verticale.
gloss_en: The Solomonic column, also called Barley-sugar column, is a helical column, characterized by a spiraling twisting shaft like a corkscrew.

gloss_it: Il Byōbu è un tipico paravento giapponese formato dall'unione di pannelli decorati con pitture decorative e calligrafiche, utilizzato per separare interni e delimitare spazi privati.
gloss_en: Byōbu are Japanese folding screens made from several joined panels, bearing decorative painting and calligraphy, used to separate interiors and enclose private spaces, among other uses.

gloss_it: Le espressioni di origine inglese "stencil graffiti" e "stencil art" si riferiscono a un tipo di graffiti ottenuti per mezzo di uno stencil attraverso cui viene spruzzata vernice spray.
gloss_en: Stencil graffiti is a form of graffiti that makes use of stencils made out of paper, cardboard, or other media to create an image or text that is easily reproducible.

gloss_it: Fort-la-Latte – conosciuto anche come château de la Roche Goyon – è uno dei più famosi castelli della Bretagna.
gloss_en: Fort la Latte or Castle of the Rock Goyon is a castle in the northeast of Brittany, about 4 kilometres southeast of Cap Fréhel and about 35 kilometres west of Saint-Malo, in the commune of Plévenon, Côtes-d'Armor. Castle

gloss_it: Il minbar è l'elemento della moschea che in arabo indica un pulpito che, con un numero variabile di gradini, conduce a una piattaforma, spesso sormontata da un baldacchino.
gloss_en: A minbar is a pulpit in a mosque where the imam stands to deliver sermons. Pulpit in a mosque A pulpit in a mosque, usually shaped like a small tower, where the imam stands to deliver sermons.

gloss_it: Il COA, o certificato di autenticità, è un'etichetta che può essere di diverse forme e serve ad identificare un computer contenente software autentico o con licenza OEM.
gloss_en: A certificate of authenticity is a seal or small sticker on a proprietary computer program, t-shirt, jersey, or any other memorabilia or art work, especially in the world of computers and sports. A document demonstrating that an item is as claimed

gloss_it: La gerarchia dei generi è una formalizzazione che elenca diversi generi nell'arte in termini di prestigio e valore culturale.
gloss_en: A hierarchy of genres is any formalization which ranks different genres in an art form in terms of their prestige and cultural value. Any formalization that ranks different types of art genres in an art-form in terms of their value

gloss_it: Per passaggio segreto o galleria segreta si intende un tipo di percorso, collocato in alcuni edifici o nel sottosuolo, utilizzato per fare spostamenti, fuggire da un determinato luogo, spostare oggetti o avviare attività commerciali, spesso di contrabbando, in totale segretezza.
gloss_en: Secret passages, also commonly referred to as hidden passages or secret tunnels, are hidden routes used for stealthy travel, escape, or movement of people and goods. A hidden route used for stealthy travel Hidden routes used for stealthy travel, escape, or movement of people and goods

Castle-guard was an arrangement under the feudal system, by which the duty of finding knights to guard royal castles was imposed on certain manors, knight's fees or baronies. The guard or defence of a castle.
Kesi is a technique in Chinese silk tapestry, admired for its lightness and clarity of pattern. Also Kesi, Chinese silk tapestry Technique in Chinese silk tapestry weaving

Bone carving encompasses the acts of creating art, tools, and other goods by carving animal bones, antlers, and horns. Folk art of carving designs in animal bones, teeth, horns, or antlers, or making figures or implements from these materials

lab_it: leadership in energy and environmental design
lab_en: leadership in energy and environmental design
leader in energy and environmental design
leadership in energy and environment design
gloss_it: Il sistema statunitense di classificazione dell'efficienza energetica e dell'impronta ecologica degli edifici LEED, sviluppato dallo U.S. Green Building Council, fornisce un insieme di standard di misura per valutare le costruzioni ambientalmente sostenibili. Standard Statunitense per la progettazione delle Green Building.
gloss_en: Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design is a green building certification program used worldwide. Standard for green building design
Architectural glass is glass that is used as a building material.

Visual music, sometimes called colour music, refers to the use of musical structures in visual imagery, which can also include silent films or silent Lumia work. Visual representation of music in film or other art forms

A dog-leg is a configuration of stairs between two floors of a building, often a domestic building, in which a flight of stairs ascends to a half-landing before turning at a right angle and continuing upwards. A configuration of stairs which includes a half-landing before turning and continuing upwards

gloss_it: Con architettura contemporanea si intende l'architettura prodotta odiernamente e quella degli ultimi decenni, indicativamente dagli anni ottanta ad oggi. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Contemporary architecture is the architecture of the 21st century.

lab_en: list of building information modeling software
gloss_it: Il Building Information Modeling indica un metodo per l'ottimizzazione della pianificazione, realizzazione e gestione di costruzioni tramite aiuto di un software. Modello di informazioni edilizie
gloss_en: Building information modeling is a process supported by various tools, technologies and contracts involving the generation and management of digital representations of physical and functional characteristics of places. Building Information Modeling approaches to design, construction and management of built assets

gloss_it: La villa in età romana era essenzialmente una casa di campagna. Unità produttiva dell' Impero Romano
gloss_en: A Roman villa was typically a country house for wealthy people built in the Roman Republic and the Roman Empire. Historical residential structure

gloss_it: Lo Stile revival coloniale spagnolo è uno stile architettonico degli Stati Uniti diffusosi all'inizio del XX secolo e basato sull'Architettura coloniale spagnola del periodo della colonizzazione spagnola delle Americhe.
gloss_en: The Spanish Colonial Revival Style is an architectural stylistic movement arising in the early 20th century based on the Spanish Colonial architecture of the Spanish colonization of the Americas.
The Trampe bicycle lift was invented and installed in 1993 by Jarle Wanwik.

gloss_it: La vetrificazione dei forti è un processo chimico-fisico indotto dall'alta temperatura a cui, in epoca preistorica, venivano esposti i muri in pietra delle fortificazioni sommitali europee, secondo un'usanza che si colloca nell'età del ferro nord-europea.
gloss_en: Vitrified forts are stone enclosures whose walls have been subjected to vitrification through heat.

gloss_it: Il bouleuterion [ era un edificio che ospitava il consiglio della polis nell'antica Grecia.
gloss_en: A bouleuterion, also translated as council house, assembly house, and senate house, was a building in ancient Greece which housed the council of citizens of a democratic city state. Assembly building of Ancient Greece

A figure painting is a work of fine art in any of the painting media with the primary subject being the human figure, whether clothed or nude. Realistic representation, especially of the human form Genre of painting

gloss_it: La stufa in maiolica è un particolare tipo di stufa anche detta ad accumulo, costruita in materiale refrattario e rivestita in maiolica che, a differenza delle altre stufe che scaldano l'aria, scalda per irraggiamento e funziona a biomasse legnose.
gloss_en: A masonry heater is a device for warming an interior space through radiant heating, by capturing the heat from periodic burning of fuel, and then radiating the heat at a fairly constant temperature for a long period. A device for warming an interior space through radiant heating, by capturing the heat from periodic burning of fuel (usually wood), and then radiating the heat at a fairly constant temperature for a long period.

lab_en: li tang - li tang - halls of worship
礼堂 - li tang - halls of worship
gloss_en: A temple of Confucius or Confucian temple is a temple for the veneration of Confucius and the sages and philosophers of Confucianism in Chinese folk religion and other East Asian religions. A temple for the veneration of Confucius and the sages and philosophers of Confucianism in Chinese folk religion and other East Asian religions

In Great Britain and Ireland, especially in the 18th and 19th centuries, assembly rooms were gathering places for members of the higher social classes open to members of both sexes. A gathering place in either the United Kingdom or Ireland
Coade stone or Lithodipyra or Lithodipra was stoneware that was often described as an artificial stone in the late 18th and early 19th centuries.

gloss_it: Una rosetta è un motivo ornamentale costituito da un fiore stilizzato, usato molto nell'antichità in opere scolpite, comparso in Mesopotamia e utilizzato nelle stele funerarie nell'antica Grecia.
gloss_en: A rosette is a round, stylized flower design. A small flower design A cluster of leaves arising from a common point resembling the arrangement of petals in a rose, ranging in form from a hemispherical tuft to a flat whorl

gloss_it: La stampa all'albume è un tipo di stampa fotografica introdotta nel 1850 da Louis Désiré Blanquart-Evrard.
gloss_en: The albumen print, also called albumen silver print, was published in January 1847 by Louis Désiré Blanquart-Evrard, and was the first commercially exploitable method of producing a photographic print on a paper base from a negative.

An artist-run space is a gallery or other facility operated or directed by artists, frequently circumventing the structures of public art centers, museums, or commercial galleries and allowing for a more experimental program.

Displacement ventilation It is a room air distribution strategy where conditioned outdoor air is supplied at a low velocity from air supply diffusers located near floor level and extracted above the occupied zone, usually at ceiling height.

gloss_it: L'architettura rinascimentale è quella fase dell'architettura italiana che si sviluppò dal 1420 alla metà del XVI secolo, con il ritorno alla vita dell'antichità classica. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Renaissance architecture is the European architecture of the period between the early 14th and early 16th centuries in different regions, demonstrating a conscious revival and development of certain elements of ancient Greek and Roman thought and material culture. Architectural style
Scenic design is the creation of theatrical, as well as film or television scenery. Person who designs the visual environment of the stage in a play or opera

gloss_it: Le strutture iperboloidi sono strutture architettoniche disegnate con una geometria iperbolica.
gloss_en: Hyperboloid structures are architectural structures designed using a hyperboloid in one sheet. Architectural structure in the shape of a partial hyperboloid

American craft is craft work produced by independent studio artists, working with traditional craft materials and/or processes such as wood, woodworking or furniture making, glass or glassblowing, clay or ceramics, textiles, metal or metalworking. craft work produced by independent studio artists

gloss_it: Il Palazzo Esterházy o Castello di Eszterháza è un palazzo situato nella città di Fertőd, in Ungheria.
gloss_en: Esterházy is a palace in Fertőd, Hungary, built by Prince Nikolaus Esterházy. Château

gloss_it: Casa energetica è un termine utilizzato per definire un'unità abitativa con alte prestazioni energetiche, grazie a caratteristiche costruttive, tipologiche ed impiantistiche finalizzate al risparmio energetico e alla riduzione di emissione di CO2.
gloss_en: A zero-energy building, also known as a zero net energy building, net-zero energy building, net zero building is a building with zero net energy consumption, meaning the total amount of energy used by the building on an annual basis is equal to the amount of renewable energy created on the site, or in other definitions by renewable energy sources offsite, using technology such as heat pumps, high efficiency windows and insulation, and solar panels. Energy efficiency standard for buildings

Kanazōshi describes a type of printed Japanese book that was produced primarily in Kyoto between 1600 and 1680. ("kana books") genre of Japanese books produced primarily in Kyoto between 1600 and 1680

gloss_it: La ghorfa è una tipologia di edificio propria dell'architettura berbera del sud della Tunisia.
gloss_en: A ghorfa is a vaulted room used by Berbers for storing grain. Room in a ksar

gloss_it: Una mansio, in età imperiale, era una stazione di posta lungo una strada romana, gestita dal governo centrale e messa a disposizione di dignitari, ufficiali, o di chi viaggiasse per ragioni di stato.
gloss_en: In the Roman Empire, a mansio was an official stopping place on a Roman road, or via, maintained by the central government for the use of officials and those on official business whilst travelling.

gloss_it: Triforio è il termine architettonico che indica una galleria ricavata nello spessore murario, posta sotto le finestre del cleristorio e situata sopra le navate laterali di una chiesa mediante una teoria di loggette.
gloss_en: A triforium is an interior gallery, opening onto the tall central space of a building at an upper level. area of a church or cathedral

gloss_it: Il tatami è una tradizionale pavimentazione giapponese composta da pannelli rettangolari modulari, costruiti con un telaio di legno o altri materiali rivestito da paglia intrecciata e pressata.
gloss_en: A tatami is a type of mat used as a flooring material in traditional Japanese-style rooms. A flooring material in traditional Japan, often of woven rush Type of mat Straw matting, in a standard size, used as a floor covering in Japanese houses. Straw matting in Japanese houses.

gloss_it: Il dolmen di Poulnabrone è un antico dolmen situato nel Burren, in Irlanda.
gloss_en: Poulnabrone dolmen is an unusually large dolmen or portal tomb located in the Burren, County Clare, Ireland. Dolmen in Ireland

gloss_it: Le terme romane erano edifici pubblici dotati di impianti che oggi chiameremmo igienico-sanitari. Edifici pubblici per il bagno e altre attività nell'antica Roma
gloss_en: In ancient Rome, thermae and balneae were facilities for bathing. The building that housed ancient Roman public baths

A "Ring of bells" is the name bell ringers give to a set of bells hung for English full circle ringing. Arrangement of percussion instruments optimized for swinging in a circle to create peals A set of large bells of English origin, played by means of a wheel that moves each bell in a nearly 360-degree arc.
Static trapeze, also known as fixed trapeze, is a type of circus art performed on the trapeze.
The fortifications of Portsmouth are extensive due to its strategic position on the English Channel and role as home to the Royal Navy.

Megastructure is an architectural and urban concept of the post-war eras which envisions a city or an urban form that could be encased in a massive single man-made structure or a relatively small number of interconnected structures. A concept where a city or large settlement can be housed in one building

Industrial style or industrial chic refers to an aesthetic trend in interior design that takes clues from old factories and industrial spaces that in recent years have been converted to lofts and other living spaces. 21st-century aesthetic trend in interior design

gloss_it: struttura architettonica intesa per un uso collegato alla religione
gloss_en: Sacral architecture is a religious architectural practice concerned with the design and construction of places of worship or sacred or intentional space, such as churches, mosques, stupas, synagogues, and temples. The creation of sacred spaces Architectural practices used in places of worship building intended for religious worship or other activities related to a religion; ceremonial structures that are related to or concerned with religion

A stick-built home is a wooden house constructed entirely or largely on-site; that is, built on the site which it is intended to occupy upon its completion rather than in a factory or similar facility.

The cultural and artistic events of Italy during the period 1500 to 1599 are collectively referred to as the Cinquecento, from the Italian for the number 500, in turn from millecinquecento, which is Italian for the year 1500. The Renaissance in literature and art in the sixteenth century The 16th century as a period of Italian art, architecture, or literature
Pre-Romanesque architecture in Asturias is framed between the years 711 and 910, the period of the creation and expansion of the kingdom of Asturias.
The period of the imperial Cholas was an age of continuous improvement and refinement of Dravidian art and architecture. Period of the imperial Cholas (c. 850 CE - 1250 CE) in South India

Mixed-use development is a term used for two related concepts: In the sense of mixed-use zoning or mixed-use planning, it is a type of urban development, urban planning and/or a zoning type that blends residential, commercial, cultural, institutional, or entertainment uses into one space, where those functions are to some degree physically and functionally integrated, and that provides pedestrian connections. Development which blends a combination of residential, commercial, cultural, institutional, or industrial uses

A war memorial is a building, monument, statue or other edifice to celebrate a war or victory, or to commemorate those who died or were injured in a war. An edifice to commemorate those who died, or were injured, in war Memorial for the fallen soldiers of a war A monument to commemorate the people who were killed in a particular war. Commemorial monument.

gloss_it: Per avancorpo si intende la parte di una costruzione che sporge in avanti rispetto al corpo dell'edificio.
gloss_en: An avant-corps, a French term literally meaning "fore-body", is a part of a building, such as a porch or pavilion, that juts out from the corps de logis, often taller than other parts of the building. Part of a building protruding from the alignment of a building structure

gloss_it: Il paliotto è la parte anteriore di un altare oppure un pannello decorativo che può essere posto a rivestimento dello stesso.
gloss_en: An antependium, also known as a parament or hanging, or, when speaking specifically of the hanging for the altar, an altar frontal, is a decorative piece, usually of textile, but also metalwork, stone or other material that can adorn a Christian altar. Decorative piece, usually of textile, but also metalwork, stone or other material that can adorn a Christian altar.

An air-supported structure is any building that derives its structural integrity from the use of internal pressurized air to inflate a pliable material envelope, so that air is the main support of the structure, and where access is via airlocks.
The Lakshmi Devi temple is located in Doddagaddavalli, a village in Hassan District of Karnataka state, India.
Bastel, bastle, or bastille houses are a type of construction found along the Anglo-Scottish border, in the areas formerly plagued by border Reivers.

gloss_it: L'high-tech è uno stile architettonico sviluppatosi negli anni settanta.
gloss_en: High-tech architecture, also known as Structural Expressionism, is a type of Late Modern architectural style that emerged in the 1970s, incorporating elements of high tech industry and technology into building design.

To comply with the Building Act 1984 and the subsequent statutory instruments known as the Building Regulations, Building regulations approval is required to construct certain structures in England and Wales.

A licked finish is a hallmark of French academic art. It refers to the process of smoothing the surface quality of a painting so that the presence of the artist's hand is no longer visible. Process of smoothing the surface quality of a painting so that the presence of the artist's hand is no longer visible; codified by the French Academy in the eighteenth century in order to distinguish 'professional' art from that produced by amateurs

gloss_it: Il crescent, dall'inglese "mezzaluna", indica una serie di unità immobiliari disposte a schiera, a formare un blocco unitario lungo un perimetro semicircolare, in genere aperto verso la campagna; la parola è anche traducibile come "strada a esedra".
gloss_en: A crescent is an architectural structure where a number of houses, normally terraced houses, are laid out in an arc to form a crescent shape. An architectural structure where a number of houses are laid out in an arc to form of a crescent shape Architectural structure; multiple terraced houses arranged in a curve
In the southwestern United States, a ramada is a temporary or permanent shelter equipped with a roof but no walls, or only partially enclosed. open-sided shelter

gloss_it: L'hennin è un antico copricapo femminile a forma di cono allungato, associato generalmente alle fate delle fiabe.
gloss_en: The hennin was a headdress in the shape of a cone, steeple, or truncated cone worn in the late Middle Ages by European women of the nobility. Medieval women's headgear A headdress in the shape of a cone, "steeple" or truncated cone worn by European women of the nobility in medieval times. Medieval headgear.
The Franklin stove is a metal-lined fireplace named after Benjamin Franklin, who invented it in 1741. Type of fireplace

gloss_it: Si definisce giardino verticale una parete coltivata con piante specifiche.
gloss_en: A green wall is a vertical greening typology, where a vertical built structure is intentionally covered by vegetation. Form of building greening A wall covered by greenery.

In the controlled demolition industry, building implosion is the strategic placing of explosive material and timing of its detonation so that a structure collapses on itself in a matter of seconds, minimizing the physical damage to its immediate surroundings. Method of building demolition

gloss_it: Una chiesa palizzata è una chiesa costruita con palizzate, ceppi di legno strutturale tagliati per il lungo, piantati nel terreno, nella ghiaia o sopra una piattaforma.
gloss_en: A palisade church is a church building that is constructed with palisade walls, standing split logs of timber, rammed into the ground, set in gravel or resting on a sill.

In architecture, a spur is the ornament carved on the angles of the base of early columns. The ornament carved on the angles of the bases of early columns A projection from the round base of a column, occupying the angle of a square plinth upon which the base rests, or bringing the bottom bed of the base to a nearly square form. It is generally carved in leafage.

A Bismarck tower is a specific type of monument built according to a more or less standard model across Germany to honour its first chancellor, Otto von Bismarck Towers built in honor of Otto Bismarck
Wearable art, also known as Artwear or "art to wear", refers to individually designed pieces of handmade clothing or jewellery created as fine or expressive art.

gloss_it: Lo shachihoko o shachi è un animale del folklore giapponese con la testa da tigre e il corpo da carpa.
gloss_en: A shachihoko – or simply shachi – is an animal in Japanese folklore with the head of a tiger and the body of a carp. Japanese mythological creature

gloss_it: Suiseki è l'arte giapponese di disporre pietre trovate in natura ed aventi un aspetto particolare in una maniera che sia gradevole e in grado di favorire la meditazione.
gloss_en: In traditional Japanese culture, suiseki are small naturally occurring or shaped rocks which are appreciated for their aesthetic or decorative value. Art A Japanese artform in which attractively shaped rocks and stones are mounted and displayed.
Jogyesa is the chief temple of the Jogye Order of Korean Buddhism.

Precast concrete is a construction product produced by casting concrete in a reusable mold or "form" which is then cured in a controlled environment, transported to the construction site and lifted into place. Or precast reinforced concrete, a material used in prefabricated buildings

A kissing gate is a type of gate which allows people to pass through, but not livestock. Type of gate A small gate, used instead of a stile at the boundary of a field, that swings in a U- or V-shaped enclosure and touches (kisses) each of two gateposts, allowing one person at a time to pass through.

gloss_it: Un parterre è un giardino realizzato su una superficie piana, costituita da aiuole, tipicamente in modelli simmetrici, separate e collegate da sentieri di ghiaia.
gloss_en: A parterre is a formal garden constructed on a level substrate, consisting of plant beds, typically in symmetrical patterns, which are separated and connected by paths. Formal garden constructed on a level surface, consisting of planting beds arranged to form a pleasing, usually symmetrical pattern, with gravel paths laid between
A sugar-baker was the owner of a sugar house, a factory for the refining of raw sugar from Barbados.

gloss_it: La bombarda era un pezzo d'artiglieria a tiro parabolico, inizialmente costruito con verghe prismatiche di ferro battuto disposte come le doghe delle botti e poi saldate e rinforzate con cerchi di ferro cui si dava la forma cilindrica saldandone poi gli orli. Un tipo particolare di bocca da fuoco. Pezzo d'artiglieria a tiro parabolico
gloss_en: The bombard is a type of cannon or mortar which was used throughout the Middle Ages and the early modern period. A type of late -- medieval siege weapon. Cannon A medieval primitive cannon, used chiefly in sieges for throwing heavy stone balls. Medieval primitive cannon.

gloss_it: Un pujari o archaka è un sacerdote induista che officia nei templi.
gloss_en: Pūjari or archaka is a designation given to a Hindu temple priest who performs pūja. Someone who performs a puja, especially a priest in a Hindu temple.

Lustron houses are prefabricated enameled steel houses developed in the post-World War II era United States in response to the shortage of homes for returning GIs by Chicago industrialist and inventor Carl Strandlund.

An art manifesto is a public declaration of the intentions, motives, or views of an artist or artistic movement. Recurrent feature associated with the avant-garde in Modernism Public declaration of the intentions, motives, or views of an artist or artistic movement

gloss_it: I broch sono costruzioni megalitiche, risalenti all'età del ferro, diffuse nella Scozia settentrionale e nelle Isole Orcadi.
gloss_en: A broch is an Iron Age drystone hollow-walled structure found in Scotland. A type of Iron Age drystone hollow-walled structure found in Scotland. Type of Iron Age drystone hollow-walled structure

gloss_it: Il décollage è una tecnica artistica che consiste nel procedimento opposto al collage per cui, invece di aggiungere degli elementi all'opera, si parte da un oggetto artistico dal quale vengono staccate delle parti.
gloss_en: Décollage, in art, is the opposite of collage; instead of an image being built up of all or parts of existing images, it is created by cutting, tearing away or otherwise removing, pieces of an original image. Art genre The opposite of collage: the process of cutting, tearing, etc. an original image to produce a new work.

Jerusalem stone is a name applied to various types of pale limestone, dolomite and dolomitic limestone, common in and around Jerusalem that have been used in building since ancient times. Wikimedia list article
In Japan, a tōrō is a traditional lantern made of stone, wood, or metal. A Japanese traditional lantern, originally from China Traditional Japanese lantern
A serpentine shape is any of certain curved shapes of an object or design, which are suggestive of the shape of a snake. An object with sinuous geometry

A retablo is a devotional painting, especially a small popular or folk art one using iconography derived from traditional Catholic church art. Historic reredos in Spain, votive paintings of Mexican folk art

gloss_it: L'Hallenkirche o chiesa a sala è una particolare tipologia relativa alla costruzione delle chiese nella quale la navata centrale è alta quanto le navate laterali, o di poco più alta, contrariamente a quanto si riscontra nella prevalente tipologia basilicale.
gloss_en: A hall church is a church with nave and side aisles of approximately equal height, often united under a single immense roof. Type of church building

gloss_it: L'effetto camino è un fenomeno fisico di convogliamento di gas verso l'esterno di una struttura o di un'apparecchiatura che si basa sulla dilatazione dei gas prodotta dal loro riscaldamento e dal conseguente stabilirsi di una differenza di densità e di pressione tra il punto più basso e il punto più alto.
gloss_en: Stack effect or chimney effect is the movement of air into and out of buildings, chimneys, flue-gas stacks, or other containers, resulting from air buoyancy. The phenomenon of air buoyancy leading to the movement of air into and out of buildings, chimneys, etc., which may drive natural ventilation, air infiltration, and fires.
The Buddhist monastic education system facilitates basic educational needs of the Asian Buddhist countries before the contemporary era.
Slipform stonemasonry is a method for making a reinforced concrete wall with stone facing in which stones and mortar are built up in courses within reusable slipforms.
An almshouse is charitable housing provided to people in a particular community. Charitable housing

gloss_it: Il koilon o cavea è l'insieme delle gradinate di un anfiteatro o di un teatro classico, dove prendevano posto gli spettatori per assistere alle rappresentazioni, ai giochi, o ad altri intrattenimenti.
gloss_en: In Roman times the cavea referred to the seating sections of Roman theatres and amphitheatres. seating sections of historical Roman theatres and amphitheatres

gloss_it: L'architettura carolingia si sviluppò a partire dalle fortune dei sovrani franchi prima della dinastia dei Pipinidi, chiamata poi dinastia carolingia in onore di Carlo Magno.
gloss_en: Carolingian architecture is the style of north European Pre-Romanesque architecture belonging to the period of the Carolingian Renaissance of the late 8th and 9th centuries, when the Carolingian dynasty dominated west European politics. A type of architecture

gloss_it: L'architettura neorinascimentale è una corrente che si sviluppò a partire dal XIX secolo, parallelamente al Neoclassicismo e al Neogotico, riprendendo l'apparato formale dell'architettura rinascimentale.
gloss_en: An all-encompassing designation that covers many 19th century architectural revival styles which were neither Grecian nor Gothic but which instead drew inspiration from a wide range of classicizing Italian modes. Renaissance Revival architecture is a group of 19th century architectural revival styles which were neither Greek Revival nor Gothic Revival but which instead drew inspiration from a wide range of classicizing Italian modes. Branch of 19th-century architectural revival style
Cuban infrastructure is significant and includes: massive Spanish fortifications built in principal ports.
The architecture of Philadelphia is a mix of historic and modern styles that reflect the city's history.

gloss_it: Il marmo di Carrara è un tipo di marmo che è estratto dalle cave delle Alpi Apuane in territorio di Carrara, universalmente noto come uno dei marmi più pregiati. Tipo di marmo prezioso utilizzato per sculture e decorazioni di edifici.
gloss_en: Carrara marble is a type of white or blue-grey marble popular for use in sculpture and building decor. A type of white or blue-grey structural marble Type of white or blue-grey marble popular for use in sculpture and building decor
Venezuelan art, from the country Venezuela in South America, has a long and eventful history.

gloss_it: Le piramidi greche, conosciute anche come piramidi dell'Argolide, sono strutture situate nella piana Argolide, in Grecia. Strutture piramidali antiche situate in Grecia
gloss_en: Greek pyramids, also known as the Pyramids of Argolis, refers to several ancient structures located in the plains of Argolid, Greece. Ancient structures located in the plains of Argolid, Greece

gloss_it: Il Regency è uno stile architettonico che si riferisce principalmente alle costruzioni inglesi del periodo dei primissimi anni del XIX secolo quando il principe Giorgio del Galles venne nominato principe reggente per conto del padre Giorgio III del Regno Unito.
gloss_en: Regency architecture encompasses classical buildings built in the United Kingdom during the Regency era in the early 19th century when George IV was Prince Regent, and also to earlier and later buildings following the same style. The architecture of the period

A santo is a piece of one of various religious art forms found in Spain and areas that were colonies of the Kingdom of Spain, consisting of wooden or ivory statues that depict various saints, angels, or Marian titles, or one of the personages of the Holy Trinity. Religious and folk artform. Wooden or ivory statues that depict saints, angels
The greenhouse of a car comprises the windshield, rear and side windows, the pillars separating them, and the car's roof.

gloss_it: Un frangisole, o spesso chiamato in francese brise-soleil è un elemento d'architettura atto a proteggere dal diretto soleggiamento facciate di edifici o ambienti interni, al fine di evitarne il surriscaldamento, soprattutto in estate su edifici con grandi quantità di vetro e metalli.
gloss_en: Brise soleil, sometimes brise-soleil, is an architectural feature of a building that reduces heat gain within that building by deflecting sunlight. Architectural feature that reduces heat gain within a building by deflecting sunlight A type of structural sunshade with slats, holes, etc, to keep sunlight from striking fully on a building. Structural sunshade.

lab_en: international high plateau festivities of kumbet
international high plateau festivities of kuembet
international high plateau festivities of kümbet
gloss_en: In traditional Persian architecture, a dome is referred to as a gonbad. Dome in traditional Persian architecture

gloss_it: Il saḥn,, è una corte tipica dell'architettura delle moschee.
gloss_en: A sahn, is a courtyard in Islamic architecture, especially the formal courtyard of a mosque. Courtyard in Islamic architecture
Kasota limestone or simply, Kasota stone, also called Mankato stone, is a dolomitic limestone found in southern Minnesota, especially near the Minnesota River and its tributaries.
A clochán, or beehive hut, is a dry-stone hut with a corbelled roof, commonly associated with the south-western Irish seaboard. Dry stone hut in Ireland

gloss_it: Una fortezza su promontorio è una struttura difensiva situata su una ripida scogliera, spesso unita alla terraferma solo grazie ad uno stretto lembo di terra, e che sfrutta quindi la topografia per ridurre la quantità di bastioni necessari.
gloss_en: A promontory fort is a defensive structure located above a steep cliff, often only connected to the mainland by a small neck of land, thus using the topography to reduce the ramparts needed. Mainly Iron Age Fortification, usually dating from the Iron Age
This refers to a pagoda containing the relics of Dabo Yeorae. Pagoda located in Bulguk Temple in Gyeongju, South Korea

Leading lights are a pair of light beacons, used in navigation to indicate a safe passage for vessels entering a shallow or dangerous channel; and may also be used for position fixing. Light beacons used for watercraft navigation in a shallow or dangerous channel or as position fixing

A portable, demountable or transportable building is a building designed and built to be movable rather than permanently located. A manufactured structure that is built off site and moved in upon completion of site and utility work

A light characteristic is a graphic and text description of a navigational light sequence or colour displayed on a nautical chart or in a Light List with the chart symbol for a lighthouse, lightvessel, buoy or sea mark with a light on it. Pattern of a lighted beacon Navigational light sequence or colour displayed on a nautical chart or in a Light List with the chart symbol for a lighthouse, lightvessel, buoy or sea mark with a light on it.
Truth to materials is a tenet of modern architecture, which holds that any material should be used where it is most appropriate and its nature should not be hidden.
A Tower telescope is a telescope with a large refraction length at which the tube is installed inside a tower.

lab_it: chiesa san nicolò dei greci alla martorana
lab_en: co-cathedral of st. mary of the admiral
gloss_it: La chiesa di Santa Maria dell'Ammiraglio, sede della parrocchia di San Nicolò “dei Greci” e nota come Martorana, è ubicata nel centro storico di Palermo. Chiesa a Palermo
gloss_en: The Church of St. Mary of the Admiral, also called Martorana, is the seat of the Parish of San Nicolò dei Greci, overlooking the Piazza Bellini in Palermo, Sicily, southern Italy. Church in Palermo, Italy
Maya architecture spans several thousands of years, several eras of political change, and architectural innovation before the Spanish colonization of the Americas. Architecture style

gloss_it: Una biblioteca Carnegie è una biblioteca costruita con i soldi donati dall'uomo d'affari e filantropo scozzese Andrew Carnegie.
gloss_en: A Carnegie library is a library built with money donated by Scottish-American businessman and philanthropist Andrew Carnegie. Libraries built with money donated by Scottish-American businessman and philanthropist Andrew Carnegie: 2,509 Carnegie libraries were built between 1883 and 1929 One of several libraries built with money donated by Andrew Carnegie sometime between 1883 and 1929.

gloss_it: La religione maya è quell'insieme di credenze politeiste, con una storia di più di 3000 anni, della civiltà maya precolombiana.
gloss_en: The traditional Maya religion of the extant Maya peoples of Guatemala, Belize, western Honduras, and the Tabasco, Chiapas, and Yucatán states of Mexico is part of the wider frame of Mesoamerican religion. The religious practices of the Maya peoples of parts of Mexico and Central America Beliefs of the ancient Maya people
A diamond vault is a form of vault church architecture used in the Late Gothic and Renaissance style, which is based on an elaborate system of cavernous vaults in a manner resembling diamonds.

An outstation, homeland or homeland community is a very small, often remote, permanent community of Aboriginal Australian people connected by kinship, on land that often, but not always, has social, cultural or economic significance to them, as traditional land.

gloss_it: L'architettura neomoresca è stata una tendenza artistica, all'interno di una più vasta tendenza delle arti verso l'Orientalismo e il Revivalismo in voga tra Ottocento e primo Novecento in Europa e negli Stati Uniti, ispirata all'architettura islamica.
gloss_en: Moorish Revival or Neo-Moorish is one of the exotic revival architectural styles that were adopted by architects of Europe and the Americas in the wake of the Romanticist fascination with all things oriental. Style in 19th-century European architecture and decorative arts characterized by Hispano-Moresque forms and motifs such as honey comb vaulting, arabesques, and horseshoe arches

gloss_it: Progettazione di gruppi di edifici, insediamenti, quartieri e spazi pubblici
gloss_en: Urban design is the process of designing and shaping the physical features of cities, towns, and villages and planning for the provision of municipal services to residents and visitors. Process of designing and shaping cities, towns and villages A plan, outline or preliminary sketch of, or for, a city or town.
Neo-Baroque architectural style of many public buildings built in the British Empire during the Edwardian era

gloss_it: Lo Stile Jeffersoniano è il nome alla tipica architettura neoclassica e neopalladiana americana incarnata dai disegni architettonici del presidente statunitense Thomas Jefferson, a cui appunto questo stile deve il nome.
gloss_en: Jeffersonian architecture is an American form of Neo-Classicism and/or Neo-Palladianism embodied in the architectural designs of U.S. President and polymath Thomas Jefferson, after whom it is named.

Black is beautiful is a cultural movement that was started in the United States in the 1960s by African Americans. A cultural movement that began in the United States of America in the 1960s by African Americans Cultural movement started in the USA in the 1960s by African Americans

gloss_it: Gli allineamenti di Carnac sono tra i complessi megalitici più estesi al mondo.
gloss_en: The Carnac stones are an exceptionally dense collection of megalithic sites in Brittany in northwestern France, consisting of stone alignments, dolmens, tumuli and single menhirs. Collection of monolithic sites around the village Stone rows in Carnac, France

lab_en: exposition internationale coloniale, maritime et d'art flamand
international exhibition of rubber and other tropical products
united states, colonial and international exposition
indo china exposition française et internationale
indo china exposition francaise et internationale
gloss_en: A colonial exhibition was a type of international exhibition that was held to boost trade. Type of exhibition held to promote colonial empires
