A buitenplaats was a summer residence for rich townspeople in the Netherlands.

gloss_it: La Spagna ha prodotto molti artisti famosi e influenti, tra cui Velázquez, Goya e Picasso.
gloss_en: Spanish art has been an important contributor to Western art and Spain has produced many famous and influential artists including Velázquez, Goya and Picasso. Especially Spanish painting History of art of Spain from Ancient Iberia to the present

A roofbox is a specially contrived opening above a doorway, usually built for some astronomical significant event. A specially contrived opening above a doorway, usually aligned to mark an astronomical event.

gloss_it: Deva è il termine indù per la divinità; devata, sono una sorta di piccoli deva più mirati.
gloss_en: Deva is the Buddhist and Hindu term for deity; however, devata is a smaller, more focused deva. hindu term for deity

lab_en: high ozone shock treatment for mold remediation
gloss_en: High ozone shock treatment or ozone blasting is a process for removing unwanted odour, and killing mold, vermin and microorganisms in commercial and residential buildings.
Landshövdingehus is a building type unique to the Swedish city of Gothenburg. building in Gothenburg Municipality, Gothenburg and Bohus County, Sweden
Octagon houses were a unique house style briefly popular in the 1850s in the United States and Canada. The type of design in general

gloss_it: Per architettura neoegizia si intende uno stile architettonico che usa motivi e immagini relativi all'antico Egitto. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Egyptian Revival is an architectural style that uses the motifs and imagery of ancient Egypt. It is attributed generally to the public awareness of ancient Egyptian monuments generated by Napoleon's conquest of Egypt and Admiral Nelson's defeat of the French Navy at the Battle of the Nile in 1798. Architectural style

lab_en: stocks golf resort hotel and health spa
gloss_en: Stocks manor house is a large Georgian mansion, built in 1773. A mansion in Hertfordshire, England Georgian mansion in the village of Aldbury, Hertfordshire

gloss_it: Un portale in architettura è una porta monumentale di un edificio, che generalmente dà all'esterno. porta monumentale di un edificio
gloss_en: A portal is an opening in a wall of a building, gate or fortification, especially a grand entrance to an important structure. An opening in the walls of a structure
A Stobie pole is a power line pole made of two steel joists held apart by a slab of concrete. Power line pole made of two steel joists separated by concrete
In Gothic architecture, a lierne is a tertiary rib connecting one rib to another, as opposed to connecting to a springer, or to the central boss. Architectural term for an element of a vault

gloss_it: La fibula di Bülach è una fibula d'argento di forma circolare, con decorazioni in almandino, rinvenuta a Bülach, Canton Zurigo, nel 1927.
gloss_en: The Bülach fibula is a silver disk-type fibula with almandine inlay found in Bülach, Canton Zürich in 1927.
Stone veneer is a thin layer of any stone used as decorative facing material that is not meant to be load bearing. A thin facing layer of stone Thin sheets of stone applied as a decorative surface
EcoHomes was founded in 2004 by Conor Vanderlip.

gloss_it: Raubritter è un'espressione coniata in tempi moderni, il cui utilizzo fa riferimento a una presunta categoria di esponenti della classe cavalleresca medievale che nel Tardo medioevo germanico si sarebbero ridotti alla pratica abituale del banditismo, di rapine di strada, faide e saccheggi, quale conseguenza della marginalizzazione del loro ruolo in un'epoca di notevoli trasformazioni sociali ed economiche e di grandi progressi intervenuti nella tecnica militare medievale. Cavalieri predoni, utilizzato, in passato, come paradigma storico per designare una presunta classe cavalleresca del Tardo medioevo germanico, dedita a ruberie e banditismi s
gloss_en: A robber baron or robber knight was an unscrupulous feudal landowner who, protected by his fief's legal status, imposed high taxes and tolls out of keeping with the norm without authorization by some higher authority. German nobles who levied illegal tolls in the twelfth and thirteenth centuries Historic term and title of disdain applied to the behavior and practices of a purported group of unscrupulous and despotic landowners (nobles) in the medieval Europe

gloss_it: La torre Beograđanka, in serbo cirillico Београђанка, è un grattacielo situato nel centro della città di Belgrado, capitale della Serbia.
gloss_en: Beograđanka, officially Belgrade Palace is a modern high-rise building in the Belgrade downtown area.

gloss_it: La tegola canadese è un tipo di manto di copertura, composta da strati di diversi materiali inorganici, e impermeabilizzata attraverso l'applicazione di bitume, e, in alcuni casi, con la parte esterna ricoperta da ardesia.
gloss_en: An asphalt shingle is a type of wall or roof shingle that uses asphalt for waterproofing. Type of shingle A shingle manufactured by coating a reinforcing material (felt or fibrous glass mat) with asphalt and having mineral granules on the side exposed to the weather.
A porters' lodge or porter's lodge is a place near the entrance of a building where one or more porters can be found to respond to enquiries from the public and direct them around the building.

gloss_it: Una muratura a ciottoli è un particolare tipo di muro costruito con ciottoli rotondi di selce o altre pietre, cementati insieme tramite l'uso di malta.
gloss_en: A boulder wall, also spelled boulder-walls or bowlder-wall, is a kind of wall built of round flints and pebbles, laid in a strong mortar.
It is said by some that, underneath the streets of the town of Northampton in England, there remains a labyrinth of tunnels, along with many cellars and ancient crypts from the past.

The Brno chair is a modernist cantilever chair designed by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe and Lilly Reich in 1929-1930 for the bedroom of the Tugendhat House in Brno, Czech Republic. Chair designed by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe and Lilly Reich

A bressummer, breastsummer, summer beam are load bearing beams in a timber framed building. A beam used in building construction A large, horizontal supporting beam which bears the weight of a wall starting on a first or higher floor. Particularly found in timber-frame overhang constructions.

gloss_it: La poltrona Tugendhat è una poltrona a sbalzo modernista progettata da Ludwig Mies van der Rohe nel 1929-1930 per la Villa Tugendhat a Brno, in Cecoslovacchia.
gloss_en: The Tugendhat chair is a modernist cantilever chair designed by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe in collaboration with Lilly Reich 1929-1930 for the Tugendhat House in Brno, Czechoslovakia. Chair designed by Mies van der Rohe

lab_en: colored lights that provide a weather forecast
gloss_en: A weather beacon is a beacon that indicates the local weather forecast in a code of colored or flashing lights.
Structural building components are specialized structural building products designed, engineered and manufactured under controlled conditions for a specific application.

gloss_it: Con il termine Unité d'Habitation si indica un complesso progetto residenziale e urbanistico ideato dall'architetto svizzero Le Corbusier. Progetto residenziale e urbanistico ideato dall'architetto svizzero Le Corbusier
gloss_en: The Unité d'habitation is a modernist residential housing design principle developed by Le Corbusier, with the collaboration of painter-architect Nadir Afonso. Modernist residential housing design principle developed by Le Corbusier, with the collaboration of painter-architect Nadir Afonso

gloss_it: L'adyton era, nell'architettura dei templi greci e romani, uno spazio riservato agli officianti del culto per funzioni specifiche, per lo più religiose.
gloss_en: The adyton or adytum was a restricted area within the cella of a Greek or Roman temple.
A gesture drawing is a laying in of the action, form, and pose of a model/figure. Drawing technique for capturing the position of figures

gloss_it: La storia della Sardegna riguarda le vicende storiche relative all'isola della Sardegna. Aspetto della storia d'Italia
gloss_en: Archaeological evidence of prehistoric human settlement on the island of Sardinia is present in the form of nuraghes and other prehistoric monuments, which dot the land.

gloss_it: Nel diritto consuetudinario del Regno d'Inghilterra, il caput baroniae era la sede principale o il castello di un nobile che non sarebbe stata divisa con le figlie a seguito della sua morte in caso mancasse un figlio maschio.
gloss_en: In the customs of the kingdom of England, the caput baroniae was the ancient, or chief seat or castle of a nobleman, which was not to be divided among the daughters upon his death, in case there be no son to inherit.

gloss_it: Il primo luogo scenico del teatro medievale del quale ci sono giunte notizie è la chiesa.
gloss_en: Medieval theatre encompasses theatrical performance in the period between the fall of the Western Roman Empire in the 5th century and the beginning of the Renaissance in approximately the 15th century.

gloss_it: Basilica maggiore è il titolo dato alle quattro chiese cattoliche di più alto rango: la basilica di San Giovanni in Laterano, la basilica di San Pietro in Vaticano, la basilica di San Paolo fuori le mura e la basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore.
gloss_en: Title given to the four highest-ranking Roman Catholic churches
Opus emplectum is an advanced roman construction technique.

Reverse perspective, also called inverse perspective, inverted perspective, divergent perspective, or Byzantine perspective, is a form of perspective drawing in which the objects depicted in a scene are placed between the projective point and the viewing plane.
A church monument is an architectural or sculptural memorial to a deceased person or persons, located within a Christian church.

gloss_it: L'infisso è il telaio su cui sono fissate le parti apribili, dette ante o partite, di finestre, porte ecc., oppure i vetri o i pannelli di un serramento non apribile. Cornice decorativa di porta, spesso con un elemento di legno sopra; più raramente anche per finestre e caminetti Fascia decorativa che delimita una porta, una finestra, un mobile o simili.
gloss_en: In architecture and joinery, the chambranle is the border, frame, or ornament, made of stone or wood, that is a component of the three sides round chamber doors, large windows, and chimneys. Border, frame, or ornament around chamber doors, windows, etc. A decorative band that delimits a door, a window, a furniture, etc. In architecture, the case or frame used on three sides around a chamber door, large window, or fireplace mantel, and the border decorations.
In medieval castles the chemise was typically a low wall encircling the keep, protecting the base of the tower.

Surrealist automatism is a method of art-making in which the artist suppresses conscious control over the making process, allowing the unconscious mind to have great sway. An art technique. Art technique

gloss_it: L'architettura Newa è uno stile architettonico indigeno usato dai Newar nella valle di Kathmandu in Nepal in edifici che vanno dagli stupa ai monasteri chaitya, dalle strutture dei cortili alle case di élite.
gloss_en: Newa architecture is an indigenous style of architecture used by the Newari people in the Kathmandu valley in Nepal.
The term gardenesque was introduced by John Claudius Loudon in 1832 to describe a style of planting design in accordance with his 'Principle of Recognition'.

gloss_it: Il karesansui è una tipologia di giardino giapponese e, per estensione, dei nihonga che lo rappresentano.
gloss_en: The Japanese rock garden or “dry landscape” garden, often called a zen garden, creates a miniature stylized landscape through carefully composed arrangements of rocks, water features, moss, pruned trees and bushes, and uses gravel or sand that is raked to represent ripples in water. Creates a miniature stylized landscape, also called a zen garden Type of garden

A wilderness hut, bothy, backcountry hut, or backcountry shelter is a free, primitive mountain hut for temporary accommodation, usually located in wilderness areas, national parks and along backpacking and hiking routes. Simple shelter or hut for temporary accommodation outside built-up areas

gloss_it: In architettura, un'esedra è un incavo semicircolare, sovrastato da una semi-cupola, posto spesso sulla facciata di un palazzo. elemento architettonico
gloss_en: An exedra is a semicircular architectural recess or platform, sometimes crowned by a semi-dome, and either set into a building's façade or free-standing. semicircular niche or recess, often lined with seats A semicircular recess, with stone benches, used as a place for discussion. A semicircular recess.

gloss_it: Il periodo Angkor approssimativamente va dalla seconda metà dell'VIII secolo d.C. alla prima del XV secolo d.C. Volendo stabilire una data precisa, l'inizio può essere fissato nell'anno 802, allorché il re Khmer Jayavarman II si attribuì il titolo di Chakravartin e dichiarò così implicitamente la sua indipendenza dal regno di Java, e la fine nel 1431, quando gli invasori Thai provenienti dal regno di Ayutthaya saccheggiarono Angkor e costrinsero l'élite Khmer a migrare a Phnom Penh.
gloss_en: Khmer architecture, also known as Angkorian architecture is the architecture produced by the Khmers during the Angkor period of the Khmer Empire from approximately the later half of the 8th century CE to the first half of the 15th century CE. The architecture of Cambodia

gloss_it: L'architettura nazista è l'architettura espressione della Germania nazista di Adolf Hitler.
gloss_en: Nazi architecture is the architecture promoted by Adolf Hitler and the Nazi regime from 1933 until its fall in 1945.

A wythe is a continuous vertical section of masonry one unit in thickness. Vertical layer of masonry units A unit of thickness in masonry construction defined by the quantity of masonry units 4" or greater.

A building management system, otherwise known as a building automation system, is a computer-based control system installed in buildings that controls and monitors the building's mechanical and electrical equipment such as ventilation, lighting, power systems, fire systems, and security systems.

gloss_it: Luogo o edificio destinato ad attività religiose
gloss_en: A place of worship is a specially designed structure or space where individuals or a group of people such as a congregation come to perform acts of devotion, veneration, or religious study. Specially designed structure or consecrated space for use in worshipping

gloss_it: Bhaiṣajyaguru — dal sanscrito "Maestro della Medicina"; in cinese Yàoshī Fó ; giapponese Yakushi Nyorai ; coreano Yaksa Yeorae ; tibetano Sman-bla — o più formalmente Bhaisajyaguruvaidūryaprabha, in giapponese Yakushirurikō Nyorai, noto anche come Buddha della Medicina o Maestro delle Cure, è il Buddha che rappresenta la medicina e il suo potere curativo.
gloss_en: Bhaiṣajyaguru, formally Bhaiṣajya-guru-vaiḍūrya-prabhā-rāja, is the Buddha of healing and medicine in Mahāyāna Buddhism. The Buddha of healing and medicine in Mahāyāna Buddhism

In the French formal garden, a bosquet is a formal plantation of trees, at least five of identical species planted as a quincunx, or set in strict regularity as to rank and file, so that the trunks line up as one passes along either face. A formal plantation of trees Formal plantation of trees, in a formal garden

gloss_it: Un mazār è una tomba o mausoleo.
gloss_en: A mazār, or darīh in the Maghreb, is a mausoleum or shrine in some places of the world, typically that of a saint or notable religious leader. A venerated structure in Middle Eastern folk religions Venerated structure in traditional Islam
A brahmasthan is a principle of Vedic architecture and community planning that designates the center point of a building or geographical area.

Pontefract cakes are a type of small, roughly circular black sweet measuring approximately 3/4" wide and 1/5" thick, made of liquorice, originally manufactured in the Yorkshire town of Pontefract, England. type of liquorice candy A small, disc-shaped sweet with an impressed castle, made from locally grown liquorice.

gloss_it: Un castello lineare è un castello progettato per affrontare gli assalitori tramite una serie di barriere e ostacoli disposti in linea.
gloss_en: A linear castle is a castle that was designed to confront its attackers with a series of barriers/impediments in a line.
The National Romantic style was a Nordic architectural style that was part of the National Romantic movement during the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Nordic architectural style

The architecture of Montreal, Quebec, Canada is characterized by the juxtaposition of the old and the new and a wide variety of architectural styles, the legacy of two successive colonizations by the French, the British, and the close presence of modern architecture to the south.

lab_en: conversion of non-christian places of worship into churches
the conversion of non-christian places of worship into churches
gloss_en: The Christianization of sites that had been pagan occurred as a result of conversions in early Christian times, as well as an important part of the strategy of Interpretatio Christiana during the Christianization of pagan peoples. Method employed in the Interpretatio Christiana

gloss_it: Piano di una costruzione che è interrato per metà
gloss_en: In architecture, a semi-basement is a floor of a building that is half below ground, rather than entirely such as a true basement or cellar. Floor of a building that is half below ground

Egyptian faience is a sintered-quartz ceramic material from Ancient Egypt. The sintering process "covered [the material] with a true vitreous coating" as the quartz underwent vitrification, creating a bright lustre of various colours "usually in a transparent blue or green isotropic glass". Sintered-quartz ceramic
A pleasure garden is usually a garden that is open to the public for recreation and entertainment. Garden open for recreation and entertainment

Architectural terracotta refers to a fired mixture of clay and water that can be used in a non-structural, semi-structural, or structural capacity on the exterior or interior of a building. Ceramic construction material

In wrought ironwork, the overthrow, particularly popular in the Baroque era commencing in the 17th century, refers to the crowning section of ornamental wrought ironwork which forms a decorative crest above a wrought-iron gate; the overthrow provides some stabilizing structure tying together supporting piers on either side of the swinging sections. The crowning section of ornamental wrought iron work which forms a decorative crest above a wrought iron gate.

gloss_it: Oftersheim è un comune tedesco di 10.086 abitanti, situato nel land del Baden-Württemberg. Comune tedesco
gloss_en: Oftersheim is a municipality in the district of Rhein-Neckar-Kreis, in Baden-Württemberg, Germany. Municipality in Germany

In modern usage, an aquamanile is a ewer or jug-type vessel in the form of one or more animal or human figures. Water vessel in the form of an animal or human figure A ewer or jug-like vessel, shaped like an animal or human figure, used for washing the hands. Water vessel.

A wall stud is a vertical framing member in a building's wall of smaller cross section than a post. A vertical member in construction Vertical framing member in a building's wall of smaller cross section than a post

gloss_it: Con il termine penthouse si definisce una particolare tipologia di appartamento di grande metratura destinato a un pubblico facoltoso e solitamente situato agli ultimi piani di prestigiosi edifici o grattacieli.
gloss_en: A penthouse is an apartment or unit on the highest floor of an apartment building, condominium, or hotel. A special apartment on the top floor of a building Apartment on the highest floor of an apartment building

gloss_it: Una buca pontaia è un buco fatto intenzionalmente in una muratura per sostenere un'impalcatura di ponteggio.
gloss_en: Putlog holes or putlock holes are small holes made in the walls of structures to receive the ends of poles or beams, called putlogs or putlocks, to support a scaffolding.

gloss_it: Le veneri paleolitiche sono piccole statue preistoriche raffiguranti donne con gli attributi sessuali molto pronunciati e ritratti con certo realismo. Statue preistoriche
gloss_en: A Venus figurine is any Upper Palaeolithic statuette portraying a woman, usually carved in the round. Group of prehistoric objects Prehistoric statuettes depicting women
As a relatively new school of painting, hyperrealism is a recognized outgrowth of the school of photorealism. A school of painting

A sliding glass door, patio door, or doorwall is a type of sliding door in architecture and construction, is a large glass window opening in a structure that provide door access from a room to the outdoors, fresh air, and copious natural light. Large sliding glass window opening providing door access

A sliding door is a type of door which opens horizontally by sliding, usually parallel to a wall. Door which opens horizontally by sliding A door that opens and closes by sliding to the side; sometimes one of a pair. Door.

gloss_it: La prefabbricazione è il processo costruttivo dove gli elementi di una costruzione edilizia sono realizzati con ottica industriale, a piè d'opera o in fabbrica, e poi montati con procedure codificate. Edificio le cui sezioni sono prodotte in fabbriche specializzate e poi trasportate e assemblate in un cantiere.
gloss_en: A prefabricated building, informally a prefab, is a building that is manufactured and constructed using prefabrication. Building whose sections are manufactured in specialized factories and later transported and assembled on a building site.

gloss_it: Le dōtaku sono campane giapponesi di bronzo, relativamente sottili, risalenti al periodo Yayoi.
gloss_en: Dōtaku are Japanese bells smelted from relatively thin bronze and richly decorated. Japanese bell smelted from relatively thin bronze and richly decorated
Spanish Baroque is a strand of Baroque architecture that evolved in Spain, its provinces, and former colonies. Architecture of the Baroque era in Spain and its former colonies

gloss_it: Il romanico lombardo si sviluppò tra gli ultimi decenni dell'XI secolo e il XII secolo in un'area più vasta della regione Lombardia attuale, comprendente anche l'Emilia e una parte del Piemonte, ed influenzò una larga parte dell'Italia, fino all'Umbria, alle Marche, al nord del Lazio, ed in parte anche la Puglia e la Sardegna.
gloss_en: One of the first streams of Romanesque architecture in Europe from the 10th century and the beginning of 11th century is called First Romanesque or Lombard Romanesque. Or Lombard Romanesque architectural style
Déprimisme is a contemporary French art and literary movement, in which authors dwell on the failures of society.
French Baroque architecture, sometimes called French classicism, was a style of architecture during the reigns of Louis XIII, Louis XIV and Louis XV. Architecture of the Baroque era in France

A firebox or firepit is the part of the fireplace where fuel is combusted, in distinction from the hearth, chimney, mantel, overdoor and flue elements of the total fireplace system. The part of a fireplace where fuel is combusted

lab_en: baroque architecture of the dutch republic
gloss_en: Dutch Baroque architecture is a variety of Baroque architecture that flourished in the Dutch Republic and its colonies during the Dutch Golden Age of the 17th century. Architecture of the Baroque era in the Dutch Republic and its colonies

Opera publica is the Latin name used by Ancient Rome for the building of public works, construction or engineering projects carried out under the direction of the state on behalf of the community, and the buildings themselves.
A carillon-like instrument with fewer than 23 bells is called a chime. An array of large bells, typically housed in a tower and played from a keyboard Musical instrument

A respond is a half-pier or half-pillar which is bonded into a wall and designed to carry the springer at one end of an arch. A half-pillar, pilaster, or any corresponding device engaged in a wall to receive the impost of an arch.

gloss_it: La crociera è una porzione di spazio definita dall'incrocio della navata centrale e del transetto che si trova nelle chiese in pianta a croce latina o greca. In architettura un tipo di volta formata dall `intersezione di due volte a botte
gloss_en: A crossing, in ecclesiastical architecture, is the junction of the four arms of a cruciform church. The junction of the four arms of a cruciform church The volume formed by the intersection of chancel, nave and transepts in a cruciform church; often with a tower or cupola over it. Volume formed by the intersection of chancel, nave and transepts in a cruciform church.

gloss_it: Il bordone è la più pesante delle campane che appartengono ad uno strumento musicale, in particolare una campana o un carillon, e produce il suo tono più basso.
gloss_en: The bourdon is the heaviest of the bells that belong to a musical instrument, especially a chime or a carillon, and produces its lowest tone. The lowest bell in a set

A moon gate is a circular opening in a garden wall that acts as a pedestrian passageway and is a traditional architectural element in Chinese gardens. a circular opening in a garden wall and a traditional architectural element in Chinese gardens
This is a timeline of architecture, indexing the individual year in architecture pages.

gloss_it: Il palladianesimo o architettura palladiana è uno stile architettonico ispirato alle opere e ai disegni dell'architetto veneto Andrea Palladio. Stile architettonico derivato dall'opera di Andrea Palladio
gloss_en: Style of architecture based on the writings and buildings of the humanist and theorist from Vicenza, Andrea Palladio (1508–80). Palladian architecture is a European architectural style derived from and inspired by the designs of the Venetian architect Andrea Palladio. Style of architecture derived from the work of architect Andrea Palladio
The architecture of Houston includes a wide variety of award-winning and historic examples located in various areas of the city of Houston, Texas.

Form follows function is a principle associated with late 19th and early 20th century architecture and industrial design in general, and it means the shape of a building or object should primarily relate to its intended function or purpose.

gloss_it: La Dea dei serpenti è una dea della civiltà minoica, riferibile a rituali della fecondità, figura ricorrente della scultura minoica.
gloss_en: Snake goddess is the name commonly given to a type of figurine depicting a woman holding a snake in each hand, as were found in Minoan archaeological sites in Crete.
Papercutting or paper cutting is the art of paper designs. Art of cutting paper

A country house poem is a poem in which the author compliments a wealthy patron or a friend through a description of his country house. Poem in which the author compliments a wealthy patron or a friend through a description of his country house

gloss_it: L'opus sectile è un'antica tecnica artistica che utilizza marmi tagliati per realizzare pavimentazioni e decorazioni murarie a intarsio, detta anche in seguito, a seconda dei materiali utilizzati, commesso marmoreo o commesso di pietre dure. tecnica artistica dell'antichità romana
gloss_en: Opus sectile is an art technique popularized in the ancient and medieval Roman world where materials were cut and inlaid into walls and floors to make a picture or pattern.
A bell foundry is a factory that makes bells.

gloss_it: L'architettura spagnola assunse caratteri unitari con l'annessione della penisola iberica all'Impero romano.
gloss_en: Spanish architecture refers to architecture in any area of what is now Spain, and by Spanish architects worldwide. Architecture of building in Spain

Multi-family residential is a classification of housing where multiple separate housing units for residential inhabitants are contained within one building or several buildings within one complex. Multiple separate housing units for residential inhabitants contained within one building or several buildings within one complex

gloss_it: Jali o jaali, è il termine per indicare una pietra perforata o una grata, di solito con un motivo ornamentale realizzato attraverso l'uso della calligrafia e della geometria.
gloss_en: A jali or jaali, is the term for a perforated stone or latticed screen, usually with an ornamental pattern constructed through the use of calligraphy and geometry. Perforated lattice or screen of stone A stone screen, perforated or latticed, usually with a geometrical ornamental pattern, used in Indian and Islamic architecture.

gloss_it: Il mandylion o immagine di Edessa era un telo, venerato dalle comunità cristiane orientali, sul quale era raffigurato il volto di Gesù.
gloss_en: According to Christian tradition, the Image of Edessa was a holy relic consisting of a square or rectangle of cloth upon which a miraculous image of the face of Jesus had been imprinted—the first icon. Relic consisting of a square or rectangle of cloth upon which a miraculous image of the face of Jesus had been imprinted

gloss_it: Il cocciopesto è un materiale edilizio utilizzato come rivestimento impermeabile per pavimenti sia interni sia esterni e per il rivestimento di pareti.
gloss_en: Opus signinum is a building material used in ancient Rome.

A material consideration, in the United Kingdom, is a process in planning law in which the decision maker when assessing an application for development must consider in deciding the outcome of an application.
ArtDaily is an Internet-based media company founded in 1996 by editor-in-chief Ignacio Villarreal and a group of professionals in the art world.

The architecture of Sydney, Australia’s oldest city, is not characterised by any one architectural style, but by an extensive juxtaposition of old and new architecture over the city's 200-year history, from its modest beginnings with local materials and lack of international funding to its present-day modernity with an expansive skyline of high rises and skyscrapers.
A storey pole is a length of narrow board usually cut to the height of one storey.

Passive cooling is a building design approach that focuses on heat gain control and heat dissipation in a building in order to improve the indoor thermal comfort with low or no energy consumption. Any cooling method that facilitates heat dissipation without additional energy input
Stone carving is an activity where pieces of rough natural stone are shaped by the controlled removal of stone. The act of shaping stone materials

gloss_it: Una berma è un gradino o muretto di calcestruzzo che si erge alla base di un terrapieno o di un argine per prevenirne il cedimento.
gloss_en: A berm is a level space, shelf, or raised barrier separating two areas. raised bank of land or barrier

gloss_it: La locuzione latina Ex voto, tradotta letteralmente, significa "a seguito di un voto". Locuzione latina che indica le offerte votive donate dai fedeli per grazia ricevuta da santi o divinità, esposti su altari di templi, chiese, santuari
gloss_en: An ex-voto is a votive offering to a saint or to a divinity; the term is usually restricted to Christian examples. votive offering to a saint or to a divinity in Christianity or in ancient religions An offering to a church in fulfillment of a vow. An offering.

Australian architecture has generally been consistent with architectural trends in the wider Western world, with some special adaptations to compensate for distinctive Australian climatic and cultural factors.

gloss_it: Il muro di Trombe-Michel è un particolare tipo di muro solare inventato e brevettato nel 1881 da Edward Morse e reso famoso nel 1964 dall'ingegnere francese Félix Trombe e dall'architetto Jacques Michel che ne realizzarono alcune applicazioni sperimentali nella cittadina francese di Odeillo.
gloss_en: A Trombe wall is a massive Equator-facing wall that is painted a dark color in order to absorb thermal energy from incident sunlight and covered with a glass on the outside with an insulating air-gap between the wall and the glaze. A wall built on the winter sun side of a building with a glass external layer and a high mass internal layer separated by a layer of air, so as to absorb heat during sunlit hours of winter and slowly release it overnight.
A dievdirbys is a Lithuanian wood carver who creates statues of Jesus and the Christian saints in more recent times, but used to create statues of the Lithuanian pagan deities.

In medieval England, Wales and the Channel Islands a licence to crenellate granted the holder permission to fortify his property. formal permission to build a fortification In medieval Britain, a licence, granted by the king, giving permission to fortify a manor house.
In architecture, a Nubian vault is a type of curved surface forming a vaulted structure.

lab_en: jelling mounds, runic stones and church
gloss_it: Le pietre runiche di Jelling sono due pietre runiche rinvenute nella cittadina danese di Jelling, nello Jutland, e risalenti al X secolo: la prima pietra runica fu commissionata da re Gorm il Vecchio ed è dedicata a sua moglie Thyra, mentre la seconda fu commissionata dal figlio di Gorm e Thyra, Aroldo Dente Azzurro in memoria dei propri genitoriLe due pietre runiche sono considerate una sorta di "certificato di nascita" della Danimarca e, unitamente alla chiesa e le colline adiacenti, sono annoverate dall'Unesco nel patrimonio dell'umanità dal 1994.
gloss_en: The Jelling stones are massive carved runestones from the 10th century, found at the town of Jelling in Denmark. 2 runestones in Jelling, Denmark

gloss_it: Fibula è il nome latino della fibbia o della spilla, utilizzata in primo luogo per assicurare le vesti sulle spalle ed alla vita.
gloss_en: A fibula is a brooch or pin for fastening garments, typically at the right shoulder. Ancient pin or brooch for securing clothing An ancient kind of brooch used to hold clothing together, similar in function to the modern safety pin. Ancient brooch.

gloss_it: Opus vermiculatum è un tipo di mosaico antico caratterizzato da piccole tessere che, disposte in maniera asimmetrica, seguono il contorno delle immagini. tecnica artistica dell'antichità romana
gloss_en: Opus vermiculatum is a method of laying mosaic tesserae to emphasise an outline around a subject. Method of laying mosaic tesserae to emphasise an outline around a subject
For other uses of Compartmentalization, see Compartmentalization.
A modular building is a prefabricated building that consists of repeated sections called modules. prefabricated building or house that consists of repeated sections

gloss_it: Il guscio è un elemento strutturale avente due dimensioni prevalenti rispetto alla terza, con una superficie media non riconducibile ad un piano ed il cui comportamento statico sia caratterizzato sia da azioni membranali che da azioni flessionali.
gloss_en: Thin-shell structures are lightweight constructions using shell elements. Lightweight constructions using shell elements

The architecture of Penang reflects the 171 years of British presence on the island, coalescing with local, Chinese, Indian, Islamic and other elements to create a unique and distinctive brand of architecture.

gloss_it: Nell'ambito nautico, per punti notevoli o punti cospicui si intendono quelle particolari conformazioni naturali o quelle costruzioni erette dall'uomo che hanno la caratteristica di poter essere facilmente individuati ed osservati da lontano e costituire quindi un punto di riferimento durante la navigazione.
gloss_en: A daymark or a day marker is the daytime identifier of an aid to navigation or day beacon. A mark (such as a tower) designed to help navigators to find their way during daylight hours. Daytime navigation mark.

A reflecting pool or reflection pool is a water feature found in gardens, parks, and at memorial sites. A shallow pool designed to reflect a structure and its surroundings Water feature found in gardens, parks, and at memorial sites, consists of a shallow pool of water, undisturbed by fountain jets, for a reflective surface A water feature consisting of a shallow pool of water with a reflective surface, undisturbed by fountain jets.

gloss_it: L'inglesina è una griglia che viene inserita in un serramento a fini estetici.
gloss_en: A muntin, muntin bar, glazing bar or sash bar is a strip of wood or metal separating and holding panes of glass in a window. Strip of wood or metal that separates and holds glass panes in a window One of the separators between panes of glass in a composite window. Window pane separator.

gloss_it: Gli archeologi britannici affinano l'uso generale del termine archeologico viale per denotare una lunga, striscia di terra parallela ai lati che misura intorno ai 30 m di larghezza, aperta alle estremità e con margini segnati da allineamenti di pietre o legno e/o un basso cumulo e fossato. Elemento archeologico dell `Inghilterra
gloss_en: British Archaeologists refine the general archaeological use of avenue to denote a long, parallel-sided strip of land, measuring up to about 30m in width, open at either end and with edges marked by stone or timber alignments and/or a low earth bank and ditch. A specialist term in archaeology referring to lines of stones

gloss_it: Un edificio incompiuto è un edificio i cui lavori di costruzione si sono interrotti e il progetto è stato abbandonato.
gloss_en: An unfinished building is a building where construction work was abandoned or on-hold at some stage or only exists as a design.
In the Middle Ages, an obedientiary or obedienciary was a lesser official of a monastery appointed by will of the superior. The holder of a monastic rank or office below that of superior.

lab_it: campo per il gioco della palla
gloss_it: Presso le popolazioni centroamericane il campo per il gioco della palla era un'ampia struttura in muratura usata per più di 2.700 anni per la pratica del gioco della palla, in particolare nella versione in cui la sfera veniva colpita con le anche.
gloss_en: A Mesoamerican ballcourt is a large masonry structure of a type used in Mesoamerica for over 2,700 years to play the Mesoamerican ballgame, particularly the hip-ball version of the ballgame. structure used for playing the Mesoamerican ballgame

gloss_it: Un cerchio di pietre è un antico monumento. Antico monumento
gloss_en: A stone circle is a circular alignment of standing stones. Monument of standing stones arranged in a circle A prehistoric monument consisting of standing stones arranged in a circle. Prehistoric monument.

gloss_it: La lunetta è un elemento architettonico, tipico di ambienti coperti da volte.
gloss_en: A lunette is a half-moon shaped architectural space, variously filled with sculpture, painted, glazed, filled with recessed masonry, or void. Half-moon shaped space in architecture
An altered book is a form of mixed media artwork that changes a book from its original form into a different form, altering its appearance and/or meaning.

gloss_it: Un sistema trilitico o trilite è una struttura formata da due elementi disposti in verticale e un terzo appoggiato orizzontalmente sopra di essi, a formare una sorta di porta.
gloss_en: A trilithon is a structure consisting of two large vertical stones supporting a third stone set horizontally across the top. Structure consisting of two large vertical stones supporting a third stone set horizontally across the top A structure consisting of two stone pillars supporting a horizontal stone.
From the 12th century in central Europe, a Burgmann was a knight ministeriales or member of the nobility who was obliged to guard and defend castles.
Hanging bowls are a distinctive type of artefact of the period between the end of Roman rule in Britain in c.

The following outline is an overview and topical guide to architecture:Architecture – the process and the product of designing and constructing buildings. Overview of and topical guide to architecture
Foundation deposits are the archaeological remains of the ritual burial of materials under the foundations of buildings.
The buildings and architecture of Chicago have influenced and reflected the history of American architecture. Regional architecture
Type design may also refer to aircraft type design. Art of designing typefaces and fonts

gloss_it: In architettura, un pennacchio o scuffia è un elemento di raccordo fra l'imposta di una cupola e la struttura ad essa sottostante, generalmente costituita da appoggi puntiformi. Elemento architettonico di una cupola.
gloss_en: In architecture, a pendentive is a constructional device permitting the placing of a circular dome over a square room or of an elliptical dome over a rectangular room. Architectural element used to support a dome

gloss_it: Una stavkirke è una chiesa medioevale costruita interamente in legno.
gloss_en: A stave church is a medieval wooden Christian church building once common in north-western Europe. A Medieval wooden church with post and beam construction prevalent in Norway A Northern European style of wooden church typical in early medieval Scandinavia A wooden church with a medieval post and lintel construction. Wooden church of a medieval type.

gloss_it: La tecnica di Six era una tecnica usata dai primi pittori di vasi attici a figure nere descritti dallo studioso danese Jan Six nel 1888.
gloss_en: Six's technique is the modern name for a technique used by Attic black-figure vase painters that involves laying on figures in white or red on a black surface and incising the details so that the black shows through.

gloss_it: Le anfore panatenaiche sono anfore prodotte per contenere l'olio sacro che nell'antica Grecia veniva consegnato come premio agli atleti vincitori dei giochi panatenaici. Forma ceramica greca
gloss_en: Panathenaic amphorae were the amphorae, large ceramic vessels, that contained the olive oil given as prizes in the Panathenaic Games. Special shape of attic amphoras

Heal's is a British furniture and furniture retail company comprising seven stores, selling a range of furniture, lighting and home accessories. A British department store British department store chain

gloss_it: Lo specchio Claude è un piccolo specchio convesso con la superficie tinta di nero; generalmente contenuto in una scatoletta portatile.
gloss_en: A Claude glass is a small mirror, slightly convex in shape, with its surface tinted a dark colour. 18th-century artist drawing tool Small mirror A slightly convex tinted mirror once used by artists to view landscapes and produce works similar to those of Claude Lorrain.

A hollow core slab, also known as a voided slab, hollow core plank or simply a concrete plank is a precast slab of prestressed concrete typically used in the construction of floors in multi-story apartment buildings.
A causewayed enclosure is a type of large prehistoric earthwork common to the early Neolithic in Europe.

gloss_it: La Aeolian Company è stata un'azienda statunitense che produceva fin dal 1880 circa strumenti musicali automatici: il primo fu un harmonium che funzionava a dischi di cartone perforati.
gloss_en: Æolian-Skinner Organ Company, Inc.

gloss_it: Con arte geometrica si intende la produzione materiale della civiltà greca tra il 900 e il 700 a.C., che prende il nome dal termine tradizionalmente usato per la produzione ceramica dello stesso periodo. Fase storico-artistica
gloss_en: Geometric art is a phase of Greek art, characterized largely by geometric motifs in vase painting, that flourished towards the end of the Greek Dark Ages, c. Phase of Greek art characterized by geometric motifs in vase painting, fl. ca. 900–700 BCE, centred in Athens and spread among Aegean trading cities

A nef is an extravagant table ornament and container used in the Middle Ages and Renaissance, made of precious metals in the shape of a ship – nef was another word for a carrack in French. Ornamental metalwork container for food made in the shape of a ship An extravagant table ornament and container used in the Middle Ages and Renaissance, made in the shape of a ship.
Stone rubbing is the practice of creating an image of surface features of a stone on paper.
Grooved ware is the name given to a pottery style of the British Neolithic. Pottery style of the British Neolithic Type of prehistoric pottery

gloss_it: La ceramica protogeometrica è la produzione vascolare della civiltà greca che si pone tra la fine del submiceneo e l'inizio dello stile geometrico, ossia tra 1050 e 900 a.C. È il primo momento di rinascita tecnologica e creativa nell'antica Grecia dopo il crollo della cultura minoico-micenea e dell'arte palaziale. Tecnica o stile della ceramica greca
gloss_en: The Protogeometric style is a style of Ancient Greek pottery led by Athens produced between roughly 1030 and 900 BCE, in the first period of the Greek Dark Ages.

gloss_it: Il periodo orientalizzante, anche conosciuto come arte orientalizzante, è un periodo storico-culturale e artistico iniziato nella seconda parte dell'VIII secolo a.C., e che segue il periodo geometrico, quando vi fu una forte influenza dell'arte più avanzata del Mediterraneo orientale e del Vicino Oriente antico nella fase arcaica dell'arte nell'antica Grecia, nelle isole greche dell'Egeo, nell'isola di Creta, nelle colonie greche dell'Italia meridionale, nelle polis greche della Sicilia, in Sardegna, e in alcune aree dell'Italia centro-settentrionale, tra le quali l'area picena, il Latium vetus, l'Agro Falisco, l'Etruria, e l'area atestina. Fase storico-artistica
gloss_en: In the Archaic phase of ancient Greek art, the Orientalizing period or Orientalizing revolution is the cultural and art historical period that began during the later part of the 8th century BC, when there was a heavy influence from the more advanced art of the Eastern Mediterranean and Ancient Near East. Cultural and art historical period in the Archaic phase of ancient Greek art

An elevator test tower is a structure usually 100 to over 200 metres tall that is designed to evaluate the stress and fatigue limits of specific elevator cars in a controlled environment. Structure designed to test elevators

gloss_it: I Latini chiamavano oppidum una città fortificata priva di un confine sacro, proprio invece dell'urbe. Nell `antica Roma era una città fortificata corrispondente alle medievali castrum.
gloss_en: An oppidum is a large fortified Iron Age settlement. A Latin word meaning the main settlement in any administrative area of ancient Rome Large defended Iron Age settlement A large, defended Iron Age settlement associated with the Celtic La Tène culture.
In art, a cloudscape is the depiction of a view of clouds or the sky. A depiction of clouds or sky Artistic depiction of a view of clouds or the sky

gloss_it: I long barrow sono dei monumenti preistorici risalenti al primo periodo del neolitico, e precisamente, dei tumuli di terra rettangolari o trapezoidali tradizionalmente interpretati come tombe collettive.
gloss_en: Long barrows are a style of monument constructed across Western Europe in the fifth and fourth millennia BCE, during the Early Neolithic period.

gloss_it: L'allée couverte è una tipologia di sepolcro collettivo megalitico.
gloss_en: A gallery grave is a form of megalithic tomb built primarily during the Neolithic Age in Europe in which the main gallery of the tomb is entered without first passing through an antechamber or hallway. Type of neolithic gallery grave in France and Belgium Type of neolithic gallery grave in Germany

gloss_it: L'architettura mesoamericana è l'insieme delle tradizioni architettoniche prodotte dalle culture e dalle civiltà precolombiane della Mesoamerica, tradizioni che sono meglio conosciute sotto forma di edifici e strutture monumentali pubbliche, cerimoniali e urbane.
gloss_en: Mesoamerican architecture is the set of architectural traditions produced by pre-Columbian cultures and civilizations of Mesoamerica, traditions which are best known in the form of public, ceremonial and urban monumental buildings and structures. Building traditions of pre-Columbian Mesoamerica

gloss_it: L’epitaffio o epitafio, spesso tradotto come orazione funebre o discorso funebre, nell'antica Grecia era un discorso funebre pubblico pronunciato in occasione della sepoltura di un defunto. Discorso funebre pubblico pronunciato nell'antica Grecia
gloss_en: A funeral oration or epitaphios logos is a formal speech delivered on the ceremonial occasion of a funeral. Ancient Greece formal speech delivered on the ceremonial occasion of a funeral
This article covers the architecture of Sweden from a historical perspective. Overview of the architecture in Sweden

gloss_it: Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Fascist architecture is an architectural style developed by architects of fascist states in the early 20th century. Architectural style

Scandinavian design is a design movement characterized by simplicity, minimalism and functionality that emerged in the early 20th century, and subsequently flourished in the 1950s throughout the five Nordic countries: Norway, Sweden, Finland, Denmark, and Iceland. A design movement of the 1950s

In urban design, a terminating vista is a building or monument that stands at the end or in the middle of a road, so that when one is looking up the street the view ends with the site. building or monument at the end of a view

gloss_it: La casa-famiglia in Italia è una struttura destinata all'accoglienza e una «comunità di tipo familiare con sede nelle civili abitazioni» la cui finalità è l'accoglienza di minorenni, disabili, anziani, adulti in difficoltà, persone affette da AIDS e/o in generale persone con problematiche psicosociali.
gloss_en: A group home is residence model of medical care for those with complex health needs.

gloss_it: La naveta è un tipo di tomba a camera megalitica diffusa unicamente nell'isola di Minorca, in Spagna.
gloss_en: A naveta is a form of megalithic chamber tomb unique to the Balearic island of Menorca. A kind of megalithic chamber tomb, unique to the Balearic island of Minorca, with two vertical and two corbelled walls giving it the form of an upturned boat.

gloss_it: Le domus de janas sono tombe preistoriche scavate nella roccia tipiche della Sardegna prenuragica. Tomba prenuragica tipica della Sardegna
gloss_en: Domus de Janas are a type of pre-Nuragic chamber tombs found in Sardinia. Type of chamber tomb found in Sardinia, Italy

lab_it: per finire ancora e altri fallimenti
for to end yet again and other fizzles
gloss_it: Per finire ancora e altri fallimenti è una raccolta di 8 brevi prose di Samuel Beckett, pubblicate da Grove Press di New York, Éditions de Minuit di Parigi e John Calder di Londra nel 1976 e, in italiano, da Einaudi di Torino nel 1980.
gloss_en: The "fizzles" are eight short prose pieces written by Samuel Beckett: Fizzle 1 [He is barehead] Fizzle 2 [Horn came always] Fizzle 3 Afar a Bird Fizzle 4 [I gave up before birth] Fizzle 5 [Closed place] Fizzle 6 [Old earth] Fizzle 7 Still Fizzle 8 For to end yet againSome fizzles are unnamed and are identified by their numbers or first few words, which appear above in brackets. A short stories by Samuel Beckett

gloss_it: La velatura è una tecnica pittorica che consiste nella stesura di uno strato di colore sopra un altro già asciutto.
gloss_en: A glaze is a thin transparent or semi-transparent layer on a painting which modifies the appearance of the underlying paint layer. A layer of paint, thinned with a medium, so as to become somewhat transparent Transparent or semi-transparent coating on wood, fabric, cardboard or paper

gloss_it: La rilocazione di una struttura è il procedimento con cui si sposta una struttura normalmente immobile, solitamente un edificio, dal luogo ove si trova ad un altro.
gloss_en: A structure relocation is the process of moving a structure from one location to another. Process of moving a structure from one location to another. There are two main ways for a structure to be moved: disassembling and then reassembling it at the required destination, or transporting it whole

gloss_it: La produzione di opere artistiche da parte dei Maya comincia nel periodo preclassico, diventa florida nel periodo classico e continua nel periodo postclassico fino al XVI secolo quando giunge alla sua fase terminale con la distruzione della cultura di corte da parte degli invasori spagnoli che misero così fine ad una grande tradizione artistica.
gloss_en: Ancient Mayan art is about the material arts of the Mayan civilization, an eastern and south-eastern Mesoamerican culture shared by a great number of kingdoms in present-day Mexico, Guatemala, Belize and Honduras. Pre-Columbian art

gloss_it: Un bank barrow, detto talvolta anche barrow-bank, ridge barrow, o ridge mound, è un tipo di tumulo per prima identificato da O.G.S. Crawford nel 1938.
gloss_en: A bank barrow, sometimes referred to as a barrow-bank, ridge barrow, or ridge mound, is a type of tumulus first identified by O.G.S. Crawford in 1938. Type of tumulus
The existence of the earliest forts in India have been substantiated by documentation and excavation.

gloss_it: Il cassone è un pezzo di mobilio fatto da una cassa a base rettangolare, con un coperchio sul lato superiore che si apre tramite cerniere e che può generalmente essere usato anche come sedile. Pezzo d''arredamento simile alla cassapanca
gloss_en: A cassone or marriage chest is a rich and showy Italian type of chest, which may be inlaid or carved, prepared with gesso ground then painted and gilded. A highly-decorated traditional Italian dowry chest.
The architecture of Bermuda has developed over the past four centuries.
Nālukettu pronunciation is the traditional homestead of old Tharavadu where many generations of a matrilineal family lived.
Swahili architecture is a term used today to designate a whole range of diverse building traditions practiced or once practiced along the eastern and southeastern coasts of Africa.

gloss_it: L'antica cultura delle Cicladi prosperò nelle isole del Mar Egeo da 3300 al 1100 a.C. circa. Arte delle isole Cicladi, Grecia
gloss_en: The ancient Cycladic culture flourished in the islands of the Aegean Sea from c. 3300 to 1100 BCE. Ancient art flourished in the Cyclades

Constructivist architecture was a constructivist style of modern architecture that flourished in the Soviet Union in the 1920s and early 1930s. An architectural movement in Russia from 1919 onwards 1920s–30s architecture movement in the USSR combining advanced technology and engineering with Communist social purpose
A Fischer Random Chess starting position is one of 960 possible initial game positions in the chess variant Fischer Random Chess.

Chambered long barrows, also known as megalithic long barrows or chambered tombs, were a style of monument constructed across Western Europe in the fifth and fourth millennia BC, during the Early Neolithic period.

The colony houses of Edinburgh were built between 1850 and 1910 as homes for artisans and skilled working-class families by philanthropic model dwellings companies. A type of house built in Edinburgh, Scotland in the 19th century

lab_en: berlin transmediale international media arts festival
gloss_it: transmediale è un festival di arte e cultura digitale che si tiene a Berlino.
gloss_en: transmediale is an annual festival for art and digital culture in Berlin, usually held over five days at the end of January and the beginning of February. Annual film festival held in Berlin, Germany

gloss_it: Tipo di abitazione rurale
gloss_en: A boô pronunciation is an old Saxon building where a farmer could spend the night with his cattle if he let them graze far outside the village. old Saxon building

gloss_it: L'opus tessellatum è una tecnica medievale di ornamentazione dei pavimenti, che consiste nell'assemblaggio di piccoli frammenti multicolori chiamati tessere di marmo, pietra, pasta di vetro, ceramica o altri materiali duri. tecnica artistica dell'antichità e del medioevo
gloss_en: Opus tessellatum is the Latin name for the normal technique of Greek and Roman mosaic, made from tesserae that are larger than about 4 mm.

A mechanical room, boiler room or plant room is a room or space in a building dedicated to the mechanical equipment and its associated electrical equipment, as opposed to rooms intended for human occupancy or storage.
An electrical room is a room or space in a building dedicated to electrical equipment.

Yakusha-e, often referred to as "actor prints" in English, are Japanese woodblock prints or, rarely, paintings, of kabuki actors, particularly those done in the ukiyo-e style popular through the Edo period and into the beginnings of the 20th century. Art genre
In military fortification, a contramure, or countermure, is a wall raised behind another, to supply its place when breached or destroyed.

The term ASCII porn –sometimes typographically euphemized as "ASCII pr0n"– describes pornographic images consisting of ASCII art. ASCII porn was the world's first Internet pornography, and was popular before the invention of the World-Wide Web, and often found on BBSes and other text mode terminal-based systems that could be reached via direct modem dial-up. Pornographic images consisting of ASCII art

The reredorter or necessarium was a communal latrine found in mediaeval monasteries in Western Europe and later also in some New World monasteries. A latrine situated at the rear of a medieval monastery or convent.

gloss_it: L’isolante termico in edilizia è il materiale utilizzato nelle costruzioni per ridurre lo scambio di calore tra l'interno e l'esterno di un edificio e viceversa.
gloss_en: Building insulation is any object in a building used as insulation for any purpose. A material used in building construction to prevent heat loss Material used to  thermally insulate buildings
An artist's statement is an artist's written description of their work.

The art world comprises everyone involved in producing, commissioning, presenting, preserving, promoting, chronicling, criticizing, buying and selling fine art. Everyone involved in producing, commissioning, presenting, preserving, promoting, chronicling, criticizing, and selling fine art
A box pew is a type of church pew that is encased in panelling and was prevalent in England and other Protestant countries from the 16th to early 19th centuries. Special type of church benches

gloss_it: L'ordine architettonico è uno degli stili sviluppatisi a partire dall'architettura classica, e successivamente codificati dalla cultura architettonica, ognuno distinto da proporzioni e profili e dettagli caratteristici, generalmente riconoscibili dal tipo di colonna, o per meglio dire dall'insieme coordinato di elementi architettonici teso a costituire un completo sistema trilitico, i cui elementi caratterizzanti sono principalmente la colonna con il rispettivo capitello e la sovrastante trabeazione. Uno degli antichi modi del costruire
gloss_en: An order in architecture is a certain assemblage of parts subject to uniform established proportions, regulated by the office that each part has to perform. Styles of classical architecture, most readily recognizable by the type of column employed
Cordwood construction is a term used for a natural building method in which short logs are piled crosswise to build a wall, using mortar or cob to permanently secure them.

gloss_it: Il concorso di architettura è un particolare tipo di concorso che riguarda l'architettura e/o l'urbanistica.
gloss_en: An architectural design competition is a type of design competition in which an organization that intends on constructing a new building invites architects to submit design proposals.
Modern furniture refers to furniture produced from the late 19th century through the present that is influenced by modernism. Furniture designed in 19th century to this day

Timber framing and "post-and-beam" construction are traditional methods of building with heavy timbers, creating structures using squared-off and carefully fitted and joined timbers with joints secured by large wooden pegs. Often simply called timber framing, is an ancient traditional method of building using wooden joinery held together with pegs, wedeges and rarely iron straps. Half-timbering is a notable type of timber framing common in parts of Europe. Building technique, construction method using heavy squared-off and carefully fitted and joined timbers A method of construction using heavy timber beams, usually joined by tenon and mortice joints pegged together.

A structural insulated panel, or structural insulating panel,, is a form of sandwich panel used in the construction industry. A building system for construction Form of sandwich panel used as a building material

gloss_it: L'architettura dei templi indù prevede una struttura aperta simmetricamente guidata, con molte varianti, su una griglia quadrata di pada, con figure geometriche perfette, come cerchi e quadrati.
gloss_en: Hindu temple architecture as the main form of Hindu architecture has many varieties of style, though the basic nature of the Hindu temple remains the same, with the essential feature an inner sanctum, the garbha griha or womb-chamber, where the primary Murti or the image of a deity is housed in a simple bare cell. The art, practice, and elements in the planning, designing and building of Hindu temples

Hawaiian architecture is a distinctive architectural style developed and employed primarily in the Hawaiian Islands, buildings and various other structures indicative of the people of Hawaiʻi and the environment and culture in which they live.

A chapel of ease is a church building other than the parish church, built within the bounds of a parish for the attendance of those who cannot reach the parish church conveniently. church building A chapel built in a remote part of a parish to meet the needs of those who live far from the parish church. Remote chapel.

A datestone is typically an embedded stone with the date of engraving and other information carved into it. typically an embedded stone with the date of engraving and other information carved into it An embedded stone with a date carved into it.
Indian rock-cut architecture is more various and found in greater abundance in that country than any other form of rock-cut architecture around the world.

gloss_it: Un crannóg è un'antica isola artificiale utilizzata per realizzare un insediamento umano.
gloss_en: A crannog is typically a partially or entirely artificial island, usually built in lakes and estuarine waters of Scotland, Wales, and Ireland. Prehistoric lake dwelling An artificial island, used in prehistoric and medieval times in Scotland and Ireland for dwelling. Artificial island.

gloss_it: Una cista è una sepoltura a scatola di pietra utilizzata in antichità per accogliere i corpi dei defunti.
gloss_en: A cist is a small stone-built coffin-like box or ossuary used to hold the bodies of the dead. Small stone-built coffin-like box, ossua or dolmen

A cadaver monument or transi is a type of church monument to deceased persons featuring a sculpted effigy of a skeleton or an emaciated, even decomposing, dead body. Tomb featuring an effigy in the form of a decomposing body Effigy tombs or slabs depicting decomposition

gloss_it: Il teatro è un edificio usato per spettacoli pubblici. Inteso come struttura architettonica di epoca romana Edificio usato per spettacoli pubblici
gloss_en: Roman theatres derive from and are part of the overall evolution of earlier Greek theatres. The theatre buildings of Ancient Rome Theatre building built in ancient Roman time

gloss_it: L'architrave, detto anche epistilio, sopraccolonnio o soprassoglio, è un elemento architettonico orizzontale, non spingente e portato, anche se molto spesso è a sua volta portante per elementi superiori che lo sovrastano. Elemento architettonico orizzontale
gloss_en: In classical architecture, an architrave is the lintel or beam that rests on the capitals of columns. Element in Classical architecture, lintel beam

gloss_it: L'archivolto è un elemento architettonico che corona l’arco di una porta o finestra o di altra apertura avente varie funzioni.
gloss_en: An archivolt is an ornamental molding or band following the curve on the underside of an arch. It is composed of bands of ornamental moldings surrounding an arched opening, corresponding to the architrave in the case of a rectangular opening. Ornamental molding or band following the curve on the underside of an arch An ornamental molding or band following the curve on the underside of an arch. An ornamental molding or band following the underside of an arch.

A chambered cairn is a burial monument, usually constructed during the Neolithic, consisting of a sizeable chamber around and over which a cairn of stones was constructed. Types of megalithic burial monument Burial monument, usually constructed during the Neolithic, consisting of a sizeable chamber around and over which a cairn of stones was constructed

A certificate of occupancy is a document issued by a local government agency or building department certifying a building's compliance with applicable building codes and other laws, and indicating it to be in a condition suitable for occupancy. A legal document Document issued by a government authority, usually from the local government, certifying that a property is fit for a specific use in accordance with the applicable regulations.

gloss_it: Il panorama era un tipo di intrattenimento popolare in voga tra XVIII e XIX secolo, consistente essenzialmente in una stanza circolare con le pareti coperte da un disegno di una veduta a 360°, che ricreassero l'illusione di un paesaggio che circondava lo spettatore.
gloss_en: A cyclorama is a panoramic image on the inside of a cylindrical platform, designed to give viewers standing in the middle of the cylinder a 360° view, and also a building designed to show a panoramic image. Panoramic painting on the inside of a cylindrical canvas

gloss_it: Una fiamma eterna è una fiamma, una lampada o una torcia che brucia continuamente per un periodo indefinito.
gloss_en: An eternal flame is a flame, lamp or torch that burns for an indefinite time. A constantly burning flame Continuously burning fire or lamp

gloss_it: Il cemento a vista, detto anche calcestruzzo a vista o faccia a vista, indica una modalità di utilizzo architettonico del calcestruzzo che consiste nel non ricoprire le superfici a vista con intonaco o rivestirle con altri materiali, ma lasciarle piuttosto visibili, evidenziando le forme e le caratteristiche strutturali della costruzione edilizia.
gloss_en: Béton brut is a french term that translates in English to “raw concrete”. Unfinished concrete

An earth shelter is a structure with earth against the walls, on the roof, or that is entirely buried underground. Constructing a building into a hill side or Earth berm to reduce heating and cooling requirements House placed in slope

gloss_it: Il collezionismo d'arte, cioè l'abitudine di famiglie e soggetti privati di raccogliere opere d'arte, è strettamente connesso a motivazioni culturali ed estetiche, al fenomeno del mecenatismo ed al mercato dell'arte.
gloss_en: A private collection is a privately owned collection of works. A privately owned collection of works, usually a collection of art Privately owned collection of works, usually a collection of art
In Western ecclesiastical architecture, a cathedral diagram is a floor plan showing the sections of walls and piers, giving an idea of the profiles of their columns and ribbing.

Venetian Gothic is the local variant architectural style for Venice of Italian Gothic architecture, with a confluence of influences from local building requirements, some influence from Byzantine architecture, and some from Islamic architecture, reflecting Venice's trading network. Originated in the 14th century

Solar gain is the increase in thermal energy of a space, object or structure as it absorbs incident solar radiation. The percentage of incident Solar radiation transmitted by an object The increase in thermal energy of a space, object or structure as it absorbs incident solar radiation.

The Badami Chalukya architecture was a temple building idiom that evolved in the 5th – 8th centuries AD in the Malaprabha river basin, in present-day Bagalkot district of Karnataka state of India, under the Chalukya dynasty.

gloss_it: Nel tempio greco l'opistodomo è lo spazio posto dietro la cella.
gloss_en: An opisthodomos can refer to either the rear room of an ancient Greek temple or to the inner shrine, also called the adyton.

A wool church is an English church financed primarily by donations from rich merchants and farmers who had benefitted from the medieval wool trade, hoping to ensure a place in heaven due to their largesse. Church

gloss_it: L'hortus conclusus è la forma tipica di giardino medievale, legato soprattutto a monasteri e conventi.
gloss_en: Hortus conclusus is a Latin term, meaning literally "enclosed garden". Enclosed garden; attribute of the Virgin Mary

Dravidian architecture or the South Indian temple style is an architectural idiom in Hindu temple architecture that emerged in the southern part of the Indian subcontinent or South India and in Sri Lanka, reaching its final form by the sixteenth century. A style of temple construction Architectural idiom that emerged in the Southern part of the Indian subcontinent or South India, consisting primarily of temples with pyramid shaped towers

gloss_it: Un castello a base quadrangolare è un tipo di castello caratterizzato da una serie di edifici che si integrano con il muro di cortina, i quali racchiudono una corte centrale o un quadrangolo, e che tipicamente sono delimitati agli angoli da torri.
gloss_en: A quadrangular castle or courtyard castle is a type of castle characterised by ranges of buildings which are integral with the curtain walls, enclosing a central ward or quadrangle, and typically with angle towers. Type of castle
A parish church in the Church of England is the church which acts as the religious centre for the people within each Church of England parish.

gloss_it: Un matoi era un oggetto utilizzato durante il periodo Edo in Giappone dai pompieri
gloss_en: A matoi was a flag used in Edo period Japan by firemen to notify people of a fire near or within a building. flag used in Edo Japan to signal to firefighters that the building the flag was raised above was on fire
Staddle stones were originally used as supporting bases for granaries, hayricks, game larders, etc.

gloss_it: Il plastico ferroviario è una riproduzione, in scala, di un circuito ferroviario più o meno complesso, completo di ambientazione paesaggistica.
gloss_en: In model railroading, a layout is a diorama containing scale track for operating trains.

In archaeology, a celt is a long, thin, prehistoric, stone or bronze tool similar to an adze, hoe, or axe. Old general term for prehistoric stone or bronze axe-like tools Prehistoric tool, similar to adze, ax, or hoe
A courtyard house is a type of house—often a large house—where the main part of the building is disposed around a central courtyard.

A historiated initial is an initial, an enlarged letter at the beginning of a paragraph or other section of text, that contains a picture. decorated initial containing a scene or figure germane to the text

gloss_it: La casa lunga neolitica era una lunga e stretta dimora in legno costruita dai primi "agricoltori" dell'Europa Centrale e Occidentale, dal bacino parigino a quello pannonico, a partire dal VI millennio a.C..
gloss_en: The Neolithic long house was a long, narrow timber dwelling built by the first farmers in Europe beginning at least as early as the period 5000 to 6000 BC.

gloss_it: Un rivellino o revellino è un tipo di fortificazione indipendente generalmente posto a protezione di una porta di una fortificazione maggiore. Elemento architettonico
gloss_en: A ravelin is a triangular fortification or detached outwork, located in front of the innerworks of a fortress. Traingle shape fortification An outwork. A fortification outside a castle used to split an attacking force; composed of two faces, forming a salient angle whose gorge resembles a half-moon. Fortification outside a castle.
There are two types of exhibition catalogue : a printed list of exhibits at an art exhibition; and a directory of exhibitors at a trade fair or business-to-business event.

Chinese imperial roof decorations or roof charms or roof-figures or "walking beasts" or "crouching beasts" were statuettes placed along the ridge line of official buildings of the Chinese empire. statuettes placed along the ridge line of official buildings of the Chinese empire
Frauenroth Abbey is a former Cistercian nunnery in Burkardroth in Bavaria, South Germany, in the bishopric of Würzburg Cultural heritage monument D-6-72-117-10 in Burkardroth, Bavaria

An old master print is a work of art produced by a printing process within the Western tradition. A product of printmaking, such as an engraving, etching or woodcut, in the European tradition, instead of others (e.g., Asian), especially if made before 1830

gloss_it: In architettura si definisce monoptero un tempio costituito da un semplice colonnato circolare. Tempio circolare con colonnato
gloss_en: A monopteros is a circular colonnade supporting a roof but without any walls. Circular colonnade supporting a roof but without any walls
This article describes several characteristic architectural elements typical of European megalithic structures. Architectural elements typical of European megalithic structures

gloss_it: Una colonia romana era una comunità autonoma, situata in un territorio conquistato da Roma in cui si erano stanziati dei cittadini romani e/o latini, legata da vincoli di eterna alleanza con la madrepatria. In cui si erano stanziati dei cittadini romani. Tipologia di comunità civica nell'antica civiltà romana
gloss_en: A Roman colonia was originally a Roman outpost established in conquered territory to secure it. Roman outpost established in conquered territory to secure it
A bee bole is a cavity or alcove in a wall. The ancestor of modern bee hives.

gloss_it: Chindōgu è l'arte dell'inventare oggetti "utili ma inutilizzabili", inventata dal giapponese Kenji Kawakami.
gloss_en: Chindōgu originated in Japan and is characterized by the invention of ingenious everyday gadgets that seem to be ideal solutions to particular problems, but which, in fact, cause more problems than they solve.

gloss_it: Nelle chiese bizantine, barriera che separa la navata dai sacramenti all'altare
gloss_en: A templon is a feature of Byzantine churches consisting of a barrier separating the nave from the sacraments at the altar. A barrier between the nave and the altar in a Byzantine church.
A proskynetarion is a monumental icon of the Eastern Orthodox Church usually depicting Christ, the Virgin Mary, or the patron saint of a church. Icon in the Eastern Orthodox Church

gloss_it: L'architettura del Sahel, anche chiamata architettura sudano-saheliana, comprende un insieme di stili architettonici indigeni, comuni ai popoli del Sahel e di alcune aree pianeggianti e fertili dell'Africa occidentale, a sud del Sahara, ma soprattutto regioni forestali fertili della costa.
gloss_en: Sudano-Sahelian architecture refers to a range of similar indigenous architectural styles common to the African peoples of the Sahel and Sudanian grassland regions of West Africa, south of the Sahara, but north of the fertile forest regions of the coast. Range of similar indigenous architectural styles in West Africa

Passive ventilation is the process of supplying air to and removing air from an indoor space without using mechanical systems. Process of supplying air to and removing air from an indoor space without using mechanical systems

A print room is either a room or industrial building where printing takes place, or a room in an art gallery or museum, where a collection of old master and modern prints, usually together with drawings, watercolours and photographs, are held and viewed. Collection of prints, and sometimes drawings, watercolours and photographs

A rape is a traditional territorial sub-division of the county of Sussex in England, formerly used for various administrative purposes. A geographic unit in Sussex, England County subdivision One of the six former administrative divisions of Sussex, England.

gloss_it: Il giardino giapponese è un giardino tradizionale il cui progetto è basato sull'estetica e le idee filosofiche giapponesi, evitando ornamenti artificiali e sottolineando vedute naturali.
gloss_en: Japanese gardens are traditional gardens whose designs are accompanied by Japanese aesthetics and philosophical ideas, avoid artificial ornamentation, and highlight the natural landscape.

A shōji is a door, window or room divider used in traditional Japanese architecture, consisting of translucent sheets on a lattice frame. A type of Japanese room partition with a wooden frame holding a wooden or bamboo grid

gloss_it: Un castello concentrico è un castello posto all'interno di un altro castello, con due o più cerchie di mura concentriche e, a volte, senza dongione centrale.
gloss_en: A concentric castle is a castle with two or more concentric curtain walls, such that the inner wall is higher than the outer and can be defended from it. Fortification

gloss_it: Il castellano era il responsabile della custodia di un castello o di una rocca; con questo termine si poteva indicare sia il signore proprietario del castello stesso, sia l'ufficiale da questi nominato, che, al comando di una guarnigione, era incaricato di custodirlo e difenderlo in caso di attacco o assedio. Proprietario o custode di un castello
gloss_en: A castellan is the title used in Medieval Europe for an appointed official, a governor of a castle and its surrounding territory referred to as the castellany. The captain or official in charge of a castle Governor or captain of a castle The governor or caretaker of a castle or keep. Governor or caretaker of a castle or keep.

gloss_it: Con chalet svizzero si intende uno stile architettonico ispirato ai tipici chalet svizzeri.
gloss_en: Swiss chalet style is an architectural style of Late Historicism, originally inspired by rural chalets in Switzerland and the Alpine regions of Central Europe.

gloss_it: L'architettura coloniale olandese è uno stile architettonico domestico, caratterizzato soprattutto da tetti gambrel, in italiano mansarda, incurvati.
gloss_en: Dutch Colonial is a style of domestic architecture, primarily characterized by gambrel roofs having curved eaves along the length of the house.

In architecture and masonry, the term set-off is given to the horizontal line shown on a floor plan indicating a reduced wall thickness, and consequently the part of the thicker portion appears projecting before the thinner. The horizontal line shown on a floorplan indicating a reduced wall thickness, and consequently the part of the thicker portion appears projecting before the thinner
Acoustic transmission is the transmission of sounds through and between materials, including air, wall, and musical instruments.

A tin ceiling is an architectural element, consisting of a ceiling finished with plates of tin with designs pressed into them, that was very popular in Victorian buildings in North America in the late 19th and early 20th century.
