gloss_it: Con il termine autocostruzione nel campo dell'architettura si indicano le strategie per sostituire con operatori dilettanti le imprese che, in una struttura produttiva evoluta, si occupano normalmente della realizzazione dell'edificio per conto dei suoi futuri utenti. In edilizia e architettura, la realizzazione in proprio di abitazioni ed edifici
gloss_en: Self-build is the practice of creating an individual home for oneself through a variety of different methods. practice of creating one's own individual house

gloss_it: Una buca assassina è un buco ricavato nel soffitto tramite il quale i difendenti potevano sparare o lasciare cadere sostanze dannose sugli assalitori.
gloss_en: A murder hole or meurtrière is a hole in the ceiling of a gateway or passageway in a fortification through which the defenders could fire, throw or pour harmful substances or objects such as rocks, arrows, scalding water, hot sand, quicklime, tar, or boiling oil, down on attackers. A waterhole or pit in a bog where the bodies of murder victims were thrown. A slit or hole above the entrance to a fortification, thought to provide access for defenders to kill invaders.
A wicker man was a large wicker statue reportedly used by the ancient Druids for sacrifice by burning it in effigy. Effigy for burning in pagan ritual

gloss_it: Un cronogramma è una massima o un motto latino in cui alcune lettere corrispondono a numeri romani che, sommati, danno la data dell'evento al quale il testo si riferisce.
gloss_en: A chronogram is a sentence or inscription in which specific letters, interpreted as numerals, stand for a particular date when rearranged. Inscription whereby specific letters stand for a date A sentence or inscription in which the capital letters, interpreted in Roman numerals, stand for a particular date if rearranged.

gloss_it: Un plastico è un modello in scala che riproduce elementi architettonici.
gloss_en: An architectural model is a type of scale model – a physical representation of a structure – built to study aspects of an architectural design or to communicate design ideas. Scale model built to study aspects of an architectural design or to communicate design ideas
A sylvan theater—sometimes called a greenery theater —is a type of outdoor theater situated in a wooded setting. An outdoor theatre in a woodland setting

gloss_it: Le costruzioni metalliche sono opere edili la cui struttura portante è realizzata interamente in acciaio.
gloss_en: A steel building is a metal structure fabricated with steel for the internal support and for exterior cladding, as opposed to steel framed buildings which generally use other materials for floors, walls, and external envelope. Steel design, or more specifically, structural steel design, is an area of structural engineering used to design steel structures. Part of civil engineering
According to Hindu legends, Hemvati was a beautiful young woman for whom the famous temples of Khajuraho have been built.
The architecture of Indonesia reflects the diversity of cultural, historical and geographic influences that have shaped Indonesia as a whole. Overview of the architecture in Indonesia
A strategist is a person with responsibility for the formulation and implementation of a strategy. A person with responsibility for the formulation and implementation of a strategy

gloss_it: La grondaia è un canale di scolo per acque meteoriche, parte della gronda. Sistema di raccolta limita gli effetti di dilavamento dell'acqua sulla superficie esterna di un edificio, che ne comporterebbero il deterioramento, oltre a consistenti danni estetici di varia natura
gloss_en: A rain gutter, eavestrough, eaves-shoot or surface water collection channel is a component of a water discharge system for a building. A narrow trough or duct which collects rainwater from the roof of a building and diverts it away from the structure, typically into a drain. Component of a water discharge system for a building
The fortifications of London are extensive and mostly well maintained, though many of the City of London's fortifications and defences were dismantled in the 17th and 18th century.

An exhibition designer is a professional who creates fixtures and display stands for events such as large public exhibitions, conferences, trade shows and temporary displays for businesses, museums, libraries and art galleries. Professional who creates fixtures and display stands for events

A water castle is a castle or stately home whose site is entirely surrounded by water-filled moats or natural waterbodies such as island castles in a river or offshore. Fortification surrounded by water

gloss_it: L'amazzonomachia è un tema iconografico dell'arte greca e da qui passata anche all'arte etrusca, consistente nella rappresentazione della lotta tra Greci e Amazzoni.
gloss_en: In Greek mythology, Amazonomachy was one of various mythical battles between the ancient Greeks and the Amazons, a nation of all-female warriors. Artistic theme
A fly-whisk is a tool that is used to swat flies. Used as a flyswatter or as regalia
In classical architecture, a sima is the upturned edge of a roof which acts as a gutter. Upturned edge of an ancient roof The upturned edge of a roof which acts as a gutter; a cyma.

A candi is a Hindu or Buddhist temple in Indonesia, mostly built during the Zaman Hindu-Buddha or "Hindu-Buddhist period", between the 4th and 15th centuries. An Indonesian word for stupa (temple) Hindu and Buddhist temples and sanctuaries in Indonesia
A skyscraper fire or high-rise fire is a class of structural fire specific to tall buildings.

gloss_it: Le maschere sono un elemento fondamentale della cultura tradizionale e dell'arte dei popoli dell'Africa subsahariana e occidentale.
gloss_en: Traditional African masks play an important role in certain traditional African rituals and ceremonies. Ritual and ceremonial mask of Sub-Saharan Africa

lab_en: art and architecture of babylonia and assyria
gloss_it: Le prime civiltà del mondo sorsero in una regione dell'Asia Minore chiamata Mesopotamia, un territorio compreso tra i fiumi Tigri ed Eufrate, corrispondente all'odierno Iraq.
gloss_en: The architecture of Mesopotamia is ancient architecture of the region of the Tigris–Euphrates river system, encompassing several distinct cultures and spanning a period from the 10th millennium BC, when the first permanent structures were built in the 6th century BC.

gloss_it: Un hôtel particulier è un tipo di costruzione che si trova in Francia e consiste in un'abitazione lussuosa e di vaste dimensioni a foggia di villa ma costruita nel tessuto cittadino, spesso su più piani.
gloss_en: An hôtel particulier is a townhouse of a grand sort, comparable to the British townhouse or mansion. Townhouse of a grand sort
An Air traffic obstacle is a tall structure which can endanger air traffic.

gloss_it: Shan shui è uno stile di pittura cinese che riguarda o raffigura panorami o paesaggi naturali, usando pennello e inchiostro in luogo di colori più convenzionali.
gloss_en: Shan shui refers to a style of traditional Chinese painting that involves or depicts scenery or natural landscapes, using a brush and ink rather than more conventional paints. 山水 in Chinese, mountain water, landscape scene Art genre to draw landscapes
A Fête champêtre was a popular form of entertainment in the 18th century, taking the form of a garden party. Diversion in a park popular in the 18th-century
A pendhapa or pandhapa is a fundamental element of Javanese architecture; a large pavilion-like structure built on columns.

gloss_it: Anglès è un comune spagnolo di 5.446 abitanti situato nella comunità autonoma della Catalogna.
gloss_en: Anglès is a Spanish municipality, in the comarca of Selva, in the province of Girona, Catalonia, Spain.
An Imperial staircase is the name given to a staircase with divided flights. Type of staircase with divided flights

gloss_it: La lavanderia può essere intesa come: un locale dove si possono lavare i vestiti e la biancheria di una famiglia, di un'abitazione collettiva, di un ospedale, di un esercizio d'ospitalità ; oppure un reparto di una industria del settore abbigliamento o tessile che produce articoli che richiedono il lavaggio prima di altre lavorazioni ; oppure un esercizio pubblico o una industria che provvedono al lavaggio di abiti e biancheria per conto di clienti. Un locale
gloss_en: A laundry room is a room where clothes are washed and dried. equipment to wash laundry
A Jain temple or Derasar is the place of worship for Jains, the followers of Jainism. The place of worship for Jains, the followers of Jainism

gloss_it: La Tomba a pilastro è un tipo di tomba monumentale in cui la caratteristica centrale è un unico pilastro o colonna prominente, spesso in pietra.
gloss_en: A pillar tomb is a type of monumental grave wherein the central feature is a single, prominent pillar or column, often made of stone. Tipo de tumba monumental con un pilar o columna prominente

gloss_it: La parola "Acheropita" o "achiropita", dal Greco bizantino ἀχειροποίητα, significa "non fatto da mano ".
gloss_en: Acheiropoieta — also called Icons Made Without Hands — are Christian icons which are said to have come into existence miraculously; not created by a human. Christian icon said to have come into existence miraculously An image of Christ believed not to have been created by human hands.
Building design refers to the broadly based architectural, engineering and technical applications to the design of buildings. Planning and specifications for construction
The Aeolic order or Aeolian order was an early order of Classical architecture. Aka Aeolian order, an order of architecture
A garrison is an architectural style of house, typically two stories with the second story overhanging in the front. A type of house Architectural style of house

gloss_it: Il gruppo dei Tirannicidi è un gruppo scultoreo raffigurante Armodio e Aristogitone, realizzato da Crizio e Nesiote; è la prima statua del mondo greco che raffigura personaggi e fatti storici. Gruppo scultoreo greco
gloss_en: A sculptural pairing of the tyrannicides Harmodius and Aristogeiton was well known in the ancient world in two major versions but survives only in Roman marble copies. Classical Greek sculpture

gloss_it: Tra le varie strutture di culto tipiche della religione romana, come altari e sacelli, il più importante edificio sacro della Roma antica è il tempio. Struttura di culto tipica della religione romana
gloss_en: Ancient Roman temples were among the most important buildings in Roman culture, and some of the richest buildings in Roman architecture, though only a few survive in any sort of complete state. Ancient temple of the Roman culture
A room number is a number assigned to a room within a building. A number assigned to a room within a building

gloss_it: Il tempio può essere considerato la più impegnativa realizzazione dell'architettura greca antica.
gloss_en: Greek temples were structures built to house deity statues within Greek sanctuaries in ancient Greek religion. Structures built to house deity statues within Greek sanctuaries

gloss_it: L'iscrizione kalós è una forma di epigrafe diffusa sui vasi attici tra il 550 e il 450 a.C., di solito rinvenuta su vasi simposiaci.
gloss_en: A kalos inscription is a form of epigraph found on Attic vases and graffiti in antiquity, mainly during the Classical period from 550 to 450 BC. Form of epigraph found on Attic vases and graffiti in antiquity

gloss_it: In ingegneria elettrica il traliccio è un sostegno metallico a travatura reticolare che fa parte dell'infrastruttura di rete destinata al trasporto di energia elettrica nel caso di linee elettriche aeree. Struttura metallica che sostiene una linea elettrica
gloss_en: A transmission tower or power tower is a tall structure, usually a steel lattice tower, used to support an overhead power line. Used for electric power transmission
The architecture of Aylesbury, the county town of Buckinghamshire, reflects that which can be found in many small towns the length and breadth of England.
A proto-city, or a proto-town, is a large village or town of the Neolithic such as Jericho and Çatalhöyük, and also any prehistoric settlement which has both rural and urban features.

gloss_it: L'offerta votiva è un oggetto lasciato in un luogo sacro per scopi rituali, quali ad esempio un ex voto.
gloss_en: A votive offering or votive deposit is one or more objects displayed or deposited, without the intention of recovery or use, in a sacred place for religious purposes. Type of religious offering

gloss_it: Nell'antica Roma la taberna era un ambiente aperto su uno spazio più ampio, dotato di un'ampia porta, in genere dedicato ad attività commerciali.
gloss_en: A taberna was a type of shop or stall in Ancient Rome. Roman one-room, rectangular chambers opening directly off the street and used primarily as shops or booths A type of shop in Ancient Rome.

gloss_it: L'architettura Māru-Gurjara ebbe origine nel VI secolo in quello che è oggi la stato del Rajasthan in India.
gloss_en: The architecture of the Indian state of Rajasthan has usually been a regional variant of the style of Indian architecture prevailing in north India at the time. Architecture in the Indian state of Rajasthan

gloss_it: La jarokha è un tipo di balcone sopraelevato, utilizzato nell'architettura indiana, prevalentemente moghul e del Rajasthan.
gloss_en: A jharokha is a type of overhanging enclosed balcony used in the architecture of Rajasthan. A type of enclosed overhanging balcony in Indian architecture.
A chhajja is an overhanging eave or roof covering found in Indian architecture.
French Renaissance architecture is a style which was prominent between the late 15th and early 17th centuries in the Kingdom of France. Style of French architecture

Renaissance architecture was that style of architecture which evolved firstly in Florence and then Rome and other parts of the Italian Peninsula as the result of Renaissance humanism and a revived interest in Classical architecture. style of architecture

gloss_it: Nel campo dell'incisione uno stato è la differente "versione" di una stampa dovuta alle modifiche deliberate e permanenti effettuate sulla matrice, sia che si tratti di una lastra di rame o di un blocchetto di legno. stampa eseguita da un differente cambio sulla matrice
gloss_en: In printmaking, a state is a different form of a print, caused by a deliberate and permanent change to a matrix such as a copper plate  A unique form of a print, caused by a deliberate change to a matrix Print made by a permanent change to a matrix
A gridshell is a structure which derives its strength from its double curvature, but is constructed of a grid or lattice.
Australian artist-run initiatives are a series of artist-run initiatives and galleries found throughout Australia.
Earthbag construction is an inexpensive building method using mostly local soil to create structures which are both strong and can be quickly built. Building method

gloss_it: Il piano nobile è un elemento tradizionale e tipico dei palazzi nobiliari urbani dal primo rinascimento fino al XIX secolo circa, quando la distinzione di funzione fra i vari piani ed ambienti di un palazzo perse il rigido carattere schematico verso una maggiore libertà di destinazione degli ambienti. elemento architettonico
gloss_en: The piano nobile is the principal floor of a palazzo. Architectural element The floor of a building where the principal bedrooms and main reception rooms are found, very often on the first or second floor in older buildings. Floor.
Housing action trusts were non-departmental public bodies, set up to redevelop some of the poorest council housing estates in England's inner-city suburbs.
Plop art is a pejorative slang term for public art made for government or corporate plazas, spaces in front of office buildings, skyscraper atriums, parks, and other public venues.

gloss_it: Il paesaggio in prestito è una tecnica paesaggistica tipica dei giardini orientali cinesi e giapponesi, che consiste nell'incorporare elementi esterni del paesaggio all'interno della composizione di un giardino.
gloss_en: Borrowed scenery is the principle of "incorporating background landscape into the composition of a garden" found in traditional East Asian garden design. The principle of incorporating background landscape into the composition of a garden found in traditional East Asian garden design. Principle of incorporating background landscape into the composition of a garden.

gloss_it: L'architettura del ferro è un tipo di produzione architettonica diffusasi in Europa tra la fine dell'Ottocento e la prima metà del Novecento.
gloss_en: Cast-iron architecture is the use of cast iron in buildings and objects, ranging from bridges and markets to warehouses, balconies and fences. Type of architecture
A cove is a tightly concentrated group of large standing stones found in Neolithic and Bronze Age England. A megalithic feature

gloss_it: La cella era la parte interna di un tempio greco o romano.
gloss_en: A cella or naos is the inner chamber of an ancient Greek or Roman temple in classical antiquity. Inner chamber in a temple Inner chamber of a temple in classical architecture, or a shop facing the street in domestic Roman architecture The central, enclosed part of an ancient temple, as distinguished from the open porticos.

gloss_it: Le reliquie dei Sacri Chiodi sono tre e corrispondono ai chiodi che, secondo la tradizione, sono stati utilizzati durante la Crocifissione di Gesù. Chiodi che proverrebbero dalla croce di Gesù
gloss_en: Relics that are claimed to be the Holy Nails with which Jesus was crucified are objects of veneration among some Christians, particularly Roman Catholics and the Eastern Orthodox. Used in the crucifixion of Christ
Liturgical architecture refers to religious structures, forms, spaces and orders. Religious structures, forms, spaces and orders
In ancient Rome, Appias was a statue of a nymph near the Appiades Fountain in the Forum of Caesar.

gloss_it: Rijksmonument è la classificazione data dal Rijksdienst voor het Cultureel Erfgoed ad edifici o altri monumenti dei Paesi Bassi che si contraddistinguono per la particolare bellezza artistica, il valore storico o l'importanza scientifica. Classificazione data dal Rijksdienst voor het Cultureel Erfgoed
gloss_en: A rijksmonument is a national heritage site of the Netherlands, listed by the agency Rijksdienst voor het Cultureel Erfgoed acting for the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science. National heritage site of the Netherlands

A chapelry was a subdivision of an ecclesiastical parish in England and parts of Lowland Scotland up to the mid 19th century. subdivision of an ecclesiastical parish The district attached to a chapel; a division of a large parish which has its own district chapel.

gloss_it: Nell'antica Grecia, il gorgoneion era, in origine, un pendente orrorifico apotropaico che rappresentava la testa di una Gorgone.
gloss_en: In Ancient Greece, the Gorgoneion was a special apotropaic amulet showing the Gorgon head, used most famously by the Olympian deities Athena and Zeus: both are said to have worn the gorgoneion as a protective pendant, and often are depicted wearing it. Apotropaic amulet showing the Gorgon head A representation of a gorgon's head.

gloss_it: Dun è un termine celtico che significava in primo luogo "forte", ma oggi è anche usato come sinonimo di "collina".
gloss_en: A dun is an ancient or medieval fort. Generic term for an ancient or medieval fort An ancient or medieval fortification; especially a hill-fort in Scotland or Ireland.

gloss_it: Con il termine albarello o alberello si indica un recipiente usato nelle antiche farmacie per contenere spezie, prodotti erboristici o preparati medicinali come unguenti, polveri ed elettuari.
gloss_en: An albarello is a type of maiolica earthenware jar, originally a medicinal jar designed to hold apothecaries' ointments and dry drugs. type of drug jar A ceramic pharmacy or drug jar, generally majolica ware, usually tall rather than wide, and often of a waisted shape. Ceramic pharmacy or drug jar.

gloss_it: Architettura spontanea è una definizione dello storico e architetto Bernard Rudofsky che descrive quelle forme architettoniche-edilizie che appartengono alla tradizione più antica dell'uomo: dalle tende dei popoli nomadi alle tombe celtiche fino ai portici come dispositivo urbano e che non sono attribuibili a nessun progettista o autore in particolare. Metodi di costruzione che utilizzano risorse disponibili localmente per rispondere ai bisogni locali.
gloss_en: Vernacular architecture is architecture characterised by the use of local materials and knowledge, usually without the supervision of professional architects. A category of architecture based on local needs and construction materials, and reflecting local traditions Category of architecture based on local needs, construction materials and reflecting local traditions Methods of construction which use locally available resources to address local needs. A class of architectural styles which meet local needs, use local construction materials and reflect local traditions.

gloss_it: Un acroterio è in senso stretto un plinto al culmine del frontone nei templi e per estensione indica la decorazione che vi era collocata.
gloss_en: An acroterion or acroterium or akroteria is an architectural ornament placed on a flat pedestal called the acroter or plinth, and mounted at the apex or corner of the pediment of a building in the classical style. Architectural ornament on a flat pedestal mounted at the apex or corner of the pediment of a building
An akmon is a multi-ton concrete block used for breakwater and seawall armouring. Concrete breakwater element

gloss_it: Un leggio a forma di aquila è un elemento tradizionale dell'arredamento di una chiesa o cattedrale anglicana.
gloss_en: An eagle lectern is a lectern in the shape of an eagle on whose outstretched wings the Bible rests.
The conversion of barns involves the conversion of old farming barns to structures of commercial or residential use. Barn converted in to a house
A spring house, or springhouse, is a small building, usually of a single room, constructed over a spring. A small building used for refrigeration found in rural areas
A disc barrow is a type of tumulus or round barrow, a variety of fancy barrow identified in English Heritage's Monument Class Descriptions.

gloss_it: Lo zellige è un assemblaggio di piastrella tagliata in terracotta smaltata che riproduce un disegno geometrico.
gloss_en: Zellīj is a style of mosaic tilework made from individually hand-chiseled tile pieces set into a plaster base. Architectural element
The ancient boroughs were a historic unit of lower-tier local government in England and Wales. Historic unit of lower-tier local government in England and Wales
Tilt-up, tilt-slab or tilt-wall is a type of building and a construction technique using concrete.
Bathing played a major part in ancient Roman culture and society. Custom of ancient Roman society
Straw marquetry is a craft very similar to that of wood marquetry, except that straw replaces the wood veneer. craft imitating wood marquetry with straw
Like other Mesoamerican people, the traditional Maya recognize in their staple crop, maize, a vital force with which they strongly identify.

gloss_it: Il tachisme è uno stile pittorico di arte astratta iniziato in Francia negli anni quaranta e gli anni cinquanta.
gloss_en: Tachisme is a French style of abstract painting popular in the 1940s and 1950s. French style of abstract painting
Eastern Orthodox church architecture constitutes a distinct, recognizable family of styles among church architectures. Type of church building

gloss_it: La fusione a cera persa è una tecnica scultorea originariamente introdotta nell'età del bronzo, già dal 3500 a.C. dalle popolazioni sarde, e che nei secoli ha conosciuto una notevole fioritura, soprattutto nell’arte sarda, e nell'arte greca, romana e nella scultura monumentale, dalla prima derivate.
gloss_en: Lost-wax casting is the process by which a duplicate metal sculpture is cast from an original sculpture. Process by which a duplicate metal sculpture is cast from an original sculpture

gloss_it: L'opera quadrata, tecnica più antica sulla costruzione degli opus. tecnica edilizia dell'antica civiltà romana
gloss_en: Opus quadratum is an ancient Roman construction technique, in which squared blocks of stone of the same height were set in parallel courses, most often without the use of mortar. Roman masonry using parallel courses of squared stone of the same height

gloss_it: La parola latina castellum, diminutivo di castrum, si riferisce nella civiltà romana a due tipi di costruzioni: il castellum militare è un fortino, di solito integrato nel sistema di fortificazione del limes.
gloss_en: A castellum in Latin is usually: a small Roman fortlet or tower, a diminutive of castrum, often used as a watchtower or signal station like on Hadrian's Wall. Smaller castrum A small Roman detached fort or fortlet used as a watch tower or signal station.

A sill plate or sole plate in construction and architecture is the bottom horizontal member of a wall or building to which vertical members are attached. Bottom horizontal member of a wall or building to which vertical members are attached The bottom horizontal member of a wall or building to which vertical members are attached.
A kneeler is a cushion or a piece of furniture used for resting in a kneeling position during Christian prayer. Furniture in a place of worship for kneeling.

Kilkenny marble or Kilkenny black marble is a fine-grained very dark grey carboniferous limestone found around County Kilkenny in Ireland in the "Butlersgrove Formation", a Lower Carboniferous limestone that contains fossils of brachiopods, gastropods, crinoids and corals.
Commercially, a smoke flap can take the form of a metal, tin, or other alloy and can be manipulatable by hand or lever, and appears in home chimneys, stoves or boilers.

Portuguese architecture refers to both the architecture of present-day Portugal's territory in Continental Portugal, the Azores and Madeira, as well as the architectural heritage/patrimony of Portuguese architects and styles throughout the world, particularly in countries formerly part of the Portuguese Empire.

gloss_it: Un giardino islamico è generalmente una proprietà espressiva della terra che include temi di acqua e ombra. Giardino particolare dei paesi islamici
gloss_en: An Islamic garden is generally an expressive estate of land that includes themes of water and shade.

A Bremer wall, or T-wall, is a twelve-foot-tall portable, steel-reinforced concrete blast wall of the type used for blast protection throughout Iraq and Afghanistan. Used for protection by American forces in Iraq Concrete barrier used to protect structures from explosions

The architecture of Thailand is a major part of the country's cultural legacy and reflects both the challenges of living in Thailand's sometimes extreme climate as well as, historically, the importance of architecture to the Thai people's sense of community and religious beliefs.
A round church is a special type of church construction, having a completely circular plan. Type of church construction

gloss_it: Il talud-tablero è uno stile architettonico usato molto comunemente nelle piattaforme, nei templi e nelle piramidi della Mesoamerica precolombiana, che divenne popolare nel Primo periodo classico di Teotihuacan.
gloss_en: Talud-tablero is an architectural style most commonly used in platforms, temples, and pyramids in Pre-Columbian Mesoamerica, becoming popular in the Early Classic Period of Teotihuacan. Pre-Columbian  architectural style

In Indian architecture, gavaksha or chandrashala are the terms most often used to describe the motif centred on an ogee, circular or horseshoe arch that decorates many examples of Indian rock-cut architecture and later Indian structural temples and other buildings. motif centred on an arch in Indian rock-cut architecture

gloss_it: La terra armata è una tecnologia impiegata per le opere di sostegno delle terre, messa a punto nel 1966 dall'ingegnere Henri Vidal a Parigi, che permette di realizzare spalle di ponte e muri di sostegno per strade, autostrade e ferrovie.
gloss_en: Mechanically stabilized earth is soil constructed with artificial reinforcing.
Smart glass or switchable glass is a glass or glazing whose light transmission properties are altered when voltage, light, or heat is applied.

gloss_it: L'ortostato è, nell'architettura, una lastra in pietra, legno o terracotta con funzione di sostegno o di contenimento e anche di abbellimento, se decorato o iscritto.
gloss_en: In the context of classical Greek architecture, orthostates are squared stone blocks much greater in height than depth that are usually built into the lower portion of a wall. vertical stone plaque in Mediterranean antique architecture

gloss_it: L'oratorio è un luogo della cristianità solitamente di piccole dimensioni destinato alla preghiera e al culto privato di famiglie o comunità. Luogo consacrato, solitamente di piccole dimensioni, destinato alla preghiera e al culto privato di famiglie o comunità. Luogo della cristianità solitamente di piccole dimensioni destinato alla preghiera
gloss_en: In the canon law of the Catholic Church, an oratory is a place which is set aside by permission of an ordinary for divine worship, for the convenience of some community or group of the faithful who assemble there, but to which other members of the faithful may have access with the consent of the competent superior. A place of worship Room for prayer

gloss_it: La cornice marcapiano è un elemento architettonico tipico delle architetture residenziali, come palazzi e ville.
gloss_en: A belt course, also called a stringcourse or sillcorse, is a continuous row or layer of stones or brick set in a wall.

gloss_it: Un manoscritto miniato è un manoscritto il cui testo è completato dall'aggiunta di decorazioni, come ad esempio capolettera, bordi e inserimento di figure. Manoscritto il cui testo è completato dall'aggiunta di decorazioni Manoscritto il cui testo è completato con l'aggiunta di decorazioni, come le iniziali decorate, i confini e le illustrazioni in miniatura.
gloss_en: An illuminated manuscript is a manuscript in which the text is supplemented with such decoration as initials, borders, and miniature illustrations. The artistic decoration of hand-written texts Manuscript in which the text is supplemented by the addition of decoration A manuscript in which the text is supplemented by the addition of decoration, such as decorated initials, borders and miniature illustrations.

gloss_it: L'adeguamento sismico delle strutture consiste nella modificazione delle costruzioni esistenti per renderle più resistenti all'azione sismica, ossia al movimento del terreno dovuto a un terremoto.
gloss_en: Seismic retrofitting is the modification of existing structures to make them more resistant to seismic activity, ground motion, or soil failure due to earthquakes. Modification of existing structures to make them more resistant to seismic activity Modification of a building that already exists to make it seismically fit.

ArtAsiaPacific is the longest running English-language periodical solely dedicated to covering contemporary art and culture from sixty-seven countries, territories, and Chinese Special Administrative Regions that it considers to be within Asia, the Pacific, and the Middle East. A contemporary art and culture magazine magazine

A larnax is a type of small closed coffin, box or "ash-chest" often used as a container for human remains in the Minoan civilization and in Ancient Greece, either a body or cremated ashes. Small closed burial-chest, often used as a container for human remains in Minoan culture and Greek antiquity A small closed coffin, box or cinerary urn often used as a container for human remains in Ancient Greece. Small closed coffin, box or cinerary urn.

gloss_it: Un paravento è un tipo di mobile.
gloss_en: A folding screen is a type of free-standing furniture. A piece of furniture Furniture consisting of flat, hinged panels for dividing a room, sometimes with artistic decoration

gloss_it: Situate nell'odierno Sudan, le piramidi nubiane sono piramidi costruite da vari re dei regni Kush ed egizio, oltre 500 anni dopo che in Egitto e nella valle del Nilo se ne era cessata la costruzione.
gloss_en: Nubian pyramids are pyramids that were built by the rulers of the ancient Kushite kingdoms. Pyramids that were built by the rulers of the ancient Kushite kingdoms

gloss_it: L'architettura italiana sviluppò caratteri omogenei sotto l'Impero romano. Architettura dell'Italia
gloss_en: Italy has a very broad and diverse architectural style, which cannot be simply classified by period or region, due to Italy's division into various small states until 1861. Overview of the architecture in Italy
The architecture of Germany has a long, rich and diverse history. Overview of the architecture of Germany

The architecture of Finland has a history spanning over 800 years, and while up until the modern era the architecture was strongly influenced by currents from Finland's two respective neighbouring ruling nations Sweden and Russia, from the early 19th century onwards influences came directly from further afield: first when itinerant foreign architects took up positions in the country and then when the Finnish architect profession became established.

gloss_it: L'opera spicata è un tipo di paramento costituito da laterizi collocati di taglio secondo la disposizione di una lisca di pesce o di una spiga di grano, utilizzata in epoca romana antica. tecnica edilizia dell'antica civiltà romana
gloss_en: Opus spicatum, literally "spiked work," is a type of masonry construction used in Roman and medieval times. Type of masonry construction used in Roman and medieval times

An equivalent dumping coefficient is a mathematical coefficient used in the calculation of the energy dispersed when a structure moves. Used in the calculation of the energy dispersed when a building moves mathematical energy physics coefficient in engineering
The design of a prairie barn, also known as the Western barn, reflects the iconic image of an American barn.
Crib barns were a popular type of barn found throughout the U.S. south and southeast regions. A popular type of barn found throughout the U.S. south and southeast regions
The English barn, or three bay barn, is a barn style that was most popular in the northeast region of the USA, but are the most widespread barn type in America.

In architecture, a hood mould, label mould, drip mould or dripstone, is an external moulded projection from a wall over an opening to throw off rainwater. An architectural feature for handling rain water
Dutch barn is the name given to markedly different types of barns in the United States and Canada, and in the United Kingdom.
A sculpture garden or sculpture park is an outdoor garden dedicated to the presentation of sculpture, usually several permanently sited works in durable materials in landscaped surroundings.
A rice barn is a type of barn used worldwide for the storage and drying of harvested rice.
A gotul is a spacious tribal hut surrounded by earthen or wooden walls. A spacious tribal hut used for education etc. in Gond culture.
A Pennsylvania barn is a type of banked barn built in the US from about 1790 to 1900. Type of banked barn

gloss_it: Il metodo paranoico-critico è una tecnica concepita dall'artista Salvador Dalí all'inizio degli anni 30, usata nelle sue opere soprattutto pittoriche che coinvolgano le illusioni ottiche ed altri tipi di immagini multiple.
gloss_en: The paranoiac-critical method is a surrealist technique developed by Salvador Dalí in the early 1930s.
A functionally classified barn is a barn whose style is best classified by its function.

gloss_it: La città lineare, in urbanistica, è una città sviluppata lungo un asse di indefinita lunghezza, normalmente costituito da un'arteria di trasporto come una ferrovia.
gloss_en: The linear city was an urban plan for an elongated urban formation. A type of urban plan

Monolithic architecture describes buildings which are carved, cast or excavated from a single piece of material, historically from rock. A style of construction in which a building is carved, cast or excavated from a single piece of material
The Building Research Establishment is a centre of building science in the United Kingdom, owned by charitable organisation the BRE Trust. Institution in United Kingdom Institution in United Kingdom
As with other towns and cities in Ireland, Letterkenny has a history of great architecture.
A country estate of 438 acres, the heart of Heckfield Place is a Georgian Grade II listed manor house.
A breezeway is an architectural feature similar to a hallway that allows the passage of a breeze between structures to accommodate high winds, allow aeration, or provide aesthetic design variation.
The Wandjina, also written Wanjina and Wondjina and also known as Gulingi, are cloud and rain spirits from Australian Aboriginal mythology that are depicted prominently in rock art in Australia.

The French term goût grec is often applied to the earliest expression of the neoclassical style in France and refers specifically to the decorative arts and architecture of the mid-1750s to the late 1760s. Style of decorative arts 18th-century French style of art and architecture

Short-term rental describes furnished self-contained apartments that are rented for short periods of time, usually by the month as opposed to annual rentals in the unfurnished apartment rental market. rental of furnished self-contained apartments for short periods of time

gloss_it: Una silhouette, in italiano siluetta o siloetta, è, nelle arti visive, un'immagine di un oggetto che ne rende esclusivamente i contorni. Aspetto e arte da dove si vede solo il contorno di qualcosa
gloss_en: A silhouette is the image of a person, animal, object or scene represented as a solid shape of a single colour, usually black, with its edges matching the outline of the subject. Appearance and art form where only the outline of something is visible A representation of the outlines of an object filled in with a single color.

lab_en: national register of historic places contributing resource
national register of historic places contributing property
gloss_en: In the law regulating historic districts in the United States, a contributing property or contributing resource is any building, object, or structure which adds to the historical integrity or architectural qualities that make the historic district, listed locally or federally, significant.

In art, an underpainting is an initial layer of paint applied to a ground, which serves as a base for subsequent layers of paint. Initial layer of paint applied to a ground, which serves as a base for subsequent layers of paint An initial layer of paint, often monochromatic, applied to a ground as a base for subsequent layers.

gloss_it: L'imprimitura, detta anche mestica o anche imprimatura, è la preparazione del supporto pittorico, consiste nel primo strato di materia che viene applicato al fondo grezzo, sia esso tela, tavola, carta o altro, prima che vi si dipinga sopra. Strato di vernice di base utilizzato per migliorare la successiva verniciatura finale.
gloss_en: In painting, imprimatura is an initial stain of color painted on a ground. In the art of painting, any colored glaze, size, or wash applied on top of a white ground
The "Coptic period" is an informal designation for Late Roman Egypt and Byzantine Egypt.

lab_en: architecture of the people's republic of china
architecture in the people's republic of china
architecture of the republic of china
gloss_it: Con architettura cinese ci si riferisce a uno stile architettonico che ha preso forma in Asia orientale nel corso dei secoli.
gloss_en: Chinese architecture demonstrates an architectural style that developed over millennia in China, before spreading out to influence architecture throughout East Asia. Style of architecture

gloss_it: L'architettura postmoderna definisce alcune esperienze che iniziarono a manifestarsi dagli anni cinquanta del XX secolo, e che divennero un movimento solo nella seconda metà degli anni settanta. Stile architettonico
gloss_en: Postmodern architecture is a style or movement which emerged in the 1960s as a reaction against the austerity, formality, and lack of variety of modern architecture, particularly in the international style advocated by Philip Johnson and Henry-Russell Hitchcock. Architectural style

gloss_it: Con il termine composto casa museo si indica una tipologia museale.
gloss_en: A historic house museum is a house that has been transformed into a museum.

gloss_it: La barbottina è un legante liquido, ma piuttosto viscoso e di consistenza cremosa, ottenuto dall'impasto di acqua e argilla in quantità variabili a seconda dell'uso.
gloss_en: A slip is a liquid mixture or slurry of clay and/or other materials suspended in water. An aqueous suspension of minerals, frequently a deflocculant Liquid mixture or slurry of clay and/or other materials suspended in water

In North America, a standpipe is a type of rigid water piping which is built into multi-story buildings in a vertical position or bridges in a horizontal position, to which fire hoses can be connected, allowing manual application of water to the fire. A rigid vertical or horizontal pipe to which fire hoses can be connected

gloss_it: Un plafond, in campo assicurativo e creditizio e finanziario rappresenta l'importo limite di un fido bancario, di una carta di credito o di una carta di debito.
gloss_en: A plafond, in a broad sense, is a ceiling.

A salabhanjika or shalabhanjika is the sculpture of a woman, displaying stylised feminine features, standing near a tree and grasping a branch. In Indian art, a sculpture of a woman with stylized feminine features, standing near a tree and grasping a branch.
An environmental portrait is a portrait executed in the subject's usual environment, such as in their home or workplace, and typically illuminates the subject's life and surroundings.
Medium specificity is a consideration in aesthetics and art criticism.
A shop drawing is a drawing or set of drawings produced by the contractor, supplier, manufacturer, subcontractor, consultants, or fabricator.

gloss_it: La diagnosi energetica o audit energetico è una valutazione sistematica, documentata e periodica dell'efficienza energetica.
gloss_en: An energy audit is an inspection survey and an analysis of energy flows for energy conservation in a building.

gloss_it: Il tulou, o "costruzione di terra", è un'abitazione contadina collettiva, costruita a fortezza, residenza tradizionale del popolo degli Hakka nella Cina meridionale.
gloss_en: A tulou, or "earthen building", is a traditional communal Hakka people residence found in Fujian, in South China, usually of a circular configuration surrounding a central shrine, and part of Hakka architecture. oftenly circular structural building shape of Hakka architecture in Fujian, China

lab_en: architecture of polish churches in the united states
list of polish cathedral style churches in chicago
gloss_en: The Polish Cathedral architectural style is a North American genre of Catholic church architecture found throughout the Great Lakes and Middle Atlantic regions as well as in parts of New England. Architectural design influenced by Polish Catholic immigrants
A clerk of works or clerk of the works is employed by an architect or a client on a construction site.

A marriage stone, nuptial stone or lintel stone is usually a stone, rarely wood, lintel carved with the initials, coat of arms, etc. of a newly married couple, usually displaying the date of the marriage.
Victorian decorative arts refers to the style of decorative arts during the Victorian era.

gloss_it: L'arte di guerra è un'arte con un soggetto militare, indipendentemente dal suo stile o mezzo. Opere artistiche di tema militare
gloss_en: The genre of art depicting military themes. Military art is art with a military subject matter, regardless of its style or medium. Works of art on military themes

The Low German house or Fachhallenhaus is a type of timber-framed farmhouse found in Northern Germany and the Netherlands, which combines living quarters, byre and barn under one roof. A type of German timber-framed farmhouse Type of timber-framed farmhouse found in Northern Germany and the Netherlands, which combines living quarters, byre and barn under one roof
Silesian architecture is the name given to the constructions made in Silesia throughout time, and those by Silesian architects worldwide.

gloss_it: Una alta croce detta talvolta impropriamente croce astile è una croce cristiana in pietra eretta solitaria in un luogo e spesso riccamente decorata e scolpita.
gloss_en: A high cross or standing cross is a free-standing Christian cross made of stone and often richly decorated. Early Medieval free-standing Christian cross made of stone and often richly decorated Free-standing Christian cross made of stone and often richly decorated A large free-standing Celtic cross made of stone and often richly decorated. A large free-standing Celtic cross made of stone.

The rubble trench foundation, an ancient construction approach popularized by architect Frank Lloyd Wright, is a type of foundation that uses loose stone or rubble to minimize the use of concrete and improve drainage.
Ceramic houses are buildings made of an earth mixture which is high in clay, and fired to become ceramic.

In two-dimensional works of art, such as painting, printmaking, photography or bas-relief, repoussoir is an object along the right or left foreground that directs the viewer's eye into the composition by bracketing the edge.
A tin can wall is a wall constructed from tin cans, which are not a common building source.
In archaeology, timber circles are circular arrangements of wooden posts interpreted as being either complexes of freestanding poles or as the supports for large circular buildings.
A bottle wall is a wall made out of glass or plastic bottles and binding material.

gloss_it: Uno shabono è un tipo di capanna usato dagli Yanomami che vivono tra il confine del Venezuela e il Brasile.
gloss_en: A shabono is a hut used by the Yanomami, an indigenous people in extreme southern Venezuela and extreme northern Brazil. A hut used by the Yanomami A traditional communal hut built by the Yanomamo, traditionally of thatched palm leaves and wood and divided into areas for different family units.

The caisson, also referred to as a caisson ceiling, or spider web ceiling, in East Asian architecture is an architectural feature typically found in the ceiling of temples and palaces, usually at the centre and directly above the main throne, seat, or religious figure. A spider web ceiling

gloss_it: Devadasi è un termine usato in India per indicare le donne che, secondo una pratica religiosa induista, vengono fatte "sposare" alla divinità di un tempio.
gloss_en: In Southern India, a devadasi was a female artist who was dedicated to worship and serve a deity or a temple for the rest of her life. Girl "dedicated" to worship and service of a deity or a temple for the rest of her life A girl that underwent Hindu religious practice in which they would be "married" to a deity. In addition to taking care of the temple, she learned and practiced Bharatanatyam and other classical Indian arts traditions, and enjoyed a high social status.
Protest art is the creative works produced by activists and social movements.

gloss_it: Un'Apsaras o Accharā, è uno spirito femmina delle nubi e delle acque nelle mitologie indù e buddista, come attesta l'etimologia del nome ap e sar.
gloss_en: An apsara, also spelled as apsaras, is a type of female spirit of the clouds and waters in Hindu and Buddhist culture. Type of female spirit of the clouds and waters in Hindu and Buddhist culture

gloss_it: Il Labirinto di Porsenna è costituito da una serie di cunicoli sotterranei posti sotto l'abitato antico di Chiusi, in particolare sotto piazza del Duomo, la cattedrale e gli edifici circostanti. Sezione sotterranea del Museo delle Cattedrale di Chiusi, e percorso sotterraneo nei cunicoli del sistema idraulico e acquedotti che s’irradiavano sotto la città.
gloss_en: archaeological site

gloss_it: Il cartone in campo artistico è un bozzetto, uno studio preparatorio per la realizzazione di un affresco.
gloss_en: Life-size drawing on cardboard, used as a design for an artwork
staple, spike, or block made from wood or metal used to hold two masonry units together
Hinged panel within an opening
Standing stone in Simandre-sur-Suran, France
A loja is a kind of a grocery-bar or a characteristic boutique in Cape Verde, which makes up a subdivision of a Creole lifestyle.
Refugee castle in Ittelsburg, a district of Bad Grönenbach

Twickel is a protected historic country estate with 81 complex parts near Delden in the hamlet of Deldeneresch, in the municipality of Hof van Twente in the province of Overijssel in The Netherlands. Castle in Delden, Overijssel
Bridge in Amsterdam
estate in Groningen, the Netherlands

gloss_it: La casa dei Grifi è un'antica abitazione romana sul colle Palatino, al di sotto dell'ala settentrionale del palazzo di Domiziano, che la seppellì.
gloss_en: A domus of the Roman republican period now obscured beneath the palace of the emperor Domitian. The wall decorations demonstrate the transition from the First to the Second Pompeian style.

lab_it: affreschi di san vincenzo al volturno
gloss_it: Gli affreschi di San Vincenzo al Volturno sono un ciclo di affreschi dell'abbazia di San Vincenzo al Volturno, a Castel San Vincenzo. ciclo di affreschi dell'abbazia di San Vincenzo al Volturno realizzati nel secondo quarto del IX secolo
gloss_en: cycle of frescoes from the old abbey of San Vincenzo al Volturno made in the second quarter of the 9th century
A windmill in Rotterdam, Netherlands
Apartment in the Hague
Open air bandstand in Kampen, Netherlands

A staircase tower or stair tower is a tower-like wing of a building with a circular or polygonal plan that contains a stairwell, usually a helical staircase. shaft within a building housing staircases and landings A shaft in a multi-story building enclosing a stairway or staircase. A shaft in a multi-story building enclosing a stairway or staircase.

The Building Performance Database is an anonymized database that contains energy use intensity data for hundreds of thousands of buildings in the United States. A database maintained by the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory for the Department of Energy in the United States with anonymized data on the energy use intensity of hundreds of thousands of buildings in the United States
A Ramachandran: A Retrospective, is a two-volume book by Indian art historian R. Siva Kumar.

gloss_it: La Jentower, o Intershop Tower è un grattacielo della città di Jena.
gloss_en: The JenTower is a skyscraper in Jena, Germany. Skyscraper in Jena, Germany

gloss_it: Le Sante Piaghe o otto Sante Piaghe sono le ferite sofferte da Cristo durante la Crocefissione.
gloss_en: In Christian tradition, the Five Holy Wounds, also known as the Five Sacred Wounds or the Five Precious Wounds, are the five piercing wounds Jesus Christ suffered during the crucifixion. The five piercing wounds Jesus suffered during the crucifixion, i.e. those in his hands and feet and the lance wound on his side

A killing field, in military science, is an area in front of a defensive position that the enemy must cross during an assault and is specifically intended to allow the defending troops to incapacitate a large number of the enemy.

lab_en: exhibition of achievements of national economy
exhibition of soviet national economic achievement
gloss_it: L'Esposizione delle conquiste dell'economia popolare è una fiera-esposizione commerciale permanente di Mosca, sita nel quartiere Ostankinskij nel nord-est della città.
gloss_en: Exhibition of Achievements of National Economy is a permanent general purpose trade show and amusement park in Moscow, Russia. Known as All-Russia Exhibition Center in 1992 -- 2014 Trade show in Moscow, Russia
In architecture, a perron generally refers to an external stairway to a building. Stairs A platform outside the raised entrance to a church or large building, or the steps leading to such a platform.
In Sundanese and Javanese wayang, Tumaritis is a place or a mythological abode of the Punokawan clown-servants.
House raising is the process of separating a building from its foundation and temporarily raising it with hydraulic screw jacks.
The harbours serving Irvine at Seagatefoot and Fullarton in North Ayrshire have had a long and complex history. Harbour in North Ayrshire, Scotland, UK

In the United Kingdom, the term conservation area nearly always applies to an area of special architectural or historic interest the character of which is considered worthy of preservation or enhancement. Protected area, usually architectural or urban, in the UK

gloss_it: Il passage, termine francese per passaggio, può considerarsi la prima forma di galleria commerciale coperta.
gloss_en: Part of building
Plastered human skulls are reconstructed human skulls that were made in the ancient Levant between 9,000 and 6,000 BC in the Pre-Pottery Neolithic B period.

A regents group portrait, is a group portrait of the board of trustees, called regents or regentesses, of a charitable organization or guild. Group portrait of regents of an organisation (usually a Dutch charity)

gloss_it: Bijin-ga è un termine generico che indica immagini di belle donne nell'arte giapponese, specie nella xilografia del genere ukiyo-e, che precorre la fotografia.
gloss_en: Bijin-ga is a generic term for pictures of beautiful women in Japanese art, especially in woodblock printing of the ukiyo-e genre, which predate photography. Japanese art genre

A curtain wall is a defensive wall between two towers of a castle, fortress, or town. Defensive wall between two towers of a castle, fortress or town The outer wall of a castle or defensive wall between two bastions.

gloss_it: Un autoritratto è un ritratto che un artista fa di sé stesso.
gloss_en: A self-portrait is a representation of an artist that is drawn, painted, photographed, or sculpted by that artist. In which the artist portrays his own image Representation of an artist, drawn, painted, photographed, or sculpted by the artist Portrait which depicts the artist himself.
A tower castle is a small castle that mainly consists of a fortified tower or a tower-like structure that is built on natural ground. Dushyant Sidar is life

gloss_it: Il pastello è una tecnica di disegno che usa bastoncini di pigmento colorato. Tecnica di disegno
gloss_en: A pastel is an art medium in the form of a stick, consisting of powdered pigment and a binder. Painting or drawing equipment An art medium in the form of a stick, consisting of pure powdered pigment and a binder.

The unchambered long barrow earthen long barrow, non-megalithic long barrow or non-megalithic mound, is a type of long barrow found across the British Isles, in a belt of land in Brittany, and in northern Europe as far east as the River Vistula. Type of barrow
The term drum tower is used to refer to a tower in the center of an old Chinese city, housing signal drums. Asian style of tower, traditionally for drum signalling
Castle chapels in European architecture are chapels that were built within a castle.
In art history, formalism is the study of art by analyzing and comparing form and style. That a work's artistic value is entirely determined by its form
The calefactory was an important room or building in a medieval monastery in Western Europe. The room or building in a monastery holding its communal fire, kept warm and used as a sitting room.

gloss_it: La tecnica a sbalzo.
gloss_en: Repoussé or repoussage refer to a metalworking technique in which a malleable metal is shaped by hammering from the reverse side to create a design in low relief. Hand sheet metal Metalworking technique A metalworking technique in which a malleable metal is ornamented or shaped by hammering from the reverse side.

lab_en: architecture in the republic of kosovo
gloss_en: The architecture of Kosovo dates back to the Neolithic period and includes the Copper, Bronze and Iron Ages, Antiquity and the Medieval period.

gloss_it: giudice di una competizione
gloss_en: A juried competition is a competition in which participants' work is judged by a person or panel of persons convened specifically to judge the participants' efforts, either by the competition's stated rubric or by a subjective set of criteria dependent upon the nature of the competition or the judges themselves. Person or panel of persons convened specifically to judge the participants' efforts

Proper right and proper left are conceptual terms used to unambiguously convey relative direction when describing an image or other object. Terms for unambiguous directions, like port and starboard terms for unambiguous directions, like port and starboard, relative to a depicted subject's perspective

gloss_it: Un rotolo appeso è uno dei molti modi tradizionali di mostrare ed esporre la pittura e la calligrafia cinesi.
gloss_en: A hanging scroll is one of the many traditional ways to display and exhibit East Asian painting and calligraphy. A type of decorative art Type of scroll painting

A compressed earth block, also known as a pressed earth block or a compressed soil block, is a building material made primarily from damp soil compressed at high pressure to form blocks. building material
The fort was part of the defensive system of the Roman province of Dacia in the 2nd and 3rd centuries AD. Small Roman fort in Dacia

gloss_it: Il vetro dorato, fondo d'oro o vetro d'oro, è un artefatto di lusso in vetro, in cui una decorazione in foglia d'oro è fusa tra due strati di vetro.
gloss_en: Gold glass or gold sandwich glass is a luxury form of glass where a decorative design in gold leaf is fused between two layers of glass.
A twin-pyramid complex or twin-pyramid group was an architectural innovation of the Maya civilization of ancient Mesoamerica.

Sheldon tapestries were produced at Britain's first large tapestry works in Barcheston, Warwickshire, England, established by the Sheldon family. tapestries attributed to the English  workshops established by William Sheldon in the 1560s
A castle well was a water well built to supply drinking water to a castle. Provided a protected source of drinking water Water well built to supply drinking water to a castle
The development of a distinct architectural style in Paraguay is relatively recent. Distinctive architectural style of Paraguay
Joge-e are special playful images that were often created in the Meiji era in Japan. Japanese art genre
A Chinese palace is an imperial complex where the court and the civil government resided.

gloss_it: Con il termine allegra compagnia si indica nella storia dell'arte un dipinto, di solito del XVII secolo, che raffigura un piccolo gruppo di persone che si divertono, di solito seduti con bevande e spesso mentre fanno musica.
gloss_en: Merry company is the term in art history for a painting, usually from the 17th century, showing a small group of people enjoying themselves, usually seated with drinks, and often music-making. Term in art history for a painting showing a small group of people enjoying themselves A painting, usually from the 17th century, showing a small group of people enjoying themselves, usually seated with drinks and music.
garden of Mirabell Palace in Salzburg, Austria
The East Asian hip-and-gable roof consists of a hip roof that slopes down on all four sides and integrates a gable on two opposing sides. Type of roof in East Asian architecture

gloss_it: Il belvedere è una struttura architettonica, solitamente posta in posizione rialzata o panoramica, così chiamata per le sue aperture, come finestre o portici, verso l'esterno di modo da offrire una visuale gradevole al visitatore. Spazio di edificio o urbano Struttura architettonica
gloss_en: A belvedere or belvidere is an architectural structure sited to take advantage of a fine or scenic view. An architectural term for a structure designed to incorporate a view Architectural structure A turret or other raised structure offering a pleasant view of the surrounding area. Raised structure offering a pleasant view of the surrounding area.

The double chapel, sometimes double church, is a chapel or church building with two storeys that either have a central aperture enabling their simultaneous use for services or are completely separate, just connected by a staircase, and used for different liturgical functions.
Fine art nude photography is a genre of fine-art photography which depicts the nude human body with an emphasis on form, composition, emotional content, and other aesthetic qualities.
American historic carpentry is the historic methods with which wooden buildings were built in what is now the United States since European settlement.

gloss_it: Il riwaq è un porticato o arcata aperta su almeno un lato.
gloss_en: A riwaq is an arcade or portico open on at least one side. An arcade in Islamic architecture

gloss_it: Un santuario è un luogo considerato sacro per la manifestazione del divino, per la presenza di sepolture di personaggi importanti o reliquie, o perché connesso a eventi considerati soprannaturali. Luogo di culto di una religione Luogo di culto al quale viene attribuita particolare venerazione per la presenza di reliquie di santi.
gloss_en: A sanctuary, in its original meaning, is a sacred place, such as a shrine. Place of worship which is given special reverence for the presence of the relics of saints.

An A-frame house or other A-frame building is an architectural house or building style featuring steeply-angled sides that usually begin at or near the foundation line, and meet at the top in the shape of the letter A. An A-frame ceiling can be open to the top rafters. Architectural house or building style
An Oudemannenhuis, or Old Men's house is a Dutch term for a home for poor men older than sixty, who could spend their final days enjoying regular meals and a clean place to sleep. Old Men''s home

A funerary hatchment is a depiction within a black lozenge-shaped frame, generally on a black background, of a deceased's heraldic achievement, that is to say the escutcheon showing the arms, together with the crest and supporters of his family or person. A depiction within a black lozenge-shaped frame of a deceased's heraldic achievement Heraldic memorial to a deceased person An escutcheon of a deceased person, placed within a black lozenge and hung on a wall.
Hopton Wood stone is a type of limestone quarried west of Middleton-by-Wirksworth, Derbyshire, England. Limestone

A fortress church is a particular type of church that, in addition to its religious functions is also used by the local population as a retreat and defensive position, similar to a refuge castle. Fortified church used also as a retreat
In architecture, an inverted pyramid is a structure in the shape of an upside-down pyramid. Structure in the shape of an upside-down pyramid

gloss_it: La locuzione "torre d'avorio" si trova per la prima volta nel Cantico dei Cantici, e fu successivamente usato come epiteto per la vergine Maria. Metafora di luogo nel quale ci si isola per perseguire i propri interessi e ideali
gloss_en: An ivory tower is a metaphorical place—or an atmosphere—where people are happily cut off from the rest of the world in favor of their own pursuits, usually mental and esoteric ones.
The interior portrait or, in German, Zimmerbild, is a pictorial genre that appeared in Europe near the end of the 17th century and enjoyed a great vogue in the second half of the 19th century.
Ridge-post framing is an old type of timber framing.

gloss_it: Nome dato ad un artista sconosciuto
gloss_en: In art history, a notname is an invented name given to an artist whose identity has been lost. Name given to an unknown artist
A snow lantern is a hollow cone built of snowballs into which a light is put, usually a candle or a Japanese stone garden lantern Yukimi Gata.
Architectural painting is a form of genre painting where the predominant focus lies on architecture, including both outdoor and interior views.
An outer bailey or outer ward is the defended outer enclosure of a castle.
An Albarrana tower is a defensive tower detached from the curtain wall and connected to it by a bridge or an arcade. Defensive tower detached from the curtain wall
A crown post is a term in traditional timber framing for a post in roof framing which stands on a tie beam or collar beam and supports a collar plate.
This classical, popular puzzle involves a large rectangle divided into five "rooms".
The term "autonomous" as applied to stained glass refers to works which are designed independent of architecture.

In gardening, a terrace is an element where a raised flat paved or gravelled section overlooks a prospect. An element where a raised flat paved or gravelled section overlooks a prospect An element where a raised flat paved or gravelled section overlooks a prospect.

gloss_it: Con il termine casa di campagna inglese si intendono edifici di considerevoli dimensioni, che possono essere case o mansion di proprietà di un singolo che possiede le terre attorno alla casa e, solitamente, anche una dimora in città. Tipologia di magioni di campagna inglesi
gloss_en: An English country house is a large house or mansion in the English countryside. Type of great country house found in the British Isles Larger mansion estate in England, UK
The major aspects of Medieval Scandinavian architecture are boathouses, religious buildings, and general buildings.

gloss_it: Il termine astrazione indica il procedimento mentale attraverso il quale si sostituisce un insieme di oggetti con un concetto, più generale, che descrive gli oggetti in base a proprietà a loro comuni.
gloss_en: Typically, abstraction is used in the arts as a synonym for abstract art in general. Art unconcerned with the literal depiction of things from the visible world Art genre
architecture element
A Romano-Celtic temple is a sub-class of Roman temple found in the north-western provinces of the Roman Empire.
Stained glass by Hervé Mathieu-Bachelot and André Ropion
In Hindu temple architecture, ratha is a facet or vertical offset projection on the plan of the sanctum and shikhara above, or other structure.

gloss_it: L’involucro edilizio è un elemento architettonico che delimita e conclude perimetralmente l'organismo costruttivo e strutturale.
gloss_en: A building envelope is the physical separator between the conditioned and unconditioned environment of a building including the resistance to air, water, heat, light, and noise transfer. The exterior layer of a building that protects it from the elements Physical separator between the conditioned and unconditioned environment of a building
CetraRuddy Architecture is a New York City-based architecture and interior design firm with projects in New York City, the United States, Europe, and the Middle East.
Bhadrakalpikasūtra is a Mahayana sutra with 24 chapters written in c. sutra in Mahāyāna Buddhism
The term Jōkamachi refers to a type of urban structures in Japan in which the city surrounds a feudal lord's castle.
Brisbane tuff is a type of rock, formed as a result of a volcanic eruption.

Construction Operations Building Information Exchange is an international standard relating to managed asset information including space and equipment. Construction Operations Building Information Exchange (COBie) is a data format for the publication of a subset of building model information focused on delivering building information not geometric modeling. It is closely associated with BIM.

gloss_it: Si parla di pianta a croce latina per le chiese in cui la navata e il transetto hanno lunghezza differente e si intersecano ad angolo retto. Costruzione architettonica e simbolo religioso cristiano.
gloss_en: A Latin cross or crux immissa is a type of cross in which the vertical beam sticks above the crossbeam, with the three upper arms either equally long or with the vertical topmost arm shorter than the two horizontal arms, and always with a much longer bottom arm. Symbol of Christianity A cross consisting of a vertical bar intersected by a shorter horizontal one above its midpoint; the form of the Christian cross: ✝.

gloss_it: La cavana è un ricovero coperto per imbarcazioni tipico della città di Venezia e di tutta la laguna e dei fiumi navigabili dell'entroterra.
gloss_en: A cavana is a covered shelter for boats.
Ritual landscapes are extensive archaeological tracts that were seemingly dedicated to ceremonial purposes in the Neolithic and early Bronze Ages.

gloss_it: Le pietre pitte sono stele monumentali trovate in Scozia, in buona parte a nord della linea Clyde-Forth.
gloss_en: A Pictish stone is a type of monumental stele, generally carved or incised with symbols or designs.
Romantic realism is art that combines elements of both romanticism and realism.
The roundel is a strong artillery fortification with a rounded or circular plan of a similar height to the adjacent defensive walls. Artillery fortification design
HuntonBrady is a modern architecture and interior design firm based in Orlando, Florida.

gloss_it: Il giardino all'inglese è un tipo di giardino sviluppato nel corso del Settecento che, al contrario di quelli geometrici, non si avvale più di elementi per definire e circoscrivere lo spazio, come fondali, quinte arboree o prospettive, ma si basa sull'accostamento e sull'avvicendarsi di elementi naturali e artificiali, tra cui, grotte, ruscelli, alberi secolari, cespugli, pagode, pergole, tempietti e rovine, che chi passeggia scopre senza mai arrivare ad una visione d'insieme, un luogo comunque in cui la natura non è mai incolta, anche quando assume un carattere selvaggio. Tipo di giardino Appezzamento di terreno costituito da una disposizione ordinata ed equilibrata delle masse di fiori, arbusti e alberi, seguendo le tradizioni e lo stile britannico.
gloss_en: The English landscape garden, also called English landscape park or simply the English garden, is a style of "landscape" garden which emerged in England in the early 18th century, and spread across Europe, replacing the more formal, symmetrical jardin à la française of the 17th century as the principal gardening style of Europe. Style of garden A plot of ground consisting of an orderly and balanced arrangement of masses of flowers, shrubs and trees, following British traditions or style.
Type of prefabricated houses in Minsk

The Fatimid architecture that developed in the Fatimid Caliphate of North Africa combined elements of eastern and western architecture, drawing on Abbasid architecture, Byzantine, Ancient Egyptian, Coptic architecture and North African traditions; it bridged early Islamic styles and the medieval architecture of the Mamluks of Egypt, introducing many innovations.

gloss_it: La nuova architettura classica, o nuovo classicismo, è un movimento architettonico moderno che continua la pratica dell'architettura classica, storicista e tradizionale, mai cessata nel corso del XX secolo, ma posta in secondo piano dagli stili modernisti diventati dominanti.
gloss_en: New Classical architecture, New Classicism or the New Classical movement is a contemporary movement in architecture that continues the practice of Classical architecture. Style of Architecture

A flanking tower is a fortified tower that is sited on the outside of a defensive wall or other fortified structure and thus forms a flank. Fortified tower sited on the outside of a defensive wall or other fortified structure
Garnish Island, is an island in Glengarriff harbour. Island
In painting, accidentalism is the effect produced by accidental lights. The effect produced by accidental lights

Post-painterly abstraction is a term created by art critic Clement Greenberg as the title for an exhibit he curated for the Los Angeles County Museum of Art in 1964, which subsequently travelled to the Walker Art Center and the Art Gallery of Toronto.

gloss_it: Nell'induismo il tempio, o Mandir è un luogo d'incontro tra il fedele e il Dio cui esso è dedicato, il luogo in cui sperimentare una visione che è epifania, manifestazione ed esperienza diretta del divino.
gloss_en: A Hindu temple or mandir is a symbolic house, seat and body of divinity for Hindus.

lab_en: towns and villages in great britain with a market cross
gloss_it: Le croci di mercato sono dei monumenti posti a segnalare le piazze del mercato nelle città di mercato britanniche.
gloss_en: A market cross, or in Scots, a mercat cross, is a structure used to mark a market square in market towns, where historically the right to hold a regular market or fair was granted by the monarch, a bishop or a baron.

The architecture of Vancouver and the Metro Vancouver area holds a combination of modern architectural styles, ranging from the 20th century Edwardian style, to the 21st century modernist style and beyond.

gloss_it: La motta castrale è un tipo di castello che si diffuse in Francia, Germania, Italia meridionale, Sicilia e Gran Bretagna nell'XI e XII secolo.
gloss_en: A motte-and-bailey castle is a fortification with a wooden or stone keep situated on a raised area of ground called a motte, accompanied by a walled courtyard, or bailey, surrounded by a protective ditch and palisade. Fortification with a wooden or stone keep situated on a raised earthwork
A large number of monuments were erected in Germany in honour of Emperor William I.

gloss_it: La facciata continua o curtain wall, termine inglese nato negli Stati Uniti d'America, è una particolare tipologia di involucro leggero continuo che garantisce, di per sé o congiuntamente all'opera edilizia, tutte le funzioni normali di una parete esterna, che non porta altro carico che il peso proprio e la spinta del vento.
gloss_en: A curtain wall system is an outer covering of a building in which the outer walls are non-structural, utilized only to keep the weather out and the occupants in. The outer skin of a modern building Outer non-structural walls of a building
A battery tower was a defensive tower built into the outermost defences of many castles, usually in the 16th century or later, after the advent of firearms. Defensive tower
Maya belt plaques were decorative and functional pendants worn by ancient Maya ajawob to validate their rulership through referencing major deities and important ancestors.
A window sill is the horizontal structure or surface at the bottom of a window. horizontal structure immediately under a window

gloss_it: L'Aula Regia era un ambiente di rappresentanza nella Domus Flavia, una sezione del palazzo di Domiziano sul colle Palatino a Roma. Ambiente di rappresentanza nella Domus Flavia del palazzo di Domiziano
gloss_en: An aula regia, also referred to as a palas hall, is a name given to the great hall in an imperial or royal palace.

In Christian countries a churchyard is a patch of land adjoining or surrounding a church, which is usually owned by the relevant church or local parish itself. Patch of land adjoining or surrounding a church
A Drum tower in Europe is a round tower that has a longer diameter length than height, resembling the shape of the musical instrument. Cylindrical tower, usually on European fortifications
In architecture, batter is a receding slope of a wall, structure, or earthwork. An intentional slope of walls or earthworks.
A cry room or crying room is a space designed for people to take babies or small children for privacy or to reduce the disturbance of others.

gloss_it: Il termine generico stile coloniale o architettura coloniale sta a indicare gli stili architettonici adottati dai popoli europei che avevano colonizzato terre straniere, in genere situate in altri continenti; pur trovando la sua essenziale espressione nell'architettura, si parla di stile coloniale anche in riferimento ad arredamento e decorazioni.
gloss_en: Colonial architecture is an architectural style from a mother country that has been incorporated into the buildings of settlements or colonies in distant locations.

Sasanian art, or Sassanid art, was produced under the Sasanian Empire which ruled from the 3rd to 7th centuries AD, before the Muslim conquest of Persia was completed around 651. Art of the Sassanid Empire

A shield wall, also shield-wall or Schildmauer, refers to the highest and strongest curtain wall, or tower of a castle that defends the only practicable line of approach to a castle built on a mountain, hill or headland.
Plumbangan is a candi that actually is a paduraksa-style gate with cube-shaped peak.

gloss_it: Con il termine designer toys vengono identificati giocattoli e altri personaggi da collezione prodotti in tiratura limitata e ideati da artisti e designer di tutto il mondo.
gloss_en: Designer toys, also called art toys, are toys and collectibles created by artists and designers that are either self-produced or made by small, independent toy companies, typically in very limited editions.
Speed painting is an artistic technique where the artist has a limited time to finish the work. artistic technique where the artist has a limited time to finish the work
Log buildings and structures can be categorized as historic and modern.
A votive ship, sometimes called a church ship, is a ship model displayed in a church. Model of a ship in a church building
A poupou is a wall panel located underneath the veranda of a Māori wharenui. A wall carving in a Māori wharenui

lab_en: gothic architecture in the czech republic
gloss_en: Czech Gothic architecture refers to the architectural period primarily of the Late Middle Ages in the area of the present-day Czech Republic.
A certain type of three-story apartment building is often called a three-decker or triple-decker in the United States. Type of housing

gloss_it: L'astrazione lirica è una delle due tendenze correlate ma distinte nella pittura modernista del dopoguerra, ovvero l'abstraction lyrique europea, descritta per la prima volta da Jean José Marchand nel 1947 e appartenente alla corrente Tachisme, e la Lyrical Abstraction, un movimento statunitense descritto da Larry Aldrich nel 1969.
gloss_en: Lyrical abstraction is either of two related but distinct trends in Post-war Modernist painting: European Abstraction Lyrique born in Paris, the French art critic Jean José Marchand being credited with coining its name in 1947, considered as a component of Tachisme when the name of this movement was coined in 1951 by Pierre Guéguen and Charles Estienne the author of L'Art à Paris 1945–1966, and American Lyrical Abstraction a movement described by Larry Aldrich in 1969. Art movement

The hall house is a type of vernacular house traditional in many parts of England, Wales, Ireland and lowland Scotland, as well as northern Europe, during the Middle Ages, centring on a hall. A kind of vernacular house of the Middle Ages, traditional in the United Kingdom and northern Europe, usually timber-framed, and having a hall as the central element.

gloss_it: lista di un progetto Wikimedia
gloss_en: Sasanian architecture refers to the Persian architectural style that reached a peak in its development during the Sasanian era. Architecture of the Sassanid Empire

gloss_it: Il ritratto miniato è l'arte di raffigurare una persona su una piccola superficie.
